<div id="page-1134786">
<h3><a name="page-1134786">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 001)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>1</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts. <span class='line-break'> </span><u>Suffolk Ss., <date when='1870-06-07'>June 7<sup>th</sup> 1870</date>.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary'>Oath of Secretary</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Then personally appeared Samuel Batchelder Jr.,<span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully perform the <span class='line-break'> </span>duties of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>[Revenue stamp 5]</th> <th>Before me <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Jacob Sleeper Justice of the Peace</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>---------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees June 8th, 1870'><u>Trustees <date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date></u></span><span class='line-break'> </span><u><date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date></u><span class='line-break'> </span>The regular monthly Meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, <date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date>, at half past three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs N. J. Bradlee, T. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Livermore, Norcross, Rand, Sleeper and  Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last Meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Finance Report of'><u>Com. on Finance Report of</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A Report was received from the Committee on Finance, as follows:</p>
<p><u>Report of the Committee on Finance.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>"The Committee on Finance would respectfully report that <span class='line-break'> </span>the newly elected officers of the Corporation, for Treasurer H. B. <span class='line-break'> </span>MacKintosh, and for Secretary Sam<sup>l</sup> Batchelder jr., have assumed <span class='line-break'> </span>the duties of their respective offices,  and the necessary transfer <span class='line-break'> </span>of the books and papers from the late Treasurer and Secretary, Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Coolidge has taken place, in accordance with the vote to the Trustees.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. MacKintosh, the Treasurer, has given the required Bond, and<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Batchelder has taken the oath of office as recorded.</p>
<p>The receipt of H. B. MacKintosh of the evidences of property <span class='line-break'> </span>which has been passed into his hands as Treasurer of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>is hereto annexed</p>
<p>In adjusting the accounts of the late Treasurer, Mr. Coolidge,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134788">
<h3><a name="page-1134788">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 002)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>2</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. June 8th, 1870.'><u>Trustees. <date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date>.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>your Committee have found the same duly and properly vouched, <span class='line-break'> </span>and the evidences of property correct, as recorded in the books <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation.  They have charged off, as loss to the Cor=<span class='line-break'> </span>=poration, a twenty dollar counterfeit note, received by the <span class='line-break'> </span>late Treasurer in his official capacity.</p>
<p>Your Committee would also recommend, in view of the long <span class='line-break'> </span>and valuable services rendered by the late Treasurer and Secretary, <span class='line-break'> </span>that his salary from <date when='1870-01-01'>January 1<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date> to <date when='1870-06-06'>June 6<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date> be at the <span class='line-break'> </span>rate of $2000. per annum for the office of Treasurer, and <span class='line-break'> </span>$1500. per annum for that of Secretary, and in accordance <span class='line-break'> </span>with these views would unanimouusly report the acompany=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ing vote.<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>(Signed)</th> <th>Jacob Sleeper</th> <th>} Com. on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>( " [Signed] )</td> <td>Alfred T. Turner</td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted.  that there be allowed and paid to Austin J. Coolidge,<span class='line-break'> </span><small>as Treasurer from <date when='1870-01-01'>January 1<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date> to <date when='1870-06-06'>June 6<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date> at the rate of $2000. </small><span class='line-break'> </span>per annum, and as Secretary for the same period of time at the <span class='line-break'> </span>rate of $1500 per annum."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted, excepting Vote.'>Report accepted, excepting Vote.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>.  that the above Report of the Finance Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>with the exception of the Vote therein recommended,  be accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Substitute A.J. Coolidge. Compensation to. for Extra Services.'>Substitute A.J. Coolidge. Compensation to. for Extra Services.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. N. J. Bradlee the following Vote was <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted as a substitute for the Vote recommended by the Committee,.</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u> that there be paid to Austin J. Coolidge the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>Two hundred and fifty dollars as compensation for amounts <span class='line-break'> </span>paid by him for extra services.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134790">
<h3><a name="page-1134790">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 003)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>003</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, June 8th, 1870.'><u>Trustees, <date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>th</sup>, 1870.</date></u></span></p>
<p><u>Bond, Receipts Accounts to be recorded.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted.</u>  that the Abstracts of Account of the outgoing Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>the receipt of the new Treasurer together with his Bond, all of <span class='line-break'> </span>which  papers were submitted by the Finance Comittee as accom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=panying their Report, be spread upon the record.</p>
<p>[See record of the same at p. 10]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bond of Treasr, &amp;c. placed in charge of the President.'><u>Bond of Treas<sup>r</sup>, &amp;c. placed in charge of the President.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. Livermore it was</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u>  that the Bond of the Treasurer, together with his <span class='line-break'> </span>receipt for the evidences of property delivered to him, be placed <span class='line-break'> </span>in the custody of the President. [This was done <date when='1870-06-17'>June 17<sup>th</sup>,1870</date>, by the Secretary.]</p>
<p>The President signified his willingness to receive the <span class='line-break'> </span>aforesaid papers and deposit them in his own safe.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unfinished Business'>Unfinished Business</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary then read from a Memorandum book made <span class='line-break'> </span>by Mr. Coolidge a list of various matters not finally acted upon <span class='line-break'> </span>by the several Committees or by the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Birds in the Cemetery.'><u>Com. on Birds in the Cemetery.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A partial report was received fromDr. Brewer in behalf <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Special Committee appointed March 15<sup>th</sup>, 1870, to consider<span class='line-break'> </span>the expediency of the protection, encouragement and introduction <span class='line-break'> </span>of birds within the Cemetery", and asking further time.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comn from Gardner Brewer. adn on Horseback '>Com<sup>n</sup> from Gardner Brewer. ad<sup>n</sup> on Horseback </span><span class='line-break'> </span>A communication from Mr. Gardner Brewer respecting<span class='line-break'> </span>admission to the Cemetery on horseback together with the endorse<span class='line-break'></span>=ment of the late Secretary to the effect that he had issued to Mr. <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer upon payment of Ten dollars a permit dated <date when='1870-05-25'>May 25<sup>th</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1870</date>, for admission on horseback for one year from date, having <span class='line-break'> </span>been read it was</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u>  that the said Letter and endorsement be placed on file.</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u> that the report of the Committee be accepted, and <span class='line-break'> </span>that they have leave to sit gain.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134792">
<h3><a name="page-1134792">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 004)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>004</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees June 8t, 1870. Comn from C. W. Cotting resp&apos;g Mrs. Bournes&apos; Lot.'><u>Trustees <date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date>. Com<sup>n</sup> from C. W. Cotting resp'g Mrs. Bournes' Lot</u>.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A communication from Mr. Charles W. Cotting, dated <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1870-05-24'>May 24<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date>, continuing his "application for a part of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot now occupied by the partially constructed Receiving Tomb,<span class='line-break'> </span>to add to Mrs. Bourne's Lot adjoining," was read by the Secretary.</p>
<p><u>Voted.</u>  that said communication be referred to the com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs of Coolidge Avenue'>Repairs of Coolidge Avenue</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A communiction from Mr. Joseph G. Coolidge, dated <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1870-06-08'>June 8<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date>, in regard to the condition of Coolidge Avenue, and <span class='line-break'> </span>requesting that the Board would appoint a Committee to <span class='line-break'> </span>arrange with him the terms on which he shall put his premises <span class='line-break'> </span>in good condition, and that he shall be reimbursed from the <span class='line-break'> </span>sum of $250.  which the Treasurer was authorized to pay to the <span class='line-break'> </span>City of Cambridge for the improvement made upon said Avenue, <span class='line-break'> </span>was read by the Secretary:</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u>  that said Communication be laid upon the table.</p>
<p>Various communications from the Superintendent were <span class='line-break'> </span>read by Mr Rand,- viz, </p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='List of Neglected Lots Notice to Proprietors'>List of Neglected Lots Notice to Proprietors</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A "List of neglected Lots reported under Article 29 of the <span class='line-break'> </span>By=Laws," dated<date when='1870-06-01'> June 1<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date>.  The List comprised more than 100<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots and was read by its title only.  Accompanying the List<span class='line-break'> </span>was a proposed form of notification to be sent in the name of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent to each proprietor.  After consideration it was</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u>  that the above communication be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Henry Blaney &amp; Ezra Trull. Rep. on Tombs of'><u>Henry Blaney &amp; Ezra Trull. Rep. on Tombs of</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A communiction in relation to repairs on the Tomb of <span class='line-break'> </span>the late Ezra Trull and Henry Blaney on Hazel Dell Path</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u>  that the above communication be referred to a <span class='line-break'> </span>special Committee consisting of Messrs. Norcross and N. J.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134794">
<h3><a name="page-1134794">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 005)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>005</p>
<p>Bradlee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. June 8, 1870 Comn from Supt. as to the use of Granite Curbstones'><u>Trustees. <date when='1870-06-08'>June 8, 1870</date> Com<sup>n</sup> from Supt. as to the use of Granite Curbstones</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A communication asking whether any restrictions existed <span class='line-break'> </span>in deeds or otherwise rendering necessary the use of granite curbstone<span class='line-break'> </span>exclusively for Lots.</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u> that the Secretary be instructed to refer the Superinten=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dent to Article 25 of the By=Laws as an answer to his Enquiry.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bills of Shedd &amp; [?]'><u>Bills of Shedd &amp; [?]</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>Certain bills for surveys and plans due to Mr. Shedd, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs Shedd &amp; Sawyer were referred to the President without vote.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coms rep. progress leave to sit again'><u>Com<sup>s</sup> rep. progress leave to sit again</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The following named Committees reported progress, and <span class='line-break'> </span>were granted leave to sit again.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Land W. of Cemetery'><u>Land W. of Cemetery</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The committee on Grounds, to whom was "referred" the Memorial <span class='line-break'> </span>of Sundry proprietors for the purchase by the Corporation of land West <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb'><u>Receiving Tomb</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>Same Committee, on the question as to "what action shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>taken relative to the completion of the Receiving Tomb."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Change of By-Laws'><u>Change of By-Laws</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>Special Committee, (Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Livermore and <span class='line-break'> </span>Norcross,) to consider and report what changes, if any, are desirable <span class='line-break'> </span>in the By=Laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs of Supts house.'><u>Repairs of Supt<sup>s</sup> house.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>Special Committee; "on change of Superintendent," (Messrs J. T. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer and N. J. Bradlee,) on repairs of the Superintendent's<span class='line-break'> </span>house.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Flagstone Crossing.'><u>Flagstone Crossing.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Reception House Committee on the expediency of providing <span class='line-break'> </span>a broad flag=stone crossing between the Gate and the Reception House."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Change of Supt Rep. of Committee'><u>Change of Sup<sup>t</sup> Rep. of Committee</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Committee appointed <date when='1870-04-25'>April 25, 1870</date>, (Messrs J. T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer and N. J. Bradlee,) "upon the subject matter of transfer under <span class='line-break'> </span>the vote relating to change of Superintendent," reported that they had <span class='line-break'> </span>attended to the duty assigned them, and that the said transfer had <span class='line-break'> </span>been duly effected.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134796">
<h3><a name="page-1134796">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 006)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>006</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees June 7th, 1870.'><u>Trustees<date when='1870-06-07'> June 7<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date>.</u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lease of part of Reception House'>Lease of part of Reception House</span><span class='line-break'> </span>"The Reception House Committee, authorized on <date when='1870-06-07'>the above <span class='line-break'> </span>date</date> "to lease a portion of the new building for a refreshment<span class='line-break'> </span>=room, and for no other purpose, for one year," with the provision <span class='line-break'> </span>"that the care of the building may be made a port of the con=<span class='line-break'> </span>=sideration of said Lease," reported that they had attended <span class='line-break'> </span>to the duty assigned them, and had effected a Lease of the premises <span class='line-break'> </span>for one year at a rent of three hundred dollars per annum.<span class='line-break'> </span>to C. J. Belcher.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence G. prem. of J. C. Gray &amp; R. H.'>Fence G. prem. of J. C. Gray &amp; R. H.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The same Committee, authorized on the above date "to <span class='line-break'> </span>arrange with Mr John C. Gray for an open partition fence be=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tween his premises and the lot on which the Reception Building<span class='line-break'> </span>stands," reported that they had attended to the duty assigned them.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fence G. prem. of  McDonald &amp; R. H. '>Fence G. prem. of  M<sup>c</sup>Donald &amp; R. H. </span><span class='line-break'> </span>Also that the Superintendent who was authorized on <span class='line-break'> </span>the above date, under the directon of the same Committee, "to <span class='line-break'> </span>remove the high fence btween the grounds of M<sup>c</sup>Donald, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>new building just erected by the Corporation as far back as the <span class='line-break'> </span>rear line of the new building, and to substitute therefor a slat <span class='line-break'> </span>fence not over four feet high," had attended to that duty.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Unfinished business. Sec&apos;y. to furnish List of to Committees.'>Unfinished business. Sec'y. to furnish List of to Committees.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted,</u>  that the Secretary be instructed to furnish the <span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman of each Committee of this Board a statement of <span class='line-break'> </span>the matter referred to that Committee and not yet finally <span class='line-break'> </span>disposed of.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rep. of Lots appointed.'>Rep. of Lots appointed.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest, representatives <span class='line-break'> </span>were designated for Lots as follows, viz; </p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='96'>96</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Caroline T. Kurtz of Boston, daughter of Melzar Dunbar, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Ninety=Six.</p>

<p>The following papers are spread upon the record <span class='line-break'> </span>in accordance with the Vote of the Trustees recorded at p. 3, accts.</p>
<p><u>Bond of H. B.  Mackintosh Treas<sup>r</sup>.</u> <span class='line-break'> </span>Know all men by these presents that we, Henry B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>of Boston in the County of Suffolk, and Horatio Chickering and <span class='line-break'> </span>Ebenezer P. Burgess both of Dedham in the County of Norfolk<span class='line-break'> </span>and Commonwealth of Massachusets are holden and firmly<span class='line-break'> </span>bound unto the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>in the penal sum of Ten thousand dollars, to the payment of <span class='line-break'> </span>which we bind ourselvs by these presents.  Sealed with our <span class='line-break'> </span>seals and dated this<date when='1870-06-06'> sixth day of June A. D. Eighteen hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>and seventy</date>.</p>
<p>The condition of the above obligation is such that <span class='line-break'> </span>wheres the said Henry B. Mackintosh has been duly appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer of the said corporation; Now if the said Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>shall well and truly perform all of his duties as such Treasurer, <span class='line-break'> </span>during such time as he may continue in the said office, under<span class='line-break'> </span>the said appointment, and under any and all future elections <span class='line-break'> </span>to the said office, and shall well and truly account with and <span class='line-break'> </span>pay over to the said Corporation on ceasing to hold the said office, <span class='line-break'> </span>any and all such sums of money, and shall deliver over all <span class='line-break'> </span>property and evidences of property which shall be in his custody as such <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer, when he ceased to hold said office, then this obligation shall void,<span class='line-break'> </span>otherwise to remain in full force.<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Witness</td> <td>___</td> <td>(Signed)</td> <td>H. <div id="page-1134816">
<h3><a name="page-1134816">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 016)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>016</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees July 13t, 1870'><u>Trustees <date when='1870-07-13'>July 13<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date></u></span></p>
<p><u><date when='1870-07-13'>July 13<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date></u>.<span class='line-break'> </span>The regular monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was notified to be held on Wednesday, <date when='1870-07-13'>July 13<sup>t</sup>, 1870</date>, at half <span class='line-break'> </span>past three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>At the day and hour aforesaid the President and Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Turner and N. J. Bradlee were present, but for want of a quorum<span class='line-break'> </span>the Meeting was <u>adjourned</u>, to reassemble at such day and hour <span class='line-break'> </span>as should be indicated by the President in the manner prescribed <span class='line-break'> </span>by Article 3<sup>d</sup> of the By=Laws paragraph 2<sup>d</sup>.</p>
<p>Sam<sup>l</sup> Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p>-----------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees July 21st, 1870'><u>Trustees <date when='1870-07-21'>July 21<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date></u></span></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>Mount Auburn Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>16 Pemberton Square </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td><u>Boston, <date when='1870-07-16'>July 16, 1870</date>.</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>Jacob Bigelow, M. D.,</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td><small>President of the Proprietors of the Cem'y. of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn,</small></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Dear Sir,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Request for Special Meeting'><u>Request for Special Meeting</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>We the undersigned, members of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees of the above Corporation, hereby request you to <span class='line-break'> </span>call a Special Meeting of the said Board, to assemble on Thursday,<span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1870-07-21'>twenty-first day of July instant</date>, at half past three o'clock, P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>(Signed)</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Edward S. Rand</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Isaac Livermore</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Alfred T. Turner</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Nath<sup>l</sup> J.Bradlee</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>T. M. Brewer</td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134818">
<h3><a name="page-1134818">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 017)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>017</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. July 21, 1870'><u>Trustees. <date when='1870-07-21'>July 21, 1870</date></u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y. instructed to call Sp. Meeting'><u>Sec'y. instructed to call Sp. Meeting</u></span></p>
<p><u>Boston, <date when='1870-07-16'>July 16<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date></u></p>
<p>To  Sam<sup>l</sup> Batchelder Jr., Secretary, M<sup>t</sup> Auburn Cem'y. Corp<sup>n</sup>.</p>
<p>Sir,</p>
<p>Your [sic] are hereby instructed to call <span class='line-break'> </span>a Meeting of the Board of Trustees, as above, by notification issued <span class='line-break'> </span>in the usual manner.</p>
<p>(Signed) Jacob Bigelow, President</p>
<p>_________ . . _________</p>
<p>In accordance with the request and call aforesaid, and <span class='line-break'> </span>pursuant to notifications duly issued, a Special Meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board of Trustees was held on <date when='1870-07-21'>Thursday, July 21<sup>st</sup></date>, at half <span class='line-break'> </span>past three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. Turner, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Livermore and Brewer.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read an approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on compn of Receiving Tomb.'><u>Report on comp<sup>n</sup> of Receiving Tomb.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A report was received from the President in behalf <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Grounds to which was referred the question <span class='line-break'> </span>as to "what action shall be taken relative to the completion of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Receiving Tomb."  The report consisted of two letters on the sub=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ject from the Superintendent, respectively dated <date when='1870-06-30'>June 30<sup>t</sup></date> &amp; <date when='1870-07-08'>July 8<sup>t</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1870.</date>  It was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that the report be accepted and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Props purchase of Old Coolidge Place'><u>Prop<sup>s</sup> purchase of Old Coolidge Place</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The President submitted certain communications from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent respectively dated <date when='1870-07-11'>July 11<sup>th</sup></date>, and <date when='1870-07-20'>July 20<sup>th</sup></date>, in <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the purchase by the Corporation of "the old Coolidge Place"<span class='line-break'> </span>Also a letter from the Superintendent of the date first mentioned<span class='line-break'> </span>addressed by him to the President personally.  Said communications <span class='line-break'> </span>being accompanied by a Plan of the vicinity of the Cemetery,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134820">
<h3><a name="page-1134820">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 018)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>018</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, July 21st, 1870. Purchase of Add. Real Estate'><u>Trustees,<date when='1870-07-21'> July 21<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date>. Purchase of Add. Real Estate</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>showing the premises in question.  After full discussion, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, that the communications made to this Board in <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the purchase of additional real estate be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on  Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Introduction of Cherry Trees.'>Introduction of Cherry Trees.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A Communication dated <date when='1870-06-10'>June 10, 1870</date>, was received<span class='line-break'> </span>from W. F. Shaw, relative to the introduction of cherry trees <span class='line-break'> </span>and other trees likely to attract birds to the Cemetery precincts</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>. that the above communication be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Committee on the protection, Encouragement and introduction <span class='line-break'> </span>of birds within the Cemetery".</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs of Chapel Floor '>Repairs of Chapel Floor </span><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>.  that the President and Mr. N. J. Bradlee be a Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee with power to examine, and, if necessary, to put in <span class='line-break'> </span>repair, any part of the Chapel floor and foundation which <span class='line-break'> </span>may have been disturbed by the introduction of the hot air <span class='line-break'> </span>flue in that building.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs on the Tombs of Mrs. Ezra Trull and Henry Blaney (3948) (3949.)'>Repairs on the Tombs of Mrs. Ezra Trull and Henry Blaney (3948) (3949.)</span><span class='line-break'> </span>'A report was received from Mr. N. J. Bradlee, in<span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Committee appointed to consider the subject  of <span class='line-break'> </span>repairs on the tombs of ^<sup>Mrs.</sup> Ezra Trull and Henry Blaney, recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mending the making of such repairs as may appear to be <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary to put the tombs in good order at the expense of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn Cemetery, at such early time as may be conve=<span class='line-break'> </span>=nient to the Superintendent.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>.   that the above report be accepted, and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent be instructed to make the contemplated <span class='line-break'> </span>repairs, under the direction of the Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement &amp;c. of Treasurer.'>Statement &amp;c. of <u>Treasurer</u>.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Treasuer having submitted his "Statement <span class='line-break'> </span>for 2<sup>d</sup> quarter, ending <date when='1870-07-01'>July 1, 1870</date>" together with "Trial Balance</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134822">
<h3><a name="page-1134822">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 019)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>019</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, July 21st, 1870. [Rep]t to Finance Com.'><u>Trustees,<date when='1870-07-21'> July 21<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date>. [Rep]t to Finance Com.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>for <date when='1870-07-01'>July 1<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date>," it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,  that the above papers be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Finance.</p>
<p><b><u>"Hemmenway improvement". Unsold Lots on to be restricted.</u></b><span class='line-break'> </span>[A report was received from the Committee on Lots to the <span class='line-break'> </span>effect "that the best interests of Mount Auburn will be promoted<span class='line-break'> </span>by restricting the unsold Lots upon the "Hemmenway improvement,"<span class='line-break'> </span>(so called,) by requiring stone curbs substantially in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the surroundings," and recommending "that a Vote be passed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Trustees so instructing the Superintendent.  And, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,  that the above report be accepted, and that the Su=<span class='line-break'> </span>=perintendent be instructed in accordance with the views and <span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations in said report set forth.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='List of Neglected Lots. '>List of Neglected Lots. </span></p>
<p>A communication was received from the Superinten=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dent under date of <date when='1870-07-12'>July 12<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date>, accompanied by a List of 1175<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots out of repair, in which he "reiterates the recommendations <span class='line-break'> </span>contained in his communiction of <small><date when='1870-06-06'>June 6<sup>th</sup>, 1870</date>, " (vid. p. 4. Supra) <sub>(Copy from pg. 4)</sub></small>,<span class='line-break'> </span>accompanying a similar, but shorter List; - viz: - that the <u>Super=<span class='line-break'> </span>=intendent</u> be authorized to put himself in <u>personal communication</u> <span class='line-break'> </span>with each of the parties whose Lots are out of repair, giving an <span class='line-break'> </span>estimate of cost, and asking that the proprietor authorize him <span class='line-break'> </span>to do the work."  A form of Circular appended to the Communication.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent authorized to communicate to the Proprietors of.'><u>Superintendent authorized to communicate to the Proprietors of.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. Turner, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,   that the suggestions of the Superintendent in regard to <span class='line-break'> </span>putting himself into personal communication with the proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of neglected Lots, are hereby approved, and that he is hereby au=<span class='line-break'> </span>=thorized and instructed to carry out the recommendations in <span class='line-break'> </span>this respect by him submitted to the Trustees.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Livermore it was </p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134824">
<h3><a name="page-1134824">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 020)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>020</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, July 21st, 1870'><u>Trustees,<date when='1870-07-21'> July 21<sup>st</sup>, 1870</date></u></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bill vs. Amos H. Powers. (2017)'>Bill vs. Amos H. Powers. (2017)</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted,</u>  that a bill of the Corporation against Mr. Amos. H. <span class='line-break'> </span>Powers for work done upon his Lot dated <date when='1869-07-19'>July 19<sup>t</sup>, 1869</date>, and amounting <span class='line-break'> </span>to $68.97 be referred to the Treasurer to make such settlement<span class='line-break'> </span>of the same as he may think proper in confirmation with the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, and with Mr. Winsor the former Superin=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tendent, with whom the contract for the work was made by <span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. John Livemore _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition of Messrs Douglass &amp; Dennis (2224) &amp; (2225)'><u>Petition of Messrs Douglass &amp; Dennis</u> (2224) &amp; (2225)</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A petition was received from the Messrs Robert Douglass<span class='line-break'> </span>and William W. Dennis in reference to an alleged injury to <span class='line-break'> </span>their Lots, (N<sup>os</sup> 2224 &amp; 2225,) caused last year by grading <span class='line-break'> </span>adjoining Lots, and requesting that their Lots may be graded <span class='line-break'> </span>so as to conform to adjoining Lots, &amp;c.  Whereupon it was</p>
<p><u>Voted,</u>   that the above petition be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bond given by the late Joseph Carew'><u>Bond given by the late</u> Joseph Carew</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary called the attention of the Board to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Bond given by Mr. Joseph Carew to the Corporation, under <span class='line-break'> </span>date of <date when='1869-04-21'>April 21<sup>st</sup>, 1869</date>, by virtue of which he was allowed to <span class='line-break'> </span>do work upon Lots at request of proprietors without first <span class='line-break'> </span>obtaining the customary permits from the Corporation, <span class='line-break'> </span>with  a view of ascertaining what action if any might be <span class='line-break'> </span>expedient on the part of the Trustees, in view of the recent <span class='line-break'> </span>decease of Mr. Carew.  After discussion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary to notify his business successors.'><u>Secretary to notify his business successors</u>.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted,</u>  that the Secretary be instructed to inform the <span class='line-break'> </span>parties, if any, who may be carrying on business as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Successors of the late Mr. Carew, that the privilege accorded <span class='line-break'> </span>to Mr. Carew upon his bond, with surety, of doing work in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery without obtaining permits was personal to himself <span class='line-break'> </span>and would not be construed as applicable to his Successors.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134826">
<h3><a name="page-1134826">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 021)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Successors of Joseph Carew.'><u>Successors of Joseph Carew.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary reported that in obedience to the vote adopted <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting he had duly notified the successor in business<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mr. Joseph Carew in accordance with the terms thereof, and <span class='line-break'> </span>had received an assurance that upon the settlement of Mr. Carew's<span class='line-break'> </span>affairs, the matter would receive due attention.</p>

<p>Present, the President &amp; Messrs Austin J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, Norcross, Rand and Turner.</p>

Shaw</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A Report was received from Dr. Brewer in behalf of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, (Messrs Brewer and Rand,) appointed <date when='1870-03-15'>March 15, 1870</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>"to consider the expediency of the protection, encouragement and <span class='line-break'> </span>introduction of birds within the Cemetery", (IV = 305), to whom was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred the communiction of Mr. W. F. Shaw relative to the intro=<span class='line-break'> </span>=duction of cherry trees and other trees likely to attract birds to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery precincts.  The Report was adverse to the introduction <span class='line-break'> </span>of the cherry tree for reasons stated; favored the introduction of <span class='line-break'> </span>other trees and shrubs as more attractive to birds, and less ob=<span class='line-break'> </span>=jectionable as well as more ornamental, and closed with a</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>,  that the Report of the Committee be accepted, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the recomendation thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Flavel Moseley&apos;s Note &amp; Mortgage'><u>Flavel Moseley's Note &amp; Mortgage</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>An oral communication was received from Mr. Rand in <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the Note of Flavel Moseley of Dorchester for $5000.00<span class='line-break'> </span>secured by mortgage of that amount on premises on Crescent <span class='line-break'> </span>Av. Dorchester, held by the Corporation as a part of the "Repair Fund," <span class='line-break'> </span>stating that Mr. Moseley desired to obtain from the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>a release of a portion of the premises covered by said Mortgage, <span class='line-break'> </span>proposing to furnish the other security in the place of the property <span class='line-break'> </span>so released.  After consideration it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Portion of premises to be released.'><u>Portion of premises to be released.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>,  that the Treasurer and Secretary be, and they <span class='line-break'> </span>are hereby authorized to execute and deliver a Deed of Release <span class='line-break'> </span>of so much of the premises included in the mortgage of Flavel <span class='line-break'> </span>Moseley to the corporation as Mr. Rand has recommended to be <span class='line-break'> </span>released, upon receipt of a certificate from Mr. Rand that the <span class='line-break'> </span>papers and all the arrangements in the case are satisfactory <span class='line-break'> </span>to him-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs on Tombs of Trull &amp; Blaney Report of the completion of.'><u>Repairs on Tombs of Trull &amp; Blaney Report of the completion of.</u></span><span class='line-break'> </span>A Report was received from Mr. N. J. Bradlee, in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Committee, (Messrs. Norcross and Bradlee,) under<span class='line-break'> </span>whose direction the Superintendent was instructed to make <span class='line-break'> </span>such repairs on the tombs of Mrs. Ezra Trull and Henry Blaney <span class='line-break'> </span>as might appear to be necessary,   to the effect that they had <span class='line-break'> </span>"caused the said tombs to be rebuilt, and that they are now <span class='line-break'> </span>in perfect order."</p>

<p>Superintendent in a communication dated August 24^th, 1870, <span class='line-break'> </span>addressed to the Committee on Grounds to whom the matter <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred at the meeting of July 21^st, 1870 (V=20); it was</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cambridge Taxes for 1870 referred to Com. on Finance[underlined]'>Cambridge Taxes for 1870 referred to Com. on Finance[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The subject of the taxes for the year 1870 assessed upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the property of the corporation by the City of Cambridge having <span class='line-break'> </span>been brought to the notice of the Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the taxes assessed by the City of Cambridge for 1870<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the corporate property be referred to the ^consideration of the^ Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Finace, with a view to obtaining an abatement thereof;<span class='line-break'> </span>and with full powers.</p>

Raymond, chairman of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Commissioners of the Cambridge Cemetery, renewing an <span class='line-break'> </span>application for the purchase of a strip of land on the South <span class='line-break'> </span>side of the lot owned by the corporation being a part of the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Stone meadow," originally mde in September, 1858, having been <span class='line-break'> </span>laid before the Board it was</p>
<p>Voted,[underlined]- that the same be referred to the C ommittee on Grounds.</p>

<p>Voted[underlined], - that the subject be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds with full powers.</p>

<p>"the Committee on Grounds beg leave to report that they <span class='line-break'> </span>"have attended to the various duties assigned them, and <span class='line-break'> </span>"recommend</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot of Sarah J. Locke Sam^l S. Osgood N^os 280 &amp; 2151 to be raised[underlined]'>Lot of Sarah J. Locke Sam^l S. Osgood N^os 280 &amp; 2151 to be raised[underlined]</span></p>
<p>"1^st. That the Lot of Mrs Sarah J. Locke, and the adjacent <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot of Samuel S. Osgood be raised so as to restore the natural <span class='line-break'> </span>drainage, the obstruction having been caused by the authority of <span class='line-break'> </span>this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Improvement of premises on Hazel=Dell amended, p. 33'>Improvement of premises on Hazel=Dell amended, p. 33</span></p>
<p>"2^nd.  That no Tombs hereafter be erected on the Southerly <span class='line-break'> </span>"side of Hazel Dell, and that the plan presented by the Superinten=<span class='line-break'> </span>"=dent for grading the land on the other sides of the same be adopted,<span class='line-break'> </span>" and the same be carried out under the direction of Messrs. <span class='line-break'> </span>"Livermore and J. T. Bradlee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb Report of Progress[underlined]'>Receiving Tomb Report of Progress[underlined]</span></p>
<p>"3^rd . In regard to the new Receiving Tomb they have directed the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Superintendent to furnish an estimate of the expense of finishing <span class='line-break'> </span>"the Vestibule and two compartments, and they report progress.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Edw. Palgemeyer Lot of, &amp; premises in vicinity, proposed to improve[underlined]'>Edw. Palgemeyer Lot of, &amp; premises in vicinity, proposed to improve[underlined]</span></p>
<p>"4^th, In regard to the lots of Edward Palgemeyer and others <span class='line-break'> </span>"they have directed the Superintendent to furnish a prospective<span class='line-break'> </span>"plan for improving the tract of land between Lavender, Myrtle <span class='line-break'> </span>"and Hazel Paths and Chestnut Avenue. wich the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>"will at some future time lay before the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale to the City of Cambridge of a portion Stone Meadow on Coolidge Av. recommended[underlined]'>Sale to the City of Cambridge of a portion Stone Meadow on Coolidge Av. recommended[underlined]</span></p>
<p>"5^th. Upon the application of the Commissioners of the Cambridge <span class='line-break'> </span>"Cemetery for the purchse of a part of the Stone meadow Lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>"on Coolidge Avenue they recommend a sale to the City of Cambridge <span class='line-break'> </span>"of a strip of the said land measuring seven feet two inches on <span class='line-break'> </span>"Coolidge Avenue and thirty=one feet in the rear, containing ten <span class='line-break'> </span>"thousand four hundred and twenty square feet, at the rate of<span class='line-break'> </span>"twelve and a half cents per foot.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134844">
<h3><a name="page-1134844">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 030)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>30</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Oct. 12, &apos;70.[underlined]'>Trustees. Oct. 12, '70.[underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coolidge Estate declined.  Land on W. side of Cemetery &amp; Buckley Estate further time asksed.'>Coolidge Estate declined.  Land on W. side of Cemetery &amp; Buckley Estate further time asksed.</span></p>
<p>"The Committee further report that the purchase of the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Coolidge Estate is inexpedient, and they ask further time in <span class='line-break'> </span>"regard to the purchase of the land on the Westerly side of <span class='line-break'> </span>"the Cemetery, and of the Buckley Estate on Coolidge Avenue.</p>
<p>"They also report that is is inexpedient at the present time <span class='line-break'> </span>"to remove the Engine-house and its appurtenances to the Stone <span class='line-break'> </span>"meadow."</p>
<p>"for the Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) Jacob Bigelow, Chairman"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted'>Report accepted</span></p>
<p>After full discussion, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined],- that the above report be accepted and placed on file,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p>The following papers were laid before the Board by <span class='line-break'> </span>M^r J. T. Bradlee in behalf of M^r N. J. Bradlee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pavement of 100 f in front of Gateway.'>Pavement of 100 f in front of Gateway.</span></p>
<p>(a) Copy of a Petition to the Mayor and Alderman of the City of <span class='line-break'> </span>Cambridge signed by C. W. Folsom Supt, dated July 14^th, 1870,<span class='line-break'> </span>requesting that the Mayor &amp; Alderman would cause M^t. Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>"Street in front of the gateway at M^t Auburn to be paved with</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s Petition to Mayor &amp; Aldermen'>Supt's Petition to Mayor &amp; Aldermen</span><span class='line-break'> </span>"granite blocks for the full width of said Street, and for a <span class='line-break'> </span>"space of fifty-feet on each side of said gateway, or one hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>"feet in all.  The grade to be raised one foot in the centre."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rep. of Com. on Roads &amp; Bridges to Mayor &amp; Aldermen'>Rep. of Com. on Roads &amp; Bridges to Mayor &amp; Aldermen</span></p>
<p>(b) Copy of a Report made to the Bard of Aldermen by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Standing Committee on Roads and Bridges, September 21^st, 1870, <span class='line-break'> </span>stating that the proposed improvement would involve an <span class='line-break'> </span>expenditure of about $3500.- and recommending "that the Petition <span class='line-break'> </span>be granted when the Cambridge Horse Railroad and M^t Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery Corporations should agree together to bear one half of the <span class='line-break'> </span>expenses."  Memorandum of its acceptance endorsed on the Report.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134846">
<h3><a name="page-1134846">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 031)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>31</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, Oct. 12, &apos;70. Supt&apos;s Com^ee to N. J. Bradlee in  regard to proable [petition?] of Horse R. R. [underlined]'>Trustees, Oct. 12, '70. Supt's Com^ee to N. J. Bradlee in  regard to proable [petition?] of Horse R. R. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>(c) A communication adressed by the Superintendent to M^r.<span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee, dated September 29^th, 1870, enclosing the above named <span class='line-break'> </span>copy of Report and Vote, and stating that the President of the Horse <span class='line-break'> </span>Railroad Company was of opinion that the proposition would be <span class='line-break'> </span>met by them "in a liberal spirit."  To this Communication we re<span class='line-break'> </span>appended the signatures of eight Trustees of M^t Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Approval of 8 Trustees to the Plan to maximum cost of $875.00[underlined]'>Approval of 8 Trustees to the Plan to maximum cost of $875.00[underlined]</span></p>
<p>in apparoval of the Superintendent's "notifying the City that the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Cemetery Corporation will pay one quarter of the expense of paving <span class='line-break'> </span>"in front of the Gateway [as ^2^mentioned]  [not exceeding $875.][sq. bracket original] in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Report of the City Government on September 21^st, 1870."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s Com^ee to N. J. Bradlee,[underlined]'>Supt's Com^ee to N. J. Bradlee,[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(d) A communication addressed by the Superintendent to Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>N. J. Bradlee dated October 10, 1870, enclosing the papers above <span class='line-break'> </span>named, and stating that if the Trustees should formally approve<span class='line-break'> </span>the arrangement at their next Meeting the work could probably <span class='line-break'> </span>be done this fall.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Formal Approval of the above Plan by Vote.[underlined]'>Formal Approval of the above Plan by Vote.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>After full consideration it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the Secretary be instructed to notify the City of <span class='line-break'> </span>Cambridge that the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Aubur <span class='line-break'> </span>will pay one fourth part of the expense of paving the space op=<span class='line-break'> </span>=posite to the Gateway in the manner set forth in the Superintendent's<span class='line-break'> </span>Petition to the Honorable the Mayor and Aldermen of July 14;<span class='line-break'> </span>provided that the said one fourth part of the expense shall not <span class='line-break'> </span>exceed the sum of eight hundred and seventy-five dollars ($875.00)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com^ee of Messrs [Mr?] H. W. Dutton &amp; Son Publishers of the Transcript.[underlined]'>Com^ee of Messrs [Mr?] H. W. Dutton &amp; Son Publishers of the Transcript.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having read a communication dated <span class='line-break'> </span>October 12^th, 1870, addressed to the Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>by Messessrs Henry W. Dutton and Son, Publishers of the Daily <span class='line-break'> </span>Evening Transcript, enquirig whether an Order given to them by <span class='line-break'> </span>a member of this Board for the discontinuance of a certain series</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134848">
<h3><a name="page-1134848">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 032)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>32</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees October 12, 1870. Sec&apos;y. instructd to reply to above communication[underlined]'>Trustees October 12, 1870. Sec'y. instructd to reply to above communication[underlined]</span></p>
<p>of articles entitled "Mount Auburn Memoranda" was done by the <span class='line-break'> </span>authority of the Board of Trustees; it was</p>
<p>Voted,[underlined]- that the Secretary be instructed to reply to the letter<span class='line-break'> </span>frm the Publishers of the Transcript dated this day, informing <span class='line-break'> </span>them that the Board of Trustees have never taken any official <span class='line-break'> </span>action in respect to the publications referred to.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement ,&amp;c. of Treasurer to October 1, 1870 Referred to Com. on Finance.[underlined]'>Statement ,&amp;c. of Treasurer to October 1, 1870 Referred to Com. on Finance.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer having submitted his Statement for the 3^d<span class='line-break'> </span>quarter ending October 1, 1870, together with Trial Balances <span class='line-break'> </span>for the same date, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the above papers be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Finance.</p>
<p>Upon the petition of the parties in interest representatives <span class='line-break'> </span>were designated for Lots as follows: - viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='471'>471</span></p>
<p>Thomas H. H. Messinger of Stamford, Conn., residuary Trustee of</p>
<p>George W. Messinger <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four Hundred and seventy-one.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='497'>497</span></p>
<p>Susan S. Lombard of Boston, daughter of Israel Lombard,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four hundred and ninety=seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1331'>1331</span></p>
<p>Nathaniel A. Daniels of Somerville, son of Nathaniel Daniels <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of lot numbered Thirteen hundred and thirty-one.</p>
<p>Adjourned[underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>

<div id="page-1134850">

<div class="page-content">
<p>33</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 9^th, 1870.[underlined]'>Trustees. November 9^th, 1870.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>November 9^th, 1870[underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly Meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, November 9^th, 1870, at half past three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present the President, and Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Nath^l J.<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee, Brewer, Livermore, Lovejoy, Norcross, Sleeper &amp; Turner.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134852">
<h3><a name="page-1134852">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 034)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>34</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees November 9^th, 1870[underlined]'>Trustees November 9^th, 1870[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Corporation by the City of Cambridge for the year 1870; (that<span class='line-break'> </span>subject having been referred to their considration by vote <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees at the Meeting of September 14^th, 1870;) in the <span class='line-break'> </span>following terms.</p>
<p>"Boston, November 8^th, 1870.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on Cambridge Taxes for 1870.[underlined]'>Report on Cambridge Taxes for 1870.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Finance, to whom was referred the <span class='line-break'> </span>tax-bill of the City of Cambridge, herewith submit a statement <span class='line-break'> </span>of the same; from which it appears that the valuation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the taxable property of this Corporation in Cambridge has been <span class='line-break'> </span>increased $5000. - over that of 1869, and that the sum total of <span class='line-break'> </span>the tax has been increased by $70.-</p>
<p>The Committee are of the opinion that the tax is not <span class='line-break'> </span>unreasonable, and they have therefore approved the bill,<span class='line-break'> </span>and authorized its paymet</p>
<p>Respectfuly submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) Jacob Sleeper<span class='line-break'> </span>(") Alfred T. Turner</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted[underlined]'>Accepted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined],- that the above Report of the Finance Committee be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Committee on New Greenhouse[underlined]'>Report of Committee on New Greenhouse[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from M^r N. J. Bradlee, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to whom was referred at the last meeting, (V=31.)<span class='line-break'> </span>the communication of the Superintendent in reference to the <span class='line-break'> </span>erection of a new greenhouse, recommending "that the <span class='line-break'> </span>"first proposition of M^r Folsom for a building covering<span class='line-break'> </span>"three thousand feet and costing not over $3000. - to <span class='line-break'> </span>"accommodate not less than 12,000 plants be adopted,<span class='line-break'> </span>"and that the Superintendent be instructed to Erect the Same"</p>
<p>On the foregoing Report it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>Voted, that the Superintendent be authorized to erect <span class='line-break'> </span>at an expense of not exceeding $3000. - under the super=<span class='line-break'> </span>=vision of M^r N. J. Bradlee a new Greenhouse as recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mended in the report of M^r Bradlee this day submitted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cambridge Cemetery. Purchase of land, ordered by City of Cambridge[underlined]'>Cambridge Cemetery. Purchase of land, ordered by City of Cambridge[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A communication having been received from <span class='line-break'> </span>M^r D. W. Chamberlin in behalf of the Committee on Public <span class='line-break'> </span>Property of the City Council of the City of Cambridge, stating that <span class='line-break'> </span>the City Council had ordered the said Committe to purchase <span class='line-break'> </span>the strip of land containing ten thousand four hundred and <span class='line-break'> </span>twenty square feet as applied for by the Commissioners of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cambridge Cemetery, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of land, ordered by this Board[underlined]'>Sale of land, ordered by this Board[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], that the Treasurer and Secretary be and they are <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby authorized and empowered to make execute and <span class='line-break'> </span>deliver in the name of the Corporation to the City of Cambridge <span class='line-break'> </span>a deed of so much of the Stone Meadow lot, so called, as <span class='line-break'> </span>is described in the Report of the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>recommending said conveyance, made to and accepted by <span class='line-break'> </span>this Board October 12^th, 1870, for the consideration named<span class='line-break'> </span>in said report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Henry Gurney&apos;s Petition for Add^l rights of interment in Lot 1014[underlined]'>Henry Gurney's Petition for Add^l rights of interment in Lot 1014[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A communication have been received from M^r Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>Gurney in relation to the existing restrictions upon the right <span class='line-break'> </span>of interment in Lot N^o 1014, reconveyed by said Gurney to <span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation in trust, by deed dated April 16, 1867; requesting <span class='line-break'> </span>that the rights of interment in said deed expressed might <span class='line-break'> </span>be extended to "Eight great grandchildren, if so many would <span class='line-break'> </span>ever have application made at their decease;"  it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Acceded to.[underlined]'>Acceded to.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined,  - that the request of Mr Gurney be acceded to <span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board, and that the Secretary be instructed</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p>36</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, November 9^th, 1870. [underlined['>Trustees, November 9^th, 1870. [underlined[</span></p>
<p>to make such entry upon the margin of the record of the <span class='line-break'> </span>reconveyance aforesaid, as shall adequately express the <span class='line-break'> </span>action of the Trustees in the premises.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contract for Perpetual Repair of Lot 845[underlined]'>Contract for Perpetual Repair of Lot 845[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Seretary having stated that the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guarantee the <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N^o 845 upon Central Av. be=<span class='line-break'> </span>=longing to the late Ann M. Tracy, deceased, for four <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars, - four hundred dollars being<span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual care of said Lot, and fifty dollars for<span class='line-break'> </span>immmediate use in regrading and improving the same, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that said contract had been duly Executed by W^m<span class='line-break'> </span>G. Means, Executor of the late proprietor, and the money paid,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined[, - that the said contract be concurred in</p>
<p>Upon the petition of the parties in interest <span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designed for Lots as follows, viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='48'>48</span></p>
<p>Sarah E. Shurtleff of Boston, daughter of Hiram Smith <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Forty-eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='132'>132</span></p>
<p>Francis W. Hunnewell of Boston, Trustee of Eliza Smith, widow,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One hundred and thirty=two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1403'>1403</span></p>
<p>William Harris of Boston, son of Isaac Harris, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fourteen hundred and three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1444'>1444</span></p>
<p>L. Philip Morrison of Boston, sonn in-law of Barnabas Thacher<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fourteen hundred and forty-four.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134858">
<h3><a name="page-1134858">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 037)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>37</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees November 9^th, 1870.[underlined]'>Trustees November 9^th, 1870.[underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1481'>1481</span></p>
<p>Cheever Newhall of Lynn, son of John M. Newhall<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprieter of Lot numbered Fourteen hundred and eight=one.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2606'>2606</span></p>
<p>Almira P. Needham of Cambridge, sister of W^m W/ Meedham <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty=six hundred and six.</p>
<p>Adjourned[underlined].</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees December 14^th, 1870[underlined]'>Trustees December 14^th, 1870[underlined]</span></p>
<p>December 14^th, 1870[undrlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly Meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, December 14^th, 1870, at half past Three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. Austin, Bowditch,<span class='line-break'> </span>J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Livermore, Norcross, Rand and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Land W. of Cem&apos;y. Rep. in ref. to purchase of[underlined]'>Land W. of Cem'y. Rep. in ref. to purchase of[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal report was received from M^r J. T. Bradlee in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the sub-committee, (Messrs. Livermore and J. T. Bradlee) of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Grounds, in reference to the purchase of land <span class='line-break'> </span>West of the Cemetery; stating that an offer had been made by <span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor of the tract in question, containing about six and <span class='line-break'> </span>a half acres, to sell the same to the Corporation for the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>seventy=five hundred dollars, ($7500.-)</p>
<p>===Spec. Com^tee app. with authority to purchase[underlined]</p>
<p>After a full discussion, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]- that the subject of purchasing the lot of land West <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery be referred to a special Committee consiting of <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. Livermore ad J. T. Bradlee, with full powers to purchase the <span class='line-break'> </span>same, if they deem it expedient.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134860">
<h3><a name="page-1134860">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 038)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>38</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 14^th, 1870[underlined]'>Trustees. December 14^th, 1870[underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed Donation to Corporation by President'>Proposed Donation to Corporation by President</span></p>
<p>A verbal statement, accompanied by a written com=<span class='line-break'> </span>munication was made to the Board by the President, both <span class='line-break'> </span>having refrence to a proposed donation by him, upon certain<span class='line-break'> </span>terms and conditions, to the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn of a Memorial Work of Art, commemorative of the <span class='line-break'> </span>great events of our national history during the past ten years.</p>
<p>After hearing the same it was-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refered to Special Com^tee[underlined]'>Refered to Special Com^tee[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]. - that a SpecialCommittee be appointed by nom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ination at large to whom the communications of the Presidnt <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred.</p>
<p>And Messrs Rand,Norcross and Livermore were so <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation for new Greenhouse at last Meeting, irregularity in;[underlined]'>Appropriation for new Greenhouse at last Meeting, irregularity in;[underlined]</span></p>
<p>In connection with the vote adopted at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting authorizing the erecton of a new greenhouse at an <span class='line-break'> </span>expense not exceeding $3000. - the Secretary called the attention <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board to Article 14 of the By=Laws providing that "No <span class='line-break'> </span>appropriation of money exceding one thousand dollars ^for any one object^ shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be made by the Trustees except at a meeting at least seven days <span class='line-break'> </span>subsequent to the Meeting in which the said appropriation has<span class='line-break'> </span>been moved, whereof special notice shall have been given,"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='how met[undrlined]'>how met[undrlined]</span></p>
<p>M^r N. J. Bradlee the mover of the Vote above referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>then moved that the aforesaid appropriation be made, said <span class='line-break'> </span>motion to be considered and acted on at a meeting held at least <span class='line-break'> </span>seven days subsequent to the present one.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bill of Sam^l Snow vs Corp^n[underlined]'>Bill of Sam^l Snow vs Corp^n[underlined]</span></p>
<p>M^r Sam^l. Snow's Bill for professonal services as <span class='line-break'> </span>Counsel for the Corporation in the case of Gardner vs. Prop^s<span class='line-break'> </span>of the M^t Auburn, having been laid before the Board, it was.</p>

<p>===Trustees. December 14, 1870. [?Payment}  authorized [underlined]</p>
<p>Voted,[underlined] that the Treasurer be authorized to pay Mr Snow's Bill <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $75.00 for services rendered as a counsel for the <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation in the above suit.</p>
<p>Upon the pettion of the parties in interest, representatives <span class='line-break'> </span>were designated for Lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='518'>518</span></p>
<p>Eliza F. Bridgham, (Mrs Sam^l. W.) of New York, daughter of Samuel Fales,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Five hundred and eighteen.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1770'>1770</span></p>
<p>Martha G. Smith, (Mrs. Robert) of Boston, sister of M^rs Caroline Ameling[?] (formerly Langley)}<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Seventeen hundred and seventy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1845'>1845</span></p>
<p>Henry F. Jenks of Boston, son of John Henry Jenks<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eighteen hundred and forty=five.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2156'>2156</span></p>
<p>Edward A. Locke of Boston, son of Edward Locke<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty=one hundred and fifty=six.</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], that when this Meeting adjourns it adjourn to <span class='line-break'> </span>meet at the call of the special Committee to whom was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred the communications of the President made this day.</p>
<p>Adjourned[underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l Batchelder Jr., Secretary</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees January 4, 1871 [underlined]'>Trustees January 4, 1871 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Boston, January 2^d, 1871[undrlined]</p>
<p>Dr. Jacob Bigelow, Pres^t</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>You are hereby requested to call <span class='line-break'> </span>a Meeting of the Board of Trustees of M^t Auburn Cemetery, <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday afternoon next, (Jan'y. 4, 1871,) at 4 o'clock to <span class='line-break'> </span>hear the report of the Special Committee empowered to <span class='line-break'> </span>purchase land West of the Cemetery, and oblige</p>
<p>Yours &amp;c.,</p>
<p>(Signed) Isaac Livermore<span class='line-break'> </span>John T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Alfred T. Turner<span class='line-break'> </span>T. M. Brewer<span class='line-break'> </span>Nath^l. J. Bradlee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secy. instructed to call Sp. Meeting [underlined]'>Secy. instructed to call Sp. Meeting [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Boston, January 2^d, 1871.</p>
<p>Sam^l Batchelder Jr.  Secy. Prop^s M^t Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please call a Meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>agreeably to the within request.</p>
<p>(Signed) Jacob Bigelow, Pres^t.</p>
<p>In accordance with the requst and call aforesaid, <span class='line-break'> </span>and pursuant to notifications duly issued, a Special Meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees was held on Wednesday, January 4^th,<span class='line-break'> </span>1871, at Four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. Rand, Livermore, Turner and J. T. Bradlee.</p>

<p>A Report was received from M^r J. T. Bradlee in behalf <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Special Committee consisting of Messrs. Livermore and <span class='line-break'> </span>J. T. Bradlee appointed at the last Meeting on the purchase <span class='line-break'> </span>of the land West of the Cemetery, with full powers to purchase the <span class='line-break'> </span>same should they deem it expedient to do so, - stating that they <span class='line-break'> </span>had agreed to purchase the same from the R^t Rev^d John J. <span class='line-break'> </span>Williams, Roman Catholic Biship of Boston, for the sum of</p>
<p>===Purchase agreed upon [underlined]</p>
<p>Sixty-five hundred dollars, ($6500.00), being one thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars per acre, should the title prove satisfactory.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted Appropriation of $6500 moved'>Report accepted Appropriation of $6500 moved</span></p>
<p>Voted,[underlined]- that the Report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p>M^r J. T. Bradlee then moved that the aforesaid sum<span class='line-break'> </span>of Sixty-five hundred dollars, ($6500) be appropriated for <span class='line-break'> </span>the payment for the real Estate in question.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laid over to Next Meeting'>Laid over to Next Meeting</span></p>
<p>The President announced that the above motion would <span class='line-break'> </span>lay over for consideration at the next meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>under Article 14 of the By=Laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secy. ord^d to Examine Title,[underlined]'>Secy. ord^d to Examine Title,[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted,[underlined] - that the Secretary be instructed to examine the <span class='line-break'> </span>title of the said real Estate, and report to the Trustees.</p>
<p>Adjourned[underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees January 11, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees January 11, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>January 11^th, 1871[underlined]</p>

<p>The record of the last Meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p>The Secretary stated that he had examined the title</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. February 6^th, 1871.[underlined]'>Proprietors. February 6^th, 1871.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Annual Meeting ^of the^ Proprietors.<span class='line-break'> </span>Monday February 6^th, 1871 [underlined]</p>
<p>A duly notified Meeting of the Proprietors of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn was held at Horticultural <span class='line-break'> </span>Hall, Boston, on Monday, February 6^th, 1871, at half past <span class='line-break'> </span>Three o'clock in the afternoon.</p>
<p>A quorum being present, the meeting was called <span class='line-break'> </span>to order by the Secretary, in the absence of the President.</p>
<p>===Chairman Chosen. Isaac Livermore Esq.</p>
<p>Voted[underlined],- that M^r Isaac Livermore be chosen chairman.</p>
<p>M^r Livermore having taken the chair, the call <span class='line-break'> </span>for the Meeting was read by the Secretary.  On motion</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the reading of the record of the lst Pro=<span class='line-break'> </span>=prietors' Meeting be dispensed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports accepted.[underlined]'>Annual Reports accepted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the reading of the Annual Reports be dis=<span class='line-break'> </span>pensed with, and that said Reports be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignations of Messrs. Austin, Bowditch, Lovejoy, Norcross &amp; Sleeper.  Vote of thanks to them.'>Resignations of Messrs. Austin, Bowditch, Lovejoy, Norcross &amp; Sleeper.  Vote of thanks to them.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having read letters of resignation <span class='line-break'> </span>from Messrs. Jacob Sleeper, J. Ingersoll Bowditch, Loyal <span class='line-break'> </span>Lovejoy, Edward Austin and Otis Norcross, as members <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees, on motion of Mr. Jeffrey <span class='line-break'> </span>Richardson it was unanimously</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the thanks of the Proprietors are hereby <span class='line-break'> </span>presented to the retiring members of the Board of Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. appt. to collect assort &amp; count Votes'>Com. appt. to collect assort &amp; count Votes</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that a Committee of three be appointed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>chair to collect, assort and count the votes for filling the</p>
</div>
</div>
