Snow, (3 ")  " 128 <span class='line-break'></span>Jams L. Little, (2 ")  " 125 <span class='line-break'></span>Edward Lawrence, (1 year)  "  131 <span class='line-break'></span>Charles F. Choate, ( "  " )  " 129-</p>

<div id="page-1134875">
<h3><a name="page-1134875">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 048)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>48</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Report[underlined]'>Trustees' Report[underlined]</span></p>
<p>During the past year liberal importations and <span class='line-break'> </span>purchases of flowering shrubs and plants have been made <span class='line-break'> </span>for the embellisment of the Cemetery, most of which are<span class='line-break'> </span>now in good and promising condition.</p>
<p>The Reception House opposite the Gate has been <span class='line-break'> </span>completed and suppplied with various accommodations <span class='line-break'> </span>for the use of visitors.  the Superintendent's House and <span class='line-break'> </span>appurtenances have been put in thorough repair.</p>
<p>Hazel Dell has been further improved by the com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=pleting of Tombs on the Northerly side, and laying out of <span class='line-break'> </span>new lots on the Southerly side of said Dell, conformably to <span class='line-break'> </span>a Plan submitted by the Superintendent and adopted by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees.</p>
<p>A strip of land outside of Coolidge Avneue, measuring <span class='line-break'> </span>seven feet two inches in front, and thirty=one feet in the rear, <span class='line-break'> </span>containing ten thousand four hundred and twenty square<span class='line-break'> </span>feet has been sold to the City of Cambridge, at the rate of <span class='line-break'> </span>twelve and a half cents per foot, for $1302.50</p>
<p>It has been voted to erect a new Greenhouse at <span class='line-break'> </span>an expense not exceeding three thousand dollars, ($3000. -)</p>
<p>A tract of land lying West of the Cemtery, con=<span class='line-break'> </span>=taining aboaut six and a half acres has been purchased <span class='line-break'> </span>of R^t Rev. John J. Williams, Roman atholic Bishop of <span class='line-break'> </span>Boston, for the sum of six thousand five hundred ollars ($6500.)</p>
<p>The Trustees, at a meeting April 12^th, elected Col. <span class='line-break'> </span>charles W. Folsom as Superintendent for the current year.</p>
<p>At the same meeting they adopted the Report of a </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134876">
<h3><a name="page-1134876">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 049)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>49</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Report[underlined]'>Trustees' Report[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Committee providing that the offices of Secretary and Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>shall hereafter be held by diffrent persons, and took order to <span class='line-break'> </span>that effect.</p>
<p>Austin J. Coolidge Esq., having declined re=election to <span class='line-break'> </span>either of the said offices, Henry B. Mackintosh Esq. was <span class='line-break'> </span>elected Treasurer, and Samuel Batchelder Jr. Esq. was elected <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary for the ensuing year.</p>
<p>By the Treasurer's s Report pf 1870, it appears that the Per=<span class='line-break'> </span>=manent Fund for the future support and preservation of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery now amounts to $115.456.76.  The Repair Fund is <span class='line-break'> </span>now $69.466.63. and the estimated balance in cash, and <span class='line-break'> </span>invested disposable property is $30,943.04, exclusive of real <span class='line-break'> </span>estate owned by the Corporation outside of the Cemetery.</p>
<p>For the Trustees,</p>
<p>(Signed) Jacob Bigelow</p>
<p>President.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134886">
<h3><a name="page-1134886">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 059)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees February 15, 1871'>Trustees February 15, 1871</span><span class='line-break'> </span>February 15, 1871</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees, being the first since<span class='line-break'> </span>the Annual Meeting of the Proprietors, was held on Wednesday,<span class='line-break'> </span>February 15, 1871 at half past Three o'clock P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present the President, Dr Bigelow and Messrs John T.<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee [long line], Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Little<span class='line-break'> </span>Livermore, Perkins, Rand, Snow and Turner<span class='line-break'> </span>The record of the last Trustees' Meeting and of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Meeting of Proprietors was read by the Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President'>Election of President</span></p>
<p>The business first in order being the choice of officers ^<span class='line-break'> </span>Dr. Bigelow having declined a reelection^<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board proceeded to ballot for President with the following<span class='line-break'> </span>result; Whole number of ballots cast   11</p>
<p>Necessary for a choice      6<span class='line-break'> </span>John T. Bradlee received 6<span class='line-break'> </span>Edward L. Rand   "    3<span class='line-break'> </span>Isaac Livermore  "     2<span class='line-break'> </span>And Mr John T. Brandlee was declared duly  elected President.<span class='line-break'> </span>Dr. Bigelow moved that the Board proceed to the<span class='line-break'> </span>election of a Treasurer and Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span>Before the question was put on the above motion, the<span class='line-break'> </span>following substitute was offered: a motion of Mr Turner it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of other officers deferred'>Election of other officers deferred</span></p>
<p>Voted, that the choice of the other officers, and the Com<span class='line-break'> </span>mittees be postponed to to an adjourned meeting of the Board.<span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Dr. Brewer it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Nominating Com appd to [??] Committees'>Nominating Com appd to [??] Committees</span></p>
<p>Voted, that a Committee of three be appointed to nominate<span class='line-break'> </span>Committees.</p>
<p>The Presdient thereupon appointed Messrs Rand, Brewer <span class='line-break'> </span>and Little to constitute said Committee.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134887">
<h3><a name="page-1134887">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 060)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees February 15, 1871 Fixing of Salaries deferred [underlined] '>Trustees February 15, 1871 Fixing of Salaries deferred [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the fixing of salaries be also postponed<span class='line-break'> </span>to the next Meeting.</p>
<p>On motion of Dr. Bigelow it was</p>

<p>Voted [underlined] - that a Committee of three be appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider what action may be necessary or expedient in<span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the use and appropriation of the lately purchased<span class='line-break'> </span>land West of the Cemetery.</p>
<p>The President appointed Messrs Bigelow, Livermore <span class='line-break'> </span>and Lawrence to constitute said Committee.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr Little it was</p>
<p>Voted,[underlined] that the President be added to the above Committee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permanent Fund, Saleable land, By-Law revisions; subjects referred at Last Trustees Meeting [underlined]'>Permanent Fund, Saleable land, By-Law revisions; subjects referred at Last Trustees Meeting [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary called the attention of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>to the subjects referred to its consideration at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees, viz: the Communications of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent in regard to the increase of the Permanent<span class='line-break'> </span>Fund, and to computing the percentage of saleable land<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery. Also the subject of a revision of the <span class='line-break'> </span>By Laws.   On motion   it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laid on the table underlined]'>Laid on the table underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted, that the foregoing subject to be laid upon the table.</p>

<p>A communication for the Superintendent recom<span class='line-break'></span>mending the appointment of Mr. George G. Spear to the<span class='line-break'> </span>office of Gate Keeper - the said communication being ac<span class='line-break'></span>companied with numerous testimonials in favor of Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Spear, were also laid before the Board by the Secretary, and it was</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Subject postponed to next Meeting [uderlined]='>Subject postponed to next Meeting [uderlined]=</span></p>
<p>Voted that the consideration of the foregoing matters <span class='line-break'> </span>be postponed to the next meeting.</p>

<p>February 23^rd, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Thursday, February 23^rd, 1871, at half past Three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Livermore, Perkins, Rand, <span class='line-break'> </span>Snow and  Turner, full Board.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Secretary and Treasurer [underlined]'>Election of Secretary and Treasurer [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The first business in order bieng the election of <span class='line-break'> </span>officers, which was postponed to this Meeting by special assign=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ment, at the Meeting held on the 15^th inst., a ballot was had<span class='line-break'> </span>for the choice of a Secretary for the ensuing year and it appeared<span class='line-break'> </span>that Samuel Batchelder Jr. was elected to that office as aforesaid.<span class='line-break'> </span>A ballot was then had for the  office of Treasurer, or the ensuing<span class='line-break'> </span>year and it appeared that H.B. Mackintosh was elected to <span class='line-break'> </span>that office as aforesaid.</p>

Rand, Brewer, and Little, appointed at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last Meeting to nominate candidates for the standing Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittes of the Board for the ensuing year, as follows</p>

<p>The undersigned, in behalf of the Committee appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>to nominate to this Board the Standing Committees for the year<span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing, reports that said Comittee have attended to that <span class='line-break'> </span>duty, and recommend the following list.</p>

Also recommending that the Gate=Keeper's salary be <span class='line-break'> </span>advanced from $700. to $800.  On motion of Mr. Livermore, it was</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolutions of respect, upon the Retirement of Jacob Bigelow, M. D. '>Resolutions of respect, upon the Retirement of Jacob Bigelow, M. D. </span></p>
<p>The following Preamble and Resolutions were read <span class='line-break'> </span>and submitted to the Board by M^r Rand:</p>
<p>"Whereas at the Meeting of the Trustees on the 15^th<span class='line-break'> </span>February, continued by adjournment to this day, Dr. Jacob <span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow declined a reelection as Presidnet fo the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of M^t. Auburn, the Trustees are unwilling that <span class='line-break'> </span>the occasion should pass without an expression of their regard <span class='line-break'> </span>for him, and of their appreciation of his long=continued<span class='line-break'> </span>and valuable Services;  therefore,</p>
<p>Resolved[underlined], that on this the retirement of Dr. Bigelow <span class='line-break'> </span>from the office which for twenty=six years he has so worthily <span class='line-break'> </span>filled, and for which, by his knowledge and varied ac<span class='line-break'></span>=quirements, he has shown himself so singlularly qualifited,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees desire to express  their appreciation of his labors and <span class='line-break'> </span>services so long rendered to the corporation of which he was <span class='line-break'> </span>one of the original projectors  and founders, - labors and services <span class='line-break'> </span>which have impressed themselves upon the Cemetery where <span class='line-break'> </span>every object, its entrance gateway, its chapel, its beautiful <span class='line-break'> </span>Avenues, paths and fountains all bear witness to his science<span class='line-break'> </span>skill alnd taste, and signally identify him with M^t. Auburn.</p>
<p>Resolved[underlined], - that the Trustees tender to Dr. Bigelow <span class='line-break'> </span>the expression of their deep personal regard; and while <span class='line-break'> </span>they may not hereafter meet him at their Board, as their <span class='line-break'> </span>presiding officer, they are gratified with the knowledge that <span class='line-break'> </span>they will still havea the benefit of his experience and advice</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 8^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. March 8^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>March 8^th, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, March 8^th, 1871 at half past Three o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Livermore, Perkins, Snow <span class='line-break'> </span>and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Land West of Cem&apos;y. Rep. of Com. on use and apropriation of [underlined]'>Land West of Cem'y. Rep. of Com. on use and apropriation of [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Special Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of Messrs. Johb T. Bradlee, Bigelow, Livermore and <span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, appointed at the  Meeting held on the 15^th Ult^o, (V=60),<span class='line-break'> </span>to consider what action may be necessary or expedient, in re=<span class='line-break'> </span>=gard to the use and appropriation of the lately purchased land <span class='line-break'> </span>West of the Cemtery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted[underlined]'>accepted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Said Report having ben read and considered, it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted [underlined]- that the Report be accepted, and the Committee discharged.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Votes Embodied in said Report adopted. [underlined]'>Votes Embodied in said Report adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of the Chairman of the Committee, the votes<span class='line-break'> </span>embodied in said Report were unanimously adopted, as follows: -</p>
<p>"Voted [underlined],  - that the Lot of land recently purchased by the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn of R^t Rev^d John J. <span class='line-break'> </span>"Williams, Roman Catholic Bishop of Boston,situated on the Westerly  <span class='line-break'> </span>"side o f their Cemetery, be and hereby, is annexed to said Cemetery,</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>"and made part thereof.</p>
<p>"Voted [underlined], - that the Secretary be directed to send a copy of <span class='line-break'> </span>"the foregoing Vote to the Assessors of Watertown.</p>
<p>"Voted [underlined], - that the Committee on Grounds be instructed to <span class='line-break'> </span>"cause an iron fence, of the same design and finish as that <span class='line-break'> </span>"now bounding the Cemetery of Mount Auburn Street to be placed<span class='line-break'> </span>"on that part of the line of the Lot recently purchased of <span class='line-break'> </span>"Bishop Williams running on said Street.</p>
<p>"Voted [underlined], - that the subject of the laying out and occupancy<span class='line-break'> </span>"of said land be referred to the Committee on Grounds, to <span class='line-break'> </span>"consider and report."</p>

Proposed improvements in vicinity of- Stone Meadow. Erec. of Carp. Shop on. Referred to Com. on Grounds [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from the Superintend=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dent in reference to certain proposed improvements in the <span class='line-break'> </span>vicinity of the Engine house, the erection of a carpenter's <span class='line-break'> </span>shop on the Stone Meadow, &amp;c., accompanied with a plan <span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. Turner, it was</p>

On motion of Mr. Perkins</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], -that said communication be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds with full powers.</p>

<p>On motion of M^r Livermore it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted [underlined], that a Committee of three, to consist of the President<span class='line-break'> </span>with two other members of the Board designated by him, be <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed to consider and report upon the subject of a</p>

<p>Then personally appeared Samuel Batchelder Jr., and made<span class='line-break'> </span>oath that he would faithfully perform the duties appertaining to <span class='line-break'> </span>the office of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of M^t Auburn.</p>

<p>H. B. MaKintosh.  Justice of the Peace.</p>

<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, April 12^th, 1871, at half past Three o'clock,P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Livermore, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Enging =house. Supt. instructed to carry out improvements in vicinity of.'>Enging =house. Supt. instructed to carry out improvements in vicinity of.</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Comittee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to certain improvements recommendd by the Super=<span class='line-break'> </span>=intendent in the vicinity of the Engine=house, stating that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee had instructed the Superintendent to carry out the <span class='line-break'> </span>plan of improvements suggested.</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p>A Report was received from the same Committee in reference <span class='line-break'> </span>to a recommendation by the Superintendent for the cancellation</p>

<p>of the lease of certain premises held by Alex. M^cDonald, for <span class='line-break'> </span>reasons stated.  The said Communication having, in common <span class='line-break'> </span>with the one above noted, been referred to the Committee with <span class='line-break'> </span>full powers, they report that said lease had been cancelled to take effect January 1^st, 1871.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report be accpted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving=Tomb Cons^tn of Vestibule &amp; 2 compartments of recommended. [underlined]'>Receiving=Tomb Cons^tn of Vestibule &amp; 2 compartments of recommended. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the same Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>based upon a communication from the Superintendent dated<span class='line-break'> </span>March 8^th, 1871, covering estimates for the completion of a portion <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Recieving Tomb; stating that the Committee had <span class='line-break'> </span>given theg subject careful consideration, and recommending <span class='line-break'> </span>the passage of the following order</p>
<p>"Voted, - that the Superintendent be dircted to <span class='line-break'> </span>construct, under the direction of the Committee on Grounds, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Vestibule and two compartments of the new Receiving Tomb in <span class='line-break'> </span>accordance wtih plans submitted herewith, and that an amount <span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding Six thousand dollars be, and hereby is appropriated <span class='line-break'> </span>to defray the expenses of the same. "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote appropriating $6000.- for above purpose laid over[underlined]'>Vote appropriating $6000.- for above purpose laid over[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined],- that the Report be accepted and that the vote therein <span class='line-break'> </span>recommended be laid over for action at a subsequent meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>under Article 14 of the By=Laws.</p>

Upon motion of M^r Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Qu. of raising fence referred to [underlined]'>Qu. of raising fence referred to [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the question of raising the fence on M^t Auburn S^t<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds, with instructions to</p>

<p>A communicatin dated April 11^th, 1871, was received <span class='line-break'> </span>from the Superintendent in reference to neglected Lots pursuant <span class='line-break'> </span>to the requirements of Article 29 of the By=Laws, accompanied <span class='line-break'> </span>with books and forms used and proposed to be used in keeping <span class='line-break'> </span>records of said Lots and communicating with the proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined]. - that said communication be placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Carriage acc^ns asked for by Supt. [underlined]'>Carriage acc^ns asked for by Supt. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A communication dated April 7^th, 1871 was received from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent asking that ahe might be provided with suitable <span class='line-break'> </span>carriage accommodations to drive in the Cemetery with parties <span class='line-break'> </span>desirous of purchasing Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Referred to Pres^t with full powers[underlined] '> Referred to Pres^t with full powers[underlined] </span></p>

<p>A communication dated Mrch 8^th, 1871 was received <span class='line-break'> </span>from the Superintendent suggesting that the Board of Trustees consider<span class='line-break'> </span>the expediency of providing dwelling houses for a few of the <span class='line-break'> </span>employees of the Corporation.</p>

J. Belcher of Cambridge.<span class='line-break'> </span>After consideration it was</p>

<p>On the statement made by M<sup>r</sup> Turner that we had <span class='line-break'> </span>been requested by Dr. Brewer now absent from the City, to <span class='line-break'> </span>bring to the notice of the Board the expediency of appointing <span class='line-break'> </span>a Committee on the Birds of the Cemetery, it was</p>

<p>Mr. Turner having requested to be excused from <span class='line-break'> </span>serving, M<sup>r</sup> Little was appointed in his place.</p>

<p>A verbal communication was addressed to the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>by M<sup>r</sup> Lawrence stating that M<sup>r</sup> Stearns, President of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Fitchburg Railroad Co. had suggested to him that the Railroad<span class='line-break'> </span>Company would readily negotiate for the sale of the Pro=<span class='line-break'> </span>=prietors of M<sup>r</sup> Auburn of a small parcel of land adjoining<span class='line-break'> </span>their lately acquired premises West of the Cemetery, and for <span class='line-break'> </span>the opening of a gate affording passengers by the cars a</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 12^th, 1871. Ref. to Com. on Grounds[underlined]'>Trustees. April 12^th, 1871. Ref. to Com. on Grounds[underlined]</span></p>
<p>more convenient access to the Cemetery grounds.  After consideration it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the subject be referred to the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission to Cemetery on Decoration Day [?] referred to Pres^t with instructions. [underlined] '>Admission to Cemetery on Decoration Day [?] referred to Pres^t with instructions. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The subject of admission to the Cemetery on "Decoration=<span class='line-break'> </span>=Day" having been introduced and fully considered, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined],that the subject be referred to the President, re=<span class='line-break'> </span>=questing him to confer with the Presidents of other Cemetries <span class='line-break'> </span>in the vicinity of Boston with a view of coming to a common <span class='line-break'> </span>understanding in the matter and agreeing upon a uniform<span class='line-break'> </span>system of regulations, if possible: and to report his acion<span class='line-break'> </span>at the next Meeting of the Board of Trustees.</p>

<p>The Treasurer having presented his Reports and <span class='line-break'> </span>Statements of Account for the quarter ending marh 31, 1871, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined]. - that the Treasurer's Statements be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance to consider and report.</p>

<p>and of Lot N^o 3422 on said <span class='line-break'> </span>Path belonging to Christopher C. Chadwick for Four hundred dollars; <span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>

<div id="page-1134904">
<h3><a name="page-1134904">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 077)</a></h3>

<p>77</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>A Meeting of the Trustees was held, pursuant to adjournment,<span class='line-break'> </span>on Monday, Aparil 24^th, 1871, at half past Three o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Little, Livermore, Perkins, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p>The  proposed appropriation for the completionof a portion <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Receiving Tomb as embodied in the vote submitted by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds at the last meeting, and laid over under<span class='line-break'> </span>Article 14 of the By=Laws, was renewed by the chairman of that <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, and the same was unanimously adopted as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb. Partial Constr^n of ordered. [underlined]'>Receiving Tomb. Partial Constr^n of ordered. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Supreintendent be directed to construct under<span class='line-break'> </span>the direction of the Committee on Grounds the Vestibule and two <span class='line-break'> </span>compartments of the new Receiving Tomb, in accordane with <span class='line-break'> </span>plans submitted herewith, and that an amount not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>Six thousand dollars ($6000. -) be and hereby is appropriated<span class='line-break'> </span>to defray the expenses of the same.</p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds in reference to the raising of the fence on the front line <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery West of the Gate and of altering the grade of the <span class='line-break'> </span>street and sidewalk.  After full discussion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Raising fence &amp;c. subject postponed.[underlined]'>Raising fence &amp;c. subject postponed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the further consideration fo the subject be post=<span class='line-break'> </span>=poned to the next meeting.</p>
<p>A verbal Report was also made by the same Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>recommending the renewal of the Lease to Chas. F. Belcher of part<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Reception House for a Refreshment Room; and it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refreshment Rooms lease of authorized [underlined]'>Refreshment Rooms lease of authorized [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Committee on Grounds are hereby authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to lease to Charles F. Belcher for one year the room recently</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134905">
<h3><a name="page-1134905">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 078)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>78</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 24^th, 1871'>Trustees. April 24^th, 1871</span></p>
<p>occupied by him as a Refreshment Room in the Reception <span class='line-break'> </span>House at Mount Auburn, on such terms, and under such <span class='line-break'> </span>restrictions as they may deem desirable.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fitchburg R. R. Co. Entrnce way into Cem&apos;y from their premises requested.[underlined]'>Fitchburg R. R. Co. Entrnce way into Cem'y from their premises requested.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A communication from William B. Stearns, President <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Fitchburg Railroad Co., dated April 22^nd, 1871, petitioning <span class='line-break'> </span>for the establishment of a gateway into the Cemetery at some <span class='line-break'> </span>point opposite their railway station at Mount Auburn, and <span class='line-break'> </span>stating that the Railroad Company are prepared to pay a <span class='line-break'> </span>reasonable proportion of the expense incurred, having been <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said Communication be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p>A Report was recieved from the Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred at the last Meeting the Statements and Trial <span class='line-break'> </span>Balance of the Treasurer for the quarter ending March 31^st, 1871, <span class='line-break'> </span>approving the same as correct.  And it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Finance Com^tee Report accepted [underlined]'>Finance Com^tee Report accepted [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the Report of the Finance Committee be ac=<span class='line-break'> </span>=cepted, and the said accounts placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coolidge Avenue. Rep. of Spec. Com. on claims of Messrs Coolidge &amp; Muzzey [underlined]'>Coolidge Avenue. Rep. of Spec. Com. on claims of Messrs Coolidge &amp; Muzzey [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was submitted by the Special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of the President and M^r Choate, to whom was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last Meeting the communications of Messrs. Coolidge<span class='line-break'> </span>and Muzzey in reference to Coolidge Avenue.  The same having <span class='line-break'> </span>been read and considered, on motion of M^r Turner it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined],- that the Report be accepted and spread upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>record.  [See next page.] [square brackets original]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pres^t to Com. with City of Camb. concerning.'>Pres^t to Com. with City of Camb. concerning.</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] ,- that the President be requested to communicate to the <span class='line-break'> </span>City of Cambridge the facts embodied in said report, and <span class='line-break'> </span>otherwise connected with the claims aforesaid.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134906">
<h3><a name="page-1134906">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 079)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>79</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of Dr. Bigelow it was</p>
<p>Voted [underline], - that the Committee on Grounds be instructed to <span class='line-break'> </span>consider the expediency of a re=survey and re=constructon of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Stone Farm.</p>
<p>Adjourned. [underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coolidge Av^e Report of Special Com^tee [in?] extenso. [underlined] '>Coolidge Av^e Report of Special Com^tee [in?] extenso. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The Special Committee to whom were referred the <span class='line-break'> </span>applications of H. W. Mussey and J. G. Coolidge for payment of <span class='line-break'> </span>damages caused to their estates by grading Coolidge Avenue by the <span class='line-break'> </span>City of Cambidge in 1869 submit the following</p>
<p>Report.</p>
<p>In the year 1862 a claim made that this Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>was bound to grade and repair the Avenue was referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs C. P. Curtis and E. S. Rand, and from their full ex=<span class='line-break'> </span>=amination and report we find that the fee of the Avenue is <span class='line-break'> </span>in this Corporation, that it was laid out as a private way <span class='line-break'> </span>in 1830, and has since been open to public travel.  It is not <span class='line-break'> </span>a public way except by dedication.  Since 1846 no way can <span class='line-break'> </span>be made public unless laid out by the public authorities.  As <span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation as lately as 1848 exercised its power of granting <span class='line-break'> </span>rights in the way it seems clear it has never become a public<span class='line-break'> </span>way by dedication.</p>
<p>The original agreement between Brimmer and Josiah <span class='line-break'> </span>Coolidge provided that this way should be kept open and un=<span class='line-break'> </span>obstructed, and that said Coolidge, his heirs and assigns, should<span class='line-break'> </span>at all times have free ingress and regress to and from his ad=<span class='line-break'> </span>=joining land into said way.  H. W. Mussey, J. G. Coolidge</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134907">
<h3><a name="page-1134907">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 080)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>80</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>the petitioners, and the City of Cambridge all claim rights in <span class='line-break'> </span>the way as assigns of J. Coolidge.</p>
<p>In 1868, the way being out of repair, the question of <span class='line-break'> </span>its improvement was brought before the Board as follows: -</p>
<p>"M^r Cheever having made a statement that the City of <span class='line-break'> </span>"Cambridge contemplated the improvement of the grade of <span class='line-break'> </span>Coolidge Avenue, it was</p>
<p>"Voted[underlined] - that Messrs. Cheever and Norcross be a Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>"=mittee to arrange with the City of Cambridge for the payment <span class='line-break'> </span>" of $250. - by this Corporation when said grading shall have <span class='line-break'> </span>"been completed to the satisfaction of the Committee. "</p>
<p>In 1869 the grading was completed which has caused <span class='line-break'> </span>the injuries complained [of] [sq. bracket original]</p>
<p>The grade of the sidewalk at the entrance to M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Muzzey's estate, (then owned by M^r Lawrence,) was reduced <span class='line-break'> </span>about three feet, and no support being provided for the wall<span class='line-break'> </span>on the line of the estate it has since fallen, and besides <span class='line-break'> </span>rebuilding the wall a considerable expense has been incurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in reducing the grade of his roadway to the new grade of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Avenue.  A similar but less reduction in grade was <span class='line-break'> </span>made in front of M^r Coolidge's estate.  He claims that <span class='line-break'> </span>a bank wall is necessary in front of his land, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>access to his premises has been rendered more difficult.</p>
<p>Both parties base their claim against this Corpora=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tion, upon the allegation that the City of Cambridge, in <span class='line-break'> </span>making the changes of grade acted as the licensee or agent <span class='line-break'> </span>of the orporation as owner of the fee.</p>
<p>If this were the fact the Committee are not prepared</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134908">
<h3><a name="page-1134908">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 081)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>81</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. April 24^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>to admit that any claim for damages could be maintained.<span class='line-break'> </span>The repairs upon the Avenue have improved its condition <span class='line-break'> </span>for travel and have so far been advantageous to the abuttors.<span class='line-break'> </span>They must sooner or later have been made.  But the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>are clearly of opinion that this Corporation did not make <span class='line-break'> </span>the City of Cambridge its agent, and is not responsible for <span class='line-break'> </span>its acts.  The vote was simply an agreement to contribute<span class='line-break'> </span>to the expense, in case the work was done satisfactorily to <span class='line-break'> </span>its Committee.</p>
<p>Before the work was completed complaints were made <span class='line-break'> </span>by M^r Coolidge, and it appears from the correspondence on file <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Mayor of Cambridge was distinctly informed by M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Norcross that this Corporation would not undertake to arrange <span class='line-break'> </span>with M^r Coolidge, would do nothing about the proposed changes, <span class='line-break'> </span>but that the city must take the whole responsibility.</p>
<p>On November 7^th, 1869, after M^r Coolidge's claim had <span class='line-break'> </span>been presented to the Board, it was</p>
<p>"Voted, [underlined] - that the Treasurer be authorized to pay $250. <span class='line-break'></span>"to the City of Cambridge for the improvement made upon Coolidge <span class='line-break'> </span>"Avenue, upon receiving from said City a sufficient bond of in=<span class='line-break'> </span>=demnity against any claim for damages by the abuttors, or a <span class='line-break'> </span>"satisfactory release from said abuttors."</p>
<p>Several demands have since been made for the payment <span class='line-break'> </span>of this money, but the terms of the vote not having been com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=plied with, nothing has been paid.  The terms of the vote <span class='line-break'> </span>seem to imply that the Committee were satisfied with the <span class='line-break'> </span>work done.</p>
<p>While w are clearly of opinion that no claim can</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134909">
<h3><a name="page-1134909">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 082)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>82</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April ^24th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. April ^24th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>be maintained against the Corporation for the alleged damages, <span class='line-break'> </span>deeming it important to preserve harmonious relations with <span class='line-break'> </span>our neighbors, and the City of Cambridge, the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>recommend that the facts of the case may be presented to <span class='line-break'> </span>the City authorities of Cambridge, in the hope that a settle=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ment, just and equitable to all  parties may thus be <span class='line-break'> </span>reached.</p>
<p>(Signed) C. F. Choate, for the Committee.</p>
<p>A true copy.</p>
<p>Attest: Sam:^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.  May 10^th, 1871. [uderlined]'>Trustees.  May 10^th, 1871. [uderlined]</span></p>
<p>May 10^th, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthy meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, May 10^th, 1871, at half past Three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, the President, and Messrs. Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Livermore, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last Meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coolidge Avenue. Claims of Messrs. Coolidge &amp; Muzzey referred to City of Cambridge.'>Coolidge Avenue. Claims of Messrs. Coolidge &amp; Muzzey referred to City of Cambridge.</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>charged with the duty of communicating with the City government <span class='line-break'> </span>of Cambrige respecting the claims of Messrs. Coolidge and Muzzey for <span class='line-break'> </span>damages to their estates on Coolidge Avenue, stating that the <span class='line-break'> </span>communication had been made, through the Mayor to the City <span class='line-break'> </span>Council, and was now under consideration by that body.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>Report was accompanied by a copy of said Communcation.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the Report be accepted, and the communicaton <span class='line-break'> </span>plced on file.</p>
<p>A Report was received from the same Committee, consis=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ting of the President, appointed at the Meeting of April 12^th, 71,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134910">
<h3><a name="page-1134910">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 083)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>83</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 10, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. May 10, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>as a Special Committee of conference with the Presidents of <span class='line-break'> </span>other Cemeteries in the vicinity of Boston in regard to admission to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery on "Decoration =Day", stating that the conference had <span class='line-break'> </span>been held resulting in a mtual understanding for the exclusion <span class='line-break'> </span>of all vehicles on that day excepting those used for carrying flowers<span class='line-break'> </span>and other decorations and the carriages of proprietors.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that all vehicles, excepting those of Proprietors, to <span class='line-break'> </span>be admitted under the usual rules, and vehicles used to carry <span class='line-break'> </span>decorations, be excluded fromM^t Auburn Cemetery on "Decoration=<span class='line-break'> </span>=Day".</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Meadow. Jos. G. Coolidge&apos;s Application to purchase part of. [underlined]'>Stone Meadow. Jos. G. Coolidge's Application to purchase part of. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the application of Joseph G. Coolidge to <span class='line-break'> </span>purchase a small strip of land from the Stone meadow, declining <span class='line-break'> </span>to recommend the sale of the premises included in the original <span class='line-break'> </span>application of M^r Coolidge, but advising the conveyance of  part of <span class='line-break'> </span>the same measuring "about fourteen feet wide at the rear ditch"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conveyance of certin portion recommended. [underlined] '>Conveyance of certin portion recommended. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>and tapering to a point om Coolidge Avenue, a distance of about <span class='line-break'> </span>two hundred feet, - according to the estimate of the Superintendent, <span class='line-break'></span>contining a little less than fourteen hundred square feet, at the <span class='line-break'> </span>price of twelve and a half cents per foot.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] that the Report be accepted,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale authorized.[underlined]'>Sale authorized.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized to effect <span class='line-break'> </span>the sale to M^r Coolidge of the parcel of land above described upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the terms named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fencing &amp; grding on M^tAubur S^t. [underlined]'>Fencing &amp; grding on M^tAubur S^t. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the same Committee in regard <span class='line-break'> </span>to raising the fence and sidewalk on M^t Auburn S^t, stating as the <span class='line-break'> </span>result of the conference ordered by the Board to be held by them</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134911">
<h3><a name="page-1134911">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 084)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>84</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 10^th, 1871. Belmont consents to bear 1/2 expense[underlined]'>Trustees. May 10^th, 1871. Belmont consents to bear 1/2 expense[underlined]</span></p>
<p>with the Town authorities of Belmont, ^[asterisk] that the said authorities <span class='line-break'> </span>after considerable discussion, and as the utmost limit of <span class='line-break'> </span>concession, had agreed to divide with the Cemetery the expense <span class='line-break'> </span>of the work in question.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p>The Committee having given notice at the previous <span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting of intention to move an appropriation of thirty=five<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars ($3500. -) for use as above stated, it was, on <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of Mr. Bradlee unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation for fencing, grading, &amp;c., on line of M^t Aub. S^t. [underlined]'>Appropriation for fencing, grading, &amp;c., on line of M^t Aub. S^t. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted,[underlined] - that an amount not exceeding three thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>five hundred dollars be, and hereby is appropriated for the <span class='line-break'> </span>erection of an iron fence on M^t Auburn Street on the line of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Watriss Lot, and raising a portion of the present fence<span class='line-break'> </span>on said Street, together with the necessary grading; said work <span class='line-break'> </span>to be done under the direction of the Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm. Prel. topographical survey ordered with a view to improvement [underlined]'>Stone Farm. Prel. topographical survey ordered with a view to improvement [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the same Committee to <span class='line-break'> </span>whom was referred the ^considration of the^ Expedieny of a re=survey ^ re=construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Stone Frm accompanied by a communication from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent and an experimental sketch of his <span class='line-break'> </span>proposed design for carrying out the improvement projected.<span class='line-break'> </span>the same having been carefully considered by the Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>cuse a topographical survey to be made of the Stone Farm<span class='line-break'> </span>in general accordance with the Plan now submitted by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, which is ordered to be placed on file.</p>
<p>[Below a line drawn across the page the following asterisk]</p>
<p>[asterisk] inadvertently named "town authorities of Watertown" [underlined] by the mover of the <span class='line-break'> </span>original vote.  see p. 73.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134912">
<h3><a name="page-1134912">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 085)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>85</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 10, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. May 10, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary submitted to the Board an application <span class='line-break'> </span>in writing by G. W. Bryant &amp; Co. of North Bridgewater for a general <span class='line-break'> </span>permit to do work in the Cemetery.  After consideration, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='G. W. Bryant &amp; Co. appl^n for Gem^l Permit for work [underlined]'>G. W. Bryant &amp; Co. appl^n for Gem^l Permit for work [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted,[underlined] - that said application be referrd to the President to <span class='line-break'> </span>consider and report thereon.</p>
<p>===Contracts for Perp. Rep. with Guaranty, of Lots 49 &amp; 1689[underlined]</p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot N^o 49 on Moss Path belonging to the late Abel Adams of <span class='line-break'> </span>West Roxbury, deceased, for Four hundred dollars; and of Lot N^o<span class='line-break'> </span>1689 on Columbine Path belonging to the heirs of the late Calvin C.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sampson of Charlistown, [sic]deceased, for Eight hundred dollars; it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above mentioned contracts be severally con=<span class='line-break'> </span>curred in, on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest representatives <span class='line-break'> </span>were designated for Lots as follows; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='507.'>507.</span></p>
<p>Henry Barlett of Boston, Nephew of Thomas G. Atkins, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Five hundred and seven</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1564.'>1564.</span> William Howell Reed of Boston, Son of David Reed, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fifteen hundred and sixty=four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1578.'>1578.</span></p>
<p>Albert A. H. Meredith of Boston, Son of Hinman Meridith<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fifteen hundred and seventy= eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2421.'>2421.</span></p>
<p>Mrs. Frances M. Clark of Boston, Widow of Metcalf B. Clark,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty=four hundred &amp; twenty=one.</p>
<p>Adjourned.  Sam^l. Batchelder., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134913">
<h3><a name="page-1134913">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 086)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>86</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. June 14^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. June 14^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>June 14^th, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday June 14^14, 1871, at half past Three<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Snow amd Turmer/</p>
<p>In the absence of the President the Meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>called to order by the Secretary, and M^r Turner was <span class='line-break'> </span>elected chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of M^r Edward S. Rand [underlined]'>Resignation of M^r Edward S. Rand [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having read a communicaton <span class='line-break'> </span>from M^r Edward S. Rand, dated the 12^th inst. resigning his <span class='line-break'> </span>office as Trustee, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that said resignation be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote of thanks to M^r Rand. [underlined]'>Vote of thanks to M^r Rand. [underlined]</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='836'>836</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that a Petition for the <span class='line-break'> </span>representation of Lot N^o 836 owned by the late Simon <span class='line-break'> </span>Pearson of Boston had been presented by ^his son^ T. Lyman Pearson <span class='line-break'> </span>of Arlington, the only other heir at law of the said Simon,<span class='line-break'> </span>a minor grandson named Joseph H. Pearson, under he <span class='line-break'> </span>Guardianship of Frank A. Wood M. D., of Cambridgeport, declining <span class='line-break'> </span>to join in the request for the appointment of the said T. Lyman<span class='line-break'> </span>Pearson, - it was after consideration</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined]  that T. Lyman Pearson of Arlington be appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>representative of Lot N^o 836, until further action on the <span class='line-break'> </span>part of this Board shall become necessary.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. July 12^th, 1871. [underlined]'>Trustees. July 12^th, 1871. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>July 12^th, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, July 12^th, 1871, at half past Three o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Bigelow, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Little, Livermore, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='G. W. Bryant &amp; Co. appl^n for General Permit to work in Cemetery granted. [underlined]'>G. W. Bryant &amp; Co. appl^n for General Permit to work in Cemetery granted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Presidnt to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the application of Messrs. G. W. Bryant and Co., of <span class='line-break'> </span>North Bridgewater for a general Permit to do work in the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>in favor of granting the said request upon the same terms upon <span class='line-break'> </span>which general Permits have been granted heretofore.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above Report be accepted and the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to issue to Messrs. G. W. Bryant &amp; Co a general Permit<span class='line-break'> </span>to do work in the Cemetery upon their filing a satisfactory Bond.</p>

<p>A communication was received from the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds recommending that a new Path be laid out and <span class='line-break'> </span>established leading from Fountain Avenue Easterly, and <span class='line-break'> </span>communicating with the rear of the Lots on the Westerly side <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lime Avenue, as shown upon a sketch made by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent.  The same having been considered by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Committee on Grounds are hereby authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to lay out and estblish the said path in accordance with <span class='line-break'> </span>the Plan herewith submitted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Thomas P. Frost, damage done on his Lot (N^o 2332) be made good [by] Corporation'>Thomas P. Frost, damage done on his Lot (N^o 2332) be made good [by] Corporation</span></p>
<p>The President submitted a communication from the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent in reference to damage done upon the Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>of Thomas P. Frost of Boston on "Decoration=Day" by the <span class='line-break'> </span>over turn and breaking of a headstone costing about $75. -<span class='line-break'> </span>which in falling broke[word crossed out] two rods out of iron fence in the <span class='line-break'> </span>next Lot below.  The President stated that he had notified<span class='line-break'> </span>M^r. Frost of the facts and had assured him that the stone would <span class='line-break'> </span>be once renewed without expense to him.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above action of the President is hereby <span class='line-break'> </span>approved, and the Treasurer be authorized to pay any charges <span class='line-break'> </span>for the repairs authorized by the Presidnt which he may approve.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Increased office accommodations at Cemetery - [?] of Supt. [?] referred to Com. on Grounds, &amp; Com. on Lots.  '>Increased office accommodations at Cemetery - [?] of Supt. [?] referred to Com. on Grounds, &amp; Com. on Lots.  </span></p>
<p>A communication was received from the Superinten=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dent in reference to an increase of office accommodation at <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, and suggesting the use of a portion of the Reception <span class='line-break'> </span>House premises for that purpose.  After consideration it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the subject be referred to the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>and the Committee on Lots as a joint=committee to consider &amp; report.</p>

<p>Voted,[underliend] - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spruce Av. Acadia Path Saffron Path } Memorial of Certain prop^s on Referred to Com. on Grounds.'>Spruce Av. Acadia Path Saffron Path } Memorial of Certain prop^s on Referred to Com. on Grounds.</span></p>
<p>A Petition was received from certain proprietors of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots on Spruce Avenue, Acacia Path and Saffron Path <span class='line-break'> </span>stating "that said Lots, by reason of insufficient drainage <span class='line-break'> </span>are frequently inundated so as to be almost inacessible<span class='line-break'> </span>except through standing water or slime[?], and are also <span class='line-break'> </span>greatly damaged in their appearance," and asking "that<span class='line-break'> </span>a suitable outlet may be made for the surplus water"</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the aforesaid communication be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on grounds,.</p>

<p>The Treasurer having presented his reports and <span class='line-break'> </span>Statements of Accounts for the quarter ending June 30^th, 1871; -<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, [underlined] - that the Treasurer's Statements be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Comittee on Finance to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts for Perp. Rep. with Guaranty of Lots 98 &amp; 2189, Reconveyance of Lot 2189,'>Contracts for Perp. Rep. with Guaranty of Lots 98 &amp; 2189, Reconveyance of Lot 2189,</span></p>

<h3><a name="page-1134921">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 094)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>94</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. August 9, 1871.'><u>Trustees. August 9, 1871.</u></span></p>
<p><u>August 9, 1871.</u></p>
<p>The regular monthly Meeting of the  Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, August 9, 1871, at half past Three o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Bigelow, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Livermore and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last Meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Memorial Work of Art -(Sphynx) Report of Com. on Grounds concerning. '><u>Memorial Work of Art -(Sphynx) Report of Com. on Grounds concerning. </u></span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds to whom was referrted the proposition of Dr. Bigelow <span class='line-break'> </span>to give to the Proprietors of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn Cemetery a granite <span class='line-break'> </span>statue of a Sphynx stating that the statue is in a state <span class='line-break'> </span>of forwardness, and its early arrival expected, and recom<span class='line-break'></span>-mending "the Trustees to accept said statue on behalf of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation whenever the same finished,  complete, together<span class='line-break'> </span>with a suitable pedestal shall be delivered at Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn by Dr. Bigelow, and that the expense of transportation <span class='line-break'> </span>of said statue from the Gate of the Cemetery to the place of <span class='line-break'> </span>erection, together with the cost of erection of the same, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the construction of a suitable foundation for said pedestal <span class='line-break'> </span>be borne by the Corporation."  And further recommending <span class='line-break'> </span>"that all work necesasary to carry out the suggestions of <span class='line-break'> </span>this Report be done under the direction of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, and that said Committee be authorized and <span class='line-break'> </span>empowered to decide upon the location of said statue,<span class='line-break'> </span>and to make such changes in any Avenue or Path as may <span class='line-break'> </span>in their judgment be desirable in order to adapt the lo<span class='line-break'></span>-cation to the requirements of the statue."</p>
<p>The Report having been read and considered, <span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Lawrence, it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134922">
<h3><a name="page-1134922">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 095)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>95</p>
<p>===Trustees. August 9^th, 1871. Report accepted etc., etc. [underlined]</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] that the Report be accepted, and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds be and they hereby are authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>and empowered to carry into effect the suggestions therein <span class='line-break'> </span>contained.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Iron Fence. joinings  to be inspected &amp;c. [underlined] '>Iron Fence. joinings  to be inspected &amp;c. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>On motion of Dr. Bigelow, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Superintenent be instructed to employ <span class='line-break'> </span>one or two suitable persons to inspect carefully the joinings<span class='line-break'> </span>of the iron feance, particularly where the tenons enter mor=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tises in the stone posts or elsewhere; and if they find them <span class='line-break'> </span>corroded, then carefully to fill all cavities with lime mortar<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of closing such cavities and neutralizing <span class='line-break'> </span>acids.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts for Perp. Rep. with Guaranty pf Lpots 107 338 &amp; 3976 [underlined]'>Contracts for Perp. Rep. with Guaranty pf Lpots 107 338 &amp; 3976 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair of Lot N^o 107 on Central Avenue, belonging to the late <span class='line-break'> </span>Catherne Sargent, for Four hundred dollars; of Lot N^o. 338<span class='line-break'> </span>on Primrose Path belonging to M^rs Charlote P. Mace, for Three<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars; and of Lot N^o 3976 on Gladiolus Path <span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to M^rs Eliza Owens for Fifty dollars, - it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurred in'>Concurred in</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined]  - that the above mentioned instruments be <span class='line-break'> </span>severally concurred in on the part of this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of the Committee on  Finance [underlioned] '>Report of the Committee on  Finance [underlioned] </span></p>
<p>The Secretary stated that the Committee on Finance <span class='line-break'> </span>to whom wAs referred at the last Meeting the Statements and <span class='line-break'> </span>Trial Balance of the Treasurer for the quarter ending June 30^th, 1871,<span class='line-break'> </span>had submitted a Report approving the same as correct.  It was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted'>Accepted</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report of the</p>
<p>Finance Committee be accepted and</p>
<p>the said accounts placed on file.</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>The regular monthly Meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, September 13^th, 1871, at half past Three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. John T. Bradlee, Choate, Little, Livermore,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Snow and Turner -</p>

<p>A communication received from the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the construction of a catacomb Tomb for Sale.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>same having been read and considered, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the subject be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, to consider and report.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fitchburg R. R. Co. Proposal relative to Gateway, &amp;c. declined'>Fitchburg R. R. Co. Proposal relative to Gateway, &amp;c. declined</span></p>
<p>A ^verbal^ Report was received from the Comittee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the several communications made to this Board by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Fitchburg R. R. Co. asking for the establishment of a gatewey to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery near the M^t Auburn Station of said Railroad, <span class='line-break'></span>stating that, in the opinion of the Committee, the establishment of <span class='line-break'> </span>such a gateway was inexpedient, for reasons stated, and recommending <span class='line-break'> </span>the suspension of further negotiations on the subject.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spruce Av.}Acacia Path,} Saffron Path, } insufficient drainage upon &amp; near. Report of Committee on Grounds concerning. [underlined] '>Spruce Av.}Acacia Path,} Saffron Path, } insufficient drainage upon &amp; near. Report of Committee on Grounds concerning. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the same Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>accompanied by a written communication and drawings from <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent, in regard to the memorial of certain owners<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots on Spruce Avenue, Acacia Path and Saffron Path, asking <span class='line-break'> </span>the attention of the Trustees to the insufficient drainage of <span class='line-break'> </span>their Lots, and of other land in the vicinity.  The Report<span class='line-break'> </span>stated that the Committee, after careful inspection of the prem=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ises, consultation with the Superintendent, and full con=<span class='line-break'> </span>=sideration of the subject had been unable to devise any <span class='line-break'> </span>practicable plan for the accomplishment of the desired object.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conference with petitioners recommended. [underlined]'>Conference with petitioners recommended. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Little, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>invite the petitioners to a conference on the subject.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Need of Organ in Chapel represented by Joseph Bird. [underlined]'>Need of Organ in Chapel represented by Joseph Bird. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President stated that M^r Joseph Bird of Watertown <span class='line-break'> </span>had called upon hin with a letter of introduction from the Su=<span class='line-break'> </span>=perintendent, for the purpose of calling attention to the need of an <span class='line-break'> </span>Organ in the Chapel, to be used at Funeral services, and offering,<span class='line-break'> </span>in case an Organ should erected there, to provide gratuitously <span class='line-break'> </span>such vocal music as might be required.</p>

<p>A verbal Report was received from M^r J. T. Bradlee, in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Joint Committee composed of the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>and the Committee on Lots charaged, at the last meeting, with an <span class='line-break'> </span>enquiry into the method pursued by the Superintendent in per=<span class='line-break'> </span>=forming stone work on private Lots.  The Report stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee had entered upon the duty assigned them, but were<span class='line-break'> </span>not yet prepared with a final Report, and requested that further <span class='line-break'> </span>time be granted.  On motion of M^r Turner, it was</p>

<p>Voted, [underlined]  - that the Committee have leave to sit agian.</p>
<p>A written Report was submitted by the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Finance, through M^r Turner in reference to the present</p>

<p>condition and future prospects of the financial affairs of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation,  After discussion, &amp; on motion of M^r Lawrence,</p>

<p>The President having laid before the Board a no=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tification received from the City Council of Cambridge <span class='line-break'> </span>stating that a hearing would be given this evening at the <span class='line-break'> </span>City Hall to parties interested in the Coolidge Avenue question,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Special Committee consisting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>President and M^r Choate, to whom were referred, at the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of April 12^th, 1871, the communications of Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Coolidge and Muzzey in the premises, be designated as <span class='line-break'> </span>a Committee to respond to the above notice and to appear<span class='line-break'> </span>in behalf of this Corporation at the hearing aforesaid.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Financial Condition of the Corporation. Report of Com. on Finance onerning. [underlined] '>Financial Condition of the Corporation. Report of Com. on Finance onerning. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The Board of Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery [underlined]</p>
<p>The Committee on Finance take this occasion to bring <span class='line-break'> </span>to the attention of the Board the financial condition of the corporation.</p>
<p>It is well known that to complete the improvements com=<span class='line-break'> </span>menced by our predecessors, and carry forward those voted by this <span class='line-break'> </span>Board, the purchase of the "Watriss Lot," and the fencing the same, <span class='line-break'> </span>have made quite an inroad into the savings of previous years <span class='line-break'> </span>which had been invested.</p>
<p>Last year the expenditures exceeded the income, and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134929">
<h3><a name="page-1134929">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 102)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>102</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 11^th, 1871. [underlined] '>Trustees. October 11^th, 1871. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>showed the available funds in hand $30.943.04, against<span class='line-break'> </span>$50.916.21 the previous yuear.</p>
<p>The enclosed exhibit made by the Treasurer September <span class='line-break'> </span>17^th, 1871, of the estimated [squiggle underline] expenditures and receipts for the <span class='line-break'> </span>balance of the present year shows a deficit of $16.549.88.<span class='line-break'> </span>This would reduce our available means to $14.393.16, and <span class='line-break'> </span>compel us to sell U. S. Stocks to make good the deficiency.</p>
<p>But to place the "Sphynx" in place we think will involve <span class='line-break'> </span>an expenditure not ennumerated in the Treasurer's estimate</p>
<p>The sum of $14.393.16 is too small for us to rely upon,</p>
<p>Without questioning our action in the improvements now<span class='line-break'> </span>making and to be made, under authority of this Board, <span class='line-break'> </span>which we have voted for with great unanimity, believing <span class='line-break'> </span>that the welfare and good care of the Cemetery required <span class='line-break'> </span>such action, still this Committee are now of the unanimous <span class='line-break'> </span>opinion that no new work should be undertaken involving <span class='line-break'> </span>the expenditure of such sums of money as will compel us <span class='line-break'> </span>to exceed our revenue the coming year.  This would not <span class='line-break'> </span>hamper the  Superintendent in the general adornment of <span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds, but place us in a position which prudence <span class='line-break'> </span>and a wise economy require.</p>
<p>It is well known to the Board that the Permanent Fund <span class='line-break'> </span>for Repairs is to amount to $150.000. before the interest on <span class='line-break'> </span>the same can be used for the care of the grounds, - (the last<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Report stated it at $115,.456.76, - ) and taking in <span class='line-break'> </span>view the fact of the large quantity of land which has been <span class='line-break'> </span>sold, and the number of Avenues and Paths to be cared form<span class='line-break'> </span>your Committee are also unanimously of the opinion that </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>this sum should reach $200.000. before any of the interest<span class='line-break'> </span>on the same is touched; believing an annual interest of <span class='line-break'> </span>$14.000. is small enough for the purposes for which this <span class='line-break'> </span>Fund was created,</p>
<p>Respectfully submitted</p>
<p>(Signed) Alfred T. Turner}<span class='line-break'> </span>(  "  )  James L. Little} Committee on  Finance.</p>

<p>Trustees. November 8^th, 1871. [underlined]</p>
<p>November 8^th, 18971. [underlined]</p>
<p>The regular monthly Meeting of the  Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, November 7^th, 1871, at half past Three<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock, P,M,</p>
<p>Present, Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Livermore, Perkins, Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>and Turner; full Board.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Palm Avenue laid out &amp; established[underlined]'>Palm Avenue laid out &amp; established[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, relative to the laying out and establishment <span class='line-break'> </span>of a new Avenue between Myrtle and Lavender Paths in <span class='line-break'> </span>accordance with a plan submitted by the Superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>and recommending that said Avenue be laid out and <span class='line-break'> </span>established under the name of Palm Avenue [underlined].</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report be accepted, and the recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wistaria Path - name adopted. [underlined]'>Wistaria Path - name adopted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the same Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee recomending that the new Path laid out and established<span class='line-break'> </span>by vote of this Board, adopted July 12^th, 1871, leading from Fountain Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>Easterly, and communicating with the rear of Lots on W. side of Lime Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>be known as Wistaria Path. [underlined]</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report be accepted, and the recommen=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='W^m F. Homer Com^n from, etc., referred to Co. on Lots [underlined]'>W^m F. Homer Com^n from, etc., referred to Co. on Lots [underlined]</span></p>

Homer in <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to his rights connected with Lot N^o 1291 Ailanathus <span class='line-break'> </span>Path, under date of October 20^th, 1871, accompanied with an <span class='line-break'> </span>explanatory letter from the Superintendent, dated Oct. 28, 1871,<span class='line-break'> </span>and numerous collateral documents having been laid</p>
