<p>A verbal Report was received from M^r Choate, in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Coolidge Avenue Committee which was instructed <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last Meeting of the Board to attend the hearing before the <span class='line-break'> </span>City Council on the 11^th ult^o,  stating that he was present <span class='line-break'> </span>at the said hearing, and was of the opinion that the petitioners,<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs. Coolidge and Muzzey, had become satisfied that <span class='line-break'> </span>their remedy, if any, for damages claimed to have been <span class='line-break'> </span>sustained by them as set forth in their communication to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board in Aparil last, was against the City of Cambrige <span class='line-break'> </span>and not against this corporation.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt&apos;s mode of performing stonework, etc. Report of Joint Com^tee (See record of this Report, p.  infra[?]]'>Supt's mode of performing stonework, etc. Report of Joint Com^tee (See record of this Report, p.  infra[?]]</span></p>
<p>A written Report signed respectively by the Chairman <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Grounds, and the Chairman of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots in behalf of the joint Committee on Grounds and Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to "the method pursued by the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>in peforming stone work on private Lots," having been laid<span class='line-break'> </span>before the Board and fully considered, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above Report be accepted,and the <span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Increase of office accom^ns  [?] at Cemetery declared [ditto mark]inexpedient.[ditto mark]'>Increase of office accom^ns  [?] at Cemetery declared [ditto mark]inexpedient.[ditto mark]</span></p>

<p>Voted, [underlined]  - that the subject be referred to the Comittee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Finance, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Increased exemp^n from taxation of personal Estate of Corp^n. Legislation to be petitioned to allow,. [underlined] '>Increased exemp^n from taxation of personal Estate of Corp^n. Legislation to be petitioned to allow,. [underlined] </span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 13^th, 1871 [underlinerd]'>Trustees. December 13^th, 1871 [underlinerd]</span></p>
<p>Report of Committees on Grounds and Lots in reference to <span class='line-break'> </span>the method pursued by the Superintendent in performing stone <span class='line-break'> </span>work on private Lots.</p>
<p>Boston, November 7^th, 1871.</p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds and Lots who were instructed to <span class='line-break'> </span>enquire into the method pursued by the Superintendent in per=<span class='line-break'> </span>forming work for the proprietors on their Lots, as regards the stone <span class='line-break'> </span>curbing of them, and of the building tombs thereon and report<span class='line-break'> </span>all the facts pertaining thereto, respectfully</p>
<p>Report, that the Superintendent has in some cases had <span class='line-break'> </span>plans of stone curbings, &amp;c, prepared for proprietors, said pro=<span class='line-break'> </span>=prietors paying the corporation for the same; and that further, <span class='line-break'> </span>acting, as he says, unofficially, he has, as agent for individual <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors, presented plans to various stone dealers, &amp; requested <span class='line-break'> </span>estimates or proposals for furnishing the material required, <span class='line-break'> </span>has opened the bids when received, and on consultation with the <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor interested, awarded the contract, and in some in=<span class='line-break'> </span>=stances signed the same for the proprietor.  This course has<span class='line-break'> </span>been pursued by him, as the Committee believe, solely with the <span class='line-break'> </span>intent to act for the best interests of the Corporation, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>convenience of the proprietors, there being not the slightest sus=<span class='line-break'> </span>=picion that he has been pecuniarily interested directly or <span class='line-break'> </span>indirectly in any contract whatever.  The Committee, however, <span class='line-break'> </span>feel that it is not the business of the Corporation or the Superin=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tendent, to act as Agent of the indiviual owners of Lots in <span class='line-break'> </span>the manner designated, and that the practice is liable to <span class='line-break'> </span>great abuse, and altogether undesirable and dangerous;<span class='line-break'> </span>and further, that the time of the Superintendent can be <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>A Report from the Committee on By=Law revision <span class='line-break'> </span>was submitted in writing by M^r Snow together with a <span class='line-break'> </span>Draft of the revied Code of By=Laws.   After discussion, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report be accepted and placed on file,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the Secretary be instructed to cause the revised Code <span class='line-break'> </span>to be printed and a copy thereof to be forwarded in proof to <span class='line-break'> </span>each Trustee, and that the consideration of the proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>Code be specially assigned for the next Meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. pon Birds. '>Report of Com. pon Birds. </span></p>
<p>A written Report was received from Dr. Brewer in</p>

<p>January 24^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned Meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, January 24^th, 1872, at half past Three o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow, Choate, Little, Livermore, Perkins, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Ann. Report, Accepted &amp; ordered to be printed.'>Treasurer's Ann. Report, Accepted &amp; ordered to be printed.</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Treasurer, duly audited <span class='line-break'> </span>and certified by the Committee on Finance, having been <span class='line-break'> </span>presented, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that said Report be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s Ann. Report accepted &amp; ordered to be printed.[underlined]'>Superintendent's Ann. Report accepted &amp; ordered to be printed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Superintendent having been <span class='line-break'> </span>read by the President, it was</p>

<p>A Supplementary Report of the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>was also read by the President.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that said Report be referred to the next Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees.</p>

<p>The Superintendent's Inventory of property belonging to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation having been submitted, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that said Inventory be placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Revised Code of By=Laws adopted, and [underlined] '>Revised Code of By=Laws adopted, and [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The revised Code of By=Laws, copies of which had <span class='line-break'> </span>been forwarded in proof slips to each member of the Board, <span class='line-break'> </span>in compliance with the vote adopted at the last meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>having been taken up and considered article by article, and <span class='line-break'> </span>various amendments having been introduced and adopted <span class='line-break'></span>on motion of M^r Turner</p>
<p>it was</p>

<div id="page-1134944">

<div class="page-content">
<p>117</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees.  January 24^th, 1872 ordered to be printed with Ann Reports. [underlined]'>Trustees.  January 24^th, 1872 ordered to be printed with Ann Reports. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Code of By Laws as now read and <span class='line-break'> </span>amended be, and the same are hereby adopted.</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that said By=Laws be printed with the annual <span class='line-break'> </span>Reports to the Proprietors.</p>
<p>Adjourned [underlined] to Jabuary 29^th, 3=30 P.M.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees . January 29^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees . January 29^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>An adjourned Meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, January 29^th, 1872, at half past Three o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs J. T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Snow and Turner</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reports of Com. on Grounds [quote]inexpedient[quote] in regard to erection of houses for employees; purch. of land from heirs of Stone postponed. [underlined]'>Reports of Com. on Grounds [quote]inexpedient[quote] in regard to erection of houses for employees; purch. of land from heirs of Stone postponed. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the chairman of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Grounds to the effect that it was inexpedient <span class='line-break'> </span>at the present time to take action of the kind suggested <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Superintendent's Communication dated March 8^th,<span class='line-break'> </span>1871, recommending the erection of houses for the employees <span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation.  Also that the further consideration <span class='line-break'> </span>of Dr. Bigelow's communication dated June 8^th, 1871, respecting <span class='line-break'> </span>the purchase of fourteen acres of land from the heirs of Stone <span class='line-break'> </span>be postponed.  And it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the above Report be accepted.</p>

<p>The Annual Report of the Trustees to the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>was read by the President, and after consideration it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Report be accepted and printed,.</p>
<p>The President stated to the Board thaat he had been <span class='line-break'> </span>waited upon by M^r Charles O Whitmore on behalf of a Committee</p>

<div id="page-1134945">
<h3><a name="page-1134945">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 118)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>118</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. January 29^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. January 29^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass^tts Hort. Soc. request of the for spec. rep^ve in the M^tAuburn Bd. of Trustees. [underlined]'>Mass^tts Hort. Soc. request of the for spec. rep^ve in the M^tAuburn Bd. of Trustees. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>of the Massachusetts Horticultural Society who requested <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Board should consider the propriety of presenting <span class='line-break'> </span>the name of the President or Treasurer of said Society as <span class='line-break'> </span>a candidate for the positon of Trustee of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn at the next Annual Meeting; in order that <span class='line-break'> </span>said Society, having a pecuniary interest in the sale of lots <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery, might thus have a direct voice in the <span class='line-break'> </span>managerment of its affairs.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com^n of Pres^t of M^t Aub. Dem&apos;y embodying the above ordered to be rec^d.[underlined]'>Com^n of Pres^t of M^t Aub. Dem'y embodying the above ordered to be rec^d.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>After consideration of the subject, it being found <span class='line-break'> </span>that neither of the parties suggested were members of this <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation, and consequently were ineligible, under the <span class='line-break'> </span>By=Laws for the office of Trustee, - on motion of M^r Turner</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined]- that they foregoing communication of the President<span class='line-break'> </span>be received and placed upon the record.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='By=Laws, vote adopting reconsidered. [underlined] '>By=Laws, vote adopting reconsidered. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the vote passed at the last meeting whereby <span class='line-break'> </span>the revised Code of By=Laws, as then presented and amended <span class='line-break'> </span>was adopted be re=considered.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amended &amp; readopted.'>Amended &amp; readopted.</span></p>
<p>Various additional amendments to said Code having <span class='line-break'> </span>then been presented, considered and adopted, - it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Code of By=Laws, as now read and amended, <span class='line-break'> </span>be, and the same is hereby adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote ordering By=Laws to be printed with the Ann. Reports reconsidered.[underlined]'>Vote ordering By=Laws to be printed with the Ann. Reports reconsidered.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] -  that the vote passed at the last meeting whereby <span class='line-break'> </span>the revised Code of By=Laws was ordered to be printed with <span class='line-break'> </span>the Annual Reports to the Proprietors be re=considered,.</p>
<p>Adjourned [underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr.,</p>
<p>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134946">
<h3><a name="page-1134946">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 119)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>119</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. February 5^th, 1872. [underlined] '>Proprietors. February 5^th, 1872. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Annual Meeting of the Proprietors [underlined]<span class='line-break'> </span>Monday, February 5^th, 1872 [underlined]</p>
<p>A duly notified Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn was held at Horticultural Hall, Boston, <span class='line-break'> </span>on Monday, February 5^th, 1872, at half past Three o'clock in <span class='line-break'> </span>the afternoon.</p>
<p>A quorum being present, the Meeting was called to order <span class='line-break'> </span>by the President, who also read the call for the same.</p>
<p>The record of the last Proprietor's Meeting was read by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary and approved.</p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Trustees accompanied by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Reports of the Superintendent and Treasurer, having been dis=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tributed in print among the Proprietors present, and the Report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees having been read by the President, on motion of M^r Hatch it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded.'>Annual Reports accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded.</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the Annual Reports be accepted and recorded, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that the reading of the Superintendent's and Treasurer's <span class='line-break'> </span>Reports be dispensed with.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Testimonial to Dr. Bigelow [underlined] '>Testimonial to Dr. Bigelow [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The President having requested of the Proprietors authority <span class='line-break'> </span>to carry out the suggestions contained in the Resolutions which <span class='line-break'> </span>were adopted by the Board of Trustees February 23^d, 1871, in reference <span class='line-break'> </span>to procuring a suitable testimonial for presentation to Dr. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow, upon his retirement from the office of President <span class='line-break'> </span>after twenty=six years of service, - on motion of Mr^Richards <span class='line-break'> </span>it was unanimously</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to Trustees with full powers. [underlined] '>referred to Trustees with full powers. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the subject of procuring a testimonial for <span class='line-break'> </span>presentation to Dr. Bigelow be referred by the Proprietors to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, with full powers.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134947">
<h3><a name="page-1134947">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 120)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>120</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors Febaruary 5^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Proprietors Febaruary 5^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Collamore, it was</p>
<p>Voted, [underliend] - that a Committee of three be appointed by <span class='line-break'> </span>the chair to receive, count and sort the votes for Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. app^d to collect count and sort Votes for Trustees. [underlined] '>Com. app^d to collect count and sort Votes for Trustees. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The chair appointed Messrs. John Collamore, John R. <span class='line-break'> </span>Poor and Alex Wadsworth to compose said Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>who subsequently reported as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees elected [underlined] '>Trustees elected [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Whole number of Ballots case  84; - all of <span class='line-break'> </span>which were for the following named persons, viz: -</p>
<p>Edward Lawrence,} to serve until 1878,<span class='line-break'> </span>Charles F. Choat, } By re=election.</p>
<p>Henry W. Pickering,  To serve until 1877, in place of E. S. Rand, resigned.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lack of Office accom^Dns at Cemetery [underlined] '>Lack of Office accom^Dns at Cemetery [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Col. Charles Amory called the attention of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to the great lack of suitable office accommodations at the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery for the Superintendent and those employed by him,<span class='line-break'> </span>and suggested a method by which this deficiency could be <span class='line-break'> </span>easily and cheaply supplied.  In reply, the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>were assured by the President that the subject had already <span class='line-break'> </span>been considred by the Trustees, and would continue to receive <span class='line-break'> </span>their attention.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, - on motion <span class='line-break'> </span>of M^r Collamore, it was</p>
<p>Voted, - that this Meeting be dissolved,</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134948">
<h3><a name="page-1134948">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 121)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>121</p>
<p>Trustees' Report [underlined]===</p>
<p>Trustees' Report. [underlined]</p>
<p>During the past year extensive improvements have <span class='line-break'> </span>been made at the Cemetery, whereby land, hitherto unavailable <span class='line-break'> </span>has been prepared for sale, providing desirable lots to meet the <span class='line-break'> </span>public demand.  Additional Greenhouse accommodations <span class='line-break'> </span>have been provided, in accordance tithe the plan inaugurated <span class='line-break'> </span>the previous year.  New buildings for mechancial and storage <span class='line-break'> </span>purposes have been erected, on the Stone Meadow, thereby releasing <span class='line-break'> </span>a portion of the grounds in the vicinity of the Engine House here=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tofore encumbered, affording an oppoartunity for layoing out at=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tractive and valuable ltos, and at the same time improving the <span class='line-break'> </span>general character of a large surrounding territory.  Repairs <span class='line-break'> </span>have been made wherever required on the various buildings, and <span class='line-break'> </span>it is believed that, with the exception of repointing the chapel <span class='line-break'> </span>and Tower, which will soon be necessary, the condition of all<span class='line-break'> </span>the structures is now so good that little additional expense<span class='line-break'> </span>need be incurred for a considerable period</p>
<p>Work has been continued on the Receiving Tomb, the <span class='line-break'> </span>vestibule and fifty compartments for burial being now <span class='line-break'> </span>nearly completed.</p>
<p>The excavaton of Halcyon Lake, and improvement <span class='line-break'> </span>of grounds in its immediate vicinity have progressed satisfactorily,<span class='line-break'> </span>advantage having been taken of the unusually low state of the <span class='line-break'> </span>water to forward the work as much as possible.  The locality <span class='line-break'> </span>has long been in an unsightly condition, and it is the <span class='line-break'> </span>desire of the Trustees to complete the improvement at the <span class='line-break'> </span>earliest practicable time, that it may become a source of <span class='line-break'> </span>revenue to the corporation, and also in justice to those Proprietors</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134949">
<h3><a name="page-1134949">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 122)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>122</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Report. [underlined] '>Trustees' Report. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>who have already purchased lots anticipating the desirability <span class='line-break'> </span>of the position when the plan shall have been fully carried out.</p>
<p>An iron fence has been erected on the front of the Watriss lot, and a portion of the old fence raised to connect <span class='line-break'> </span>therewith, while the sidewalk has been filled and graded, <span class='line-break'> </span>a portion of the expense of the latter item having been paid <span class='line-break'> </span>by the town of Belmont.</p>
<p>The roadway in front of the gate of the Cemetery has <span class='line-break'> </span>been paved at the joint expense of the City of Cambridge, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Horse Railroad Company and the Corporation.</p>
<p>In order to accomplish thaese special improvements, <span class='line-break'> </span>together with others of less importance which will be found enu=<span class='line-break'> </span>=merated in the report of the Treasurer, the Trustees have drawn <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the available funds of the Corporation, believing the expen=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ditures to be investments more certain to yield an abundant <span class='line-break'> </span>return hereafter than any of the funds that have been thus <span class='line-break'> </span>converted.  The Permanent Fund for the future support <span class='line-break'> </span>and preservation of the Cemeteary has been increased by the <span class='line-break'> </span>deposit of $6.790.25, and with the accrued income for the <span class='line-break'> </span>year now amounts to $129.479.04.  The Repair Fund is now<span class='line-break'> </span>$80.134.87, and the estimated available assets of $23.334.42<span class='line-break'> </span>exclusive of real estate owned by the Corporation outside of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery.  By an irrevocable By=Law it is not lawful <span class='line-break'> </span>for the Trustees to appropriate any portion of the principal<span class='line-break'> </span>or income of the Permanent Fund for the uses of the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>until said Fund shall have amounted to the sum of one<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty thousand dollars.</p>
<p>Realizing the necessity of a larger Fund in consequence</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134950">
<h3><a name="page-1134950">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 123)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>123</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Report.[underlined] '>Trustees' Report.[underlined] </span></p>
<p>of the addition of new territory to the Cemetery, as well as the <span class='line-break'> </span>increased cost of materials and labor, the Trustees on the 8^th of<span class='line-break'> </span>November voted that the Permanent Fund shall amount to two<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred thosand dollars before any of the interest on the same <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be touched.</p>
<p>Having thus given a summary of the more important <span class='line-break'> </span>subjects acted upon during the past year, detailed accounts of <span class='line-break'> </span>the transactions of the Corporation being contained in the Reports<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent and Treasurer, submitted herewith, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees desire to refer briefly to the general condition of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery; it has been their aim, and they have been zealously ^seconded^<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent, to make the grounds attractive and <span class='line-break'> </span>pleasant, by keeping the Avenues and Paths clear and free <span class='line-break'> </span>from obstructions, and the ornamental grounds supplied, by <span class='line-break'> </span>importation and purchase, with a variety of flowering shrubs <span class='line-break'> </span>and plants.  they have also endeavored to reach the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of neglected lots, and induce them to order the necessary repairs,<span class='line-break'> </span>believing that in most cases it will only require that they <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be made aware of the condition of their lots to lead them <span class='line-break'> </span>to apply the proper remedy.  This is a most important subject, <span class='line-break'> </span>as the effect of considerable tracts of our territory is injured <span class='line-break'> </span>by the unsightly condition of a few lots, and the Trustees desire <span class='line-break'> </span>the hearty co=operation of the Proprietors in their efforts for <span class='line-break'> </span>improvement.</p>
<p>A revision of the By=Laws has been prepared and adopted <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Board; while adhereing closely to the spirit of the old laws<span class='line-break'> </span>they have been simplified and made applicable to the present <span class='line-break'> </span>requirements of the Corporation.  They are now in the hands</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>At a meeting of the Board held February 23^rd, 1871, <span class='line-break'> </span>the following preamble and resolutions were unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted, and athe Trustees require that the Proprietors will <span class='line-break'> </span>give them the authority to carry out the suggestions con=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tained therein.</p>

<div id="page-1134961">
<h3><a name="page-1134961">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 134)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>134</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees February 14^th, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees February 14^th, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>February 14^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly Meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, February 14^th, 1872, at half past Three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. Bigelow, N. J. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Livermore, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and  Turner.  In the <span class='line-break'> </span>absence of the President M^r Livermore was called to the chair.<span class='line-break'> </span>The record of the last meeting of the Trustees was read and approved.</p>
<p>This being the first meeting of the Trustees since the <span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Proprietor's Meeting, the business first in order was <span class='line-break'> </span>the choice of officers for the ensuing year.  The Board <span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly proceeded to ballot therefor with the following <span class='line-break'> </span>result, as announced by M^r Turner who was designated <span class='line-break'> </span>by the chairman a Committee to collect, sort and count the <span class='line-break'> </span>votes.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of President[underlined]'>Election of President[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for President[underlined], 9;<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for John T. Bradlee, [underlined] and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary[underlined]'>Secretary[underlined]</span></p>

<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule having <span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer in compliance <span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the new By=Laws, on motion of M^r Turner<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted [underlined], -that said bills be referred to the President for his <span class='line-break'> </span>approval, and payment if found correct.</p>

<p>The following named communications were laid before the Board:<span class='line-break'> </span>(a) From Dr. Brewer requesting the re=appointment of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Special Committee on Birds, &amp;c.</p>

<p>===Halcyon Lake  Excavations, -[underlined]<span class='line-break'> </span>(c) From the Superintendent in regard to the progress of <span class='line-break'> </span>the excavations, etc., at Halcyon Lake.</p>

<p>In the absence of the President, and in default of any <span class='line-break'> </span>Standing Committees to which the above named communications <span class='line-break'> </span>could be referred, it was</p>

Winter <span class='line-break'> </span>for Four hundred and fifty dollars, - and of Lot N^o 2247 on</p>

<p>take into consideration and report to this Board in relation <span class='line-break'> </span>to the salary and emoluments now received by the  Superintendent.</p>

<p>M^r LIvermore gave notice of intention to bring  before <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board at the next meeting the matter of the proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>Testimonial to Dr. Bigelow, which at the last Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting was referred to the Trustees with full powers.</p>

Coolidge. Request for Dec^y Deed to cure error.  Ref^d to Com. on Grounds</span><span class='line-break'> </span>(a) Request of M^r A. J. Coolidge that the Corporation would <span class='line-break'> </span>by vote authorize the execution of a declaratory deed for the <span class='line-break'> </span>purpose of rectifying an erroneous boundary line in the recent <span class='line-break'> </span>conveyance of certain premises at the Stone Meadow from the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation to Joseph G. Coolidge, in consequence of which, certain <span class='line-break'> </span>land already owned by siad Coolidge was included in said conveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>and paid for by him as part of the consideration therefor.</p>

<p>February 16^th, 1872.[underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Monday, February 26^th, 1872, at half past Three o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. Bigelow, J. T. Bradlee, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Livermore, Perkins, Pickering, Snow Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting having been read,*</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Testimonial to Dr. Bigelow'>Testimonial to Dr. Bigelow</span></p>
<p>M^r Livermore having in pursuance of notice <span class='line-break'> </span>given at the last meeting, called up the subject of the proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>Testimonial to Dr. Bigelow, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to Special Committee'>referred to Special Committee</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that this subject be referred to a committee, consisting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the President and two Trustees to be appointed by him. - The <span class='line-break'> </span>President appointed Messrs. Livermore and Little as associate <span class='line-break'> </span>members of said Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reports from Com. on Grounds,[underlined]'>Reports from Com. on Grounds,[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Reports were received from the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>as follows;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='John M^cNamee, Gen. Permit granted. [underlined]'>John M^cNamee, Gen. Permit granted. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>(a) Recommending the granting of a general permit to do work <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery to John M^cNamee, as per application from him <span class='line-break'> </span>dated Jan'y. 10, 1872, he giving the usual bond of $1000, - with two<span class='line-break'> </span>sureties satisfactory to the President.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent Salary &amp; emolluments of[underlined]'>Superintendent Salary &amp; emolluments of[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(b) Report covering an order to the effect that the salary of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent be fixed at $2500. - for the ensuing year, and <span class='line-break'> </span>that he shall have the use of a house with the grounds thereto</p>
<p>=Record amended. [underlined]===</p>
<p>*<span class='line-break'> </span>The Secretary was instructed to amend the same by stating that the <span class='line-break'> </span>re=appointment of the Committee on Birds, and of the Committee on By=Law<span class='line-break'> </span>revision was made by the President [squiggly underline], in pursuance of the provision of the <span class='line-break'> </span>new By=Laws, instead of by Vote [squiggle underline] of the Board, as stated; and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>record so amended be approved.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134968">
<h3><a name="page-1134968">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 141)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>141</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. February 26^th, 1872.[underlined]'>Trustees. February 26^th, 1872.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>belonging, the use of a horse and vehicle, and the services of one <span class='line-break'> </span>man at the expense of the corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watriss Estate. Board fence on.[underlined]'>Watriss Estate. Board fence on.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(c) Report covering an order, "that the Committee on Grounds be and <span class='line-break'> </span>they hereby are authorized to cause a close board fence, ten feet <span class='line-break'> </span>high to be ereted on the West and  South lines of the Watriss es=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tate, the expense thereof not to exceed sixteen hundred dollars."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Meadow. Declaratory deed of strip of  [?] J. G. Coolidge authorized, &amp;c.[underlined]'>Stone Meadow. Declaratory deed of strip of  [?] J. G. Coolidge authorized, &amp;c.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(d) Recommending that the Treasurer and Secretary be directed <span class='line-break'> </span>to execute an instrument setting forth a corrected description of <span class='line-break'> </span>the parcel of land from the "Stone Meadow" conveyed to Joseph G. <span class='line-break'> </span>Coolidge on the 19^th of July, 1871, recorded with Middlesex Deeds, <span class='line-break'> </span>Lib. 1173, fols. 450, 451, in accordance with an amended plan thereof <span class='line-break'> </span>of this date, by Shedd &amp; Sawyer, showing said parcel to contain<span class='line-break'> </span>fourteen ghundred and four square feet, a copy of said plan to be <span class='line-break'> </span>shown upon the margin of said instrument.  Also that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer be directed to refund to Joseph G. Coolidge nine dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>and thirteen cents, ($9.13), as an overpayment by him for seventy=<span class='line-break'> </span>=three feet of land, being a part of the consideration for the aforesaid <span class='line-break'> </span>deed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bounty payroll. Explanation of. Action thereon declared inexpedient;[underlined]'>Bounty payroll. Explanation of. Action thereon declared inexpedient;[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(e) A verbal report in response to the vote of enquiry adopted at <span class='line-break'> </span>the last meeting regarding the "bounty pay=roll" so called, explaining <span class='line-break'> </span>that the said "bounty pay=roll" was not in the nature of an extra <span class='line-break'> </span>compensation for services rendered, but a certain reservation from <span class='line-break'> </span>the regular and stipulated wages of the laborers, payable to them <span class='line-break'> </span>at certain intervals: - and that in the opinion of the Committee it <span class='line-break'> </span>was inexpedient to take any action on the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reports accepted &amp; votes, &amp;c., adopted.[underlined]'>Reports accepted &amp; votes, &amp;c., adopted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the above Reports of the Comittee on Grounds be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the votes, - orders and recommendations therein contained<span class='line-break'> </span>be severally adopted by this Board.</p>
</div>

<div id="page-1134969">
<h3><a name="page-1134969">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 142)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>142</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, February 26^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees, February 26^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Reports were received from the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>as follows:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 1291 &amp; 918, Report from Com. on Lots respecting removal of fence trees &amp;c[underlined]'>Lots 1291 &amp; 918, Report from Com. on Lots respecting removal of fence trees &amp;c[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(2)In regard to the question of right between the proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots N^os 1291 on Ailanthus Path, and 918 on Cedar Avenue,<span class='line-break'> </span>stating the facts, and recommending the adoption of the <span class='line-break'> </span>following vote, - viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote[underlined]'>Vote[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted, that the Superintendent be and he hereby is <span class='line-break'> </span>directed to request the proprietor of Lot N^o 918 to remove the<span class='line-break'> </span>fence and trees from the addition purchased of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>on the 4^th of February 1859; and if the request is not complied <span class='line-break'> </span>with within sixty days after having been made, the Superin=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tendent is further directed to perform the work at the ex=<span class='line-break'> </span>=pense of said proprietor.</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Catacomb Tomb. Construction of reported quote inexpedient unquote. [underlined]='>Catacomb Tomb. Construction of reported quote inexpedient unquote. [underlined]=</span></p>
<p>(b) A Report, "inexpedient," in reference to the construction of <span class='line-break'> </span>a Catacomb=Tomb as recommended b the Superintendent in his <span class='line-break'> </span>communication of August 19^th, 1871.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reports accepted &amp; vote adopted.[underlined]'>Reports accepted &amp; vote adopted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], -that the above Reports of the Committee on Lots be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted, and that the recommendations and vote therein <span class='line-break'> </span>contained be adopted by this Board.</p>

<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on Wednesday, <span class='line-break'> </span>March 13, 1872, at half past three o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. Bigelow, J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Lawrence, Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>

<p>A Report was received from the Comittee on Lots that <span class='line-break'> </span>it was inexpedient to take any action on the Superintendent's <span class='line-break'> </span>Communication of October 11^th, 1870, relative to a proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>mode of increasing the Permanent Fund,</p>
<p>Voted[underlined]- that the said Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title='Testimonial to Dr. J. Bigelow Report in favor of Marble Bust to be placed in Chapel [underlined]='>Testimonial to Dr. J. Bigelow Report in favor of Marble Bust to be placed in Chapel [underlined]=</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Special Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the last meeting with regard to the proposed Tes=<span class='line-break'> </span>=timonial to Dr. Bigelow, in the terms following: viz"</p>
<p>"The Special Committee to whom was referred the subject <span class='line-break'> </span>of a Testimonial to Dr. Jacob Bigelow beg leave to report: <span class='line-break'></span>that after a careful consideration of the subject, and consultation <span class='line-break'> </span>with Dr. Bigelow they recommend the passage of the following order</p>
<p>Ordered[squiggle uinderline] that the Special Committee on Testimonial be and <span class='line-break'> </span>they hereby are authorized to procure a Marble Bust of Dr.</p>

<p>May 8^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, May 8^th, 1872, at half past Three o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Bigelow<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, Livermore, Perkins, Pickering, Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Asphaltum Paths Report quote inexpendient unquote. [underlined]'>Asphaltum Paths Report quote inexpendient unquote. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the subject of using asphaltum on <span class='line-break'> </span>the paths at the Cemetery, stating that they were of the <span class='line-break'> </span>opinion that it could be used on many of the paths <span class='line-break'> </span>without any detriment to the trees or shrubbery; but <span class='line-break'> </span>that to introduce it so as to make a saving in the gravel<span class='line-break'> </span>and repair would require a larger outlay than the funds of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation will warrant; and that they were of the <span class='line-break'> </span>opinion that it is best not to take any action at present.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 667 &amp; 668 on Yarrow Path. Report in regard to numbering &amp; occupancy of. [underlined]'>Lots 667 &amp; 668 on Yarrow Path. Report in regard to numbering &amp; occupancy of. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A ^verbal^ report was received from the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the alleged ambiguity in the numbering or <span class='line-break'> </span>occupancy of Lots N^os 667 and 668 on Yarrow Path, from <span class='line-break'> </span>which it had appeared that Lot 667 conveyed in 1839 to Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>Rice had been occupied by Thomas Cole, ^who had erected upon it a monument numbered 667;^ and ^that^ Lot 668 conveyed<span class='line-break'> </span>at the same time to Thomas Cole had been occupied by Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>Rice, [following line crossed out: who had erected on Cole's Lot a monument numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>667 end crossout] that the numbers on Wadsworth's original Plan and <span class='line-break'> </span>on the Sectional Plans of the corporation corresponded with <span class='line-break'> </span>the deeds, while the numbers on the published Plans had <span class='line-break'> </span>been given in conformity with the occupancy; that the</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134976">
<h3><a name="page-1134976">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 149)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees May 8, 1872'>Trustees May 8, 1872</span><span class='line-break'> </span>interposition of the Trustees in the matter had been applied<span class='line-break'> </span>for by only one of the parties in interest, and that by a verbal<span class='line-break'> </span>communication to the Secertary; that the Committee were<span class='line-break'> </span>of opinion that such an alteration of numbering was prac<span class='line-break'></span>tically impossible; but that if all the parties interested<span class='line-break'> </span>should be desirous to bring about a correspondence between<span class='line-break'> </span>the actual ownership of the Lots and the occupation thereof<span class='line-break'> </span>they had it in their power to do so by proper conveyances<span class='line-break'> </span>the execution of which would be attended with no greater in<span class='line-break'></span>convenience than the signature of a petition to the Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees; and that the Committee was therefore of the opinion<span class='line-break'> </span>that action by the Board was inexpedient.<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the above report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quarterly statements of Treasurer, Report of Com. on Finance respecting'>Quarterly statements of Treasurer, Report of Com. on Finance respecting</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A report was received from the Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>approving as correct the statements of the Treasurer for the<span class='line-break'> </span>quarter ending March 31st, 1872, which were referred to them<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting of the Board. And it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the above report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule Bills referred to President'>Monthly Schedule Bills referred to President</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A pile of bills, with accompanying schedule, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the By-Laws, and the schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, on motion of Mr Turner it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Printing By-Laws Rand Avery + Co&apos;s Bill for approved'>Printing By-Laws Rand Avery + Co's Bill for approved</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The bill of Messrs Rand Avery + Co for printing By-Law &amp;c<span class='line-break'> </span>approved in behalf of the Committee on By-Law revision by<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. Snow having been submitted to the Board it was<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that said bill be approved</p>

<p>May 24^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>A Special Meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Friday, May 24^th, 1872, at Two o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. ^J.T.^ Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Little, Livermore, <span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering and Turner.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notice of proposed change in By=Laws as to Guaranty Contract. [underlined]'>Notice of proposed change in By=Laws as to Guaranty Contract. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President stated that the meeting had been <span class='line-break'> </span>called at the instance of the Chairman of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, for the purpose of giving notice of a proposed change in <span class='line-break'> </span>the By=Laws, by substituting the form of guaranty Contract now <span class='line-break'> </span>in use, as adopted by vote of the Board of Trustees Jan'y. 18, 1870<span class='line-break'> </span>for the form inadvertently inserted in said By=Laws, copied from <span class='line-break'> </span>the form in the By=Laws of 1867.</p>
<p>Dr. Brewer, in behalf of the Committee on Interments, <span class='line-break'> </span>called the attention of the Board to certain doubts which had <span class='line-break'> </span>arise ^in the case of removals from Trinity Church^ relative to the proper fees chargeable under the By=Laws</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>for the interment of the remains of several persons in one grave,<span class='line-break'> </span>at one burial, enclosed in one case.  After discussion, it was</p>

<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Interments, with authority to make such rules in the Revision <span class='line-break'> </span>as they may deem expedient.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be adjourned to meet at this <span class='line-break'> </span>place on Friday, the 31^st inst., at Two P.M.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder, Secretary.</p>

<p>A meeting of the Trustees was held, pursuant to ad=<span class='line-break'> </span>=journment, on Friday, May 31, 1872 at Two o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Livermore and Perkins,  The record of the last meeting was read ^&amp; approved^.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Guaranty Cont of Jan&apos;y. 18, 1870, re-affirmed. Later Form repealed. [underlined] '>Guaranty Cont of Jan'y. 18, 1870, re-affirmed. Later Form repealed. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the form of Donation in trust for the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair of Lots with guaranty, as adopted by the Board of <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, January 17^th, 1870, and now in use, be and the same <span class='line-break'> </span>is hereby substituted for the form inserted in the By=Laws of <span class='line-break'> </span>1872, which is ghereby repealed.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>

<p>A verbal communication was received from M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence in behalf of the Committee on Grounds in regard <span class='line-break'> </span>to a supply of water for a fountain at Halcyon Lake;<span class='line-break'> </span>also for a supply for a small fountain on Elm Avenue near <span class='line-break'> </span>the lot of the late Peter Hubbell, proposed to be presented<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation by his Widow,  on motion of M^r Lawrence</p>

<p>Present, Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee,  Brewer ^Choate^<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Snow and Turner.</p>

<p>A verbal Report was received from the President in <span class='line-break'> </span>relation to the claim made upon this corporation by William <span class='line-break'> </span>Washburn, architect, for professional services, stating the <span class='line-break'> </span>facts in connection therewith; after a full consideration <span class='line-break'> </span>whereof it was</p>

<p>Voted [underlined], - that W^m Washburn's bill of December, 1871, for <span class='line-break'> </span>professional services be apparoved and paid.</p>
<p>The President having asked for an expression of opinion <span class='line-break'> </span>from the Board in reference to certain repairs and refurnishings <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Corporation in Boston; on motion of M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Office in Pemb. Sq. Repairs, &amp;c., of authorized [underlined]'>Office in Pemb. Sq. Repairs, &amp;c., of authorized [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the President be authorized to procure a Brussels <span class='line-break'> </span>carpet for the rooms in Pemberton Square and to make such <span class='line-break'> </span>improvements and renovations at said rooms as he shall deem expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Time of Monthly Meeting changed to 4 P.M. [underlined]'>Time of Monthly Meeting changed to 4 P.M. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the "Rules and Orders of the Board of Trustees"<span class='line-break'> </span>be amended by striking out from the paragraph in relation <span class='line-break'> </span>to the stated meeting of the Trustees the words "half past <span class='line-break'> </span>Three," and inserting the word "Four," so that the paragraph <span class='line-break'> </span>will read as follows: "stated meetings of the Trustees shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be held at the office in Boston on the second Wednesday of <span class='line-break'> </span>each month at Four o'clock, P.M. unless otherwise ordered."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Pet^n for rep^n of Lot 52 referred to Com. on Lopts [underlined]'>Pet^n for rep^n of Lot 52 referred to Com. on Lopts [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary asked the instructions of the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to a Petition for the representation of Lot N^o 52<span class='line-break'> </span>on Iris Path, late of Richard C. Derby deceased, the person <span class='line-break'> </span>nominated to represent said Lot not being either a "devisee</p>

<p>160</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, July 10, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees, July 10, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>or heir=at=law" of the deceased proprietor.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said petition be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots to consider and report,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file.[underlined]'>Monthly Statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, and approved by the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>June 12^th to July 10^th, 1872, having been submitted by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary in compliance with the By=Laws, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said statement be accepted and placed <span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for Perpet. Rep. with G. of Lot N^o 439. [underlined]'>Cont. for Perpet. Rep. with G. of Lot N^o 439. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot numbered 459 on Indian=Ridge<span class='line-break'> </span>Path, late of Charles B. Shaw, deceased for the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>Two hundred and fifty dollars, (additional contract [both words squiggle underline];)-</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above named contract be concurred <span class='line-break'> </span>in on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the peittions of the parties in interest, repre=<span class='line-break'> </span>=sentatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz; -</p>

<p>Albert C. Pond of Boston ^73 Blackstone S^t^ for the heirs of *Moses Pond <span class='line-break'> </span>who are the purchasers of Lot numbered Four thousand and thirty=four</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4097'>4097</span></p>
<p>J. Q. A. Litchfield of Boston ^41 Chauncy S^t^, Son of Allen Litchfield<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four thousand &amp; ninety=seven</p>
<p>Voted [underlioned], - that this meeting be dissolved  Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Sec'y.</p>

<div id="page-1134988">
<h3><a name="page-1134988">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 161)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees August 14^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees August 14^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>August 14^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was notified <span class='line-break'> </span>to be held on Wednesday, August 14^th, 1872, at Four o'clock <span class='line-break'> </span>in the afternoon.  At the day and hour aforesaid, Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Turner, Perkins, Brewer, Lawrence and Snow were present, <span class='line-break'> </span>but, in the absence of a quorum it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjournment. [underlined]'>Adjournment. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be adjourned to Friday the 16^th<span class='line-break'> </span>inst., at Eleven o'clock, A. M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - August 16, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees - August 16, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>August 16^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Friday, August 16^th, 1872, at Eleven o'clock, A. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Lawrence, Little, Perkins and Turner.</p>
<p>The records of the last meetings were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fitchburg R. R. Co. Claim of for Com^n for destruction of tree.  Report of Com. on Grounds Vote, &amp;c. [underlined]'>Fitchburg R. R. Co. Claim of for Com^n for destruction of tree.  Report of Com. on Grounds Vote, &amp;c. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the claim made by the Fitchburg Railroad Co., for<span class='line-break'> </span>the destruction of a tree; said Report being comprised in a <span class='line-break'> </span>letter from the Superintendent dated July 15, 1872, stating in <span class='line-break'> </span>full the circumstances of the case.  On motion of M^r Turner,</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject be referred to the President with full <span class='line-break'> </span>powers to hold such communication with, and make such ex=<span class='line-break'> </span>=planation to the President of the Firthburg R. R. Co. as he may <span class='line-break'> </span>think proper.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='C. M. Hovey&apos;s offer to make pay^t in shrubs etc.,'>C. M. Hovey's offer to make pay^t in shrubs etc.,</span></p>
<p>A communication fromM^r C. M. Hovey, dated February 14, <span class='line-break'> </span>1872, enclosed in letter from &amp;the^ Superintendent dated August 16, 1872,<span class='line-break'> </span>were submitted to the Board by the President, and read; - M^r</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134989">
<h3><a name="page-1134989">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 162)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>162</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, August 16, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees, August 16, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Hovey's letter being a proposal to purchase a Lot  of 824<span class='line-break'> </span>feet on the corner of Mound and Spruce Avenues at $2.00<span class='line-break'> </span>per foot, giving his note for the same, and making payment <span class='line-break'> </span>in certain specified shrubs and plants.  After a full <span class='line-break'> </span>consideration of the subject, - on motion of M^r Little,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='for Lot selected by him declined'>for Lot selected by him declined</span></p>
<p>Voted, [underlined] - that the proprosition of M^r Hovey to make <span class='line-break'> </span>payment in shrubs and plants for a Lot selected by <span class='line-break'> </span>him be declined,.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President : with exception of Watertown Taxes. [underlined]'>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President : with exception of Watertown Taxes. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with acompanying schedule, having <span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the By=Laws, and the schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, who requeasted that the <span class='line-break'> </span>tax=bill rendered by the Town of Watertown might have a <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the Committee on Finance; on motion of M^r Turner,</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the aforesaid bills, with the exception of the <span class='line-break'> </span>tax=bill for 1872 rendered by the Town of Watertown, be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the President for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, <span class='line-break'> </span>if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watertown Tax Bill of 1872 referred to Com. on Finance [underlined]'>Watertown Tax Bill of 1872 referred to Com. on Finance [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above mentioned tax=bill be refererd <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Memorial Work of Art. Horses liable to be frightened at.'>Memorial Work of Art. Horses liable to be frightened at.</span></p>
<p>M^r Turner in behalf of one of the proprietors (M^r Cheever,)<span class='line-break'> </span>called the attention of the Board to an official objection which had <span class='line-break'> </span>been made to placing the Sphynx in the assigned location as <span class='line-break'> </span>being liable to occasion fright to horses.  A full discussion <span class='line-break'> </span>was had, but no action on the subject ^was^ recommended, or taken.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tenure, &amp;c of Lots Report'>Tenure, &amp;c of Lots Report</span></p>
<p>A Report was received, signed by M^r Choate, respecting <span class='line-break'> </span>the tenure and division of Lots, which subject ws referred <span class='line-break'> </span>at the July Meeting to a Committee consisting of the Committee</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134990">
<h3><a name="page-1134990">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 163)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>163</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. August 16, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees. August 16, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>on lots and M^r Choate.  In the absence of M^r Choate the <span class='line-break'> </span>Report was read by the President, and at his suggestion it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='postponed.[underlined]'>postponed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined]. - that the consideration of the same be deferred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Turner, A. T. efective drainage near his Lot. [underlined]'>Turner, A. T. efective drainage near his Lot. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal communication was made to the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>by M^r Turner respecting the insufficient size of the cess=<span class='line-break'> </span>=pool near his Lot on Saffron Path and the lack of proper <span class='line-break'> </span>drainage in this part of the Cemetery.  The subject was <span class='line-break'> </span>very fully discussed, and various plans for remedying the <span class='line-break'> </span>difficulty suggested, but no action was taken.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quarterly Statements of Treas^r referred to Com. on Finance. [underlined]'>Quarterly Statements of Treas^r referred to Com. on Finance. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The reports of the Treasurer for the quarter ending <span class='line-break'> </span>June 30^th, 1872, (which were inadvertently overlooked at the <span class='line-break'> </span>July meeting of the Board,) having been submitted by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Treasurer's statements be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance, to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of Sales of Lots [?] &amp; placed on file.  Cont.  for Perpet. Rep. with G. of Lots N^os 121  2168 &amp; 4156. Reconveyance to Corp^n-in trust of Lot 121.'>Monthly statement of Sales of Lots [?] &amp; placed on file.  Cont.  for Perpet. Rep. with G. of Lots N^os 121  2168 &amp; 4156. Reconveyance to Corp^n-in trust of Lot 121.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on Lots had re=<span class='line-break'> </span>=commended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of Lots N^os<span class='line-break'> </span>2168 and 4156 belonging to W^m R. Lawrence for the sum of one hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, each; and of Lot N^o 121 belonging to Luther Parks, for the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>Five hundred &amp; fifty dollars, and had also approved the reconveyance of <span class='line-break'> </span>said last=named Lot to the Corporation in trust, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above named instruments be concurred in, on the <span class='line-break'> </span>part of this Corporation,</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary,</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134991">

<div class="page-content">
<p>164</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept^r 11^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. Sept^r 11^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>September 11^th 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>A montly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, September 11^th, 1872, at Four o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>the President being absent M^r Turner presided.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2517. *Josiah Vose, Hearing given to W. C. Murdock, Rep. [underlined]'>Lot 2517. *Josiah Vose, Hearing given to W. C. Murdock, Rep. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>At the request of M^r N. B. Bradlee, the Board granted <span class='line-break'> </span>a hearing to M^r William C. Murdock, representative of Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>N^o 2517, Lawn Ave. late of Josiah Vose, deceased; who represented <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Board that the said Lot, which is under contract for <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair with guaranty, was in a very unsatisfactory <span class='line-break'> </span>condition, and asking the intervention of the Board in the matter.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Referred to Co m. on Lots to report at next Meeting.[underlined]'>Referred to Co m. on Lots to report at next Meeting.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined],- that the subject be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, with instructions to report at the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tenure &amp; Division of Lots. Report of Com^tee Record amended. See p. 167.[underlined]'>Tenure &amp; Division of Lots. Report of Com^tee Record amended. See p. 167.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the C ommittee consisting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Comittee on Lots and M^r Choate in respect to the <span class='line-break'> </span>tenure and the division of Lots; stating the opinion of the Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee to be that the provisions of the charter declaring Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>to be indivisible would preclude "the division of a Lot by a <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor in any manner, without the assent of the Corpo=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ration," but that under the power of the Corporation to buy and <span class='line-break'> </span>sell land such a division might be legally effected if deemed <span class='line-break'> </span>expedient, - the question of expediency not being considered <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee as before them under the submission."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted[underlined]'>Accepted[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the aforesaid Report be accepted.</p>
<p>A Report was received from the Committee on Lots</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 11^th, 1872. [underlined] '>Trustees. Sept. 11^th, 1872. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>in reference to the representative of Lot N^o 52, on Iris Path, <span class='line-break'> </span>late of Richard C. Derby, deceased, petitioned for in behalf of <span class='line-break'> </span>Oliver Read, he being neither an "heir=at=law" nor a "devisee" of <span class='line-break'> </span>the late proprietor, and styling himself as "no relation:" the</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='*Richard C. Derby Pet^n for rep^n of Lot 52, late of, declined[underlined]'>*Richard C. Derby Pet^n for rep^n of Lot 52, late of, declined[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Committee recommend, in view of the provisions of the Act of <span class='line-break'> </span>March 31, 1835, Sect. 8, that the Board decline to make the desig=<span class='line-break'> </span>=naton asked for.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the above Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Town of Watertown. Tax=bill of 1872. Report of Com.on Finance concerning, [underlined]'>Town of Watertown. Tax=bill of 1872. Report of Com.on Finance concerning, [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Committee on Finance <span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred the Tax=bill of the Town of Watertown for <span class='line-break'> </span>the year 1872, recommending "that the said Tax=bill, with the <span class='line-break'> </span>exception of the tax assessed on the Watriss Lot, be paid, but <span class='line-break'> </span>that no payment be made of the said tax assessed on the <span class='line-break'> </span>Watriss Lot until final demand made by the said Town of <span class='line-break'> </span>Watertown, when payment may be made under protest, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary measures taken by this corporation to test by suit<span class='line-break'> </span>the legality of said assessment."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted.[underlined]'>Accepted.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above Report be accepted,.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statements of Treasurer approved. [underlined]'>Monthly Statements of Treasurer approved. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was also received from the same Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>approving as correct the statements of the Treasurer for the quarter <span class='line-break'> </span>ending June 30^th, 1872, referred to them at the last meeting.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President. [underlined]'>Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A file of bills, with accompanying Schedule, having been <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the Board by the Treasurer in compliance with the <span class='line-break'> </span>requirements of the By=Laws, and the schedule having been <span class='line-break'> </span>read by the chairman, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President for his approval,<span class='line-break'> </span>and payment by the Treasurer if found correct,</p>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file.[underlined]'>Monthly statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots effected by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent and approved by the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>August 14^th to September 11^th, 1872, having been submitted and <span class='line-break'> </span>read by the Secretary, it was</p>

Lynde<span class='line-break'> </span>for Five hundred and fifty dollars, and of Lot N^o 3796 on <span class='line-break'> </span>Yarrow Path, late of *Ann Goddard, deceased, for One<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars, it was</p>

<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meetingh be adjourned to Wednesday,<span class='line-break'> </span>the eighteenth instant, at Four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder, Jr., Secretary.</p>
