<div id="page-1134994">
<h3><a name="page-1134994">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 167)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>167</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 18^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. Sept. 18^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>September 18^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, September 18^th, 1872, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting having been read, <span class='line-break'> </span>it was, on motion of M^r Snow,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendment of Record at p. 164-[underlined]'>Amendment of Record at p. 164-[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Secretary have leave to amend so much<span class='line-break'> </span>of the record of the last meeting as refers to the acceptance of <span class='line-break'> </span>the report of the "Committee on the tenure and division <span class='line-break'> </span>"of Lots", by stating that the said report was postponed to the <span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting; and that the record so amended be approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Memorial Work of Art, [Sphynx.] [sq. bracket original] Placing of reported by Com. on Grounds.[underlined]'>Memorial Work of Art, [Sphynx.] [sq. bracket original] Placing of reported by Com. on Grounds.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, through the chairman, stating that the removal <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Sphynx from the premises of M^r M^cDonald, and its <span class='line-break'> </span>erection upon the pedestal had been successfully accomplished,<span class='line-break'> </span>and suggesting that the Committee on Grounds be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to cause the said pedestal to be suitably inscribed.  On <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M^r Turner, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Inscription of Pedestal of, ref. to same Com. with full powers. [underlined]'>Inscription of Pedestal of, ref. to same Com. with full powers. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that full powers be granted to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds in reference to the inscription aforesaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Affairs of the Corp^n. General Statement of by President; etc. [underlined]'>Affairs of the Corp^n. General Statement of by President; etc. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President having laid before the Board a general <span class='line-break'> </span>statement of the affairs of the Corporation, and submitted an <span class='line-break'> </span>"Estimate of Assetts and Liabilities at the close of the financial <span class='line-break'> </span>year 1872," as prepared by the Treasurer; having also called<span class='line-break'> </span>attention to the number of operatives employed at the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>and their rate of compensation; and the various particulars<span class='line-break'> </span>involved having been fully considered by the Board, - on</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134995">
<h3><a name="page-1134995">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 168)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>168</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 18^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. Sept. 18^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>motion of M^r Turner, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Operatives: number &amp; compensation of referred to Pres^t'>Operatives: number &amp; compensation of referred to Pres^t</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject of the operatives employed by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation and their rate of  compensation be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Com,. on Grouands, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gen. Statement of Treas^r referred to Finance Committee. [underlined] '>Gen. Statement of Treas^r referred to Finance Committee. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], -  that the Statement prepared by the Treasurer, above <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to, be referred to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant lot. Notice given of vote authorizing purchase of.[underliend] '>Chant lot. Notice given of vote authorizing purchase of.[underliend] </span></p>
<p>Notice was received from M^r Turner of his intention <span class='line-break'> </span>to offer, at the next meeting of the Board, the following Vote; viz;</p>
<p>"Voted [squiggle underline], - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>"to purchase the "Chant " lot of land adjoining the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>"between the Watriss Lot, recently purchased, and the Roman <span class='line-break'> </span>"Catholic Cemetery."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laid over under the Rules. [underlined] '>Laid over under the Rules. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>And the subject having been discussed by those present, <span class='line-break'> </span>action on the same was deferred under Article IX of the By=Laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2517 *Josiah Vose. Report in readiness. Consideration of postponed, [underlined]. '>Lot 2517 *Josiah Vose. Report in readiness. Consideration of postponed, [underlined]. </span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Committee on Lots stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee were in readiness to report on the subject of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Lot of the late Josiah Vose; but suggesting, in view of the <span class='line-break'> </span>lateness of the hour, that the consideration of the same be de=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ferred to the next meeting.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the said Report be laid on the table for <span class='line-break'> </span>consideration at the next meeting.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that when this meeting adjourns it adjourn to <span class='line-break'> </span>meete at this place on Wednesday, the 25^th inst., at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Adjourned [underlined]</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134996">
<h3><a name="page-1134996">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 169)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>169</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, Sept. 25^th, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees, Sept. 25^th, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>September 25, 1872.[underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, September 25^th, 1872, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Bigelow, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Little, Pickering, Perkins and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant Lot. Purchase  of urged by M^r Turner in letter.'>Chant Lot. Purchase  of urged by M^r Turner in letter.</span></p>
<p>The President read a letter from M^r Turner, stating <span class='line-break'> </span>his inability to attend the meeting owing to illness, and urging <span class='line-break'> </span>the adoption of the vote in reference to the purchase of the Chant <span class='line-break'> </span>Lot of land, so called, notice of which was given by him at the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='&amp; Com,. on Grounds authorized to purchase.'>&amp; Com,. on Grounds authorized to purchase.</span></p>
<p>After discussion, on motion of M^r Lawrence, it was ^unanimously}<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted [underlined], - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>purchase the "Chant" lot of land, adjoining the Cemetery, <span class='line-break'> </span>between the Watriss Lot, recently purchased, and the Roman <span class='line-break'> </span>Catholic Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2517 *Josiah Vose. Com. on Lots report progress. Report Acc^d, Full powers granted, [underlined]'>Lot 2517 *Josiah Vose. Com. on Lots report progress. Report Acc^d, Full powers granted, [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from M^r Snow, chairman <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Comittee on Lots, in regard to the Lot of the late Josiah <span class='line-break'> </span>Vose, N^o. 2517, Lawn Avenue, the consideration of which was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to them at the Meeting of the 11^th inst., stating the progress<span class='line-break'> </span>made by the Committee in the duty assigned them, and requesting <span class='line-break'> </span>that the subject be recommitted to them with full powers.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report of the Committee be accepted, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the subject recommitted to them with full powers as requested.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tenure &amp; division of Lots.  Report of Com. on accepted -'>Tenure &amp; division of Lots.  Report of Com. on accepted -</span></p>
<p>A written Report was also submitted by the chairman of the^ same Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee in behalf of the Comittee consisting of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots and M^r Choate in respect to the tenure and the <span class='line-break'> </span>division of Lots. [For terms of said Report see p. 164, ante.] [sq. bracket original]</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134997">
<h3><a name="page-1134997">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 170)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>170</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 25^th, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees. Sept. 25^th, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>discussion, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Division of Lots, quote Expediency unquote  of considered,'>Division of Lots, quote Expediency unquote  of considered,</span></p>
<p>A general discussion ensued with reference to the <span class='line-break'> </span>"Expediency" of the division of a Lot among two or more <span class='line-break'> </span>different owners which the corporation had originally <span class='line-break'> </span>granted ^to^ or the title to which had vested in one proprietor,<span class='line-break'> </span>a question which the Committee states that they did not <span class='line-break'> </span>consider as before them "was under the submission".  The <span class='line-break'> </span>preponderance of opinion, both in the Committee and among<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees generally, appearing to be that such a division <span class='line-break'> </span>was inexpedient, save in exceptional cases, and under the <span class='line-break'> </span>authority of a Vote of the Trustees sanctioning a conveyance <span class='line-break'> </span>back to the Corporation, for the purposes of division, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' &amp; held to be inexpedient save in Exceptional cases. Com. on Lots instructed to report amend^t to By=Laws to this effect.'> &amp; held to be inexpedient save in Exceptional cases. Com. on Lots instructed to report amend^t to By=Laws to this effect.</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the subject be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, ^with M^r Choate,^ with the instructions to report such an amendment to <span class='line-break'> </span>the by=Laws of the Corporation as they may deem adequate<span class='line-break'> </span>in the premises to prevent such division except by Vote of the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='John F. O&apos;Brien&apos;s app^n to divide Lot 2203 declined.[underlined]'>John F. O'Brien's app^n to divide Lot 2203 declined.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the application of John F. O'Brien for the <span class='line-break'> </span>division of Lot N^o 2203 on Elm Avenue is hereby declined.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, October 9^th, 1872 [underlined] '>Trustees, October 9^th, 1872 [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Boston, October 9^th, 1872. [underlined]</p>
<p>At the time appointed for the regular monthly <span class='line-break'> </span>Meeting of the Trustees, Wednesday, October 9^th, 1872, at Four <span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock P.M., - being "the second Wednesday" in said month, <span class='line-break'></span>Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Perkins, Pickering <span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow were present, but for lack of a quorum, it was</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>171</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 9^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. October 9^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be adjourned to Thursday the <span class='line-break'> </span>10^th inst., at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 10^th, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees. October 10^th, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>October 10^th, 1872.[underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly Meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Thursday, October 10^th, 1872, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Perkins, Pickering and Snow</p>
<p>The record of the last two meetings was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President [underlined]'>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompaning schedule having <span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance <span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the By=Laws, and the schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President for his <span class='line-break'> </span>approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drinking=Fountain. Offer from M^rs Peter Hubbell to present. [underlined] '>Drinking=Fountain. Offer from M^rs Peter Hubbell to present. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The President submitted to the Board a communication <span class='line-break'> </span>from M^rs Peter Hubbell of Charlestown, dated September 27, 1872, <span class='line-break'> </span>offering to present to the Corporation a Drinking=Fountain, "provided <span class='line-break'> </span>"that the corporation will place said Fountain in a small plot of <span class='line-break'> </span>"land on Elm Avenue at the junction of Mistletoe Path, and <span class='line-break'> </span>"agree to its being always supplied with pure water when the <span class='line-break'> </span>"other fountains in the grounds are in use. "  The communication <span class='line-break'> </span>was accompanied by drawings of the proposed Fountain, and <span class='line-break'> </span>by a letter from the Superintendent dated the 8^th inst., containing <span class='line-break'> </span>an estimate of the probable cost to the Corporation of placing <span class='line-break'> </span>the same.  After discussion, on motion of M^r Perkins, as <span class='line-break'> </span>amended by M^r Snow, it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134999">
<h3><a name="page-1134999">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 172)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>172</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees October 10^th, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees October 10^th, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant Lot Terms of purchase offered by owner. [underlined] '>Chant Lot Terms of purchase offered by owner. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>An oral communication was received from the <span class='line-break'> </span>President in behalf of the Committee on Grounds with <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the terms of purchase offered by the proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of the "Chant Lot," so called.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Division of Lots,  Amendment of By=Laws to prevent reported unnecessary, etc, '>Division of Lots,  Amendment of By=Laws to prevent reported unnecessary, etc, </span></p>
<p>A written Report was submitted to the Board by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Special Committee which was instructed at the meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the 25^th alt^o. to report such an amendment to the By=Laws <span class='line-break'> </span>as they should deem adequate to prevent the division of Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>except by Vote of the Trustees; stating "that in the opinion <span class='line-break'> </span>"of the Committee a proper construction of the By=Laws does <span class='line-break'> </span>"not now permit a division of a Lot to be made, except by <span class='line-break'> </span>"vote of the Trustees " * * * " and that the Committee are of <span class='line-break'> </span>"opinion that no amendment of the By=Laws is necessary, <span class='line-break'> </span>"but that the Secretary should be instructed not to accept nor <span class='line-break'> </span>"record any conveyance to the corporation other than conveyances <span class='line-break'> </span>"in perpetual trust made under the provisions of Article XIV<span class='line-break'> </span>"of the By=Laws, unless first authorized by vote of the Trustees."</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above Report be accepted, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quarterly Statements of Treas^r referred to Com. on Finance, [underlined]'>Quarterly Statements of Treas^r referred to Com. on Finance, [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Reports of the Treasurer for the quarter ending<span class='line-break'> </span>September 30^th, 1872, having been submitted by the Secretary, ^it was^</p>
<p>Voted [underlined, - that the Treasurer's statements be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annexation to Cambridge of certain districts.[underlined] '>Annexation to Cambridge of certain districts.[underlined] </span></p>
<p>A communication ^having been read^ from M^r Truman H. Safford <span class='line-break'> </span>addressed to the Trustees, in reference to a movement recently <span class='line-break'> </span>inaugurated in favor of the annexation to Cambridge of "that</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135000">
<h3><a name="page-1135000">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 173)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>173</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 10, 1872.[underlined]'>Trustees. October 10, 1872.[underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication from T. H. Safford respecting referred to Pres^t.[underlined]'>Communication from T. H. Safford respecting referred to Pres^t.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>"part of Belmont in immediate proximity to Fresh Pond, also <span class='line-break'> </span>"that portion of M^t Auburn now in  Watertown and the territory <span class='line-break'> </span>"adjoining, including the little village West of the Cemetery,"<span class='line-break'> </span>urging the Corporation to cooperate in said plan of annexation,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was after discussion, and on motion of M^r Snow</p>
<p>Voted [underliend], - that the subject be referred to the President to take<span class='line-break'> </span>such action as he may deem expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. [underlined]'>Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the Sales of Lots effected by the Superin=<span class='line-break'> </span>=tendent and approved by the Committee on Lots, September 11^th<span class='line-break'> </span>to October 10^th, 1872, having been submitted and read by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined]  - that said statement be accepted and placed on file.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be dissolved,</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder, Jr. Secretary</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 13^th, 1872 [underlined] '>Trustees. November 13^th, 1872 [underlined] </span><span class='line-break'> </span>[NOTE: [ "Great Fire" Nov,. 9/72] written in pencil above beginning of minutes]</p>
<p>Boston, November 13^th, 1872. [underliend]</p>
<p>At the time appointed for the regular monthly <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of theTrustees, Wednesday, November 13^th, 1872, at <span class='line-break'> </span>Four o'clock' P.M. , - being the second Wednesday in said month, <span class='line-break'></span>Messrs. Pickering and Lawrence were present, but in the lack <span class='line-break'> </span>of a quorum no organization was had, or action ttttaken,</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr. Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 27, 1872. [underlined] '>Trustees. November 27, 1872. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Boston, November 27^th, 1872. [underlined]===-</p>
<p>A Special Meeting of the Board of Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, November 27^th, 1872, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>

<div id="page-1135001">

<div class="page-content">
<p>174</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees November 27, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees November 27, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved</p>
<p>Reports were received from the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots as follows; viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale to J. C. Bucknam of Lots 4215 &amp; 4216 for cons. Tombs app^d [underlined]'>Sale to J. C. Bucknam of Lots 4215 &amp; 4216 for cons. Tombs app^d [underlined]</span></p>
<p>(a) recommending that the Board approve the sale of <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots N^os 4215 and 4216 on Hazel Dell Path to M^r John C. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bucknam for the construction of a Tomb or Tombs thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cons. of Tombs on Palm Av. &amp; Hazel Dell Paths app^d.[underlined]'>Cons. of Tombs on Palm Av. &amp; Hazel Dell Paths app^d.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(b) recommending that permission be granted by the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>for the construction of tombs on the territory situated on <span class='line-break'> </span>Palm Avenue and Hazel Del Path, and marked "A B" on a Plan <span class='line-break'> </span>signed by the Superintendent, and approved by the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, dated November 1^st, 1872, - to be filed with the Plans <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Relocation of Jacob A. Dreper&apos;s Lot, N^o 3606. [underlined]'>Relocation of Jacob A. Dreper's Lot, N^o 3606. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>(c) recommending that the Secretary be instructed to receive <span class='line-break'> </span>from M^r Jacob A. Dreper a conveyance of Lot N^o 3606, Lavender <span class='line-break'> </span>Path sold to him September 14^th, 1865, - for the purpose of <span class='line-break'> </span>giving him a new location, and allowing the old one to be <span class='line-break'> </span>disposed of to M^r Samuel R. Payson.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance to G. W. Blatchford Tr. of Lot 2203. [underlined]'>Reconveyance to G. W. Blatchford Tr. of Lot 2203. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>(d) recommending that the Secretary be instructed to convey <span class='line-break'> </span>to M^r George W. Blatchford, Trustee, any interest which the <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation may have acquired in Lot N^o 2203, Elm Av.<span class='line-break'> </span>(N.br.) under, or by virtue of a conveyance from said Blatchford <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation, dated May 18, 1872, and entered on the <span class='line-break'> </span>records of deeds</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='John K. Stickney&apos;s Lots to be consolidated under one number[underlined]'>John K. Stickney's Lots to be consolidated under one number[underlined]</span></p>
<p>(e) recommending that the petition of M^r John K. Stickney<span class='line-break'> </span>for leave to consolidate under one number the two contiguous <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots owned by him on Snowdrop Path, and severally numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>3220 and 3221, be ranted.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the foregoing reports be accepted.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135002">

<div class="page-content">
<p>175</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 27, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. November 27, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>and the recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Division of Lot 511. (Moore &amp; Danielson) Ref to Com. on Lots [underlined]'>Division of Lot 511. (Moore &amp; Danielson) Ref to Com. on Lots [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The C ommittee on Lots further presented the petition <span class='line-break'> </span>of Messrs. Henry Moore and Gustaf Danielson for the division <span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot N^o 511 on Willow Avenue (W. br), whereupon it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the same be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Certified copies of deeds destroyed; subject referred to special com, [underlined] '>Certified copies of deeds destroyed; subject referred to special com, [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A request having been received from a proprietor ^M^r Joel Richards^ that <span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation woudl furnish a certified copy, from the records, <span class='line-break'> </span>of the deed of his Lot, the same having been destroyed <span class='line-break'> </span>in the fire of November 9^th, 1872, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the subject of the supply of certified copies <span class='line-break'> </span>from the official records, of instruments alleged to lost or <span class='line-break'> </span>destroyed be referred to a special Committee, consisting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots and M^r Choate -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drinking Fountain, M^rs Hubbell&apos;s offer to present declined with thanks &amp;c. [underlined]'>Drinking Fountain, M^rs Hubbell's offer to present declined with thanks &amp;c. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Commitee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>stating that in view of the outlay for laying pipes, setting foundations, <span class='line-break'> </span>supplying water, etc., which the erection of the proposed Fountain <span class='line-break'> </span>would occasion, the Committee are not prepared, considering <span class='line-break'> </span>the financial conditon of the corporation to recommend the <span class='line-break'> </span>acceptance of M^rs Hubbell's proposition at the present time.</p>
<p>Voted [underlioned], - that the above report be accepted, and the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>instructed to communicate the same to M^rs Hubbell, coupled<span class='line-break'> </span>with the thanks fo the Trustees for her generous proposition,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quarterly statements of Treasurer approved. [underlined] '>Quarterly statements of Treasurer approved. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>approving as correct the statements of the Treasurer for the quarter <span class='line-break'> </span>ending September 30^th, 1872, referred to them at the last meeting.,</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above report be accepted.</p>
<p>The schedule of monthly bills not having been presented</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>William Claflin of Newton, Ex^r &amp; Trustee ^under will of^ Isaac Richm</p>

<div id="page-1135005">
<h3><a name="page-1135005">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 178)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>178</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 11^th, 1872. [underlined] '>Trustees. December 11^th, 1872. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>December 11^th, 1872 [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, December 11^th, 1872, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bills of previous month approved. [underlined]'>Bills of previous month approved. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President reported that he had approved as <span class='line-break'> </span>correct the bills of the previous month, and read a schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>of the same.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report of the President be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Certified copies of deeds destroyed &amp;c. Report of C o mmittee [underliend] '>Certified copies of deeds destroyed &amp;c. Report of C o mmittee [underliend] </span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom at the last meeting was referred the request of <span class='line-break'> </span>M^r Richards for the supply of a certified copy of the deed <span class='line-break'> </span>of his Lot destoyed in the great Fire, recommending "that<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary be directed to furnish M^r Richards with a <span class='line-break'> </span>certified copy of his original deed; and that the same course <span class='line-break'> </span>be taken with other like applications; also recommending<span class='line-break'> </span>"that the Secretary be authorized to obtain, at the expense<span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation, such clerical assistance as may be ne=<span class='line-break'> </span>=cessary to carry this recommendation into effect,."</p>
<p>Voted [underline], - that the above Report be accepted, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dr. Bigelow Marble Bust of in the Chapel. Report of Committee [underlined]'>Dr. Bigelow Marble Bust of in the Chapel. Report of Committee [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Special Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>which was authorized at the Meeting of March 13^th, 1872, <span class='line-break'> </span>"to procure a marble bust of Dr. Bigelow and cause the <span class='line-break'> </span>same to be placed in the Chapel at M^t Auburn;" stating <span class='line-break'> </span>that they had attended to the duty assigned them, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>a bust of Dr. Bigelow ^had been^ carefully executed by M^r Henry</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135006">
<h3><a name="page-1135006">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 179)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>179</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 11^th, 1872 [underlined] '>Trustees. December 11^th, 1872 [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Dexter, sculptor, and that said bust was on the 28^th of November<span class='line-break'> </span>last, placed in the Chapel in a position selected in accor=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dance with the expressed desire of Dr. Bigelow."  The <span class='line-break'> </span>Report also presented for the approval of the Board, M^r Dexter's <span class='line-break'> </span>account, amounting to $668.75.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report of the Committee be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>the account as stated approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jonathan Mann. communication from.Report of Committee [underlined] '>Jonathan Mann. communication from.Report of Committee [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the special Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>to whom, at the last meeting, was referred the communi=<span class='line-break'> </span>=cation of M^r Jonathan Mann.  Said Report having been <span class='line-break'> </span>read and considered, on motion of M^r Turner it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ordered to be spread upon the record. [underlined] '>ordered to be spread upon the record. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>Voted, - that the Report be accepted, and spread upon the record.</p>
<p>the Report is as follows: -</p>
<p>"The Committee on Grounds and Committee on Lots to <span class='line-break'> </span>whom was referred the communication of M^r Jonathan Mann <span class='line-break'> </span>relating to the management of Mount Auburn, particularly <span class='line-break'> </span>as regards the expenses incurred for salaries and labor, the <span class='line-break'> </span>cost of maintaining the greenhouses and prices charged<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors for plants, &amp;c., and the amount paid for surveying <span class='line-break'> </span>and engineering beg leave to report the following statement <span class='line-break'> </span>of facts: -</p>
<p>1^st. Salaries and labor.  The attention of the Board was <span class='line-break'> </span>called to this question by the President several months since, <span class='line-break'> </span>and previous to the date of M^r Mann's letter.  After a <span class='line-break'> </span>full discussion it was voted "that the subject of the operatives<span class='line-break'> </span>employed by the corporation and their rate of compensation</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135007">
<h3><a name="page-1135007">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 180)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>180</p>
<p>Trustees December 11, 1872 [underlined] ===</p>
<p>be referred to the Committee on Grounds with full powers."<span class='line-break'> </span>Under this vote the Committee conferred with the Super=<span class='line-break'> </span>=intendent, and an immediate reduction in the force <span class='line-break'> </span>employed was effected; other discharges have been <span class='line-break'> </span>made since, and as soon as the rush of Fall work, <span class='line-break'> </span>such as top dressing, &amp;c., is completed, a still further <span class='line-break'> </span>reduction will be made; - and the Committee hope<span class='line-break'> </span>that a system may be matured before the commence=<span class='line-break'> </span>=ment of another season the adoption of which will <span class='line-break'> </span>materially lessen the expenses for labor, while maintaining<span class='line-break'> </span>the quality and efficiency of the work performed.</p>
<p>2^d. Cost of maintaining the greenhouses, and prices <span class='line-break'> </span>charged to prorprietors for plants, &amp;c.  This subject has <span class='line-break'> </span>been heretofore acted upon by the Board of Trustees, by <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the Committee on Lots, and a report will <span class='line-break'> </span>be made at an early day.</p>
<p>3^d. Surveying and Engineering.  The bills for surveying <span class='line-break'> </span>had attracted the attention of the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>since, under the new By=Laws it had been necessary <span class='line-break'> </span>to affix their approval to them, and, upon enquiry, <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent had informed them that the <span class='line-break'> </span>occasion of a considerable outlay had grown out of <span class='line-break'> </span>an understanding between him and a former Com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mittee that the sectional plans should be reviewed: <span class='line-break'></span>that work has been in progress during the past two <span class='line-break'> </span>years, and is now completed; the expense for such <span class='line-break'> </span>work is therefore at an end.  The other charges <span class='line-break'> </span>for the usual surveys and measurements of lots</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135008">

<div class="page-content">
<p>181</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 11, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees. December 11, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>are not considered excessive.</p>
<p>Respectfully submitted.</p>
<p>(Signed) John T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Ch^n Com on Grounds</p>
<p>(s) S. T. Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>Ch^m Com. on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Insurance held by  Corp^n [underlined] '>Insurance held by  Corp^n [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A general statement having been made by the President <span class='line-break'> </span>with reference to the Policies of Insurance on property in the <span class='line-break'> </span>use and occupation of the corporation and on property which <span class='line-break'> </span>it holds as mortgagee, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Certain increase of &amp; changes in ordered [underlined]'>Certain increase of &amp; changes in ordered [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the President be authorized to procure in=<span class='line-break'> </span>=surance on the Superintendent's house and stable to the <span class='line-break'> </span>amount of $6000. - in place of $4800, - now held in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Mechanic's Mutual Insurance Company.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Treasurer be directed to notify the <span class='line-break'> </span>mortgagors of real estate held by the Corporation to furnish <span class='line-break'> </span>other insurance in lieu of policies now held in the Mechanics<span class='line-break'> </span>Mut. Ins. Company: and that in case of non=compliance <span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of a mortgagor  with the provision of the above <span class='line-break'> </span>order, the President is hereby authorized to procure such <span class='line-break'> </span>insurance at the  Expense of said mortgagor.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President. [underlined] '>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A file of bills, with accompanying schedule, having <span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the By=Laws, and the schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President for his <span class='line-break'> </span>approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if found correct.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135009">
<h3><a name="page-1135009">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 182)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>182</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 11, 1872 [underlined]'>Trustees. December 11, 1872 [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Dr. Bigelow&apos;s Resignation[underlined]'>Dr. Bigelow's Resignation[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The President having read to the Board a com=<span class='line-break'> </span>=munication from Dr. Bigelow tendering his resignation<span class='line-break'> </span>of the office of Trustee, and a general desire having <span class='line-break'> </span>been expressed on hearing said communication that <span class='line-break'> </span>Dr. Bigelow might be induced to re=consider his intention,<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of M^r Perkins it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Attempt to be made to induce recall of. [underlined]'>Attempt to be made to induce recall of. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the President be requested to obtain <span class='line-break'> </span>the signatures of the members of the Board of Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>to a paper addressed to Dr. Bigelow with a view of pre=<span class='line-break'> </span>=vailing upon him to recall his letter of resignation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Office Safe. Investigation to be had to ascertain if it is fire=proof.  Also as to expediency of a steam=safe attachment [underlined]'>Office Safe. Investigation to be had to ascertain if it is fire=proof.  Also as to expediency of a steam=safe attachment [underlined]</span></p>
<p>M^r Snow having called the attention of the board <span class='line-break'> </span>to the importance of ascertaining whether the safe at the <span class='line-break'> </span>office N^o 16 Pemberton Square is or is not completely fire<span class='line-break'> </span>proof, and whether additional security might be gained<span class='line-break'> </span>by the use of a steam=safe apparatus in connection with <span class='line-break'> </span>the present safe, it was, after discussion, on motion of M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow,</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the expedience of introducing a steam=<span class='line-break'> </span>=safe attachment on the safe at the office of the corp=<span class='line-break'> </span>=oration be referred to a Committee consisting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>President and M^r N. J. Bradlee to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots: also revised Statement of last month&apos;s sales, accepted &amp; placed on file. [underlined]'>Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots: also revised Statement of last month's sales, accepted &amp; placed on file. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots effected by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent and approved by the Committee on Lots, <span class='line-break'> </span>November 13^th to December 11^th having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, together with a revised<span class='line-break'> </span>statement of the sales of the previous month, - it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the said statements be accepted and placed on file</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees December 11, 1872. [underlined]'>Trustees December 11, 1872. [underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contracts for perp. Rep. with G. of Lots N^os  1084  1374  2730  2831 &amp; 3318[underlined]'>Contracts for perp. Rep. with G. of Lots N^os  1084  1374  2730  2831 &amp; 3318[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretry having stated that the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual re=<span class='line-break'> </span>=pair of Lot N^o 1084 on Fir Avenue, belonging to M^rs David <span class='line-break'> </span>Nevins, Jr., for Five hundred and fifty dollars; - of Lot N^o 1374<span class='line-break'> </span>on Oak Avenue, late of Ezra S. Gannett, D. D. deceased, for Five <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars; - of Lot N^o 2730 on Spruce Avenue <span class='line-break'> </span>late of Theodore Chase deceased, for Five hundred and fifty <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars; - of Lot N^o 2831 on Lavender Path, late of Isaac D. <span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, deceased, for Six hundred dollars; - and of Lot <span class='line-break'> </span>N^o 3318 on Lime Avenue late of M^rs Mary Ann S. Easton, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased for Four hundred and seventy=five dollars; it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above named contracts be severally <span class='line-break'> </span>concurred in on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest <span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows; viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='555'>555</span></p>
<p>Martha M. Willard of Brighton, Daughter of Emery Willard, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Five hundred &amp; fifty=fie.</p>
