<div id="page-1135011">
<h3><a name="page-1135011">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 184)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>184</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. December 11, 1872[underlined]'>Trustees. December 11, 1872[underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4224'>4224</span></p>
<p>Ann R. Morrill of Boston, Widow of Samuel Morrill, <span class='line-break'> </span>for his heirs, proprietors of Lot numbered Forty=two hundred &amp; twenty=four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jan&apos;y. 8, 1873. [underlined]'>Trustees Jan'y. 8, 1873. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>January 8^th, 1873. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, January 7^th, 1873, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence, <span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Livermore, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Birds and Waterfowl: Report from Dr. Brewer. [underlined]'>Birds and Waterfowl: Report from Dr. Brewer. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>M^r Little presented a Report from Dr. Brewer <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the Birds and Waterfowl of the corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>The same having been read to the Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President. [underlined]['>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President. [underlined][</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompaning schedule <span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer in <span class='line-break'> </span>compliance with the requirements of the By=Laws, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the schedule having been read by the President, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President <span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if <span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jacob Bigelow M.D. Resignation of the Office of Trustee by,  withdrawn.'>Jacob Bigelow M.D. Resignation of the Office of Trustee by,  withdrawn.</span></p>
<p>A Report ws received from the President stating<span class='line-break'> </span>that in compliance with the vote adopted at the last meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>he had obtained the signature of the Trustees to a letter addressed <span class='line-break'> </span>to Dr. Bigelow soliciting the recall of his resignation, which he <span class='line-break'> </span>had personally presented to Dr. Bigelow, and had finally</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135012">
<h3><a name="page-1135012">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 185)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>185</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jan&apos;y. 8^th, 1873. [underlined]'>Trustees Jan'y. 8^th, 1873. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>succeeded in obtaining assurance of his wilingness to accede<span class='line-break'> </span>to the unanimous desire of the Board by remaining in office.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Correspondence in regard to the above ordered to be recorded.'>Correspondence in regard to the above ordered to be recorded.</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined[, - that the Report of the President be accepted, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that Dr. Bigelow's letter of resignation together with <span class='line-break'> </span>the letter addressed to him by the Trustees be spread upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the record.  [See pp. 186,187] [sq.brackets original]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Insurance on Supt.&apos;s House &amp; Stable increased. On real estate held by corp^ in mortgage, replaced.'>Insurance on Supt.'s House &amp; Stable increased. On real estate held by corp^ in mortgage, replaced.</span></p>
<p>The President also reported that, as instructed by the <span class='line-break'> </span>vote of the Board at the last meeting, he had replaced the <span class='line-break'> </span>insurance of $4800. - on Superintendent's House and Stable <span class='line-break'> </span>written by the Mechanics Mutual Insurance Company, with an <span class='line-break'> </span>insurance of $6000.- in the Insurance Company of North America:<span class='line-break'> </span>also that at the request of the Treasurer the mortgages of real <span class='line-break'> </span>estate held by the corporation had promptly furnished insurance<span class='line-break'> </span>in satisfactory companies in lieu of the policies written by the <span class='line-break'> </span>company first above named.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the abovbe Rrport be accepted,.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that when this Board adjourn it adjourn to meet <span class='line-break'> </span>at this place on Wednesday the 22^d inst., at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. [underlined] '>Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots effected by the Super=<span class='line-break'> </span>intendent and approved by the Committee on Lots from December 11^th<span class='line-break'> </span>1872 to January 8&amp;th, 1873, having been submitted and read by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the said statement be accepted and placed <span class='line-break'> </span>on file/</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be adjourned.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135013">
<h3><a name="page-1135013">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 186)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>186</p>
<p>Trustees. Jan'y. 8, 1873.</p>
<p>Correspondence<span class='line-break'> </span>ordered to be recorded by vote of the Board adopted January 8^th, 1873. [underlined]</p>
<p>Dr. Bigelow to the Trustees.</p>
<p>Boston, December 10, 1872.</p>
<p>John T. Bradlee, Esq.,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I request you to communicate at <span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting of the Trustees of M^t Auburn Cemetery, my <span class='line-break'> </span>resignation, by no means premature, of the office of Trustee <span class='line-break'> </span>of that Institution.</p>
<p>On leaving the long familiar meetings of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, with which I have been associated for more than <span class='line-break'> </span>forty years, I would not fail to give utterance to the <span class='line-break'> </span>satisfaction which we must all feel that an enterprize<span class='line-break'> </span>which was new a few years since, has become an object <span class='line-break'> </span>of successful imitation in all parts of this Continent.</p>
<p>With sincere acknowledgments for the uniform <span class='line-break'> </span>courtesy and kindness which I have received from the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees and the Corporationm,</p>
<p>Yours with respect and regard,</p>
<p>(Signed) Jacob Bigelow.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135014">
<h3><a name="page-1135014">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 187)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, Jan&apos;y. 8, 1873. [underlined]'>Trustees, Jan'y. 8, 1873. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Trustees to Dr. Bigelow.</p>
<p>Boston, December 13, 1872.</p>
<p>Dr. Jacob Bigelow,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The undersigned, members of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees of M^t Auburn, have received with deep <span class='line-break'> </span>regret your communication to the President of the corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>announcing your resignation of the office of Trustee.</p>
<p>Your name has been identified with the foundation <span class='line-break'> </span>and successful development of the Institution, and we <span class='line-break'> </span>are sure e express the wishes of every member of the <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation in asking the withddrawal of this letter.</p>
<p>Believing that your resignation at any time would <span class='line-break'> </span>be premature, we sincerely hope you will accede to this <span class='line-break'> </span>request.</p>
<p>Truly and respectfully yours,</p>
<p>(Signed) John T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>" Alfred T. Turner<span class='line-break'> </span>"William Perkins<span class='line-break'> </span>"Sam^l T. Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>Henry W. Pickering<span class='line-break'> </span>Nath^l J. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>Edward Lawrence<span class='line-break'> </span>Jas. L. Little<span class='line-break'> </span>Chas. F. Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>Isaac Livermore<span class='line-break'> </span>Thomas M. Brewer</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135015">
<h3><a name="page-1135015">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 188)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>188</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jan&apos;y. 22^d, 1873. [underlined] '>Trustees Jan'y. 22^d, 1873. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>January 22^d, 1873. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday, January 22^d, 1873, at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Little, Livermore, Perkins, Snow &amp; Turner.<span class='line-break'> </span>[Also present after the adjourment of the Board, having been<span class='line-break'> </span>unavoidably detained, - M^r Pickering.] [sq. bracket original]</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Finance. Rep^t laid on the table. also Rep^t of Treasurer, except certain portion referred to Com. on Lots to consider &amp; report.[underlined]'>Com. on Finance. Rep^t laid on the table. also Rep^t of Treasurer, except certain portion referred to Com. on Lots to consider &amp; report.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Report of the Committee on Finance, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the Annual Report of the Treasurer having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Board, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said Reports be laid on the table, with <span class='line-break'> </span>the exception of that part of the Treasurer's Report which <span class='line-break'> </span>has reference to the amount due and uncollected for labor <span class='line-break'> </span>and materials expended upon private lots.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this portion of the Treasurer's Report be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Lots to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Labor &amp; materials on private lots.  Com. on Finance to cons. practicability of greater promptness in ren&apos;g bills of}'>Labor &amp; materials on private lots.  Com. on Finance to cons. practicability of greater promptness in ren'g bills of}</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Committee on Finance be instructed to <span class='line-break'> </span>consider and report upon the practicability of adopting <span class='line-break'> </span>some system which may secure greater promptitude in <span class='line-break'> </span>rendering accounts of charges for labor and materials against <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors by the Superintendent to the Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Steam=safe attachment reported [quote] inexpedient[unquote][underlined]'>Steam=safe attachment reported [quote] inexpedient[unquote][underlined]</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the  Committee apointed<span class='line-break'> </span>December 11^th, 1872 to consider the expediency of introducing a <span class='line-break'> </span>steam=safe attachment on the safe at the office of the <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation,stating that, in the opinion of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>such measure was inexpedient.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report be accepted and the Committee</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135016">
<h3><a name="page-1135016">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 189)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>189</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Jan&apos;y 22^d, 1873 [underlined]'>Trustees. Jan'y 22^d, 1873 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>discharged.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='John K. Stickney&apos;s Lots. Conveyance of to Corp^n ordered &amp; new deed to be issued of the two under one number[underlined]'>John K. Stickney's Lots. Conveyance of to Corp^n ordered &amp; new deed to be issued of the two under one number[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Reports were received from the Committee on Lots as <span class='line-break'> </span>follows, viz:</p>
<p>(a) In reference to the petition of M^r John K. Stickney for <span class='line-break'> </span>leave to consolidate under one number the two contiguous <span class='line-break'> </span>lots owned by him on Snowdrop Path, and numbered respectively <span class='line-break'> </span>3220 and 3221: - recommending "that the Secretary be <span class='line-break'> </span>"authorized to accept a re-conveyance of both the lots withing<span class='line-break'> </span>"named, for the purpose of issuing to M^r Stickney a new deed <span class='line-break'> </span>"as one lot numbered 3220."  [See p.174.] [sq. bracket orig]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Moore &amp; Danielson (Lot *#511.) Leave to withdraw granted on the Pet^n for division [underlined] '>Moore &amp; Danielson (Lot *#511.) Leave to withdraw granted on the Pet^n for division [underlined] </span></p>
<p>(b) In reference to the petition of Messrs G. Danielson <span class='line-break'> </span>and Henry Moore for a division of Lot 511 on Willow Av.<span class='line-break'> </span>claimed to be owned by them in common; - stating <span class='line-break'> </span>"that the Committee are unable to discover in this appli=<span class='line-break'> </span>"=cation any reasons for a departure from the settled <span class='line-break'> </span>"policy of the Boartd on this subject; and do not therefore <span class='line-break'> </span>"recommend that the request be granted"</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above Reports be acepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Charges for Ann. Care of Lots.  Com. n Lots granted more time for consideration of.[underlined]'>Charges for Ann. Care of Lots.  Com. n Lots granted more time for consideration of.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Committee having requested that more time <span class='line-break'> </span>might be granted them for the consideration of the subject <span class='line-break'> </span>of the prices charged for the annual care of lots, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above request be acceded to.</p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Superintendent having <span class='line-break'> </span>been presented and read by the President, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said Report be accepted and printed.,<span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supp. Schedule of ?Bilsl referred to Pres^t. [underlined]'>Supp. Schedule of ?Bilsl referred to Pres^t. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule, (to the <span class='line-break'> </span>close of the financial y ear, supplementary to the file presented<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting of the Board,) having been submitted and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135017">
<h3><a name="page-1135017">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 190)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>190</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Jan&apos;y. 22^d, 1873. [underlined]'>Trustees. Jan'y. 22^d, 1873. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>read, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that said bills be referred to the President for <span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that when this Board adjourns it adjourn <span class='line-break'> </span>to meet at this place on Tuesday the 28^th inst. at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be adjourned.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Jan&apos;y. 28^th, 1873. [underlined]'>Trustees. Jan'y. 28^th, 1873. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>January 18^th, 1873. [underlined]</p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Tuesday, January 28^th, 1873, at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs J. T. Bradlee, N. J. Bradlee, Brewer, <span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt.&apos;s estimates of Bills due, &amp;c., &amp;c. Report of Com. on Lots concerning [underlined] '>Supt.'s estimates of Bills due, &amp;c., &amp;c. Report of Com. on Lots concerning [underlined] </span></p>
<p>An extended and detailed Report was made orally <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Chairman of the Committee on Lots upon that portion <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer's Report containing the estimates of the Super=<span class='line-break'> </span>=intendent of sums due and uncollected for labor and materials, <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee at the last meeting.</p>
<p>After a full consideration of the same, and conference <span class='line-break'> </span>with the Superintendent, present by invitation, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s REport (amended) accepted [underlined]'>Treasurer's REport (amended) accepted [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report of the Committee on Lots, re=<span class='line-break'> </span>=commending the approval of the Superintendt's revised<span class='line-break'> </span>estimates in the aforesaid particulars, and the incorporation <span class='line-break'> </span>of said estimates with the Treasurer's Annual Report, be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Treasurer's Annual Report, so amended, <span class='line-break'> </span>bea accepted and printed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135018">
<h3><a name="page-1135018">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 191)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>191</p>
<p>===Trustees. Jan'y. 28^th, 1873. [underlined]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sphinx Statue Rep. of Com. on Grounds accepted.  Com. on Finance Report accepted'>Sphinx Statue Rep. of Com. on Grounds accepted.  Com. on Finance Report accepted</span></p>
<p>A written Report was received from the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, to whom was entrusted the erection and in=<span class='line-break'> </span>=scription of the Sphinx Statue, presented by Dr. Bigelow.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p>On motion of M^r Turner it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report of the Committee on Finance be <span class='line-break'> </span>taken from the table, and that the same be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts at the Cemetery; imp. method of keeping. Subject postponed.'>Accounts at the Cemetery; imp. method of keeping. Subject postponed.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Finance, to whom, at the last meeting ^{see p. 188, ante}<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the subejct of the adoption of an improved<span class='line-break'> </span>system for rendering, at the Cemetery, charges against proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>for labor, and materials, submitted a Report recommending <span class='line-break'> </span>that the subject be referred to the next Board of Trustees.</p>
<p>Voted [underliend], - that the above report be accepted, and the reference made.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Ann. Report accepted &amp; ord^d to be printed.[underlined]'>Trustees Ann. Report accepted &amp; ord^d to be printed.[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Trustees to the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>was then read by the President, after consideration whereof, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Report be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant Lot, purchase of. Pres^t to have power to complete,.[underlined] '>Chant Lot, purchase of. Pres^t to have power to complete,.[underlined] </span></p>
<p>The President having stated that the examination <span class='line-break'> </span>of the title of the "Chant Lot," so called, had been completed, <span class='line-break'> </span>and papers prepared for the conveyance of the same to the <span class='line-break'> </span>corporation; it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the President be requested to take such <span class='line-break'> </span>action as may be necessary or expedient in order to complete <span class='line-break'> </span>the above transaction.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perpet. Rep. with G. of Lot 874. [this vote was passed at the Meeting of Jan.22^d, 1873. ]'>Cont. for perpet. Rep. with G. of Lot 874. [this vote was passed at the Meeting of Jan.22^d, 1873. ]</span></p>
<p>The secretary having stated that the Committee on Lots had recom=<span class='line-break'> </span>=mended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of Lot N^o 874, Pilgrim<span class='line-break'> </span>Path, belonging to Dan^l Kimball, for Five hundred and twenty=fie dollars;</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above contract be concurred in by this Board.</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam^l. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135019">
<h3><a name="page-1135019">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 192)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>192</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors February 3d, 1873.'>Proprietors February 3<sup>d</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p><u>Annual Meeting of the Proprietors <span class='line-break'></span>Monday, February 3<sup>d</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A duly notified meeting of the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, was held at Horticultural Hall,<span class='line-break'> </span>Boston, on Monday, February 3<sup>d</sup>, 1873, at half past Three<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock in the afternoon</p>
<p>A quorum being present, the meeting was called to<span class='line-break'> </span>order by the President, who also read the call for the same.</p>
<p>The record of the last Proprietors' Meeting was read<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Secretary and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports accepted, + ordered to be recorded.'>Annual Reports accepted, + ordered to be recorded.</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Trustees, accompanied by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Reports of the Superintendent and Treasurer, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been distributed in print among the Proprietors present, and<span class='line-break'> </span>the Report of the Trustees having been read by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Collamore, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Annual Reports be accepted and recorded</p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> M<sup>c</sup>Clellan it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that a Committee of three be appointed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>chair to receive, count and sort the votes for Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Com. appd to collect, count and sort votes for Trustees'> Com. app<sup>d</sup> to collect, count and sort votes for Trustees</span></p>
<p>The chair appointed Messrs. John M<sup>c</sup>Clellan, J.T.<span class='line-break'> </span>Prince and Alex. Wadsworth to compose said Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>who subsequently reported as follows, viz; -</p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast 54, - all of which<span class='line-break'> </span>were for the following named persons, viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Elected.'>Trustees Elected.</span></p>
<p>Jacob Bigelow,} to serve until 1879,<span class='line-break'> </span>James L. Little.} by re=election.</p>
<p>On motion of the Rev<sup>d</sup> George E. Ellis, D.D., seconded</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135020">
<h3><a name="page-1135020">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 193)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>193</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Proprietors. February 3d, 1873.'> Proprietors. February 3<sup>d</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p>by the Rev<sup>d</sup> Christopher T. Thayer, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn hereby express to the venerable and honored Dr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Jacob Bigelow their most grateful appreciation of his<span class='line-break'> </span>good will and [numificence?] in the Gift to the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Monumental Sphinx; which, as prompted and<span class='line-break'> </span>bestowed by his liberality, and illustrated and inscribed<span class='line-break'> </span>by his classic pen, is an Evidence alike of his private<span class='line-break'> </span>virtues and of his patriotism.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Jacob Bigelow, M.D.'>Jacob Bigelow, M.D.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Resolutions of thanks to adopted.'> Resolutions of thanks to adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this generous deed by our Benefactor is<span class='line-break'> </span>regarded by us as a most fitting crown to all the valuable<span class='line-break'> </span>services which Dr. Bigelow has rendered to the Cemetery, as chief<span class='line-break'> </span>among those who originated and planned it, as for so many<span class='line-break'> </span>years the President of its Trustees, and as always the wise<span class='line-break'> </span>and faithful guardian of its interests.</p>
<p>The above votes were unanimously adopted, each<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor [rising?]</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135021">
<h3><a name="page-1135021">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 194)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>194</p>
<p>TRUSTEES' REPORT.</p>
<p>DURING the past year considerable advance has been made<span class='line-break'> </span>in the excavation and improvement of Halcyon Lake, the<span class='line-break'> </span>dryness of the season permitting the work commenced in the <span class='line-break'> </span>autumn of 1871 to be continued during the winter months.</p>
<p>Improvements have also been made in Hazel Dell, Palm,<span class='line-break'> </span>Maple, Sycamore and Yew Avenues, the Watriss Lot, vicinity<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Engine-house and other localities, and a house has been<span class='line-break'> </span>erected for the accommodation of the swans and other<span class='line-break'> </span>water fowl.</p>
<p>The Watriss Lot has been connected with the Cemetery by<span class='line-break'> </span>the removal of the stockade which formed the division line,<span class='line-break'> </span>and a substantial wooden fence has been erected on the new<span class='line-break'> </span>boundary.</p>
<p>The drainage of Spruce Avenue and the surrounding<span class='line-break'> </span>territory has long been the subject of careful consideration,<span class='line-break'> </span>and conferences have been held with proprietors whose lots<span class='line-break'> </span>are affected, but all plans heretofore suggested, if feasible at<span class='line-break'> </span>all, would have involved large expenditures.</p>
<p>Recently negotiations have been concluded for the purchase<span class='line-break'> </span>of the "Chant Lot," containing about tow and one-half acres<span class='line-break'> </span>of land, the possession of which it is believed will enable a<span class='line-break'> </span>plan to be matured for the drainage of the low section at a <span class='line-break'> </span>reasonable cost; securing also a desirable addition to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p>In August last a monumental statue, imitated from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Sphinx of antiquity, and designed to commemorate the great<span class='line-break'> </span>war of American conservation, was placed on its pedestal in<span class='line-break'> </span>front of the Chapel at Mount Auburn. It is cut from a single<span class='line-break'> </span>block of Hallowell Granite, fifteen feet long, by about eight<span class='line-break'> </span>feet in height, the face along measuring three feet in length.<span class='line-break'> </span>It is a gift to the Proprietors of the Cemetery from the late<span class='line-break'> </span>President, Dr. Jacob Bigelow, and was executed under his<span class='line-break'> </span>direction by Martin Milmore, the distinguished sculptor.</p>
<p>The pedestal is of a plain oblong form, with emblems and<span class='line-break'> </span>inscriptions. Its emblems are simple, being on the southern<span class='line-break'> </span>end a figure of the Egyptian Lotus, and on the northern the<span class='line-break'> </span>American Water Lily. On the two remaining sides are<span class='line-break'> </span>inscriptions, on in Latin, the other in English, as follows: <span class='line-break'></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135022">
<h3><a name="page-1135022">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 195)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>AMERICA CONSERVATA<span class='line-break'> </span>AFRICA LIBERATA<span class='line-break'> </span>POPULO MAGNO ASSURGENTE<span class='line-break'> </span>HEROUM SANGUINE FUSO.</p>
<p>AMERICAN UNION PRESERVED<span class='line-break'> </span>AFRICAN SLAVERY DESTROYED<span class='line-break'> </span>BY THE UPRISING OF A GREAT PEOPLE<span class='line-break'> </span>BY THE BLOOD OF ALLEN HEROES.</p>
<p>This beautiful work of art has been formally transferred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, and the Trustees have caused the following<span class='line-break'> </span>inscription to be placed thereon:-</p>
<p>JACOB BIGELOW STATUIT ET DEDICAVIT.</p>
<p>Detailed accounts of the transactions of the Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>be found in the accompanying reports of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>and Treasurer.</p>
<p>The Permanent Fund for the future care and embellish<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the Cemetery, has been increased by the deposit of<span class='line-break'> </span>$6,272.59, and with accrued interest now amounts to<span class='line-break'> </span>$143,882.34.</p>
<p>The Repair Fund has received during the year for new<span class='line-break'> </span>endowments $11,300, and now amounts to $90,478.41.</p>
<p>In addition to these Funds the Corporation has available<span class='line-break'> </span>assets estimated at $31,555.86, exclusive of real estate<span class='line-break'> </span>outside of the Cemetery.</p>
<p>At the last Annual Meeting the Trustees were instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>to procure a suitable testimonial as a token of appreciation<span class='line-break'> </span>of the long continued and faithful services of Dr. Bigelow as<span class='line-break'> </span>President and Trustee. After consulation, it was decided<span class='line-break'> </span>that the most desirable method by which the Board could<span class='line-break'> </span>execute the wishes of the Proprietors, was to cause a marble<span class='line-break'> </span>bust of their distinguished colleague to be placed in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Chapel at Mount Auburn. This plan was found to be highly<span class='line-break'> </span>acceptable to Dr. Bigelow, and the celebrated sculptor, Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Henry Dexter was intrusted with the execution of the work.<span class='line-break'> </span>His labors have been successfully completed, and the bust<span class='line-break'> </span>placed upon a bracket prepared for its reception in the Chapel.</p>
<p>Some weeks since Dr. Bigelow transmitted to the Board a<span class='line-break'> </span>communication as follows: -</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135023">
<h3><a name="page-1135023">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 196)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>196</p>
<p>BOSTON, DEC. 10, 1872.</p>
<p>JOHN T. BRADLEE, ESQ.,</p>
<p>DEAR SIR:</p>
<p>I request you to communicate at the next meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery, my resignation, by no means<span class='line-break'> </span>premature, of the office of Trustee of that institution.</p>
<p>On leaving the long familiar meetings of Mount Auburn, with which<span class='line-break'> </span>I have been associated for more than forty years, I would not fail to<span class='line-break'> </span>give utterance to the satisfaction which we must all feel that an enter<span class='line-break'></span>prise which was new a few years since, has become an object of successful<span class='line-break'> </span>imitation in all parts of this continent.</p>
<p>With sincere acknowledgments for the uniform courtesy and kindness<span class='line-break'> </span>which I have received from the Trustees and the Corporation,</p>
<p>Yours with respect and regard,</p>
<p>(Signed.) JACOB BIGELOW.</p>
<p>At the unanimous and urgent solicitation of his associates,<span class='line-break'> </span>as expressed in a letter of which the following is a copy, he<span class='line-break'> </span>has consented to withdraw his resignation and allow the use<span class='line-break'> </span>of his name for re-election at this time.</p>
<p>BOSTON, DEC. 14, 1872.</p>
<p>DR. JACOB BIGELOW,</p>
<p>DEAR SIR:</p>
<p>The undersigned, members of the Board of Trustees of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, have received with deep regret your communication to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President of the Corporation announcing your resignation of the<span class='line-break'> </span>office of Trustee.</p>
<p>Your name has been identified with the foundation and successful<span class='line-break'> </span>development of the Institution, and we are sure we express the wishes<span class='line-break'> </span>of every member of the Corporation in asking the withdrawal of this<span class='line-break'> </span>letter.</p>
<p>Believing that your resignation at any time would be premature, we<span class='line-break'> </span>sincerely hope you will accede to this request.</p>
<p>Truly and respectfully yours,<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed.) JOHN T. BRADLEE,<span class='line-break'> </span>ALFRED T. TURNER,<span class='line-break'> </span>WILLIAM PERKINS,<span class='line-break'> </span>SAMUEL T. SNOW,<span class='line-break'> </span>HENRY W. PICKERING,<span class='line-break'> </span>NATHANIEL J. BRADLEE,<span class='line-break'> </span>EDWARD LAWRENCE,<span class='line-break'> </span>JAMES L. LITTLE,<span class='line-break'> </span>CHARLES F. CHOATE,<span class='line-break'> </span>ISAAC LIVERMORE,<span class='line-break'> </span>THOMAS M. BREWER.</p>
<p>The Trustees believe that the wishes of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>will be in full accord with their own, that the originator and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135024">
<h3><a name="page-1135024">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 197)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>197</p>
<p>founder of Mount Auburn, to whom the Cemetery is so largely<span class='line-break'> </span>indebted for its successful and honorable history, shall continue<span class='line-break'> </span>to benefit the Corporation by his experience and counsel as<span class='line-break'> </span>long as his life may be spared.</p>
<p>For the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>JOHN T. BRADLEE,<span class='line-break'> </span><i>President.</i></p>
<p>Boston, January, 1873.</p>

<p>The Repair Fund consists of Notes Receivable, secured by Mortgage<span class='line-break'> </span>and other Collateral Securities ...................................................... 30,500.00<span class='line-break'> </span>30 Shares Atlas National Bank ....................................................... 2,970.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Boston and Albany Railroad Co ............................................... 1,721.25<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Shawmut National Bank ......................................................... 2,430.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Atlantic National Bank ........................................................... 2,700.00<span class='line-break'> </span>5 " Boston and Lowell Railroad ..................................................... 3,190.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Fitchburg Railroad ................................................................ 2,600.00<span class='line-break'> </span>United States 5-20 Bonds, $39,300 ................................................. 40,527.58<span class='line-break'> </span>Cash in hands of Treasurer .......................................................... 3,839.58<span class='line-break'> </span>$90,478.41</p>
<p>Respectfully submitted,<span class='line-break'> </span>H.B. MACKINTOSH, <i>Treasurer.</i></p>
<p>Boston, January 21st, 1873.</p>
<p>This certifies that we have examined the books and accounts of the Treasurer of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn for the year Eighteen Hundred and Seventy<span class='line-break'></span>Two, and have found them correctly kept and properly balanced, with satisfactory vouchers<span class='line-break'> </span>for all payments.</p>
<p>The Certificates of Stock and other evidences of property were found in accordance with<span class='line-break'> </span>the statements of his accounts.</p>
<p>In the General Account, there appears to be a balance in the hands of the Treasurer, of<span class='line-break'> </span>$83.36; and in the Fund for Repairs, $3,839.58.</p>
<p>ALFRED T. TURNER,} <i>Committee on Finance.</i><span class='line-break'> </span>JAMES L. LITTLE, }</p>
<p>Boston, January 22nd, 1873.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135028">
<h3><a name="page-1135028">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 201)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>201</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feb&apos;y 12, 1873.'>Trustees. Feb'y 12, 1873.</span></p>
<p><u>February 12, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, February 12, 1873, at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J. T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow, and Turner.</p>
<p>Previous to the reading of the record of the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Board, and immediately upon calling the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting to order, it was announced by the chair that the<span class='line-break'> </span>business first in order would be the choice of officers for<span class='line-break'> </span>the Ensuing year, this being the first Trustees' Meeting after<span class='line-break'> </span>the Annual Meeting of the Proprietors. The Board accordingly<span class='line-break'> </span>proceeded to ballot therefor with the following result, - as<span class='line-break'> </span>announced by M<sup>r</sup> Turner, who was designated by the chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>a Committee to collect, sort and count the votes:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Election of President Secretary &amp; Treasurer'> Election of President Secretary &amp; Treasurer</span></p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for <u>President</u>, 9;<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for <u>John T. Bradlee</u>, and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared Elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for <u>Secretary</u>, 10;<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for Samuel Batchelder Jr., and he<span class='line-break'> </span>was accordingly declared Elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow, having been designated by the chair a<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to collect, count and sort the votes for Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>announced that the</p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for <u>Treasurer</u> was 10;<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh </u>, and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared Elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>Before proceeding to the Election of a Superin<span class='line-break'></span>-tendent, the chairman submitted and read a communication</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135029">
<h3><a name="page-1135029">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 202)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>202</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees, Feb&apos;y 12, 1873'> Trustees, Feb'y 12, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Superintendent, Communication from declining to be considered a Candidate for re-election. '> Superintendent, Communication from declining to be considered a Candidate for re-election. </span></p>
<p>from Col. Folsom, dated the 8<sup>th</sup> inst., addressed to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees, declining to be considered a can<span class='line-break'></span>-didate for re election for the coming term. On<span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the communication of the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>-tendent be placed on file</p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Perkins it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that a Committee of three be appointed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>chair to consider and report a suitable candidate or<span class='line-break'> </span>candidates for the office of Superintendent, with such<span class='line-break'> </span>other suggestions as they may deem desirable.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. appointed to select candidates for the office of Superintendent. '>Com. appointed to select candidates for the office of Superintendent. </span></p>
<p>The chair appointed Messrs. Perkins, Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>and Snow to constitute this Committee. M<sup>r</sup> Perkins<span class='line-break'> </span>having requested to be Excused from serving on the Com<span class='line-break'></span>-mittee M<sup>r</sup> Little was appointed in his stead. On<span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Salaries of Treasurer &amp; Secretary fixed for 1873.'> Salaries of Treasurer &amp; Secretary fixed for 1873.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the President be added to this Committee.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner is was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the salary of the Treasurer be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>Two thousand dollars ($2000.-) for the year Ensuing.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the salary of the Secretary be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>Fifteen hundred dollars ($1500.-) for the year Ensuing.</p>
<p>At the stage in the proceedings of the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>the record of the last meeting of the Board having been<span class='line-break'> </span>read by the Secretary by the direction of the President, and<span class='line-break'> </span>no objection having been made thereto said record was<span class='line-break'> </span>declared approved<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135030">
<h3><a name="page-1135030">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 203)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>203</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Feb&apos;y 12, 1873. '> Trustees. Feb'y 12, 1873. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Chant Lot. Report from President respecting purchase of. '> Chant Lot. Report from President respecting purchase of. </span></p>
<p>The President having submitted and read to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board a communication in reference to the purchase of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Chant lot, pursuant to instructions contained in the vote<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted at the last meeting of the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Report of the President be ^accepted and^ spread upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the record.</p>
<p>The Report is as follows:</p>
<p>To the Trustees of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn:</p>
<p>Gentlemen:</p>
<p>In accordance with a vote of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board passed January 28, 1873, I have completed the<span class='line-break'> </span>purchase from John Corcoran of the "Chant Lot," containing<span class='line-break'> </span>about 2 1/2 acres, at Eleven hundred ($1100.-) dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>per acre.</p>
<p>Said land was conveyed to the corporation by warranty<span class='line-break'> </span>deed, dated February 4, 1873, and the sum of Five hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>($500.-) dollars was on the same day, paid on account; and<span class='line-break'> </span>an agreement Executed containing the collowing provisions:-</p>
<p><u>First</u>. That in and after this date, (February 4, 1873), said<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors are entitled to possession of the said premises<span class='line-break'> </span>with the Exception of the buildings now standing thereon,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the land covered thereby.</p>
<p><u>Second</u>. That said buildings are to be removed from said<span class='line-break'> </span>land without Expense to said proprietors on or before the 15<span class='line-break'> </span>day of April next.</p>
<p><u>Third</u>. That whenever said removal shall have been completed<span class='line-break'> </span>in a manner satisfactory to said proprietors, and complete</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135031">
<h3><a name="page-1135031">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 204)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>204</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Feb&apos;y 12, 1873'> Trustees. Feb'y 12, 1873</span></p>
<p>possession of said premises obtained by them, the balance<span class='line-break'> </span>of said consideration shall be due and payable to said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corcoran.</p>
<p>Respectfully submitted,<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) John T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>President.</p>
<p>Boston, February 12, 1873.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Standing Committees for 1873 appointed. [Same as in 1872.] '> Standing Committees for 1873 appointed. [Same as in 1872.] </span></p>
<p>In pursuance of the provisions of the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>the President proceeded to the appointment of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Standing Committees for the Ensuing year, and designated<span class='line-break'> </span>the same individuals to serve upon the several standing<span class='line-break'> </span>Committees as were appointed last year, there having<span class='line-break'> </span>been no change in the membership of the Board.<span class='line-break'> </span>[See page 207.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Birds. Spec. Committee on. '> Birds. Spec. Committee on. </span></p>
<p>The President also appointed as a<span class='line-break'> </span>Special Committee on Birds, - Messrs. Brewer^2^ and Choate^1^.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President.'> Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of teh By-Laws, and the schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found<span class='line-break'> </span>correct</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Cambridge Tax bill approved.'> Cambridge Tax bill approved.</span></p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the ^bill for^ taxes assessed upon the property of this<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation for the year 1872 by the city of Cambridge be<span class='line-break'> </span>approved and paid</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135032">
<h3><a name="page-1135032">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 205)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>205</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Feb&apos;y 12, 1873.'> Trustees. Feb'y 12, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Watriss Lot. Claim for tax of, Com. app. to investigate '> Watriss Lot. Claim for tax of, Com. app. to investigate </span></p>
<p>A statement having been made by the President<span class='line-break'> </span>respecting a renewal by the Town of Watertown of its de<span class='line-break'></span>-mand for payment of taxes assess on the Watriss Lot; -</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the President and M<sup>r</sup> Coate be appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>a Committee with full powers to investigate and maintain<span class='line-break'> </span>the rights of the Corporation with regard to the claims<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Town of Watertown^as^ a foresaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Unfinished business of last year Re-referred to the several Comtees'> Unfinished business of last year Re-referred to the several Com<sup>tees</sup></span></p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that such portions of the business referred<span class='line-break'> </span>during the past year to Committees of this Board as may<span class='line-break'> </span>not to this date have been fully considered and determined<span class='line-break'> </span>on by them be hereby referred anew to the several Committees<span class='line-break'> </span>having cognizance thereof.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Mass. Hort. Soc. Relations of this Corpn to. Com. app. to consider, &amp;c. '> Mass. Hort. Soc. Relations of this Corp<sup>n</sup> to. Com. app. to consider, &amp;c. </span></p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that a Committee consisting of the President <span class='line-break'> </span>and two other members of the Board be appointed to con<span class='line-break'></span>-sider and report what measures, if any, should be taken<span class='line-break'> </span>to re-adjust or terminate the relations of this corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Massachusettes Horticultural Society</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly Statement of sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. '> Monthly Statement of sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. </span></p>
<p>^The President appointed Messrs. Snow and Choate as members of said Committee.^<span class='line-break'> </span>A statement of the sales of Lots Effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent from January 8 1873 to date, so far as<span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Committee on Lots, having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 409 on Indian Ridge Path<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135033">
<h3><a name="page-1135033">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 206)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>206</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees, Feb&apos;y 12, 1873.'> Trustees, Feb'y 12, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Contracts for perpet. Rep with G. of Lots 409 1872 &amp; 3467. '> Contracts for perpet. Rep with G. of Lots 409 1872 &amp; 3467. </span></p>
<p>late of Sarah E. [Cazenove?], deceased, for Six hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars; of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1872 on Spruce Avenue, belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to Dexter Roly for Five hundred and twenty-five<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars; and of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 3467 on Myrtle Path, be<span class='line-break'></span>longing to Hacket Derby, M.D. for Four hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>and fifty dollars; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the contracts aforesaid be severally<span class='line-break'> </span>concurred in by this Board</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for lots as follows, viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1663'>1663</span></p>
<p>Arthur N. Whiting of Watertown, Son of Nath<sup>l</sup> Whiting,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Sixteen hundred &amp; sixty-three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 3102'> 3102</span></p>
<p>Charles Darrow of Boston, Son of Charles S. Darrow,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-one hundred and two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Accounts &amp;c at the Cemetery. Com. to cons. what changes in mode of keeping may be desirable, &amp;c. '> Accounts &amp;c at the Cemetery. Com. to cons. what changes in mode of keeping may be desirable, &amp;c. </span></p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the President of this Board and the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance be instructed to consider and<span class='line-break'> </span>report what changes, if any, are desirable in the<span class='line-break'> </span>method and system of books and accounts at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery; and also what clerical force is necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>in said department.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that when this meeting adjourns it adjourn<span class='line-break'> </span>to meet at this place on Wednesday, the 26 inst., at Four P.M.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135034">
<h3><a name="page-1135034">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 207)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>207</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Oath of Secretary. Feb&apos;y 12, 1873.'> Oath of Secretary. Feb'y 12, 1873.</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk SS., February 12<sup>th</sup>, 1873.</p>
<p>Personally appeared Samuel Batchelder Jr., and made<span class='line-break'> </span>oath that he would faithfully perform the duties appertaining<span class='line-break'> </span>to the office of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me,<span class='line-break'> </span>John T. Bradlee Justice of the Peace.</p>
<p><u>Standing Committees.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>1873=1874</p>
<p>{The President, Ex officio, &amp; Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>{Bigelow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds. {Livermore,<span class='line-break'> </span>{Lawrence &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>{Pickering.</p>
<p>Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>{Snow,<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots. {Perkins &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>{N.J. Bradlee.</p>
<p>Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Interments {Brewer, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>{Choate.</p>
<p>Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance. {Turner, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>{Little.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135035">
<h3><a name="page-1135035">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 208)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>208</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Feb&apos;y. 26, 1873. '> Trustees. Feb'y. 26, 1873. </span></p>
<p><u>February 26, 1873.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday, February 26, 1873, at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. N.J. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President, the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>was called to order by the Secretary, and M<sup>r</sup> Snow was<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Candidate for Superintendent. Report of Com. app.d to nominate; accepted. '> Candidate for Superintendent. Report of Com. app.<sup>d</sup> to nominate; accepted. </span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p>A written report was received from the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the last meeting of the Board to consider and<span class='line-break'> </span>report a suitable candidate or candidates for the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of Superintendent, stating that they had "attended to the<span class='line-break'> </span>duty assigned them, and unanimously report the name<span class='line-break'> </span>of M<sup>r</sup> James W. Lovering of Cambridge as such candidate."</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Ballot for. Time of commencing his duties '> Ballot for. Time of commencing his duties </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board proceed to ballot for a<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, with the understanding that the person<span class='line-break'> </span>Elected to that office shall Enter upon the discharge of<span class='line-break'> </span>its duties at such time as may be fixed upon by the nomi<span class='line-break'></span>-nating Committee in consultation with him, and with<span class='line-break'> </span>the present incumbent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Report of Committee on the ballot for. '> Report of Committee on the ballot for. </span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee having been designated by the chair<span class='line-break'> </span>as a Committee to collect, count and sort the ballots<span class='line-break'> </span>for Superintendent, reported that the whole number of<span class='line-break'> </span>ballots cast was Eight. -</p>
<p>all of which were for</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135036">
<h3><a name="page-1135036">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 209)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>209</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. Feb&apos;y. 26, 1873. '> Trustees. Feb'y. 26, 1873. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Jas. W. Lovering Elected. '> Jas. W. Lovering Elected. </span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> James W. Lovering: <span class='line-break'></span>and he was accordingly declared duly Elected to the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of Superintendent, as aforesaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Salary, &amp;c, fixed. '> Salary, &amp;c, fixed. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the salary of the Superintendent be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>at $2500.- for the Ensuing year, and that he shall have<span class='line-break'> </span>the sue of a house with the grounds thereto belonging,<span class='line-break'> </span>the use of a horse and vehicle, and the services of one<span class='line-break'> </span>man, at the Expense of the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' W.W. Blackmar. Com. from asking leave to remove certain remains from lot 2017. '> W.W. Blackmar. Com. from asking leave to remove certain remains from lot 2017. </span></p>
<p>A communication having been received from Dr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer in behalf of the Committee on Interments, asking the<span class='line-break'> </span>instructions of the Board in regard to an application made<span class='line-break'> </span>by W.W. Blackmar, February 20, for leave to remove from<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot N<sup>o</sup> 2017 owned by Amos H. Powers the remains of Sarah<span class='line-break'> </span>L. and May Susan Blackmar, which were interred in<span class='line-break'> </span>said Lot May 27, 1856, the present address of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Powers being unknown, and the said Blackmar agreeing to<span class='line-break'> </span>be "responsible for any damage or complaint which may<span class='line-break'> </span>result from the removal": it was, after discussion,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Referred to Com. on Interments to cons. &amp; report. '> Referred to Com. on Interments to cons. &amp; report. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the subject be referred to the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Com. on Birds. C.T. Choat Excused from service on Com. to consist of Dr. T.M. Brewer. '> Com. on Birds. C.T. Choat Excused from service on Com. to consist of Dr. T.M. Brewer. </span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate having asked to be Excused from<span class='line-break'> </span>serving upon the Special Committee on Birds, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the request of M<sup>r</sup> Choate be acceded to,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the aforesaid Special Committee on Birds con<span class='line-break'></span>-sist of Dr. Thomas M. Brewer.</p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 139 on Willow Avenue, East branch, belonging</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Contracts for perp. Rep. with G. of Lots 139 &amp; 170 '> Contracts for perp. Rep. with G. of Lots 139 &amp; 170 </span></p>
<p>to heirs of Israel Whitney, deceased, for Five hundred dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>in addition to One hundred and fifty dollars paid for<span class='line-break'> </span>immediate repairs; and of Lot 170 on Laurel Avenue,<span class='line-break'> </span>(including the "Ornamental Ground" appurtenant thereto.)<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to Samuel P. [Langruaid?], for the sum of Five<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the contracts aforesaid be severally con<span class='line-break'></span>-curred in by this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest re<span class='line-break'></span>-presentatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz:-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='122'>122</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Edward Appleton of Reading, Son of Thomas Appleton<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One hundred &amp; twenty-two</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 995'> 995</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henry A. Willard of Cambridge, Son of Lyman Willard<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Nine hundred and ninety-five.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1400'>1400</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Henry C. Davis of Boston, Gd<sup>n</sup> of minor children of Geo. W. Collamore<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fourteen hundred</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2847'>2847</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Marietta R. Stevens of New York, Widow of Paran Stevens<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-Eight hundred &amp; forty-seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3055'>3055</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Harriet A. Damon of Somerville, Widow of Sand F. Damon,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Three thousand and fifty five.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<div id="page-1135038">
<h3><a name="page-1135038">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 211)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>211</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees March 12, 1873. '> Trustees March 12, 1873. </span></p>
<p><u>March 12, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday March 12, 1873, at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Perkins, Pickering and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' W.W. Blackmar Report of Com. on Interments [expecting?] appn of to remove certain remains from Lot 2017'> W.W. Blackmar Report of Com. on Interments [expecting?] app<sup>n</sup> of to remove certain remains from Lot 2017</span></p>
<p>A written Report was received from the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments to whom was referred the application of W.W.<span class='line-break'> </span>Blackmar for authority to remove the bodies of two persons<span class='line-break'> </span>buried in the Lot of Amos H. Powers, without the written consent of the owner of the Lot; stating "that in their opinion<span class='line-break'> </span>the legal title of the Lot having vested in M<sup>r</sup> Powers, the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>have no legal right to grant authority to any person, without<span class='line-break'> </span>the owner's consent, to remove bodies therefrom."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Accepted.'> Accepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the Report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.'> Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>A file of Bills with accompanying schedule having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the By-Laws, and the schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that said bills be referred to the President for his<span class='line-break'> </span>approval and payment by the Treasurer if found correct</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted and placed on file.'> Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted and placed on file.</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots Effected by the Su<span class='line-break'></span>-perintendent from February 12 to march 12, 1873, so far as<span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Committee on Lots, having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that said statement be accepted and placed on<span class='line-break'> </span>file.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest, representatives</p>
</div>
</div>

<h3><a name="page-1135039">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 212)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>212</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. March 12, 1873.'> Trustees. March 12, 1873.</span></p>
<p>were designated for Lots as follows, viz:-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='33'>33</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Susanna L. Folsom of Cambridge, Widow of Charles Folsom<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='139'>139</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Israel G. Whitney of West Roxbury, Son of Israel Whitney<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One hundred &amp; thirty-nine.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that this meeting be dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. April 9, 1873.'> Trustees. April 9, 1873.</span></p>
<p><u>April 9, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, April 9, 1873, at Four P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner. Also,<span class='line-break'> </span>present after the adjournment, M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Accounts &amp;c. at the Cemetery mode of Keeping Report of Com. '> Accounts &amp;c. at the Cemetery mode of Keeping Report of Com. </span></p>
<p>A verbal Report was received from the chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Finance that in pursuance of the<span class='line-break'> </span>vote of the Board adopted February 12, 1873, the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>in company with the President, had visited the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of ascertaining "what changes, if any,<span class='line-break'> </span>are desirable in the method and system of books and<span class='line-break'> </span>accounts at the Cemetery, and also what clerical force<span class='line-break'> </span>is necessary in said department." That they believed the<span class='line-break'> </span>system in use, though good, to be susceptible of improvement,<span class='line-break'> </span>Especially in the matter of its application, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>they had made suggestions for the future conduct of <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135040">

<div class="page-content">
<p>213</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. April 9, 1873.'> Trustees. April 9, 1873.</span></p>
<p>business in this department which they considered likely to<span class='line-break'> </span>be carried out hereafter, to the advantage of the corporation.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Treasurer&apos;s Reports for quarter Ending March 31, 1873.'> Treasurer's Reports for quarter Ending March 31, 1873.</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Report of Receipts and Expenditures<span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter Ending March 31, 1873, also his Report of<span class='line-break'> </span>Amounts due and unpaid for the same quarter having been<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the Reports of the Treasurer be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance.</p>
<p>The following papers were submitted to the Board by<span class='line-break'> </span>the President</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Dr. Bigelow: Comee from'> Dr. Bigelow: Com<sup>ee</sup> from</span></p>
<p>(a) A communication from Dr. Bigelow dated March 22<sup>d</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1873, in reference to certain "constructions" belonging to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery "which may be likely hereafter to require repairs<span class='line-break'> </span>or alterations and which may sometimes be difficult to find."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Fire Extinguisher purchase of recommended '> Fire Extinguisher purchase of recommended </span></p>
<p>(b) A communication from the out going Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>dated April 8, 1873, ^with accompanying papers^ recommending the purchase of Fire<span class='line-break'> </span>Extinguishers for the protection of certain buildings named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Ground near Central &amp;c. Aves work on recd'> Ground near Central &amp;c. Ave<sup>s</sup> work on rec<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p>(c) A communication from the same, of Even date, in reference<span class='line-break'> </span>to certain work requiring attention on a piece of ground sit<span class='line-break'></span>-uated between Central, Garden, Yew and Fountain Avenues.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the aforesaid communications be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' John W. Colman proposal from [?] to sell Lot 1114 to corpn. '> John W. Colman proposal from [?] to sell Lot 1114 to corp<sup>n</sup>. </span></p>
<p>A verbal communication was made to the Board by<span class='line-break'> </span>the President in regard to a request received from M<sup>r</sup> John W.<span class='line-break'> </span>Colman, proprietor of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1114 on Central Avenue that the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation would purchase a portion of said Lot. [It appears<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Treasurer's Books that said Lot is indebted to the corp<sup>n</sup></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135041">

<div class="page-content">
<p>214</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. April 9, 1873.'> Trustees. April 9, 1873.</span></p>
<p>in the sum of $84.70]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Catalogue &amp; Map of 1867. Issue of new map recommended.'> Catalogue &amp; Map of 1867. Issue of new map recommended.</span></p>
<p>The President also submitted a written communication<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Superintendent dated April 8, 1873, covering<span class='line-break'> </span>statements of the cost of the Catalogue and Map of 1867,<span class='line-break'> </span>and recommending the preparation and issue of a <span class='line-break'> </span>revised and corrected Edition of the Map.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that the request of M<sup>r</sup> Colman and the<span class='line-break'> </span>aforesaid communication of the Superintendent be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Mt Auburn Guides: supply of in hands of gate-keeper.'> Mt Auburn Guides: supply of in hands of gate-keeper.</span></p>
<p>The President also submitted a written communication<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Superintendent, dated April 9, 1873, with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>papers, touching the maintenance of the supply of "Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Guides" in the hands of the gate-keeper fro sale to<span class='line-break'> </span>visitors.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President'> Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President</span></p>
<p>A file of Bills, with accompanying schedule, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the requirements of the By-Laws, and the schedule<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the President, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>,- that said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' W.W. Blackmar App of for leave to remove remains from Lot 2017 New facts ilicited'> W.W. Blackmar App of for leave to remove remains from Lot 2017 New facts ilicited</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate, in behalf of the Committee on Interments<span class='line-break'> </span>having laid before the Board certain facts which had been<span class='line-break'> </span>brought to the attention of the Committee with reference<span class='line-break'> </span>to M<sup>r</sup> Blackmar's application for leave to remove certain<span class='line-break'> </span>bodies from Lot N<sup>o</sup> 2017, subsequent to the Report of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on his application made at the last meeting<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>of the Board, - it was, on motion by M<sup>r</sup> Snow,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be re-committed to the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments, with full powers to take such action in the<span class='line-break'> </span>premises as they may deem Expedient; reporting their action<span class='line-break'> </span>to this Board with a statement of the facts on which it is based.</p>

<p>A statement of the sales of Lots Effected by the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>from March 12, 1873 to date, so far as approved by the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots having been submitted and read by the Secretary,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>

Bowman, for the sum of Five hundred dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contract be concurred in on<span class='line-break'> </span>the part of this Board.</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be instructed to forward</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>216</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. April 9, 1873'> Trustees. April 9, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y instructed to communicate to Mr Train the Prov. of the charter.'>Sec'y instructed to communicate to M<sup>r</sup> Train the Prov. of the charter.</span></p>
<p>to M<sup>r</sup> Train a copy of the provisions of the Act of 1835,<span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the subject of the representation of Lots,<span class='line-break'> </span>wherein it is provided, (Sect. 8), that "in making such<span class='line-break'> </span>designation the Trustees shall as far as they conveniently<span class='line-break'> </span>may, give the preference to males over females, and to<span class='line-break'> </span><u>proximity of blood</u> and priority of age, having due regard,<span class='line-break'> </span>however, to proximity of residence."</p>
<p>The following representative was designated: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 1370 '> 1370 </span></p>
<p>Henry Nichols of Boston, Son of Eleazer Nichols,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirteen hundred and seventy.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
