<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, May 14, 1873, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, ^Lawrence^, Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>

<p>Reports of Committees were made as follows, viz: -</p>
<p>The <u>Committee on Grounds</u> to whom was referred the<span class='line-break'> </span>communication of the late Superintendent in regard to<span class='line-break'> </span>the purchase of Fire-Extinguishers reported that having<span class='line-break'> </span>conferred with the Superintendent they were of opinion that<span class='line-break'> </span>no action is necessary upon the said communication.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Ground near Central &amp;c. Aves work on '> Ground near Central &amp;c. Ave<sup>s</sup> work on </span></p>
<p>The <u>same Committee</u> to whom was referred the communi<span class='line-break'></span>-cation of the late Superintendent in reference to certain<span class='line-break'> </span>work to be done on a parcel of ground situated between<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>Central, Garden, Yew and Fountain Avenues, reported that<span class='line-break'> </span>they had received from the present Superintendent an Estimate<span class='line-break'> </span>of the cost of the work specified as requiring attention, and<span class='line-break'> </span>had instructed him to cause the same to be done.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Percentage of saleable &amp; unsaleable land; reported no action needed '> Percentage of saleable &amp; unsaleable land; reported no action needed </span></p>
<p>The <u>same Committee</u> to whom was referred a commu<span class='line-break'></span>-nication from the late Superintendent respecting the<span class='line-break'> </span>percentage of saleable and unsaleable lands in the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>reported that no action is necessary at the present time and<span class='line-break'> </span>recommended that the communication be placed on file.</p>

Deblois for the placing of stone steps in the<span class='line-break'> </span>bank adjoining his Lot N<sup>o</sup> 3808, reported that no further<span class='line-break'> </span>action thereon was necessary, the petitioner having Expressed<span class='line-break'> </span>his satisfaction with the access, provided by the Committee, to<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots on [Colens?] Path from Rose Path, as appears from a<span class='line-break'> </span>letter of the late Superintendent, dated the 9 ult<sup>o</sup></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that ^the^ above reports of the <u>Committee on Grounds</u><span class='line-break'> </span>be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Bounty system ordered to be discontinued '> Bounty system ordered to be discontinued </span></p>
<p>The President submitted a communication from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent in relation to the custom of keeping back<span class='line-break'> </span>a portion of the pay of the men under the so called "Bounty<span class='line-break'> </span>system", and stated that the subject had received the<span class='line-break'> </span>consideration of the Committee on Grounds, and that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee acting under authority given by the Board,<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>September 18, 1872, have instructed the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>to discontinue the said system.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above action of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds be approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' John W. Colman&apos;s Petition to have Corpn buy Lot. &apos;No action needed&apos;'> John W. Colman's Petition to have Corp<sup>n</sup> buy Lot. 'No action needed'</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the <u>Committee on Lots</u>,<span class='line-break'></span>to whom was referred at the last meeting the request of<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> John W. Colman proprietor of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1114, Central Avenue,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the corporation would purchase a portion of said Lot,<span class='line-break'></span>stating that no further action was requisite, the Lot in<span class='line-break'> </span>question having been sold by M<sup>r</sup> Colman to M<sup>r</sup> Jos. S. [Bibrin?].</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' W.W. Blackmar Appn of for leave to remove remains from Lot 2017, Report of Com. on Interments '> W.W. Blackmar App<sup>n</sup> of for leave to remove remains from Lot 2017, Report of Com. on Interments </span></p>
<p>In response to the vote adopted at the last meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board, the <u>Committee on Interments</u> submitted a<span class='line-break'> </span>Report in writing, with papers accompanying the same,<span class='line-break'> </span>with reference to the application of M<sup>r</sup> Blackmar for leave<span class='line-break'> </span>to remove certain remains from Lot 2017 to Cedar Grove<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, stating their action in the case, and recommending<span class='line-break'> </span>that their Report "be Entered upon the records, and with<span class='line-break'> </span>the papers annexed be placed on file, with the order for<span class='line-break'> </span>removal, upon its return to the Secretary's office."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded '> Accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above Report be accepted and Entered<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the record, adn the papers stated placed on file.</p>
<p>[See record of this Report at page 224.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' &apos;Mt Auburn Guides&apos; Report of Com. on Finance concerning '> 'M<sup>t</sup> Auburn Guides' Report of Com. on Finance concerning </span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the <u>Committee on Finance</u><span class='line-break'> </span>to whom was referred at the last meeting the communication of<span class='line-break'> </span>the late Superintendent in reference to maintaining the<span class='line-break'> </span>supply of "Mount Auburn Guides" in the hands of the<span class='line-break'> </span>gate-keeper for sale to visitors, stating that in the belief<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135046">
<h3><a name="page-1135046">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 219)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>219</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. May 14, 1873.'> Trustees. May 14, 1873.</span></p>
<p>of the Committee the course heretofore pursued of allowing<span class='line-break'> </span>the gate-keeper to purchase and sell the "Guides" is a <span class='line-break'> </span>proper one, and that no action is necessary on the part<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board, Except to recommend to the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>to see that the gate-keeper keeps a supply of the "Guides"<span class='line-break'> </span>on hand for those who desire them."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr&apos;s statements for quarter Ending Mar. 3st &apos;73, Approved. '>Treas<sup>r's</sup> statements for quarter Ending Mar. 3<sup>st</sup> '73, Approved. </span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the <u>same Committee</u><span class='line-break'> </span>approving as correct the Statements of the Treasurer for<span class='line-break'> </span>the quarter Ending March 31<sup>st</sup>, 1873, referred to them at the<span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Circular prop. test validity of tax on Bank shares. No action needed. '> Circular prop. test validity of tax on Bank shares. No action needed. </span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the <u>same Committee</u><span class='line-break'> </span>stating that no action was necessary in reference to the<span class='line-break'> </span>circular proposing to test the validity of the tax assessed<span class='line-break'> </span>on certain bank stocks received by the Board and referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to this Committee.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above Reports be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.'> Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule having been<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance with <span class='line-break'> </span>the By-Laws, and the schedule having been read by the<span class='line-break'> </span>President, on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt.&apos;s salary for April 1873 to be paid.'>Supt.'s salary for April 1873 to be paid.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that there be allowed and paid to the retiring<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, whose official connection with the corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>as stated by the President, terminated on the 13 [ult?], his<span class='line-break'> </span>salary for the month of Paril, 1873, in full.</p>
<p>The President submitted to the Board the following</p>

</div>

Reservations'> Com<sup>ns</sup> from the retiring Sup<sup>t</sup> respecting 1. Gravel for Cemetery 2. Signs for Avenues^&amp; Paths} 3. Reservations</span></p>
<p>communications from the late Superintendent, viz:<span class='line-break'> </span>(a) Letter of April 14, 1873, accompanied by a Plan,<span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to a supply of gravel for use at the Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span>(b) Letter of April 15, 1873, accompanied by Plans,<span class='line-break'> </span>statements and memoranda, concerning the need of new<span class='line-break'> </span>signs on various Avenues and Paths.<span class='line-break'> </span>(c) A Letter of the 15<sup>t</sup> and one of the 16<sup>t</sup> of April 1873,<span class='line-break'> </span>calling attention to certain matters connected with the<span class='line-break'> </span>"reserved spaces" on Reservations at the Cemetery.</p>
<p>The foregoing communications having been read and<span class='line-break'> </span>considered, it was</p>

'> referred to Com. on Grounds. Com<sup>[?]</sup> from Supt. respecting Bridge at Auburn Lake &amp; Benches in the Chapel referred to Com. on Grounds. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the same be referred to the <u>Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds.</u></p>
<p>The following communication from the present<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent was also submitted by the President; viz:<span class='line-break'> </span>(d) Letter of May 10<sup>t</sup>, 1873, in reference to the need of a new<span class='line-break'> </span>bridge at Auburn Lake, and to the cost of new benches for<span class='line-break'> </span>(e) the Chapel</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above communication be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the <u>Committee on Grounds</u>, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Comns from the retiring Supt. respecting 1 Extension of Greenhouses 2 Request from J. Fox for Several Permit also Petn from Laura A. Adams;'> Com<sup>ns</sup> from the retiring Supt. respecting 1 Extension of Greenhouses 2 Request from J. Fox for Several Permit also Pet<sup>n</sup> from Laura A. Adams;</span></p>
<p>The President submitted a communication from<span class='line-break'> </span>the late Superintendent dated May 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873, relating to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Extension of the Greenhouses, the same being accompanied<span class='line-break'> </span>by sundry documents and Plans.</p>
<p>Also a letter addressed to the late Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>by Joseph Fox asking information as to the means of ob<span class='line-break'></span>taining a General Permit to do work in the Cemetery.</p>
<p>A statement of facts covering a claim to the</p>

<p>221</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. May 14t, 1873.'> Trustees. May 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' referred to Com. on Lots '> referred to Com. on Lots </span></p>
<p>ownership of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 124, Ivy Path, made by Laura A. Adams,<span class='line-break'> </span>in behalf of her husband Samuel Adams, and herself, by<span class='line-break'> </span>Charles P. Gorely, her Attorney, was also presented.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the foregoing communications be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the <u>Committee on Lots</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Com[?] from ret&apos;g Supt. resp.y rem. of remains from R.T. referred to Com. on Interments '> Com<sup>[?]</sup> from ret'g Supt. resp.y rem. of remains from R.T. referred to Com. on Interments </span></p>
<p>The President submitted a communication from the<span class='line-break'> </span>late Superintendent,^dated April 10, 1873^ calling attention to the necessity of<span class='line-break'> </span>taking measures for the removal from the Receiving Tomb<span class='line-break'> </span>of remains deposited for a longer time than allowed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Committee on Interments</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wm S. Frost com[?] from resp. Dec. Day privs referred to Prest with full powers.'>W<sup>m</sup> S. Frost com<sup>[?]</sup> from resp. Dec. Day priv<sup>s</sup> referred to Pres<sup>t</sup> with full powers.</span></p>
<p>Also a communication from William S. Frost, in<span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of Post 15, G.A.R., dated Mary 3<sup>d</sup>, 1873, asking for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Extension of the same facilities to the Post under his command<span class='line-break'> </span>for Decoration-day as has been usual in former years.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the communication be referred to <u>the President<span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers.</u></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Death of Supt.&apos;s Horse. Prest authorized to purchase new one.'> Death of Supt.'s Horse. Pres<sup>t</sup> authorized to purchase new one.</span></p>
<p>The President having stated that the horse allowed for<span class='line-break'> </span>the personal use of the Superintendent had died during the<span class='line-break'> </span>previous Autumn, on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that <u>the President</u> be authorized to purchase a <span class='line-break'> </span>horse for the Superintendent's use.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Comn from Collector of taxes for Town of Watertown referred to '> Com<sup>n</sup> from Collector of taxes for Town of Watertown referred to </span></p>
<p>The President having laid before the Trustees a letter<span class='line-break'> </span>addressed to them under date of May 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873, by Geo. L. Noyes,<span class='line-break'> </span>collector of taxes for the town of Watertown, demanding<span class='line-break'> </span>payment of that portion of the Tax of 1872 which was as<span class='line-break'></span>-sessed upon the Watriss Lot, it was</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Com. consisting of the Pres<sup>t</sup> &amp; M<sup>r</sup> Choate</u>, to whom the tax-bill of said town<span class='line-break'> </span>for 1872 was referred at the meeting of February 12<sup>t</sup> 1873.<span class='line-break'> </span>[See p. 205.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Comns from the ret&apos;g. Supt. resp.&apos;g 1. &apos;Discrepant&apos; Lots 2. Plan &amp;c., for dwelling on Stone Meadow 3. List of Tools in Supt&apos;s Barn ordered to be placed on file.'> Com<sup>ns</sup> from the ret'g. Supt. resp.'g 1. 'Discrepant' Lots 2. Plan &amp;c., for dwelling on Stone Meadow 3. List of Tools in Supt's Barn ordered to be placed on file.</span></p>
<p>The President having submitted the following com<span class='line-break'></span>-munications from the late Superintendent, viz:<span class='line-break'></span>(a)Letter of April 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873, in regard to "discrepant Lots,"<span class='line-break'> </span>or Lots the Enclosures of which do not agree with the<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds, accompanied with plans and other documents;<span class='line-break'> </span>(b) Letter of April 15<sup>t</sup>, Enclosing plan and Estimates for<span class='line-break'> </span>a dwelling-house on Stone Meadow, suitable for a foreman;<span class='line-break'> </span>or mechanics<span class='line-break'> </span>(c) List of Tools (dated April 16<sup>t</sup>) on Barn-loft of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent's Barn: it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the foregoing communications and the<span class='line-break'> </span>accompanying papers be placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Comns from Supt. respecting Re-location of Lots 1800, 1896, 2940, 2941, 2942 '> Com<sup>ns</sup> from Supt. respecting Re-location of Lots 1800, 1896, 2940, 2941, 2942 </span></p>
<p>The President submitted communications from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent dated May 1<sup>st</sup> 1873, in regard to a re<span class='line-break'></span>-location of Lots N<sup>os</sup> 1800 on Yarrow Path <del>and</del> 1896 on<span class='line-break'> </span>Spruce Avenue, and 2940, 2941 &amp; 2942 on Lawn Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>as requested by the several proprietors thereof; together<span class='line-break'> </span>with plans showing the Lots as at present laid out and<span class='line-break'> </span>the changes proposed. On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Snow it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Sec&apos;y authorized to accept deeds of re-conveyance of above Lots.'> Sec'y authorized to accept deeds of re-conveyance of above Lots.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized^under the direction of the Committee on Lots^ to accept from<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietors of the Lots aforesaid deeds of re-conveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation of said Lots, as preliminary to such new<span class='line-break'> </span>grants from the corporation as may be necessary or Expedient.</p>
<p>The Secretary submitted to the Board a letter dated April 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873,</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. May 14, 1873. '> Trustees. May 14, 1873. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Jonathan H. Cheney. Lot 829. representation of action respecting.'> Jonathan H. Cheney. Lot 829. representation of action respecting.</span></p>
<p>received from Hon. Chas. R. Train in response to the communi<span class='line-break'></span>-cation addressed to him by the Secretary in compliance with<span class='line-break'> </span>the vote adopted at the last meeting of the Board; [p. 215]<span class='line-break'> </span>After discussion it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be instructed to request M<sup>r</sup> J.<span class='line-break'> </span>Homer Cheney, if desirous of appointment as representative<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lot 829, lately owned by his deceased father, to present a<span class='line-break'> </span>petition therefor to the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. '> Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. </span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots from April 9<sup>t</sup>, 1873, to<span class='line-break'> </span>date, so far as approved by the Committee on Lots, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed on<span class='line-break'> </span>file.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest, representatives<span class='line-break'> </span>were designated for Lots as follows, viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 1436'> 1436</span></p>
<p>Alanson Bigelow of Boston, Son-in-law &amp; Ex<sup>or</sup> of Isaiah Bangs<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fourteen hundred &amp; thirty-six.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 1717'> 1717</span></p>
<p>Abigail H. Pratt, of Boston, Widow of George Pratt<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Seventeen hundred &amp; seventeen.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 2046'> 2046</span></p>
<p>Nathan L. Green, of Boston, Son of Samuel S. Green<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Two thousand and forty-six.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 2368'> 2368</span></p>
<p>Catherine A. Wheeler of Cambridge, Widow of Lewis Wheeler,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-three hundred &amp; sixty-Eight.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135051">
<h3><a name="page-1135051">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 224)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>224</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. May 14, 1873. '> Trustees. May 14, 1873. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2771'>2771</span></p>
<p>Lydia M. Runey of Somerville, Widow of John Runey<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-seven hundred &amp; seventy-one.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><u>Report of Committee on Interments.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>(referred to at p. 218)</p>
<p>The Committee on Interments, to whom was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>with power, the application of W.W. Blackmar for<span class='line-break'> </span>authority to remove the bodies of Mary S. Blackmar and<span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah Blackmar from Lot 2017, for re-interment in<span class='line-break'> </span>Cedar Grove Cemetery, respectfully</p>
<p><u>Report</u>,<span class='line-break'> </span>That Lot 2017 now stands in the name of one A.H. Powers,<span class='line-break'> </span>whose present residence is unknown to the Secretary, and<span class='line-break'> </span>after search has not been found.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Blackmar has, however, presented to the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>a deed of an undivided half of said Lot, dated June 18<sup>t</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1856, to Charles E. Evans, Executed by Charles Cook as attorney<span class='line-break'> </span>for Powers, with the Power of Attorney from Powers to Cook.<span class='line-break'> </span>It further appears from the records of interments that<span class='line-break'> </span>said Cook was recognized by the Corporation as the attorney<span class='line-break'> </span>of Powers, and signed the order for the original interments.<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Evans was also recognized as a joint proprietor of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot 2017, and as such holds a ticket of admission to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135052">
<h3><a name="page-1135052">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 225)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>225</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. May 14t, 1873.'> Trustees. May 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p>the Cemetery, and now presents to the Trustees a written request<span class='line-break'> </span>that this application may be granted.</p>
<p>Under these circumstances the Committee have deemed<span class='line-break'> </span>it proper to grant the application, receiving from M<sup>r</sup> Blackmar<span class='line-break'> </span>a certified copy of the Power of Attorney from Powers, and of<span class='line-break'> </span>the deed to Evans, and an Agreement to indemnify the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation from all claims for damages in the premises,<span class='line-break'> </span>which papers accompany this Report.</p>
<p>They have therefore issued to the Superintendent an<span class='line-break'> </span>order to permit the removal, adn recommend that this<span class='line-break'> </span>Report be Entered upon the records of the Trustees, and,<span class='line-break'> </span>with the papers annexed, be placed on file, with the order<span class='line-break'> </span>for removal upon its return to the Secretary's office.</p>
<p>Boston, May 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873.<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) Thomas M. Brewer<span class='line-break'> </span>(") Charles [J?]. Choate</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. June 11, 1873. '> Trustees. June 11, 1873. </span></p>
<p><u>June 11<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was duly notified<span class='line-break'> </span>for Wednesday, June 11<sup>t</sup>, 1873, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>At the time above named there being no quorum present <span class='line-break'> </span>no business was transacted.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135053">
<h3><a name="page-1135053">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 226)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>226</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. June 20, 1873 '> Trustees. June 20, 1873 </span></p>
<p><u>June 20, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A Special meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Friday, June 20, 1873, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs J.T. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Bridge at Auburn Lake. Iron Bridge to be Erected at a cost not Exceeing $300.-'> Bridge at Auburn Lake. Iron Bridge to be Erected at a cost not Exceeing $300.-</span></p>
<p>A Report was received from the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds to whom was referred at the last meeting the<span class='line-break'> </span>communication of the Superintendent respecting the<span class='line-break'> </span>condition of the Bridge at Auburn lake, stating that<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee had ascertained that a suitable bridge <span class='line-break'> </span>of iron could probably be constructed at the point<span class='line-break'> </span>named at a cost not Exceeding three hundred^and fifty^ dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>($350.-) and asking that the Committee be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to procure and Erect a bridge as aforesaid.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Report of the Committee be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and their request granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Map of Cemetery revised &amp; corrected; issue authorized at a cost not Exceeding $500.- '> Map of Cemetery revised &amp; corrected; issue authorized at a cost not Exceeding $500.- </span></p>

Adams,<span class='line-break'> </span>in behalf of herself and of her husband Samuel Adams,<span class='line-break'> </span>referred May 14, 1873, the Committee recommend that the<span class='line-break'> </span>petitioner have leave to withdraw.</p>

<p>(d.) With regard to the Petitions of Messrs. Patrick O'Brien,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Joseph Fox for the issue to them of a General Permit<span class='line-break'> </span>to do work on the Lots of proprietors, the Committee having<span class='line-break'> </span>carefully Examined the subject respectfully report that,<span class='line-break'> </span>in consequence of the relations now Existing between<span class='line-break'> </span>certain proprietors and the applicants, however they may<span class='line-break'> </span>have been Established, and with a view of avoiding any<span class='line-break'> </span>possible Embarassments to such proprietors, the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>recommend that General Permits for work be issued to<span class='line-break'> </span>the parties named upon furnishing a bond for not less<span class='line-break'> </span>than one thousand dollars, ($1000.-) Each in the usual man<span class='line-break'></span>-ner, for the completion of the labor upon such Lots as<span class='line-break'> </span>they may be now Engaged upon, with such restrictions<span class='line-break'> </span>as shall give them no other rights than are contemplated<span class='line-break'> </span>by the present By-Laws, and as shall not prevent the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation from imposing other conditions as they may<span class='line-break'> </span>think advisable hereafter.</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the papers relating to "Discrepant Lots" which<span class='line-break'> </span>were placed on file by vote of the Board at the last meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>be taken from the file and referred to the Committee on Lots.</p>

<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the By-Laws, and the schedule having been read by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary, it was</p>

Holman<span class='line-break'> </span>in S<sup>t</sup> John's Public Lot.</p>

<p>(d) A communication from M<sup>r</sup> Austin J. Coolidge<span class='line-break'> </span>dated June 20, 1873, respecting the removal from certain<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots of a notification stating that the Lots were "for sale."</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to a <span class='line-break'> </span>special committee consisting of the Committee on Lots &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Choate.</p>

<p><u>July 9<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, July 9, 1873, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering and Snow.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' A.J. Coolidge&apos;s Communication Report of Spec. Com. thereon '> A.J. Coolidge's Communication Report of Spec. Com. thereon </span></p>
<p>A written Report was received from the Special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee consisting of the Committee on Lots and M<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Choate to whom was referred at the last meeting the<span class='line-break'> </span>communication of M<sup>r</sup> A.J. Coolidge respecting the removal<span class='line-break'> </span>from certain Lots of signs stating that said Lots were "for<span class='line-break'> </span>sale." Appended to the Report were certain votes the<span class='line-break'> </span>passage of which was recommended by the Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Accepted. Action on re-commended votes deferred. '> Accepted. Action on re-commended votes deferred. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Report be accepted and the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>discharged.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the consideration of the votes recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee be deferred to the next meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' &apos;Discrepant Lots&apos; Report of Com. on Lots '> 'Discrepant Lots' Report of Com. on Lots </span></p>
<p>A written Report was received form the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots upon the subject of "discrepant Lots," referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>them at the last meeting, stating "that the circumstances<span class='line-break'> </span>of different cases are so Entirely unlike that so special<span class='line-break'> </span>action, applicable to them all can safely be taken," and<span class='line-break'> </span>recommending "that the communication be placed on<span class='line-break'> </span>file for such use hereafter as may be found desirable or<span class='line-break'> </span>convenient."</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Report be accepted.</p>
<p>A file of bills, with accompanying schedule, having</p>

<div class="page-content">
<p>235</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. August 13, 1873. '> Trustees. August 13, 1873. </span></p>
<p>Finance approving as correct the Statements of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter Ending June 30, 1873, referred to them at<span class='line-break'> </span>the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly statement of Bills referred to President; - Excepting '> Monthly statement of Bills referred to President; - Excepting </span></p>
<p>A file of Bills with accompanying schedule having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by ^the Treasurer, through^ the President, and the same<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the said bills, with the Exception of the bill<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Town of Watertown for taxes for 1873, be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the President for his approval and payment by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Watertown taxes for 1873 referred to Spec. Com. '> Watertown taxes for 1873 referred to Spec. Com. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid tax-bill of the Town of <span class='line-break'> </span>Watertown be referred to the special Committee consisting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the President and M<sup>r</sup> Choate to whom the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of Watertown taxes was referred at the meeting of May 14.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' A.J. Coolidge&apos;s communication '> A.J. Coolidge's communication </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Consideration of Votes recommended by Spec. Com. '> Consideration of Votes recommended by Spec. Com. </span></p>
<p>The Board being about to proceed to the consideration <span class='line-break'> </span>of the votes recommended at the last meeting by the Special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on M<sup>r</sup> Coolidge's communication, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman of that Committee requested, for reasons stated,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the consideration of the same might be postponed, <span class='line-break'></span>and it was accordingly</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the consideration of the votes recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on M<sup>r</sup> Coolidge's communication<span class='line-break'> </span>be deferred to the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='*J.H. Cheney Lot 829 action on repn of deferred. '>*J.H. Cheney Lot 829 action on rep<sup>n</sup> of deferred. </span></p>
<p>The subject of the representation of Lot 829, belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to the heirs of Jonathan H. Cheney, deceased having been<span class='line-break'> </span>taken from the table and considered, on motion of M<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the further consideration of the subject be</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135063">
<h3><a name="page-1135063">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 236)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>236</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees August 13, 1873.'> Trustees August 13, 1873.</span></p>
<p>deferred to the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' A. McDonald application of for General Permit.'> A. M<sup>c</sup>Donald application of for General Permit.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary presented a request from M<sup>r</sup> A.<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>c</sup>Donald for a general Permit to do stone work in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that M<sup>r</sup> M<sup>c</sup>Donald's communication be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. '> Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file. </span></p>
<p>A Statement of the Sales of Lots Effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent from July 9 to August 13, 1873, so far<span class='line-break'> </span>as approved by the Committee on Lots, having been<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted &amp; placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot No 189'> Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 189</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots have recommended the Trustees to guaranty the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 189, Woodbine Path for<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of Eight hundred dollars, ($800.-), it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contract be concurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest re<span class='line-break'></span>-presentatives were designated for Lots as follows: viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 805 '> 805 </span></p>
<p>David P. Kimball of Boston, Son of David Kimball,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eight hundred and five.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2043'>2043</span></p>
<p>William B.D. Simmons of Boston, Son of Benjamin Simmons,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Two thousand and forty-three</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135064">
<h3><a name="page-1135064">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 237)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>237</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. September 10, 1873'> Trustees. September 10, 1873</span></p>
<p><u>September 10<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was duly<span class='line-break'> </span>notified for Wednesday, September 10, 1873, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>At the hour above named Messrs.^N.J.^ Bradlee, Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Perkins, Snow and Turner were present, but for<span class='line-break'> </span>lack of a quorum the meeting was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Adjourned, sine die.</u></p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. September 23d, 1873'> Trustees. September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873</span></p>
<p><u>September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A special meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Tuesday, September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner</p>
<p>The record of the last two meetings was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Geo. Gardner Comn from alleging neglect of p.c. Lots;'> Geo. Gardner Com<sup>n</sup> from alleging neglect of p.c. Lots;</span></p>
<p>The President submitted and read a communication<span class='line-break'> </span>addressed to the Trustees under date of the 21<sup>st</sup> inst by M<sup>r</sup> George<span class='line-break'> </span>Gardner alleging a lack of proper attention to certain Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>under the perpetual care of the Corporation. And it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred to Com. on Lots.'>referred to Com. on Lots.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that M<sup>r</sup> Gardner's communication be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' A.J. Breed req. permission to keep carriage at cemetery: referred to Com. on Grounds. '> A.J. Breed req. permission to keep carriage at cemetery: referred to Com. on Grounds. </span></p>
<p>The President also read a communication from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent dated August 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873, stating that M<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>A.J. Breed had requested permission to keep a horse and <span class='line-break'> </span>carriage at the Cemetery for the accommodation of visitors</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the communication of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135065">
<h3><a name="page-1135065">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 238)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>238</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. September 23d, 1873'> Trustees. September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth2' depth='2' title=' Design upon Mt Auburn bill-head used by Patrick O&apos;Brien on bills issued for services rend by him.='> Design upon M<sup>t</sup> Auburn bill-head used by Patrick O'Brien on bills issued for services ren<sup>d</sup> by him.=</span></p>
<p>It having been made to appear by a communication<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Superintendent, dated Enclosing<span class='line-break'> </span>copies of the bill-head used by the corporation in rendering [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>against proprietors, and of the bill-head used by M<sup>r</sup> Patrick<span class='line-break'> </span>O'Brien in making out bills for work done by him, that the<span class='line-break'> </span>wood-cut of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn gateway used on the corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>bill-head appeared also on the bill-head of M<sup>r</sup> O'Brien, the<span class='line-break'> </span>result being the creation of an impression that M<sup>r</sup> O'Brien<span class='line-break'> </span>was an agent of the corporation, or in some way connected<span class='line-break'> </span>therewith; after discussion, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Referred to Spec. Com. cons. of Prest &amp; Mr Choate.'> Referred to Spec. Com. cons. of Pres<sup>t</sup> &amp; M<sup>r</sup> Choate.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be referred to a special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee consisting of the President and M<sup>r</sup> Choate.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Chas. W. Freeland Removal of Trees in front of his Lots authorized by Prest'> Chas. W. Freeland Removal of Trees in front of his Lots authorized by Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>The President submitted and read a communication<span class='line-break'> </span>dated the 9<sup>t</sup> inst., from M<sup>r</sup> Charles W. Freeland addressed<span class='line-break'> </span>to the President and Trustees requesting permission to remove<span class='line-break'> </span>two trees standing in front of the catacomb tomb Erected<span class='line-break'> </span>on his Lots N<sup>os</sup> 699 and 700, for reasons specified. The<span class='line-break'> </span>President stated that he had intended to have laid the<span class='line-break'> </span>communication before the Trustees at the last meeting,<span class='line-break'> </span>but no quorum having been present at that time, and<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Freeland having subsequently been sent by him at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, he had on his own responsibility granted<span class='line-break'> </span>permission for the removal of the trees, which removal had<span class='line-break'> </span>been made. The President having requested that his<span class='line-break'> </span>action in the premises might be ratified by the Board, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Above action of Prest ratified by Trustees'> Above action of Pres<sup>t</sup> ratified by Trustees</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the action of the President in granting<span class='line-break'> </span>permission for the removal of trees standing in front of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Lots of M<sup>r</sup> Freeland is hereby ratified and approved.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135066">
<h3><a name="page-1135066">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 239)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>239</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. September 23d, 1873.'> Trustees. September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' A. McDonald; Issue of Gen. Permit [?] recommended.'> A. M<sup>c</sup>Donald; Issue of Gen. Permit [?] recommended.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the chairman of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots to whom, at the August meeting, was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred the request of M<sup>r</sup> Alex M<sup>c</sup>Donald for a General<span class='line-break'> </span>Permit to do^stone^ work on private Lots, recommending that such<span class='line-break'> </span>Permit be issued whenever the applicant shall furnish the<span class='line-break'> </span>usual bond for $1000.- with two [sureties?] satisfactory to the<span class='line-break'> </span>President.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Sales of Lots without reservation of intermediate space inadver-tently approved by Com. on Lots;'> Sales of Lots without reservation of intermediate space inadver-tently approved by Com. on Lots;</span></p>
<p>A statement was also made by the same gentleman<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Effect that through inadvertence^the Committee had in several instances^ approved sales of<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots made without the reservation of a space of three<span class='line-break'> </span>feet between the fence limits thereof as required by the<span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws Art. X, <del>[having done so in the case of the sale<span class='line-break'> </span>of certain Lots stated upon the report of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>dated September 1873, the deeds of which had not yet<span class='line-break'> </span>been prepared.]</del> On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Choate it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' All such sales ratified and confirmed by Bd of Trustees.'> All such sales ratified and confirmed by B<sup>d</sup> of Trustees.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that all conveyances of Lots which, in pursuance<span class='line-break'> </span>of the approval of the Committee on Lots have heretofore been<span class='line-break'> </span>made by the corporation without the reservation of such<span class='line-break'> </span>space between the fence limits thereof as the By-Laws in<span class='line-break'> </span>force at the time of such conveyance may have prescribed,<span class='line-break'> </span>be, and the same are hereby ratified and confirmed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Sec&apos;y. authorized to pass deeds of Lots contracted to be sold without intervening space.'> Sec'y. authorized to pass deeds of Lots contracted to be sold without intervening space.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized to prepare and<span class='line-break'> </span>deliver deeds of Lots contracted to be sold without intervening<span class='line-break'> </span>space, as set forth in the Superintendent's Report of the<span class='line-break'> </span>18<sup>t</sup> inst., upon approval by the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots also<span class='line-break'> </span>stated that the Committee had continued to give</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135067">
<h3><a name="page-1135067">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 240)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>240</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. September 23d, 1873'> Trustees. September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Greenhouse Extension Plan for not yet matured by Com. on Lots. Notice of intention to ask for appn^Exceeding^ $1000 for at next meeting.'> Greenhouse Extension Plan for not yet matured by Com. on Lots. Notice of intention to ask for app<sup>n</sup>^Exceeding^ $1000 for at next meeting.</span></p>
<p>careful attention to the subject of the Extension of the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation greenhouses, referred to them on the 14 of<span class='line-break'> </span>May last, and though still unprepared to advise the<span class='line-break'> </span>adoption of definite measures in this connection, were<span class='line-break'> </span>yet desirous of giving notice of their intention to ask at<span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting of the Board for an "appropriation<span class='line-break'> </span>Exceeding the sum of one thousand dollars," to be used<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of such Extension whenever plans therefor<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have been decided upon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Rubbish left by parties doing work on Lots Proposal to amend Art. XII of By-Laws to meet Expense occasioned thus to corpn'> Rubbish left by parties doing work on Lots Proposal to amend Art. XII of By-Laws to meet Expense occasioned thus to corp<sup>n</sup></span></p>
<p>The chairman of the same Committee further<span class='line-break'> </span>stated that the Committee having had under consideration<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of the Expense to which the corporation is<span class='line-break'> </span>subjected for the removal of rubbish left by persons<span class='line-break'> </span>unconnected with the corporation in performing work on<span class='line-break'> </span>private Lots, were desirous of submitting at this time,<span class='line-break'> </span>for action at the next meeting of the Board, the<span class='line-break'> </span>following amendment of the By-Laws, viz: in<span class='line-break'> </span>Article XII, "Care and condition of Lots," tenth line<span class='line-break'> </span>from the top, insert after the word "Secretary," the<span class='line-break'> </span>words following, viz:-</p>
<p>- "nor until having paid a sum to be fixed<span class='line-break'> </span>"annually by the Committee on Lots for work incident<span class='line-break'> </span>"thereto necessarily performed by the corporation."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly statement of Bills referred to Prest'> Monthly statement of Bills referred to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the Treasurer and the<span class='line-break'> </span>same having been read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135068">
<h3><a name="page-1135068">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 241)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>241</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees September 23d, 1873'> Trustees September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' A.J. Coolidge, Comn from; Cons. of votes rec. in rep. of Spec. Com. on resumed.'> A.J. Coolidge, Com<sup>n</sup> from; Cons. of votes rec. in rep. of Spec. Com. on resumed.</span></p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - to resume the consideration of the votes recom<span class='line-break'></span>-mended for adoption on the 9<sup>t</sup> of July ult<sup>o</sup> by the special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to whom was referred the communication of<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> A.J. Coolige respecting the removal from certain Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>of signs stating that said Lots were for sale.</p>
<p>The report of the special committee having been<span class='line-break'> </span>taken from the table the votes thereto annexed were submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows, viz: -</p>
<p>"<u>Voted</u>, - that in the opinion of a majority of the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Trustees signs placed upon Lots in the Cemetery for the<span class='line-break'> </span>"purpose of indicating that such Lots are for sale, are<span class='line-break'> </span>"offensive and improper, and that the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>"is hereby directed to remove all such signs.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Votes.'>Votes.</span></p>
<p>"<u>Voted</u>, - that the act of the Superintendent in<span class='line-break'> </span>"removing signs 'For Sale' is approved, and assumed as<span class='line-break'> </span>"the act of the corporation."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Erection of &apos;sale&apos; signs on Lots forbidden in other Cemeteries'> Erection of 'sale' signs on Lots forbidden in other Cemeteries</span></p>
<p>The President communicated to the Board letters<span class='line-break'> </span>received by him from the [Comptroller?] of Greenwood Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>New York and from the actuary of the West Laurel Hill<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, Philadelphia, and also stated the results of<span class='line-break'> </span>Enquiries personally made by him of the officers of<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery corporations in this vicinity; the general<span class='line-break'> </span>purport of them all being adverse to the allowance of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Erection of signs upon Lots indicating that such Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>are for sale. After discussion it was moved by<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Lawrence that the votes be adopted. M<sup>r</sup> Turner<span class='line-break'> </span>having moved as an amendment to M<sup>r</sup> Lawrence's<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135069">
<h3><a name="page-1135069">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 242)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>242</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees September 23d, 1873'> Trustees September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873</span></p>
<p>motion that the question upon the passage of the votes be<span class='line-break'> </span>taken by ayes and noes, and the Board having so ordered,<span class='line-break'> </span>the result was announced as follows; viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' In. taken by ayes &amp; noes and decided in the affirmative.'> In. taken by ayes &amp; noes and decided in the affirmative.</span></p>
<p>Ayes; - Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Lawrence, Perkins<span class='line-break'> </span>Pickering, Snow and Turner</p>
<p>No; M<sup>r</sup> Choate.</p>
<p>And the votes were accordingly declared adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Expediency of laying out the Stone Farm upon &apos;the lawn system&apos; referred to the Com. on Grounds.'> Expediency of laying out the Stone Farm upon 'the lawn system' referred to the Com. on Grounds.</span></p>
<p>A general discussion having been had respecting<span class='line-break'> </span>the Expediency of laying out the Stone Farm territory<span class='line-break'> </span>upon what is termed "the lawn system," and prohibiting<span class='line-break'> </span>sale in that district, it was, on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject of the laying out of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Stone Farm upon "the lawn system" be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Remains of persons remd to Cem. from Trinity Ch. Compn for int. of Com. on Interments to have full power resp&apos;g.'> Remains of persons rem<sup>d</sup> to Cem. from Trinity Ch. Comp<sup>n</sup> for int. of Com. on Interments to have full power resp'g.</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Interments<span class='line-break'> </span>having represented that some uncertainty Existed in the<span class='line-break'> </span>minds of the Committee as to their authority in regard to <span class='line-break'> </span>the adjustment of the claim of the corporation against<span class='line-break'> </span>Trinity Church for the interment of the remains of<span class='line-break'> </span>persons removed thence to Mount Auburn, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that full powers be vested in the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments in regard to removals from Trinity Church.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot No 722.'> Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 722.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on Lots had<span class='line-break'> </span>recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>722, Mimosa Path, for the sum of Five hundred dollars, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contract be concurred in on<span class='line-break'> </span>the part of this Board</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135070">
<h3><a name="page-1135070">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 243)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>243</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. September 23d, 1873.'> Trustees. September 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file.'> Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file.</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots Effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent from August 13 to September 10, 1873, so far<span class='line-break'> </span>as approved by the Committee on Lots, having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest, re<span class='line-break'></span>-presentatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 38'> 38</span></p>
<p>Franklin N. Thatcher of Boston, son of Peter Thatcher,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-Eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='452'>452</span> David H. Hayden, M.D., of Boston, son of Susan A.B. Hayden,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four hundred &amp; fifty-two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='829'>829</span></p>
<p>Eunice H. Thatcher of Boston, daughter of Jonathan H. Cheney,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eight hundred &amp; twenty-nine.<span class='line-break'> </span>[see Records ante, pp. 223, 233, 235]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1677'>1677</span></p>
<p>Rebecca Colby of Charlestown, widow of Samuel Colby<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Sixteen hundred and Seventy-seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3166'>3166</span></p>
<p>Ellen Amee of Cambridge, sister-in-law of Josiah L.C. Amee,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-one hundred &amp; sixty-six.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135071">
<h3><a name="page-1135071">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 244)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>244</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. October 8, 1873'> Trustees. October 8, 1873</span></p>
<p><u> October 8<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A Monthly Meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, October 8<sup>t</sup>, 1873, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>In the absence of the Secretary, M<sup>r</sup> H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>was appointed Secretary pro tem.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Paths between Garden, Yew, Ash &amp; Fountain Avenues'> Paths between Garden, Yew, Ash &amp; Fountain Avenues</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Grounds reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Paths on land lying between Garden, Yew, Ash and<span class='line-break'> </span>Fountain Avenues, East of the Well House, although upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the lithographic Plan, have never been acted upon by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, and the Committee therefore recommend that<span class='line-break'> </span>said plan of laying out the portion of ground, as above<span class='line-break'> </span>described, be approved and adopted by the Board. On<span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='adopted as shown on the Plan of 1867.'>adopted as shown on the Plan of 1867.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the plan was adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Chant Lot; full possession obtained.'> Chant Lot; full possession obtained.</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Grounds reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Corporation had come into full possession of "the<span class='line-break'> </span>Chant Lot," and that the Committee had obtained an<span class='line-break'> </span>Estimate of the cost of removing the close board fence<span class='line-break'> </span>between said Lot and the Watriss purchase, and putting <span class='line-break'> </span>up 277 feet of the same on the line of said Lot running to<span class='line-break'> </span>the fence of the Catholic Burial Ground, thereby bringing</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Fencing of &amp;c.'> Fencing of &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>said Chant Lot within the general Enclosure of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that said Estimage amounted to $264.50. The<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee recommended that authority be given them</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135072">
<h3><a name="page-1135072">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 245)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>245</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. October 8t, 1873.'> Trustees. October 8<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p>to complete said work, as described, and also to remove<span class='line-break'> </span>the stockade fence between the original Cemetery grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>and said Chant Lot. On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' ordered.'> ordered.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the recommendation of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm. Report of Com. on Grounds resp&apos;g laying out on &apos;the Landscape Lawn&apos; principle.'>Stone Farm. Report of Com. on Grounds resp'g laying out on 'the Landscape Lawn' principle.</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds submitted a plan for<span class='line-break'> </span>laying out the Stone Farm, and recommended that the<span class='line-break'> </span>same be adopted by the Board. They also recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>that a portion of said land, as shown upon the plan,<span class='line-break'> </span>lying between Albatross Avenue and land of J. Stone be<span class='line-break'> </span>set apart for sales under "the Landscape Lawn" system,<span class='line-break'> </span>under such rules and restrictions as may be hereafter<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted by the Board, and that the section lying between<span class='line-break'> </span>Albatross and Eagle Avenues be with^h^eld from sale<span class='line-break'> </span>until otherwise ordered, so that "the Landscape Lawn"<span class='line-break'> </span>principle may be Extended over said section if it shall<span class='line-break'> </span>hereafter seem advisable. On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Perkins, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Report accepted: Plan &amp; recns postponed to next meeting.'> Report accepted: Plan &amp; rec<sup>ns</sup> postponed to next meeting.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the consideration of the plan and recommendations<span class='line-break'> </span>accompanying the same be postponed until the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='George Gardner; Report of Com. on Lots resp&apos;g his Com. to the Board.'>George Gardner; Report of Com. on Lots resp'g his Com. to the Board.</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots to whom<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting was referred M<sup>r</sup> George Gardner's com<span class='line-break'></span>-munication of Sept. 21<sup>st</sup>, ult<sup>o</sup> alleging a lack of proper<span class='line-break'> </span>attention to certain Lots under the perpetual care of the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation, reported that the Committee had personally<span class='line-break'> </span>Examined the Lots referred to, and failed to observe the<span class='line-break'> </span>difference between them claimed by him: such suggestions<span class='line-break'> </span>had however been made for their care another season as would</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135073">
<h3><a name="page-1135073">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 246)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>246</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 8, 1873.'>Trustees. October 8, 1873.</span></p>
<p>certainly Ensure a uniformity of appearance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Books presented.'> Books presented.</span></p>
<p>The President called the attention of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>to books recently received, as follows; -</p>
<p>"Historical Account of the Alleghany Cemetery."<span class='line-break'> </span>"History and Improvement of Spring Grove Cem<span class='line-break'></span>-etery, Cincinnati."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr&apos;s Statements for quarter Ending Sept. 30, 1873. referred to Com. on Finance.'>Treas<sup>r's</sup> Statements for quarter Ending Sept. 30, 1873. referred to Com. on Finance.</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Report of the Receipts and Ex<span class='line-break'></span>-penditures for the quarter Ending September 30<sup>t</sup>, 1873,<span class='line-break'> </span>also Statement of amounts due and unpaid for the<span class='line-break'> </span>same quarter, having been submitted to the Board; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Statements of the Treasurer be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.'>Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompanying shcedule having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board, and read by the Secretary pro<span class='line-break'> </span>tem, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additional Greenhouse Report from Com. on Lots resp&apos;g Erection of'>Additional Greenhouse Report from Com. on Lots resp'g Erection of</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots reported<span class='line-break'> </span>in regard to the Expediency of Erecting an additional<span class='line-break'> </span>greenhouse on foundations adjoining N<sup>os</sup> 4 and 5, and<span class='line-break'> </span>asked that an appropriation of twelve hundred dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>($1200.-) be made for that purpose.</p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Snow it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cons. of deferred to next meeting.'>Cons. of deferred to next meeting.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that a further consideration of the subject be<span class='line-break'> </span>deferred until the next meeting.</p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman, the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>proceeded to consider the amendment of the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed by him at the last meeting of the Trustees for</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135074">
<h3><a name="page-1135074">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 247)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>247</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 8, 1873.'>Trustees. October 8, 1873.</span></p>
<p>action at the meeting next Ensuing; said amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>being as follows, viz: - Article XII. p. 28<sup>t</sup>, 10<sup>th</sup> line from<span class='line-break'> </span>top, insert after the word "Secretary" the words following, <span class='line-break'></span>-"nor until having paid a sum, to be fixed annually by<span class='line-break'> </span>"the Committee on Lots, for work incident thereto necessarily<span class='line-break'> </span>"performed by the corporation": so that the whole passage<span class='line-break'> </span>will read as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendment of By-Laws Article XII. See Recds. of Committees, p. 6'>Amendment of By-Laws Article XII. See Rec<sup>ds</sup>. of Committees, p. 6</span></p>
<p>"No other person than the proprietor himself or the<span class='line-break'> </span>"proper officers and servants of the corporation shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>"allowed to perform any work on a lot, or parcel of ground,<span class='line-break'> </span>"without a permit from the Secretary, nor until having<span class='line-break'> </span>"paid a sum, to be fixed annually by the Committee on Lots,<span class='line-break'> </span>"for work incident thereto necessarily performed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation." [Amendment rescinded by Prop<sup>s</sup> Feb. 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874. Records Vol. 5, p. 280.]</p>
<p>The question being upon the passage of the By-Law<span class='line-break'> </span>as amended, it was ordered, on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner, that<span class='line-break'> </span>the vote be taken by ayes and noes. Every member<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board present having voted in the affirmative,<span class='line-break'> </span>the amended By-Law was declared to be</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adopted.'>Adopted.</span></p>
<p><u>Adopted</u>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots under perpetual care; statement resp&apos;g financial condition of; ref. to Com. on Finance to cons. &amp; report.'>Lots under perpetual care; statement resp'g financial condition of; ref. to Com. on Finance to cons. &amp; report.</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow made a statement on the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>financial condition of the Lots in charge of the corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>for repairs, viz, guaranteed and unguaranteed Lots as<span class='line-break'> </span>shown in the statement taken from the Repair Fund books<span class='line-break'> </span>for the year Ending December 31<sup>st</sup>, 1872, wherein some of<span class='line-break'> </span>the lots were shown to be in arrear of the amount originally<span class='line-break'> </span>deposited to their credit. After discussion, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be referred to the Committee</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135075">
<h3><a name="page-1135075">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 248)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>248</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 8, 1873.'>Trustees. October 8, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Financial condn of Corpn Com. on Finance to report concerning.'>Financial cond<sup>n</sup> of Corp<sup>n</sup> Com. on Finance to report concerning.</span></p>
<p>on Finance, to consider, and report at the next meeting.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Finance report at the<span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting upon the financial condition of the corporation.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned to Monday<span class='line-break'> </span>October 20<sup>t</sup>, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>H.B. Mackintosh<span class='line-break'> </span>Sec'y. Pro. tem.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 20, 1873'>Trustees. October 20, 1873</span></p>
<p><u>October 20<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned Monthly Meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Monday, October 20<sup>t</sup> at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. N.J. Bradlee, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Livermore, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>was called to order by the Secretary, and on motion of<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Turner, M<sup>r</sup> Livermore was Elected chairman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Record of last meeting approved and confirmed by Ayes &amp; Noes.'>Record of last meeting approved and confirmed by Ayes &amp; Noes.</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting having been read,<span class='line-break'> </span>the chairman ruled that the non-administration of<span class='line-break'> </span>the usual oath to the Secretary pro tem, constituted an<span class='line-break'> </span>irregularity requiring confirmation of said record by<span class='line-break'> </span>voted of the Board: M<sup>r</sup> Turner requested that said vote<span class='line-break'> </span>be taken by ayes and noes, inasmuch as one of the votes<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted at the said meeting had been so taken.</p>
<p>The roll having been called by the Secretary, and<span class='line-break'> </span>Every member having voted in the affirmative, the said<span class='line-break'> </span>record was declared approved and confirmed.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135076">
<h3><a name="page-1135076">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 249)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>249</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 20st, 1873.'>Trustees. October 20<sup>st</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr&apos;s Statements for quarter Ending Sept. 30, 1873 approved'>Treas<sup>r's</sup> Statements for quarter Ending Sept. 30, 1873 approved</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Finance, approving as correct the Statements of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter Ending September 30<sup>t</sup>, 1873, referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>them at the last meeting.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Finance Committee be<span class='line-break'> </span>accepted, and said accounts placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts with Lots under R.C. Report respecting laid on the table'>Accounts with Lots under R.C. Report respecting laid on the table</span></p>
<p>A ^written^ report was also received from the same Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom at the last meeting was referred the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the mode of keeping the accounts with perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair Lots. After discussion of the same^on. motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow^ it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be laid on the table for <span class='line-break'> </span>consideration at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Financial condn of Corpn Report concerning accepted.'>Financial cond<sup>n</sup> of Corp<sup>n</sup> Report concerning accepted.</span></p>
<p>A written report was also received from the same<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to whom at the last meeting was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of the financial condition of the corporation</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said report be accepted, &amp; placed on file</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary of Treasr increased to $2250.- per ann.'>Salary of Treas<sup>r</sup> increased to $2250.- per ann.</span></p>
<p>In pursuance of the recommendation of the same<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, and on motion of the chairman thereof, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the salary of the Treasurer be at the<span class='line-break'> </span>rate of Two thousand two hundred and fifty dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>($2250.-) per annum, commencing July 1<sup>st</sup>, 1873.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Halcyon Lake; Lots near Proposed change in form of deed for.'>Halcyon Lake; Lots near Proposed change in form of deed for.</span></p>
<p>Notice was given by the chairman of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, that owing to certain proposed modifications in<span class='line-break'> </span>the grading of Lots near Halcyon Lake, it was his intention<span class='line-break'> </span>to offer at the next meeting of the Board an amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>to the By-Laws covering a change in the form of deed<span class='line-break'> </span>to be used for the conveyance of such Lots.</p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman, it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135077">
<h3><a name="page-1135077">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 250)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>250</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 20, 1873'>Trustees. October 20, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 4282 as orig. located. Secy. to acc. del. of deed of in Exch. for another of Equiv. area &amp; same No'>Lot 4282 as orig. located. Secy. to acc. del. of deed of in Exch. for another of Equiv. area &amp; same N<sup>o</sup></span></p>
