<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized, under the<span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Committee on Lots, to accept from the<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4282 on Halcyon Avenue a deed<span class='line-break'> </span>of re-conveyance of said Lot to the corporation, in Exchange<span class='line-break'> </span>for another Lot, bearing the same number, and of Equivalent<span class='line-break'> </span>area, situated on Halcyon, corner of Ash Avenue, as per<span class='line-break'> </span>re-location report of Superintendent, dated october 16<sup>t</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1873, approved by the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Saffron &amp; Crocus Paths. Work upon authorized'>Saffron &amp; Crocus Paths. Work upon authorized</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Grounds cause the gutters<span class='line-break'> </span>of Saffron and Crocus Paths to be paved, and said Paths<span class='line-break'> </span>to be graded, so as to divert the water which after Every<span class='line-break'> </span>rain-fall runs into said Saffron Path from Spruce Av.,<span class='line-break'> </span>into the "Chant Lot" so called.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication from W.B. Stevens ref. to Com. on Grounds;'>Communication from W.B. Stevens ref. to Com. on Grounds;</span></p>
<p>A communication from M<sup>r</sup> W.B. Stevens under<span class='line-break'> </span>date of the 18<sup>t</sup> inst., in regard to the drainage in front of<span class='line-break'> </span>his Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1587 Spruce Av. having been read, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='from Mrs P.S. Humphrey &amp; H.W. Suter ref. to Com. on Lots.'>from M<sup>rs</sup> P.S. Humphrey &amp; H.W. Suter ref. to Com. on Lots.</span></p>
<p>Communications from M<sup>rs</sup> Pamela S. Humphrey and<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Hales W. Suter, respectively dated the 18<sup>t</sup> and 20<sup>t</sup> insts.,<span class='line-break'> </span>having been read, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Erection of additional Greenhouse;'>Erection of additional Greenhouse;</span></p>
<p>The subject of an appropriation of $1200.- for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Erection of an additional greenhouse on foundations adjoining<span class='line-break'> </span>N<sup>os</sup> 4 and 5 having been taken from the table, on motion<span class='line-break'> </span>of M<sup>r</sup> Snow it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135078">
<h3><a name="page-1135078">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 251)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>251</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 20, 1873.'>Trustees. October 20, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appn of $1200.- for granted, &amp;c.'>App<sup>n</sup> of $1200.- for granted, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said appropriation be granted for the<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose indicated, as notified at the last meeting, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee on Lots be authorized to proceed to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Erection of a greenhouse as aforesaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trinity Church claim of this corpn against. Items of to be in part referred to Com. on Lots.'>Trinity Church claim of this corp<sup>n</sup> against. Items of to be in part referred to Com. on Lots.</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate, in behalf of the Committee on Inter<span class='line-break'></span>-ments, having stated that, in the opinion of the Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>so much of the claim of this corporation against the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of Trinity Church as related to work done and<span class='line-break'> </span>supplies furnished would come within the province of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Lots, it was, on his motion,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that that portion of the Bill of this corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>against the Proprietors of Trinity Church for interments<span class='line-break'> </span>which refers to work done and supplies furnished be re<span class='line-break'></span>-ferred to the Committee on Lots with powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file'>Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file</span></p>
<p>A statement of the Sales of Lots Effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent from September 10<sup>t</sup> to October 8<sup>t</sup>, 1873,<span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest,<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows; - viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='168'>168</span></p>
<p>Josephine M. Hicks of Boston^Highlands^, daughter of Williams H. Hicks,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot^26 Millmont S<sup>t</sup>^ numbered One hundred and sixty-Eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3006, 3007'>3006, 3007</span></p>
<p>Henry Richmond of New York City^37 South S<sup>t</sup>^, brother of Edward Richmond,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lots numbered^Three thousand and six and^ Three thousand and seven.}<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135079">
<h3><a name="page-1135079">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 252)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>252</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. October 20, 1873.'>Trustees. October 20, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3843'>3843</span></p>
<p>Almira Bright of Belmont, widow of Joseph Bright,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-Eight hundred &amp; forty-three</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4092'>4092</span></p>
<p>Daniel Johnson, of Charleston, brother of William Johnson,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four thousand and ninety-two.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting to be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 12 1873'>Trustees. November 12 1873</span></p>
<p><u>November 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, November 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate, Little,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Pickering, Snow, and Turner. Also, present after<span class='line-break'> </span>adjournment, M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mrs P.S. Humphrey. Rep. of Com. on Lots on Petn of accepted &amp; placed on file'>M<sup>rs</sup> P.S. Humphrey. Rep. of Com. on Lots on Pet<sup>n</sup> of accepted &amp; placed on file</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p>A^written^ report was received from the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>with regard to the Petition of M<sup>rs</sup> Pamela S. Humphrey referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to them at the meeting of October 20<sup>t</sup>,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted and placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hales W. Suter. Com. on Lots Expensed from further consid. of Petition of.'>Hales W. Suter. Com. on Lots Expensed from further consid. of Petition of.</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the same Committee stated that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee had had under consideration the communication of<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Hales W. Suter in behalf of the Trustees under the will of<span class='line-break'> </span>the late M<sup>r</sup> John Suter; but that as M<sup>r</sup> Suter's co-trustee<span class='line-break'> </span>was a member of the Committee on Lots, they had to request<span class='line-break'> </span>to be relieved from the further consideration of the case, and<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135080">
<h3><a name="page-1135080">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 253)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>253</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 12t, 1873.'>Trustees. November 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</span></p>
<p>that it might be referred to a special Committee, consisting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the other members of the Committee on Lots and M<sup>r</sup> Choat.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='His Petn referred to spec. Com. '>His Pet<sup>n</sup> referred to spec. Com. </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the request of the Committee on Lots be granted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that M<sup>r</sup> Suter's communication be referred to a special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee consisting of the other two members of the Commit<span class='line-break'></span>-tee on Lots and M<sup>r</sup> Choate.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rep. of Spec. Com. accepted, &amp;c.'>Rep. of Spec. Com. accepted, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>A written report from said special Committee having<span class='line-break'> </span>been made, and considered by the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>the recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trinity Church. Claim of Corpn vs. Rep. of Com. on Interments resp&apos;g portion of accepted, &amp;c.'>Trinity Church. Claim of Corp<sup>n</sup> vs. Rep. of Com. on Interments resp'g portion of accepted, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>A written report was received from the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Interments respecting that portion of the bill of the corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>against the Proprietors of Trinity Church which was left<span class='line-break'> </span>under the cognizance of the Committee by the action of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board at the last meeting</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted, and<span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bill referred to President.'>Monthly Schedule of Bill referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual file of monthly bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted by the Treasurer, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for his ap<span class='line-break'></span>-proval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts with Lots under p.c. Report respecting taken from table.'>Accounts with Lots under p.c. Report respecting taken from table.</span></p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee on Finance with<span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the method of keeping accounts with lots under the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of the corporation which was laid upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>table at the last meeting for consideration at the present<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting be taken from the table.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135081">
<h3><a name="page-1135081">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 254)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>254</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees November 12, 1873'>Trustees November 12, 1873</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Said Report laid on the table.'>Said Report laid on the table.</span></p>
<p>The report having been read by the Secretary,<span class='line-break'> </span>and considered by the Board, - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be laid upon the table, for<span class='line-break'> </span>consideration at the next meeting</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='By-Laws: prop. amendment in by chairman of Com. on Lots deferred.'>By-Laws: prop. amendment in by chairman of Com. on Lots deferred.</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots stated<span class='line-break'> </span>that he was not prepared to present for the consideration<span class='line-break'> </span>if the Board at this meeting the proposed amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>to the By-Laws covering a change in the form for conveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots near Halcyon Lake, and asked that farther<span class='line-break'> </span>time might be allowed for the preparation of the contemplated<span class='line-break'> </span>amendment, in view of the fact that it would require<span class='line-break'> </span>to be framed in such way as to meet questions connected<span class='line-break'> </span>with the laying-out of the Stone-farm district.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the request of the chairman of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots be granted</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Foundations &amp; brick graves to be hereafter constructed by Corporation only. See memn on Bonds.'>Foundations &amp; brick graves to be hereafter constructed by Corporation only. See mem<sup>n</sup> on Bonds.</span></p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that from and after the first of January<span class='line-break'> </span>next, foundations and brick graves shall be constructed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the corporation only: and any Existing General Permits<span class='line-break'> </span>inconsistent herewith shall be so modified or cancelled.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot No 4220'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4220</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4220, Garden Avenue, for the sum of Six<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file'>Monthly statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contract be concurred in on<span class='line-break'> </span>the part of this Board</p>
<p>A statement of the sales of Lots Effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent from October 8<sup>t</sup> to November 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873, so</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135082">
<h3><a name="page-1135082">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 255)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>255</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 12, 1873.'>Trustees. November 12, 1873.</span></p>
<p>far as approved by the Committee on Lots, having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted &amp; placed on file.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest repre<span class='line-break'></span>-sentatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='184'>184</span></p>
<p>H. Parsons Farnham of N. York City, son of Henry Farnam,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One hundred and Eighty-four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='304'>304</span></p>
<p>A. Sigourney Bird of Boston, son of Jesse Bird,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Three hundred and four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1054'>1054</span></p>
<p>Charles N. Cummings of Cambridge {Trustee under the Will of Caleb Whiting,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One thousand and fifty-four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2404'>2404</span></p>
<p>Edward D. Sohier of Brighton {Trustee under the Will of William Phillips,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-four hundred and four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2557'>2557</span></p>
<p>Emily W. Cook of Boston, Widow of James M. Cook,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-five hundred &amp; fifty-seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2690'>2690</span></p>
<p>John L. Blake of North Cambridge, Son of Darius Blake<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-six hundred &amp; ninety.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3441'>3441</span></p>
<p>Jane C. Chandler of East Boston, Widow of John G. Chandler<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-four hundred and forty-one.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned to Wednesday the 19 inst., at 3-30 P.M.</p>
<p>Sam Batchedler Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135083">
<h3><a name="page-1135083">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 256)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>256</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 19, 1873'>Trustees. November 19, 1873</span></p>
<p><u>November 19, 1873.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday November 19, 1873, at half past<span class='line-break'> </span>Three o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Indian-Ridge Fountain Av. grading &amp; sodding authorized'>Indian-Ridge Fountain Av. grading &amp; sodding authorized</span></p>
<p>On suggestion of the President, it was, on motion of^M<sup>r</sup> Turner^</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Grounds be, and they<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby are authorized to cause that portion of the bank<span class='line-break'> </span>of Indian-Ridge on Fountain Avenue, commencing<span class='line-break'> </span>at or near Linnaea Path, and Extending say 120<span class='line-break'> </span>feet, to be graded and sodded in accordance with<span class='line-break'> </span>plan prepared by the Superintendent, - at an Expense<span class='line-break'> </span>not Exceeding five hundred and fifty dollars, ($550.-)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone farm territory to be laid out in accordance with Supt.&apos;s Plan of September 1873.'>Stone farm territory to be laid out in accordance with Supt.'s Plan of September 1873.</span></p>
<p>The subject of the laying-out and improvement<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Stone Farm territory having been [disenssed?], in<span class='line-break'> </span>connection with the plan delineated by the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>dated September, 1873, - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the laying-out of the Stone-farm territory,<span class='line-break'> </span>as shown upon a Plan prepared by the Superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>dated September, 1873, be and the same is hereby approved<span class='line-break'> </span>and adopted by the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' &apos;Landscape-lawn&apos; system, -'> 'Landscape-lawn' system, -</span></p>
<p>After a full consideration of the subject of<span class='line-break'> </span>making sales of Lots in this portion of the Cemetery subject<span class='line-break'> </span>to such reservations as will carry out "the landscape-lawn<span class='line-break'> </span>system," so called, it was moved by M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135084">
<h3><a name="page-1135084">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 257)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>257</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. November 19, 1873.'>Trustees. November 19, 1873.</span></p>
<p>-"that Lots in the section between Albatross Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>"and Swan Avenue be reserved for sale under the land<span class='line-break'></span>"-scape-lawn system."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Debate in regard to.'>Debate in regard to.</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow moved as an amendment to M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee's<span class='line-break'> </span>motion, -</p>
<p>-"that Lots in the section between Albatross Avenue and<span class='line-break'> </span>"Eagle Avenue be so reserved."</p>
<p>The question being first taken on the amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>offered by M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was decided in the negative by a<span class='line-break'> </span>rising vote, five to four.</p>
<p>The question then recurring upon the original motion<span class='line-break'> </span>of M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee it was, in the same mann,er</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='To be adopted bet. Albatross &amp; Swan Avenues. Rest of territory to be temporarily with-held from sale'>To be adopted bet. Albatross &amp; Swan Avenues. Rest of territory to be temporarily with-held from sale</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - ^(5 to 1)^ that the section between Albatross Avenue and<span class='line-break'> </span>Swan Avenue be reserved for sale upon such tenur as will<span class='line-break'> </span>carry out "the landscape lawn system," so called.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the remaining portion of the Stone farm territory<span class='line-break'> </span>be with held from sale till further order of the Board.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Forms for deeds &amp; other papers to be reported by a special Com. Proposed amend. of By-Laws; time Extended'>Forms for deeds &amp; other papers to be reported by a special Com. Proposed amend. of By-Laws; time Extended</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that a special Committee consisting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots and M<sup>r</sup> Choate be appointed to consider<span class='line-break'> </span>and report what forms of deeds or other papers may be<span class='line-break'> </span>requisite for carrying into Effect the above reservation.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow renewed his request for leave to defer<span class='line-break'> </span>the presentation of the amendment to the By-Laws intended<span class='line-break'> </span>to be offered by him as notified at the meeting of the 20 ult<sup>o</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>[ante p. 249,] for the same reasons stated by him at the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the 12<sup>t</sup> inst., [ante, p. 254.] And it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135085">
<h3><a name="page-1135085">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 258)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>258</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, November 19, 1873.'>Trustees, November 19, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accounts with Lots under p.c. Report respecting taken from table.'>Accounts with Lots under p.c. Report respecting taken from table.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the request be acceded to.</p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>with regard to the method of keeping accounts with<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots under the perpetual care of the Corporation which<span class='line-break'> </span>was laid upon the table at the last meeting for con<span class='line-break'></span>-sideration at the next meeting be taken from the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement of Treasr resp&apos;g sd. Lots read &amp; considd'>Statement of Treas<sup>r</sup> resp'g sd. Lots read &amp; consid<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p>As preliminary to a consideration of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>report M<sup>r</sup> Snow read from a statement, prepared by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer showing the amount <del>in Excess of or</del> below <span class='line-break'> </span>the original deposit, to the clsoe of the year 1872, in<span class='line-break'> </span>the case of Each Lot under the perpetual care of the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation; and after remarking upon the same, offered<span class='line-break'> </span>the following vote, -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote offered by Mr Snow [See p. 261.]'>Vote offered by M<sup>r</sup> Snow [See p. 261.]</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Treasurer be instructed, in making<span class='line-break'> </span>up his annual accounts to transfer from the general<span class='line-break'> </span>funds of the corporation to the Repair Fund such an<span class='line-break'> </span>amount as may be necessary to make the credit side of<span class='line-break'> </span>the account with Each Lot under perpetual care Equal<span class='line-break'> </span>to the original deposit thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendment offered by Mr Choate'>Amendment offered by M<sup>r</sup> Choate</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate moved to amend by limiting the<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed transfer to the case of Lots not guaranteed.</p>
<p>After a full discussion, and without action being<span class='line-break'> </span>had Either on the vote or the amendment offered, - on<span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M<sup>r</sup> Lawrence it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Whole subject recommitted to Com. on Finance'>Whole subject recommitted to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the ^vote offered by M<sup>r</sup> Snow^ <del>Entire subject of the method of<span class='line-break'> </span>keeping accounts with Lots under perpetual care</del> be ^referred^<span class='line-break'> </span><del>recommitted</del> to the Committee on Finance to consider</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135086">
<h3><a name="page-1135086">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 259)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>259</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees. November 19, 1873.'> Trustees. November 19, 1873.</span></p>
<p>and report.</p>
<p>On motion of the chairman of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, and for reasons stated by him, - it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Re-conveyance of Lots 115, 1116, 1117 Sec&apos;y authorized to accept.'> Re-conveyance of Lots 115, 1116, 1117 Sec'y authorized to accept.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized to accept<span class='line-break'> </span>from the proprietors of Lots N<sup>os</sup> 1115, 1116 and 1117 on<span class='line-break'> </span>Ailanthus Path deeds of re-conveyance of said Lots to<span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation, as preliminary to such new grants from<span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation as may be necessary or Expedient pursuant<span class='line-break'> </span>to the report of the Superintendent of January 19, 1872,<span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Intervening space. Sec&apos;y authorized [?] pass deeds of Lots cont. to be sold without.'> Intervening space. Sec'y authorized [?] pass deeds of Lots cont. to be sold without.</span></p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman it was also</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized to prepare and<span class='line-break'> </span>deliver deeds of certain Lots contracted to be sold without<span class='line-break'> </span>intervening space as shown on Superintendent report of<span class='line-break'> </span>November 13, 1873.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Goodwin, I., &amp; S.C. Comn from referred to Com. on Lots.'>Goodwin, I., &amp; S.C. Com<sup>n</sup> from referred to Com. on Lots.</span></p>
<p>A communication from Messrs. I. &amp; S.C. Goodwin,<span class='line-break'> </span>by W<sup>m</sup> H. Goodwin, dated November 19, 1873, requesting<span class='line-break'> </span>certain repairs upon the curbing and steps of Lots N<sup>os</sup> 3777<span class='line-break'> </span>and 3778, having been submitted, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>No other business being presented it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135087">
<h3><a name="page-1135087">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 260)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>260</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Decemb. 10, 1873.'>Trustees. Decemb. 10, 1873.</span></p>
<p><u>December 10<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, December 10<sup>t</sup>, 1873, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. Brewer, Lawrence, Little, Pickering,<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>In the absence of the President the meeting was<span class='line-break'> </span>called to order by the Secretary, and M<sup>r</sup> Turner was<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen chairman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm Reservations. Time Extended for Report on the forms requisite for deeds, &amp;c.'>Stone Farm Reservations. Time Extended for Report on the forms requisite for deeds, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow, in behalf of the Special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the last meeting to consider and report<span class='line-break'> </span>what forms of deeds, Etc., may be requisite for carrying<span class='line-break'> </span>into Effect the reservations made upon the Stone Farm<span class='line-break'> </span>territory, stated that the Committee had in readiness a<span class='line-break'> </span>written report upon the subject, the presentation of<span class='line-break'> </span>which he requested might be deferred to the next<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, owing to the absence of two members of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this request be acceded to.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Goodwin I. &amp; S.C. Comn from re-submitted to Com. on Lots with full powers.'>Goodwin I. &amp; S.C. Com<sup>n</sup> from re-submitted to Com. on Lots with full powers.</span></p>
<p>The same gentleman, in behalf of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, to whom at the last meeting was referred the<span class='line-break'> </span>communication from the Messrs Goodwin, respecting<span class='line-break'> </span>certain repairs upon the curbing and steps of Lots N<sup>os</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>3777 and 3778, stated that having considered the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>referred, they were desirious, for reasons stated, that it might<span class='line-break'> </span>be recommitted to the Committee with full powers.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be so referred.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135088">
<h3><a name="page-1135088">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 261)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>261</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Decemb. 10, 1873.'>Trustees. Decemb. 10, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Transfer of amounts from general funds to Repair Fund ordered.'>Transfer of amounts from general funds to Repair Fund ordered.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the chairman of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance to whom at the last meeting was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred the vote offered by M<sup>r</sup> Snow respecting the<span class='line-break'> </span>transfer of certain amounts from the "general funds of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation to the Repair Fund, recommending the<span class='line-break'> </span>passage of the vote so offered. And said vote having<span class='line-break'> </span>been read by the Secretary the same was unanimously</p>
<p><u>Adopted.</u> [See p. 258.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of bills referred to President.'>Monthly schedule of bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual file of monthly bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted by the Treasurer and<span class='line-break'> </span>the schedule read by the chairman, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President <span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer if<span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendment of By-Laws. Renewal of Notice resp&apos;y by Mr Snow'>Amendment of By-Laws. Renewal of Notice resp'y by M<sup>r</sup> Snow</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow renewed his notice of intention to offer<span class='line-break'> </span>certain proposed amendments of the By-Laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file.'>Monthly Statement of Sales of Lots accepted &amp; placed on file.</span></p>
<p>A statement of the Sales of Lots Effected by the Super<span class='line-break'></span>-intendent from November 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873 to December 10<sup>t</sup>, 1873, so<span class='line-break'> </span>far as approved by the Committee on Lots, having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lots Nos 1507 &amp; 4288.'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lots N<sup>os</sup> 1507 &amp; 4288.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1507 Snowdrop Path for the sum of Five<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars; and of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4288, Palm Avenue for<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of Two hundred and sevety-five dollars, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contracts be concurred in,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135089">
<h3><a name="page-1135089">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 262)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>262</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees, Decemb. 10, 1873.'>Trustees, Decemb. 10, 1873.</span></p>
<p>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='354'>354</span></p>
<p>Annie B. Henshaw of Boston, daughter of Sam Henshaw,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Three hundred &amp; fifty-four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1233'>1233</span></p>
<p>Martha W. Smith of Waltham, widow of Perez Smith,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twelve hundred &amp; thirty-three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1638'>1638</span></p>
<p>Charles A. Phelps of Boston, son of Abner Phelps,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Sixteen hundred &amp; thirty-Eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2287'>2287</span></p>
<p>Nancy H. Fosdick of Charlestown, daughter of John Fosdick<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-two hundred &amp; Eighty-seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2716'>2716</span></p>
<p>Thomas Gaffield of Boston, {Guardian of one of the heirs of Nicholas Little<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-seven hundred &amp; sixteen}<span class='line-break'> </span>Lot granted to "Henry T. Green Trustee."}</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2830'>2830</span></p>
<p>Joseph A. Veazie of Boston, son of Rachel F. Veazie, (M<sup>rs</sup> Joseph)<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-Eight hundred &amp; thirty.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3275.'>3275.</span></p>
<p>Thomas E. Chamberlin of Boston, son of Thomas Chamberlin<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-two hundred &amp; seventy-five.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned to Wednesday, the 24<sup>t</sup> inst.,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 3-30 P.M.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135090">
<h3><a name="page-1135090">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 263)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>263</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Dec. 24, 1873'>Trustees. Dec. 24, 1873</span></p>
<p><u>December 24<sup>t</sup>, 1873.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday, December 24, 1873, at half past<span class='line-break'> </span>Three o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm Reservations - Report of Com. on changes in forms required.'>Stone Farm Reservations - Report of Com. on changes in forms required.</span></p>
<p>A written report was received from the chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Special Committee having in charge the subject of<span class='line-break'> </span>certain changes in the By-Laws, deeds, Etc., rendered<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary or Expedient in consequence of the reservations<span class='line-break'> </span>made upon the Stone Farm territory. Said report having<span class='line-break'> </span>been read and considered, and the question having, in<span class='line-break'> </span>the course of discussion, been incidentally mooted<span class='line-break'> </span>whether the ordinary forms of conveyance Employed by<span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation granted the fee of the land or simply<span class='line-break'> </span>a perpetual night of burial, - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject recommitted, with instructions, &amp;c.'>Subject recommitted, with instructions, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be recommitted to the com<span class='line-break'></span>-mittee with instructions to consider and report upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the general subject of the modes of conveyance Em<span class='line-break'></span>-ployed by the corporation viewed in connection with the<span class='line-break'> </span><del>the</del> terms of the several Acts of the Legislature incorporating<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sherburne Lots. re-conveyance, &amp;c. authorized See p. 228.'>Sherburne Lots. re-conveyance, &amp;c. authorized See p. 228.</span></p>
<p>Pursuant to a statement of facts made by M<sup>r</sup> Snow,<span class='line-break'> </span>and upon a motion offered by him, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized to receive from<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Warren Sherburne^formerly^ of Charlestown a re-conveyance of Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>N<sup>os</sup> 3021 and 3022, Oak Avenue, for the purpose of issuing</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135091">
<h3><a name="page-1135091">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 264)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>264</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Dec. 24, 1873.'>Trustees. Dec. 24, 1873.</span></p>
<p>new deeds of the same land differently divided.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chant Lot annexed to the Cemetery.'>Chant Lot annexed to the Cemetery.</span></p>
<p>The President having called attention to the <span class='line-break'> </span>fact that the Chant Lot of land, so called, had not<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] been formally annexed to the Cemetery by vote, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the lot of land recently purchased by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn of John<span class='line-break'> </span>Corcoran, and known as the Chant Lot, be and the<span class='line-break'> </span>same is hereby annexed to said Cemetery and made<span class='line-break'> </span>part thereof.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be directed to send a<span class='line-break'> </span>copy of the foregoing vote to the assessors of Watertown.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Turner, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 575 Geo. C. Shattuck Subject of don. for p.c. of ref. to Com. on Lots'>Lot 575 Geo. C. Shattuck Subject of don. for p.c. of ref. to Com. on Lots</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject of the donation of $1000.- made<span class='line-break'> </span>by Dr. George C. Shattuck to the general funds of the Corporation, in<span class='line-break'> </span>consideration whereof the Trustees, by vote adopted Dec. 28, 1844,<span class='line-break'> </span>agreed to keep the lot of said Shattuck in perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Lots to consider and report.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Perkins, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass. Hort. Soc. - Com. on relations of this corpn to, authorized to Em-ploy counsel.'>Mass. Hort. Soc. - Com. on relations of this corp<sup>n</sup> to, authorized to Em-ploy counsel.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the special Committee appointed Feby. 12,<span class='line-break'> </span>1873, consisting of the President and Messrs. Choate and<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow, to consider and report what measures, if any,<span class='line-break'> </span>should be taken to re-adjust or terminate the relations<span class='line-break'> </span>of this corporation to the Massachusetts Horticultural<span class='line-break'> </span>Society, be authorized to obtain the opinion of counsel<span class='line-break'> </span>on the subject.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest, representatives were<span class='line-break'> </span>designated for Lots as follows, viz; <span class='line-break'></span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135092">
<h3><a name="page-1135092">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 265)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>265</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Dec. 24, 1873.'>Trustees. Dec. 24, 1873.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1198'>1198</span></p>
<p>David W. Loring of Boston. son of Caleb G. Loring<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eleven hundred &amp; ninety-Eight.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4175'>4175</span></p>
<p>Willard J. Clough of Boston one of the heirs of Tabitha Clough<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of the Lot numbered Forty-one hundred &amp; seventy-five.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Jan&apos;y 14, 1874'>Trustees. Jan'y 14, 1874</span></p>
<p><u>January 14<sup>t</sup>, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, January 14, 1874 at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Perkins, Pickering and Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gravel for use at Cem&apos;y. Comn of late Supt. resp&apos;g. Action rep. inexpedient'>Gravel for use at Cem'y. Com<sup>n</sup> of late Supt. resp'g. Action rep. inexpedient</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds in reference to the communication of the late<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent dated April^14<sup>t</sup>^ 1873 respecting a supply<span class='line-break'> </span>of gravel for use at the Cemetery which was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to them May 14<sup>t</sup>, 1873, stating that, in the opinion of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee no action thereon was requisite.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm Reservations leave granted to defer report on.'>Stone Farm Reservations leave granted to defer report on.</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate, in behalf of the special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on the Stone Farm reservations, having stated that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, for reasons given, desired to defer the pre<span class='line-break'></span>-sentation of their report, it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135093">
<h3><a name="page-1135093">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 266)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>266</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Jan&apos;y. 14, 1874.'>Trustees. Jan'y. 14, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the request of the Committee be<span class='line-break'> </span>acceded to.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ann. Report of Treasurer ref. to Com. on Fin.'>Ann. Report of Treasurer ref. to Com. on Fin.</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Treasurer having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board by the President, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Treasurer's Report be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance, to report thereon at the<span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ann. Report of Supt. acc. &amp; ord. to be printed'>Ann. Report of Supt. acc. &amp; ord. to be printed</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>having also been submitted by the President, and<span class='line-break'> </span>read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Superintendent's Report be<span class='line-break'> </span>accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President.'>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual file of monthly bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted by the Treasurer, and<span class='line-break'> </span>the schedule read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file'>Monthly Statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file</span></p>
<p>A Statement of the sales of Lots Effected by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent from December 10, 1873 to January 14,<span class='line-break'> </span>1874, having been submitted and read by the Sec'y., it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='*Carter, Luke, Lot 1164, late of Petn for repn of rep. to Com. on Lots'>*Carter, Luke, Lot 1164, late of Pet<sup>n</sup> for rep<sup>n</sup> of rep. to Com. on Lots</span></p>
<p>The Secretary also submitted a special petition<span class='line-break'> </span>for the representation of Lot 1164 signed by M<sup>rs</sup> Nancy<span class='line-break'> </span>C. Carter, widow of Luke Carter.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above petition be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots to consider and report.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135094">
<h3><a name="page-1135094">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 267)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>267</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Jan&apos;y. 14, 1874.'>Trustees. Jan'y. 14, 1874.</span></p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest,<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='364'>364</span></p>
<p>George D. Oxnard of Boston, son of Henry Oxnard,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Three hundred &amp; sixty-four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1372'>1372</span></p>
<p>Mary M.J. Blake, of Boston, Widow of Edward Blake,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirteen hundred &amp; seventy-two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1864'>1864</span></p>
<p>Rudolphus F. Hahn of E. Boston, son of Jacob Hahn,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eighteen hundred &amp; sixty-four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3252'>3252</span></p>
<p>Mary E. Welch of Boston, Widow of Thomas J. Welch,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-two hundred &amp; fifty-two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4033'>4033</span></p>
<p>Charlotte L. Smith of Boston, widow of Joseph M. Smith,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four thousand &amp; thirty-three.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned to Thursday,<span class='line-break'> </span>the 22<sup>d</sup> inst. at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135095">
<h3><a name="page-1135095">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 268)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>268</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jany. 22d, 1874'>Trustees Jany. 22<sup>d</sup>, 1874</span></p>
<p><u>January 22<sup>d</sup>, 1874.</u></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held on Thursday, January 22<sup>d</sup>, 1874,<span class='line-break'> </span>at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, Choate, Little, Perkins, Pickering Snow and<span class='line-break'> </span>Turner.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>approved</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ann. Report of Treasurer approved &amp; ordered to be printed.'>Ann. Report of Treasurer approved &amp; ordered to be printed.</span></p>
<p>A report having been received from the Com<span class='line-break'></span>-mittee on Finance, approving as correct the Treasurer's<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Report which was referred to them at the<span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Treasurer's Annual Report<span class='line-break'> </span>be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ann. Report of Trustees adopted &amp; ordered to be printed.'>Ann. Report of Trustees adopted &amp; ordered to be printed.</span></p>
<p>The Annual Report of the Trustees to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors as prepared by the President having<span class='line-break'> </span>been read by him, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the said Report be accepted and<span class='line-break'> </span>printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Farm Reservations Spec. Committee on.'>Stone Farm Reservations Spec. Committee on.</span></p>
<p>The Special Committee upon the Stone Farm<span class='line-break'> </span>reservations to whom at the meeting of December 24,<span class='line-break'> </span>1873, was recommitted the report made by them<span class='line-break'> </span>at that meeting, [see p. 263] with instructions to con<span class='line-break'></span>-sider and report upon the general subject of the modes<span class='line-break'> </span>of conveyance Employed by the corporation viewed in<span class='line-break'> </span>connection with the terms of the several Acts of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Legislature incorporating the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135096">
<h3><a name="page-1135096">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 269)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>269</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jan&apos;y. 22d, 1874.'>Trustees Jan'y. 22<sup>d</sup>, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Majority.'>Report of Majority.</span></p>
<p>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, submitted a written<span class='line-break'> </span>report, recommending no change in the form of deed<span class='line-break'> </span>now used, Except to insert at the End of the first<span class='line-break'> </span>clause of the tenth provision, after the word "thereto,"<span class='line-break'> </span>the following words; - "and to all by-laws, rules and<span class='line-break'> </span>regulations made and to be made by said corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>in pursuance of authority granted to it by any Act<span class='line-break'> </span>or Acts of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts."<span class='line-break'> </span>Said report was signed by three members of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, Messrs. Perkins, Choate and N.J. bardlee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Minority'>Report of Minority</span></p>
<p>Annexed thereto was a minority report of M<sup>r</sup> Snow,<span class='line-break'> </span>the other member of the Committee, "concurring in<span class='line-break'> </span>the report so far as it recommends an amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>to the form for deed, but dissenting from the conclu<span class='line-break'></span>-sion that no further amendments are necessary."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Majority Report accepted'>Majority Report accepted</span></p>
<p>The question having been taken upon the report<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted by the majority of the Committee upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>re-commitment, it was unanimously</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations thereof adopted. [See pp. 274, 275.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Orig. Report accepted with amendment (See p. 274.)'>Orig. Report accepted with amendment (See p. 274.)</span></p>
<p>The question being then taken upon the original<span class='line-break'> </span>report, as amended, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said report, as amended, be accepted.</p>
<p>Both the above votes were taken by ayes and noes.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Prices charged for care of Lots. by corpn'> Prices charged for care of Lots. by corp<sup>n</sup></span></p>
<p>A written report was submitted by the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots to whom was referred February 23<sup>d</sup>, 1871, and Jan'y. 22<sup>d</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1873, the consideration of the scale of prices charged for<span class='line-break'> </span>the care of Lots by the corporation as compared with the</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report accepted.'>Report accepted.</span></p>
<p>rates adopted by other like corporations. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said report be accepted, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee discharged.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 575. Geo. C. Shattuck Dep. for p.c. of sd. Lot to be transferred &amp;c.'>Lot 575. Geo. C. Shattuck Dep. for p.c. of sd. Lot to be transferred &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>A written report was also received from<span class='line-break'> </span>the same Committee, to whom, at the meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>December 24^1873^ was referred the subject of an agreement<span class='line-break'> </span>made for the perpetual care of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 575, George C.<span class='line-break'> </span>Shattuck proprietor, in consideration of the donation<span class='line-break'> </span>of one thousand dollars made by him to the general<span class='line-break'> </span>funds of the corporation; recommending, for reasons<span class='line-break'> </span>stated, "that said amount of one thousand dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>be transferred from the general funds of the corpora<span class='line-break'></span>-tion to an account with said Lot, the income<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof to be applied in conformity with the vote<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to." And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said report be accepted, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='*Carter, Luke Lot 1164, late of Petn for repn of granted.'>*Carter, Luke Lot 1164, late of Pet<sup>n</sup> for rep<sup>n</sup> of granted.</span></p>
<p>A report was also received form the same<span class='line-break'> </span>committee to whom, at the last meeting, was re<span class='line-break'></span>-ferred the petition of Nancy C. Carter, widow of<span class='line-break'> </span>Luke Carter, late proprietor of Lot 1164, for appointment<span class='line-break'> </span>as representative of said Lot, recommending that<span class='line-break'> </span>said petition be granted. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said report be accepted.</p>
<p>And the representative was appointed as follows: <span class='line-break'></span>viz:-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1164'>1164</span></p>
<p>Nancy C. Carter of Cambridge, Widow of Luke Carter,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eleven hundred &amp; sixty-four.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Redway &amp; Hatch Marble wash. Report of Com. on Lots'>Redway &amp; Hatch Marble wash. Report of Com. on Lots</span></p>
<p>A report was also received form the same<span class='line-break'> </span>committee to whom, at the meeting of June 20, 1873,<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the communication of M<sup>r</sup> Chas. Bradley<span class='line-break'> </span>relative to the solicitations addressed to visitors at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery by Messrs. Redwary &amp; Hatch to purchase a wash<span class='line-break'> </span>for cleansing marble; - stating that the parties named<span class='line-break'> </span>having left the Cemetery precincts, no action was re<span class='line-break'></span>-quired in the premises. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement of Lots sold &amp; not paid for:'>Statement of Lots sold &amp; not paid for:</span></p>
<p>A report was also received from the same<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to whom at the same meeting was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>a statement of Lots reported sold not yet paid <span class='line-break'> </span>for, representing that the said papers having failed<span class='line-break'> </span>to come before the Committee, and the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>having in the meantime prepared statements covering<span class='line-break'> </span>the interval to the close of the year 1873, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='subject referred to next Bd of Trustees'>subject referred to next B<sup>d</sup> of Trustees</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee be discharged from<span class='line-break'> </span>the further consideration of the subject and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the same be referred to the next Board of Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Birds.'>Report of Com. on Birds.</span></p>
<p>A written report was received from Dr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Brewer, in behalf of the Special Committee on Birds<span class='line-break'> </span>giving list of the waterfowl, Etc., belonging to the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation, with statements of their condition charac<span class='line-break'></span>-teristics &amp;c.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee on Birds<span class='line-break'> </span>be accepted and placed on file.</p>
<p>A communication from the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>dated December 23, 1873, addressed to the chairman</p>

<p>of the Committee on Lots, and by him referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Grounds representing the need<span class='line-break'> </span>of certain surveys upon the Stone Farm district<span class='line-break'> </span>before the lithographic stone of the Cemetery map<span class='line-break'> </span>can be correctly altered, having been laid before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees by the chairman of the last named Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage into Cem&apos;y from certain neigh-boring buildings Com. from Supt. resp&apos;y referred to next Bd of Trust^ees^'>Drainage into Cem'y from certain neigh-boring buildings Com. from Supt. resp'y referred to next B<sup>d</sup> of Trust^ees^</span></p>
<p>A communication from the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>dated January 19<sup>t</sup>, 1874, addressed to the President, in<span class='line-break'> </span>regard to the drainage into the Cemetery precincts<span class='line-break'> </span>from certain buildings now being Erected in a street<span class='line-break'> </span>running from M<sup>t</sup> Auburn S<sup>t</sup> West of the Reception<span class='line-break'> </span>House, having by him been laid before the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the next Board of Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignations of Messrs Isaac Livermore &amp; Alfred T. Turner'>Resignations of Messrs Isaac Livermore &amp; Alfred T. Turner</span></p>
<p>A communication from M<sup>r</sup> Isaac Livermore<span class='line-break'> </span>dated January 22<sup>d</sup>, 1874, declining to be a candidate<span class='line-break'> </span>for re election as Trustee, on the Expiration of his<span class='line-break'> </span>present term, February 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874, was read by the<span class='line-break'> </span>President</p>
<p>A verbal communication resigning his office<span class='line-break'> </span>as Trustee^to take Effect at the next Annual Meeting^ was also made by M<sup>r</sup> Alfred T. Turner,<span class='line-break'> </span>Elected to serve until 1876.</p>

<p>A verbal announcement was made by the<span class='line-break'> </span>President, M<sup>r</sup> John T. Bradlee, that he should<span class='line-break'> </span>withdraw his name from^the^ consideration of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>for reelection as President upon the re-organization<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board after the Annual Meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors.</p>

<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots has recommended the Trustees to guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>os</sup> 246 on Lily Path late<span class='line-break'> </span>of Otis Daniel deceased for the sum of seven hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars; also of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 3102 on Buckthorn Path,<span class='line-break'> </span>late of Charles S. Darrow, deceased, for the sum of<span class='line-break'> </span>six hundred and seventy-five dollars; - it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contracts be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in, on the part of this Board</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz;</p>

<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>

<p><u>Report of Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to at p. 269, ante.</u></p>
<p>The special committee appointed to consider <span class='line-break'> </span>and report what forms of deeds or other papers may <span class='line-break'> </span>be requisite for carrying into Effect the reservations<span class='line-break'> </span>made upon the Stone Farm district by vote of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board of Trustees adopted November 19, 1873, respectfully<span class='line-break'> </span>submit the following</p>
<p><u>Report:</u></p>
<p>recommending alterations in the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><u>Article X, p. 26,</u> after the first paragraph, insert<span class='line-break'> </span>the words following, viz: -</p>
<p>And if the Lot is within that portion of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>set apart by vote of the Trustees passed November 19, 1873,<span class='line-break'> </span>the purchaser shall also pay to the Treasurer the<span class='line-break'> </span>further stipulated sum for its perpetual care and<span class='line-break'> </span>shall receive, in addition to such deed, a contract<span class='line-break'> </span>guaranteeing the perpetual care of said lot, in the<span class='line-break'> </span>manner provided by Article XIV of these By-Laws</p>
<p><u>Article XII, p. 28</u>, after the third paragraph insert<span class='line-break'> </span>the words following, viz; -</p>
<p>Provided that if such lot is in that portion of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery set apart by vote of the Trustees passed No<span class='line-break'></span>-vember 19, 1873, it shall be graded, sodded, marked,<span class='line-break'> </span>and thereafter kept in repair by the corporation. And<span class='line-break'> </span>no other person than the proper officers and servants</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135102">
<h3><a name="page-1135102">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 275)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>275</p>
<p>of the corporation shall be allowed to perform any work<span class='line-break'> </span>thereon. And on any such lot no fences, curbing<span class='line-break'> </span>or hedges will be permitted; and no headstone at any<span class='line-break'> </span>grave shall Exceed two feet and six inches in height<span class='line-break'> </span>fro the ground, Except by vote of the Trustees, upon<span class='line-break'> </span>special application.</p>
<p><u>Article XVII, p. 34</u>. Modify Superintendent's Certificate<span class='line-break'> </span>of selection, by adding the words following, viz; -</p>
<p>And further provided that if the selected lot is in<span class='line-break'> </span>that part of the Cemetery set apart by vote of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>passed November 19, 1873, the purchaser shall also pay<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Treasurer the sum stipulated for the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>care of the lot, before receiving a deed thereof.</p>
<p>They also recommend the annexed<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Form for conveyance of lots<span class='line-break'> </span>in that part of the Cemetery set apart by vote of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>passed November 19, 1873.</u></p>
<p>Know all men by these presents, that the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn in consideration of<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, paid to them by [blank] of [blank] the receipt<span class='line-break'> </span>of which is hereby acknowledged, do hereby grant, bargain<span class='line-break'> </span>sell and convey to the said [blank] and [blank] heirs &amp; assigns,<span class='line-break'> </span>a lot of land in the Cemetery of M<sup>t</sup> Auburn in the County<span class='line-break'> </span>of Middlesex, numbered [blank] on the plan which is in<span class='line-break'> </span>the possession of the said corporation for inspection by<span class='line-break'> </span>the said grantee [blank] heirs and assigns at all seasonable<span class='line-break'> </span>times, and situated on or near the [blank] side of the way</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135103">
<h3><a name="page-1135103">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 276)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>276</p>
<p>called [blank] at a distance of about [blank] feet<span class='line-break'> </span>therefrom, with a night of way from said [blank] to<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot. [blank] Said lot is of [blank] from [blank]<span class='line-break'> </span>and contains [blank] square feet.</p>
<p>To have and to hold the aforegranted premises<span class='line-break'> </span>unto the said [blank] heirs and assigns forever;<span class='line-break'> </span>subject however to the conditions and limitations, and<span class='line-break'> </span>with the privileges following; to wit: -</p>
<p><u>First</u>. The proprietor of the said lot of land shall<span class='line-break'> </span>use it only for a burial place for the dead.</p>
<p><u>Second</u>, The said lot of land shall be graded, sodded,<span class='line-break'> </span>suitable landmarks of stone Erected, and the number<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof legibly and permanently marked on the<span class='line-break'> </span>premises by the corporation at the expense of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor; and no work shall at any time be done<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the said lot by other persons than the proper<span class='line-break'> </span>officers or servants of the corporation, Except by vote<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees of said Corporation. No monuments,<span class='line-break'> </span>structures or inscriptions shall be placed therein without<span class='line-break'> </span>the approval of the Committee on Lots. Nor shall<span class='line-break'> </span>any headstone be Erected Exceeding two feet and six<span class='line-break'> </span>inches in height form the ground, Except by vote of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees.</p>
<p><u>Third</u>. If any monument or Effigy, or any structure<span class='line-break'> </span>whatever, or any inscription be placed in or upon the said land which shall be determined by the major<span class='line-break'> </span>part of the said Trustees for the time being to be offensive<span class='line-break'> </span>or improper, the said Trustees or the major part of them,<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>

<p>shall have the right, and it shall be their duty to Enter<span class='line-break'> </span>upon said land, and remove the said offensive or im<span class='line-break'></span>-proper object or objects.</p>
<p><u>Fourth</u>. The said lot of land shall be holden subject<span class='line-break'> </span>to the provisions contained in an Act of the General Court<span class='line-break'> </span>dated March 21, 1835, and entitled "An Act to incorporate<span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn," and<span class='line-break'> </span>the several Acts in addition thereto and to all By-Laws,<span class='line-break'> </span>rules and regulations made and to be made by said<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation, in pursuance of authority granted to it by<span class='line-break'> </span>any Act or Acts of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.</p>
<p>The convenants and conclusion are identical<span class='line-break'> </span>with those in the "Form for conveyance of lots"<span class='line-break'> </span>[See By-Laws of 1872; pp. 36 &amp; 37.]<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<div id="page-1135105">
<h3><a name="page-1135105">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 278)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>278</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. Feby. 2d, 1874.'>Proprietors. Feby. 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>Annual Meeting of the Proprietors.<span class='line-break'> </span>Monday, February 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874.</u></p>
<p>x A duly notified meeting of the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn was held at Horticultural Hall,<span class='line-break'> </span>Boston, on Monday, February 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874, at half past Three<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock in the afternoon.</p>
<p>x A quorum being present, the meeting was called<span class='line-break'> </span>to order by the President, who also read the call for the same.</p>
<p>x The record of the last Proprietors' Meeting was read<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Secretary, and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports.'>Annual Reports.</span></p>
<p>x The Annual Report o fhte Trustees, accompanied<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Reports of the Superintendent and Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>having been distributed in print among the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>present, and the Report of the Trustees having been read<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Secretary, - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Collamore, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reading of Supt.&apos;s &amp; Treasr&apos;s Reports dispensed with Reports accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded.'>Reading of Supt.'s &amp; Treas<sup>r's</sup> Reports dispensed with Reports accepted &amp; ordered to be recorded.</span></p>
<p>x <u>Voted</u>, - that the reading of the Superintendent's<span class='line-break'> </span>and Treasurer's Reports be dispensed with.</p>
<p>x<u>Voted</u>, - that the Annual Reports be accepted &amp; recorded.</p>
<p>On motion of Col. Hatch, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote of thanks to Messrs. Livermore &amp; Turner.'>Vote of thanks to Messrs. Livermore &amp; Turner.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the thanks of the Proprietors are hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>presented to the retiring Trustees, Hon. Isaac Livermore<span class='line-break'> </span>and M<sup>r</sup> Alfred T. Turner, for their faithful and valuable<span class='line-break'> </span>services.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Collamore, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. appd to col-lect, count &amp; sort votes for Trustees.'>Com. app<sup>d</sup> to col-lect, count &amp; sort votes for Trustees.</span></p>
<p><u>Vorted</u>, - that a Committee of three be appointed by<span class='line-break'> </span>the chair to receive, count and sort the votes for Trustees.</p>
<p>The chair appointed Messrs. Collamore, M<sup>c</sup>Clellan</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>and Richards to compose said Committee, who subsequently<span class='line-break'> </span>reported as follows, viz; -</p>
