Snow</u>, to serve until 1880, (by reelection.) 261.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Israel M. Spelman</u>, " " " " 273.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>T. Quincy Browne</u> " " " " 1876 273<span class='line-break'> </span>John R. Poor 4<span class='line-break'> </span>Joel Richards 4<span class='line-break'> </span>Charles F. Choate 2<span class='line-break'> </span>A.H. Safford 1<span class='line-break'> </span>A.P. Morse 1<span class='line-break'> </span>Alex. Wadsworth 1<span class='line-break'> </span>Clement Willis 1</p>
<p>And the three gentlemen first-named were declared<span class='line-break'> </span>Elected as Trustees for the terms stated.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> John R. Poor, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; power [?] make By-Laws revoked.'>Trustees' power [?] make By-Laws revoked.</span></p>
<p><u>Resolved</u>, - that the vote of the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, adopted on the tenth of<span class='line-break'> </span>July, 1835; giving the Trustees of this corporation power<span class='line-break'> </span>to make By-Laws, to be in force until otherwise ordered<span class='line-break'> </span>by the corporation is hereby repealed, and such authority<span class='line-break'> </span>revoked.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Citation of vote conferring this power, adopted 1835'>Citation of vote conferring this power, adopted 1835</span></p>
<p>[The vote of the Proprietors above referred to is in the<span class='line-break'> </span>terms following, viz: -</p>
<p>"The Trustees shall have authority to make any By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>for the due regulation and management of the property,<span class='line-break'> </span>business and prudential concerns of the corporation not<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135107">
<h3><a name="page-1135107">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 280)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>280</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Proprietors&apos; Feb&apos;y. 2d, 1874.'> Proprietors' Feb'y. 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874.</span></p>
<p>otherwise provided for by the Act of Incorporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>which shall be in force till otherwise ordered by<span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation." [Records, Vol. 1, p. 20] ]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendment to By-Laws passed by Trustees Oct. 8, 73, revoked'>Amendment to By-Laws passed by Trustees Oct. 8, 73, revoked</span></p>
<p>on motion of the same gentleman, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the amendment to the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>on the subject of work on lots, adopted by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees on the Eighth of October last, is hereby revoked.<span class='line-break'> </span>[See Reocrds Vol. 5, p. 247.]</p>
<p>The following vote was then offered by the same<span class='line-break'> </span>gentleman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote annulling Action of Trustees of Sept. 23d, 1873, resp&apos;y signs, &amp;c. rejected.'>Vote annulling Action of Trustees of Sept. 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873, resp'y signs, &amp;c. rejected.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the votes of the Trustees, passed Sep<span class='line-break'></span>-tember 23<sup>d</sup>, 1873 declaring that signs placed on lots<span class='line-break'> </span>indicating that such lots are "for sale" are offensive<span class='line-break'> </span>and improer, are hereby disapproved and annulled.<span class='line-break'> </span>[See Records Vol. 5, p. 241.]</p>
<p>The question on the above vote having been<span class='line-break'> </span>taken, it was <u>decided in the negative.</u></p>
<p>The following vote was then offered by the same<span class='line-break'> </span>gentleman; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; power to make By-Laws restored; subject to certain qualifications.'>Trustees' power to make By-Laws restored; subject to certain qualifications.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Trustees of the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn shall have power to<span class='line-break'> </span>make By-Laws for the regulation of the affairs of this<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation, subject to the approval of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>at an annual or special meeting, with the notice<span class='line-break'> </span>for which a copy of said proposed By-Laws, or any<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed amendment of Existing By-Laws shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>sent to Each proprietor.</p>
<p>Judge Warren moved to amend said vote</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135108">
<h3><a name="page-1135108">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 281)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>281</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors. Feby. 2d, 1874.'>Proprietors. Feby. 2<sup>d</sup>, 1874.</span></p>
<p>by adding thereto the words following, viz; -</p>
<p>-"and that no By-Law be amended or passed at any<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the corporation without such previous notice<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof."</p>
<p>The question being first taken on the amendment,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was adopted. And the vote as amended was then<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted as follows: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='By-Laws proposed, to be submitted to Proprietors for approval. Notice to be included in call for meeting.'>By-Laws proposed, to be submitted to Proprietors for approval. Notice to be included in call for meeting.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Trustees of the Proprietors of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn shall have power to make<span class='line-break'> </span>By-laws for the regulation of the affairs of this corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>subject to the approval of the Proprietors at an annual<span class='line-break'> </span>or special meeting, with the notice for which a copy<span class='line-break'> </span>of said proposed By-Laws, or any proposed amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>of Existing By-Laws, shall be sent to Each proprietor.</p>
<p>And that no By-Law be amended or passed at<span class='line-break'> </span>any meeting of the corporation without such previous<span class='line-break'> </span>notice thereof.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr.,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135109">
<h3><a name="page-1135109">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 282)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135110">
<h3><a name="page-1135110">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 282a)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>TRUSTEE'S REPORT.</p>
<p>THE outlay of previous years having placed the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>in an acceptable and attractive condition, the past year has<span class='line-break'> </span>not been marked by any extensive new operations. The<span class='line-break'> </span>funds and assets of the Corporation are in a satisfactory state,<span class='line-break'> </span>while the receipts from sales of lots have fully realized the<span class='line-break'> </span>anticipations of the Trustees and demonstrated the wisdom <span class='line-break'> </span>of the liberal expenditures that have been made for the<span class='line-break'> </span>preservation and embellishment of the Cemetery. The<span class='line-break'> </span>following is a summary of the most important acts of the year.</p>
<p>A vacancy having occurred in the office of Superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr. James W. Lovering was unanimously elected, and since<span class='line-break'> </span>entering upon the duties of the position, in April, has given<span class='line-break'> </span>entire satisfaction to the Board, and they believe to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors generally.</p>
<p>The Chant Lot, so called, the purchase of which was<span class='line-break'> </span>mentioned in the last annual report, has been properly fenced<span class='line-break'> </span>and formally annexed to the Cemetery; plans for laying out<span class='line-break'> </span>the territory are being prepared and will soon be submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Trustees for their action.</p>
<p>A plan for laying out the Stone Farm has been adopted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and at a recent meeting of the Trustees, it was voted, that<span class='line-break'> </span>a portion of said land, say six acres, be reserved for sale,<span class='line-break'> </span>under such restrictions as will carry out the Landscape Lawn<span class='line-break'> </span>system, and that the balance of the lot be withheld from<span class='line-break'> </span>sale until further action by the Board, it being their intention<span class='line-break'> </span>to hereacter offer the same under similar restrictions if the<span class='line-break'> </span>new system proves in accordance with the demands of the<span class='line-break'> </span>public taste. In consequence of the addition of territory</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135111">
<h3><a name="page-1135111">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 282b)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>282</p>
<p>and various changes in avenues and paths since the latest<span class='line-break'> </span>published plan of the Cemetery, a revised map is being<span class='line-break'> </span>prepared and will be issued at an early day.</p>
<p>An additional greenhouse has been erected to enable the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees to provide the plants necessary for the embellishment<span class='line-break'> </span>of the public grounds, and meet the demands of proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>for the care and adornment of their lots.</p>
<p>The bridge at Auburn Lake having become unsafe for travel,<span class='line-break'> </span>has been replaced by a more permanent structure of iron.</p>
<p>The bank of Indian Ridge, on Foundatin Avenue, having<span class='line-break'> </span>long been in an unsightly condition, a plan for grading and<span class='line-break'> </span>sodding has been prepared, adn work upon a portion of the<span class='line-break'> </span>same has been ordered to be commenced as early in the<span class='line-break'> </span>spring as practicable.</p>
<p>Detailed statements of the business of the year, together<span class='line-break'> </span>with the condition of the funds and property of the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion, will be found in the accompanying reports of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent and Treasurer.</p>
<p>The Permanent Fund for the future support and preser<span class='line-break'></span>vation of the Cemetery, has been increased by the deposit<span class='line-break'> </span>of $9,430.08, and with the accrued income amounts to <span class='line-break'> </span>$162,394.88.</p>
<p>The amount received from ednowments for perpetual care<span class='line-break'> </span>of lots, to date, is $87,473.80, with a balance of income<span class='line-break'> </span>unexpended $16,404.11, making the total amount of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Repair Fund $103,877.91.</p>
<p>The available assets for current expenses are $34,496.52,<span class='line-break'> </span>exclusive of real estate owned by the Corporation outside of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemtery.</p>
<p>For the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>JOHN T. BRADLEE,<span class='line-break'> </span><i>President.</i></p>
<p>BOSTON, January, 1874.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>REPAIR FUND - PROPERTY.<span class='line-break'> </span>Endowments received for the perpetual repair of Lots .......................... $87,473.80<span class='line-break'> </span>Income, Balance Unexpended ............................................................. 16,404.11<span class='line-break'> </span>------------ $103,877.91<span class='line-break'> </span>Invested as follows:<span class='line-break'> </span>Notes Receivable, secured by Mortgage ................................................ $31,000.00<span class='line-break'> </span>30 Shares Atlas National Bank .............................................................. 2,970.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Shawmut National Bank ................................................................ 2,430.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Atlantic National Bank .................................................................. 2,700.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Boston and Albany Railroad Co ...................................................... 1,721.25<span class='line-break'> </span>5 " Boston and Lowell Railroad ............................................................. 3,190.00<span class='line-break'> </span>20 " Fitchburg Railroad ........................................................................ 2,600.00<span class='line-break'> </span>United States 5-20 Bonds ...................................................................... 40,527.58<span class='line-break'> </span>Boston City Bonds ............................................................................... 12,935.00<span class='line-break'> </span>Cash in hands of Treasurer .................................................................. 3,804.08<span class='line-break'> </span>------------ $103,877.91</p>
<p>ALSO, Deposit in Trust, with the Massachusetts Hospital Life Insurance Company,<span class='line-break'> </span>Policy No. 3,594, for $6,330, payable on the decease of certain parties to the Proprietors of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, for perpetual care of certain lots.</p>
<p>Respectfully submitted,<span class='line-break'> </span>Boston, January 14th, 1874. H.B. MACKINTOSH, <i>Treasurer.</i></p>
<p>This certifies that we have examined the books and accounts of the Treasurer of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, for the year Eighteen Hundred and Seventy<span class='line-break'></span>three, and have found them correctly kept and properly balanced, with satisfactory vouchers<span class='line-break'> </span>for all payments.</p>
<p>The Certificates of Stock and other evidences of property were found in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the statements of his accounts.</p>
<p>In the General account, there appears to be a balance in the hands of the Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>of $5,585.14; and in the Fund for Repairs, $3,804.08.</p>
<p>ALFRED T. TURNER}<span class='line-break'> </span>JAMES L. LITTLE} <i>Committee on Finance.</i></p>
<p>Boston, January 20th, 1874.</p>

<div id="page-1135116">
<h3><a name="page-1135116">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 287)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>287</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feb&apos;y 11, 1874.'>Trustees. Feb'y 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>February 11<sup>t</sup>, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, February 11<sup>t</sup>, 1874 at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee,<span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Perkins, Pickering,<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow and Spelman.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Officers: - '>Election of Officers: - </span></p>
<p>The meeting having been called to order by M<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>J.T. Bradlee, and the names of the Trustees Elected at the<span class='line-break'> </span>annual meeting of the corporation on the 2<sup>d</sup> inst. announced<span class='line-break'> </span>by him, and the statement made that the business<span class='line-break'> </span>first in order would be the election of officers for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Ensuing year; - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Perkins, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board proceed to ballot for a President.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Perkins having been designated a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to collect and count the votes announced the result<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows, viz; -</p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast for President 9.<span class='line-break'> </span>of which John T. Bradlee received 8<span class='line-break'> </span>Henry W. Pickering " 1</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr J.T. Bradlee President.'>M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee President.</span></p>
<p>And <u>M<sup>r</sup> John T. Bradlee</u> was accordingly declared<span class='line-break'> </span>Elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>Previous to the ballot being taken, M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee had<span class='line-break'> </span>stated to the Board, in accordance with notice given by him<span class='line-break'> </span>at a meeting of the Trustees held January 22<sup>d</sup>, that the pressure<span class='line-break'> </span>of other duties rendered it imperative for him to decline to<span class='line-break'> </span>be a candidate for re-election as President, and on the<span class='line-break'> </span>announcement of the result of the ballot, he Expressed<span class='line-break'> </span>his appreciation of the compliment indicated by the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135117">
<h3><a name="page-1135117">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 288)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>288</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feby, 11, 1874.'>Trustees. Feby, 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p>unanimous vote, but felt compelled, in justice to<span class='line-break'> </span>other interests, to decline to accept. Under these<span class='line-break'> </span>circumstances, on motion of M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board take a recess for five minutes.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Qualified acceptance of the office of President by Mr Bradlee. '>Qualified acceptance of the office of President by M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee. </span></p>
<p>On re-assembling after the recess, M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>withdrew his declaration, stating that, in order to<span class='line-break'> </span>give the Trustees time to perfect their arrangements,<span class='line-break'> </span>he would hold the office for a few months, but should<span class='line-break'> </span>resign at the Expiration of that time.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Choate, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board proceed to ballot for a Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Secretary. '>Election of Secretary. </span></p>
<p>Mr. Choate having been designated a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to collect and count the votes, announced the result as follows; <span class='line-break'></span>Whole number of ballots cast for <u>Secretary</u>, 10<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for <u>Samuel Batchelder Jr.,</u> and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> N.J. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board prcoeed to ballot for a Treasurer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer &amp; Superintendent '>Treasurer &amp; Superintendent </span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee having been designated a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to collect and count the votes, announced the result as follows; <span class='line-break'></span>Whole number of ballots cast for <u>Treasurer</u>, 10<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for <u>H.B. Mackintosh</u>, and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared Elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board proceed to ballot for a Superintendent.</p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow having been designated a Committee to<span class='line-break'> </span>collect and count votes announced the result as follows; <span class='line-break'></span>Whole number of ballots cast for <u>Superintendent</u>, 10<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135118">
<h3><a name="page-1135118">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 289)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>289</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feb&apos;y 11, 1874.'>Trustees. Feb'y 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p>All of which were for <u>James W. Lovering</u>, and he was<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly declared Elected to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Choate, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries of Superintendent Treasurer &amp; Secretary.'>Salaries of Superintendent Treasurer &amp; Secretary.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the salary of the Superintendent be<span class='line-break'> </span>fixed at Two thousand five hundred dollars, ($2500.-),<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Ensuing year, and that he shall have the use<span class='line-break'> </span>of a house with the grounds thereto belonging, the use<span class='line-break'> </span>of a horse and vehicle and the services of one man,<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Expense of the corporation.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the salary of the Treasurer be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>Two thousand two hundred and fifty dollars ($2250.-)<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Ensuing year.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the salary of the Secretary be fixed at<span class='line-break'> </span>One thousand five hundred dollars for the Ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.'>Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual file of monthly bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted by the Treasurer and read by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for his<span class='line-break'> </span>approval, and payment by the Treasurer if found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Halcyon Lake grade of certain Lots in vicinity of: '>Halcyon Lake grade of certain Lots in vicinity of: </span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Snow submitted a communication from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent under date of the 9<sup>t</sup> inst., relative to the<span class='line-break'> </span>grade of certain lots in the vicinity of Halcyon Lake;<span class='line-break'> </span>and the same having been read and considered, on<span class='line-break'> </span>motion of M<sup>r</sup> Choate, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt.&apos;s comn resp.g. referred to Com. on Grounds to cons. &amp; rep. &amp;'>Supt.'s com<sup>n</sup> resp.g. referred to Com. on Grounds to cons. &amp; rep. &amp;</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the communication of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds to consider and<span class='line-break'> </span>report, and that the land in the vicinity of the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>mentioned in his communication be with^h^eld from sale<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135119">
<h3><a name="page-1135119">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 290)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>290</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Feby. 11, 1874.'>Trustees Feby. 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='land ordd to be withheld fr. sale until after report.'>land ord<sup>d</sup> to be withheld fr. sale until after report.</span></p>
<p>until after the report of the Committee.</p>
<p>In pursuance of the provisions of the By-Laws,<span class='line-break'> </span>the President proceeded to the appointment of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Standing Committee for the Ensuing year as follows; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standing Committees for 1874-1875 appointed.'>Standing Committees for 1874-1875 appointed.</span></p>
<p><u>Standing Committees.<span class='line-break'> </span>1874-1875.</u></p>
<p>Committee on <u>Grounds</u>; <span class='line-break'> </span>[The President, Ex officio, &amp; Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>[Bigelow<span class='line-break'> </span>[Lawrence<span class='line-break'> </span>[Pickering &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>[Spelman</p>
<p>Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on <u>Lots</u>;<span class='line-break'> </span>[Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>[Perkins &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>[N.J. Bradlee</p>
<p>Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on <u>Interments</u>;<span class='line-break'> </span>[Brewer &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>[Choate</p>
<p>Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on <u>Finance</u>;<span class='line-break'> </span>[Little &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>[Browne</p>
<p>Special Committee on <u>Birds</u>; Dr. Brewer.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mass. Hort. Soc. Com. on relations of this corpn to'>Mass. Hort. Soc. Com. on relations of this corp<sup>n</sup> to</span></p>
<p>At the suggestion of the President, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that the Special Committee appointed Feby. 12,<span class='line-break'> </span>1873, consisting of the President, and Messrs. Choate &amp; Snow</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135120">
<h3><a name="page-1135120">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 291)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>291</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feb&apos;y. 11, 1874.'>Trustees. Feb'y. 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='re-appointed &amp; powers continued'>re-appointed &amp; powers continued</span></p>
<p>"to consider and report what measures, if any, should be<span class='line-break'> </span>taken to re-adjust or terminate the relations of this<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation to the Massachusetts Horticultural Society,"<span class='line-break'> </span>and who were authorized December 24, 1873 "to obtain<span class='line-break'> </span>the opinion of counsel on the subject," be reappointed<span class='line-break'> </span>and its powers continued.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='unfinished business of last year [?] referred to the several committees'>unfinished business of last year [?] referred to the several committees</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that such portions of the business referred, during<span class='line-break'> </span>the past year, to Committees of this Board as may not, to<span class='line-break'> </span>this date have been fully considered and determined on<span class='line-break'> </span>by them, be hereby referred anew to the several committees<span class='line-break'> </span>having cognizance thereof.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Statement of Lots sold not pd for refd to Com. on Finance.'>Statement of Lots sold not pd for ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Finance.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Statement of Lots reported as sold<span class='line-break'> </span>which had not been paid for January 1<sup>st</sup>, 1874, be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage into Cem. from neighboring buildings refd to Com. on Grounds.'>Drainage into Cem. from neighboring buildings ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Grounds.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Superintendent's communication of<span class='line-break'> </span>January 19, 1874, with regard to the drainage into the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery precincts from certain buildings now being<span class='line-break'> </span>Erected in a street running from M<sup>t</sup> Auburn St, West<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Reception house be referred to the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb, work on new. Notice of intention to ask appn for '>Receiving Tomb, work on new. Notice of intention to ask app<sup>n</sup> for </span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Committee on Lots gave notice<span class='line-break'> </span>of an intention to ask at the next meeting of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>for an appropriation Exceeding one thousand dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>to be applied to the work on the new Receiving Tomb.</p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guarantee the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4296 on Fountain and </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135121">
<h3><a name="page-1135121">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 292)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>292</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feby. 11, 1874.'>Trustees. Feby. 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lots Nos 1780 1781 &amp; 4296.'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lots N<sup>os</sup> 1780 1781 &amp; 4296.</span></p>
<p>Halcyon Avenues, belonging to Moses A. Dow, for the<span class='line-break'> </span>sum of Eleven hundred dollars; of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1780 on<span class='line-break'> </span>Pilgrim Path belonging to J. Huntington Wolcott for<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of Eight hundred dollars; and of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 1781<span class='line-break'> </span>on Pilgrim Path, lately owned by Samuel Frothingham<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, for the sum of six hundred dollars, - it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contracts be concurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for lots as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='717'>717</span></p>
<p>Charles S. Patten of Boston, son of James Patten,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Seven hundred &amp; seventeen.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1073.'>1073.</span></p>
<p>Eliza Ayers (M<sup>rs</sup> Nath<sup>l</sup>) of Newton, sister-in-law of Asher Pike,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One thousand &amp; seventy-three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1383'>1383</span></p>
<p>William T. Burrage of Pittsford V<sup>t</sup> son of Joseph L. Burrage,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirteen hundred &amp; Eighty-three.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1661'>1661</span></p>
<p>J. Augustus Lynch of Boston, son of Stephen Lynch,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Sixteen hundred &amp; sixty-one</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3290.'>3290.</span></p>
<p>Moses Ford of Cambridge, son of Thomas Ford<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-two hundred &amp; ninety.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135122">
<h3><a name="page-1135122">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 293)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>293</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary. Feby. 11, 1874.'>Oath of Secretary. Feby. 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts.<span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk Ss., February 11, 1874.</p>
<p>Personally appeared Samuel Batchelder Jr., and made<span class='line-break'> </span>oath that he would faithfully perform the duties appertaining<span class='line-break'> </span>to the office of Secretary of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Before me,<span class='line-break'> </span>John T. Bradlee Justice of the Peace.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March, 11, 1974'>Trustees. March, 11, 1974</span></p>
<p><u>March 11<sup>t</sup>, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, March 11<sup>t</sup>, 1874, at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins and Spelman.</p>
<p>The record o the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb. Comn from the Com. on Lots respecting.'>Receiving Tomb. Com<sup>n</sup> from the Com. on Lots respecting.</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots resporting progress made by them in<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter of the new receiving Tomb, stating that they<span class='line-break'> </span>were not yet prepared to name the amount desired as<span class='line-break'> </span>an appropriation therefor, and desiring a renewal of the<span class='line-break'> </span>notice given at the last meeting. Also requesting "that<span class='line-break'> </span>"beofre the next monthly meeting the members of the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Board not already familiar with the subject, will, by<span class='line-break'> </span>"visiting the Cemetery or by personal interview with the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Superintendent, or in both tehre ways, acquaint themselves<span class='line-break'> </span>"with all the circumstances of the case so that, at that time<span class='line-break'> </span>"definitie action may be taken."</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135123">
<h3><a name="page-1135123">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 294)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>294</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 11, 1874.'>Trustees. March 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p>and its recommendations adopted; and that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board holds itself in readiness to visit the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose indicated at such time as the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots may appoint.</p>
<p>[The foregoing communication from the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>was accompanied by papers from the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows, viz: <span class='line-break'></span>(a) Communication dated February 26, 1874, containing<span class='line-break'> </span>a table showing the total number of deposit in Rec.<span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb from 1861 to 1873 inclusive.<span class='line-break'> </span>(b) Communication dated February 28, 1874, containing<span class='line-break'> </span>Estimate of cost to Enlarge and complete the new Rec.<span class='line-break'> </span>Tomb.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President'>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President</span></p>
<p>The usual file of monthly bills with accom<span class='line-break'></span>-panying schedule having been submitted by the Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if found<span class='line-break'> </span>correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file'>Monthly Statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sale of land Effected by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent January 14 to march 11, 1874, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot No 217.'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 217.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guarantee the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 217, Willow Av., lately owned<span class='line-break'> </span>by *John Lowell Jr., deceased, for the sum of One thousand</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p>295</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. March 11, 1874.'>Trustees. March 11, 1874.</span></p>
<p>dollars, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the aforesaid contract be concurred<span class='line-break'> </span>in, on the part of this Board</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1316'>1316</span></p>
<p>Charles C. Kurtz of Boston, son of John E. Kurtz<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietors of Lot numbered Thirteen hundred &amp; sixteen.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1919'>1919</span></p>
<p>Caroline C. Blanchard (M<sup>rs</sup> Chas. H.) of Malden, daughter of Eli A. Yale<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Nineteen hundred &amp; nineteen.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2513'>2513</span></p>
<p>Mary A. Tufts of Charlestown, widow of Nathan A. Tufts<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-five hundred &amp; thirteen.</p>
<p>No other business being presented it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 8, 1874.'>Trustees. April 8, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>April 8, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, April 8, 1874, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. ^J.T.^ Bradlee, Browne, Choate, Lawrence,<span class='line-break'> </span>Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Spelman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Quarterly Statements.'>Treasurer's Quarterly Statements.</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's Report of the Receipts and Expenditures<span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter Ending March 31<sup>st</sup>, 1874, also his Report of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135125">
<h3><a name="page-1135125">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 296)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>296</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 8, 1874'>Trustees. April 8, 1874</span></p>
<p>amounts due and uncollected for the same quarter,<span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the statements of the Treasurer be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President.'>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>A file of bills with accompanying schedule, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted to the Board  it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if<span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb. Report of Com. on Lots ordd to be recorded'>Receiving Tomb. Report of Com. on Lots ord<sup>d</sup> to be recorded</span></p>
<p>A written report in reference to the Receiving <span class='line-break'></span>Tomb having been submitted by the Committee on Lots,<span class='line-break'> </span>accompanied by verbal statements from the chairman,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the subject having been very fully considered by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Consideration of subject deferred to next meet&apos;g.'>Consideration of subject deferred to next meet'g.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Report of the Committee be^accepted and^ recorded,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the further consideration of the subject be<span class='line-break'> </span>postponed to the next meeting of the Board.<span class='line-break'> </span>[For record of this Report, see p. 299.]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P. O&apos;Brien &amp; Co. request for Permit for work on Lots. Ref. to Com. on Lots'>P. O'Brien &amp; Co. request for Permit for work on Lots. Ref. to Com. on Lots</span></p>
<p>A communication from "P. O'Brien &amp; Co," dated<span class='line-break'> </span>April 4, 1874, requesting that a permit be granted to them<span class='line-break'> </span>"to do general work upon Lots" having been submitted, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Intervening space: Sec&apos;y authorized to pass deed of Lot con-tracted to be sold without.'>Intervening space: Sec'y authorized to pass deed of Lot con-tracted to be sold without.</span></p>
<p>On motion of the chairman of the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized to prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>and deliver a deed of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4320, Caltha Path, con<span class='line-break'></span>tracted to be sold without intervening space between it</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135126">
<h3><a name="page-1135126">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 297)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>297</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 8, 1874.'>Trustees. April 8, 1874.</span></p>
<p>and the adjoining Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4314, as shown on the Report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent of March 19, 1874.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots under p.c. by corpn with G. ins. of structures thereon, referred to next meet&apos;g.'>Lots under p.c. by corp<sup>n</sup> with G. ins. of structures thereon, referred to next meet'g.</span></p>
<p>The subject of the guaranty contracts for the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>care of Lots, with Especial reference to the insurance of the<span class='line-break'> </span>structures thereon, having been brought up for consideration<span class='line-break'> </span>it was, after discussion,</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the further consideration of this<span class='line-break'> </span>subject be postponed to the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that when this meeting adjourns it adjourn<span class='line-break'> </span>to meet at three P.M. one week from this day.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sign-Board at Entrance of Cem&apos;y. Prest au-thorized to remove. Also to purchase vehicle for Supt.'>Sign-Board at Entrance of Cem'y. Pres<sup>t</sup> au-thorized to remove. Also to purchase vehicle for Supt.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the President be authorized to cause the<span class='line-break'> </span>removal of the sign-board standing in the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>near the gate-way, on which are painted the 'Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>for visitors,' &amp;c. Also that he be authorized to purchase<span class='line-break'> </span>for the use of the Superintendent a new vehicle to re<span class='line-break'></span>-place one new used by him which is considered unfit<span class='line-break'> </span>for use and unsafe.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of sales of Lots ac-cepted &amp; placed on file.'>Monthly statement of sales of Lots ac-cepted &amp; placed on file.</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of land Effected by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, March 11, to April 8, 1874, so far as<span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Committee on Lots, having been sub<span class='line-break'></span>-mitted and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted and placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lots Nos 2199 &amp; 3695'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lots N<sup>os</sup> 2199 &amp; 3695</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 2199, Honeysuckle Path,<span class='line-break'> </span>lately owned by *Luis Conant, deceased, for the sum of</p>

</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p>298</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 8, 1874.'>Trustees. April 8, 1874.</span></p>
<p>five hundred dollars; and of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 3695 on Hazel Dell<span class='line-break'> </span>Path, lately owned by *Mehitable P. Gay, (M<sup>rs</sup> Timothy),<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, for the sum of nine hundred &amp; twenty-five<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above contracts be concurred in <span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for lots as follows, viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2271'>2271</span></p>
<p>George A. Chandler of Boston, son of Nathan B. Chandler<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-two hundred &amp; seventy-one.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2859'>2859</span></p>
<p>Sarah W. Frost^M<sup>rs</sup> W<sup>m</sup> R.)^ of Wellesley, daughter of Daniel E. Pratt<span class='line-break'> </span>deceassed proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-Eight hundred &amp; fifty-nine.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3664'>3664</span></p>
<p>Sarah M. Stimpson of Boston, Widow of Frederick H. Stimpson<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-six hundred &amp; sixty-four.</p>
<p>No other business being presented it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135128">
<h3><a name="page-1135128">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 299)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>299</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots.'>Report of Com. on Lots.</span></p>
<p><u>Report of Committee on Lots.</u><span class='line-break'> </span>(Referred to at page 296, ante)</p>
<p>"The Committee on Lots, referring to a report made<span class='line-break'> </span>"by them at the last meeting of the Board, have further<span class='line-break'> </span>"considered whether, and in what way the new Receiving<span class='line-break'></span>"Tomb may be completed.</p>
<p>"There seems to have been originally an understanding<span class='line-break'> </span>"that the tomb should contain a sufficiently large number<span class='line-break'> </span>"of catacombs to admit of their sale for permanent occupation.<span class='line-break'> </span>"The Committee have thought such a design, if actually<span class='line-break'> </span>"Entertained at first, would not be adopted or Endorsed<span class='line-break'> </span>"by the present Board, and they therefore only contemplate<span class='line-break'> </span>"in their recommendations the construction of a suitable<span class='line-break'> </span>"place for the temporary deposit of bodies.</p>
<p>"Inasmuch as the Board have had an opportunity,<span class='line-break'> </span>"within the past month, of visiting the Cemetery, Examing<span class='line-break'> </span>"the tomb in its present ocndition, and ascertaining on the<span class='line-break'> </span>"spot all the particulars connected therewith, it is not<span class='line-break'> </span>"necessary for the Committee to Enter upon any detailed<span class='line-break'> </span>"description of it.</p>
<p>"But for the purpose of stating their conclusions, and<span class='line-break'> </span>"thereby bringing the whole subject definitely before the Board,<span class='line-break'> </span>"the Committee recommend that the section containing<span class='line-break'> </span>"fifty catacombs, now Erected, be taken down, that a new<span class='line-break'> </span>"section, to contain sixty catacombs on Each side, one hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>"and twenty in all, be constructed; and that the tomb<span class='line-break'> </span>"be thereupon fully completed, with a floor, a proper</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135129">
<h3><a name="page-1135129">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 300)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>300</p>
<p>" gateway, ventilators, and by such other work as may<span class='line-break'> </span>" be required to accomplish the purpose; and that<span class='line-break'> </span>" the Committee be authorized to give the [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>" directions to this end. <span class='line-break'> </span>"Boston, April 8, 1874"<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) S. T. Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>(") William Perkins - Common Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>(") Nath<sup>l</sup> J. Bradlee </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135130">
<h3><a name="page-1135130">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 301)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>301</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 15, 1874'>Trustees. April 15, 1874</span></p>
<p><u>April 15, 1874</u></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on Wednesday, April 15, 1874, at Three o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Little, Perkins, Snow, and Spelman</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving-Tomb Subject ref. to Com. on Finance to cons. &amp; report.'>Receiving-Tomb Subject ref. to Com. on Finance to cons. &amp; report.</span></p>
<p>The subject of the Receiving-Tomb having been<span class='line-break'> </span>taken up, by assignment from the previous meeting^, &amp; fully considered^,<span class='line-break'> </span>on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be referred to the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Finance to consider and report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perp. Care of Lots with G. discussed.'>Perp. Care of Lots with G. discussed.</span></p>
<p>The subject of the guaranty contracts for the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of lots having next been taken up by<span class='line-break'> </span>assignment from the previous meeting, a full discussion<span class='line-break'> </span>was had, - particular information upon all the points<span class='line-break'> </span>involved having been furnished by the Committee on Lots, <span class='line-break'></span>an no action was deemed necessary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Alex. McDonald; request for Permit for work on Lots ref. to Com. on Lots'>Alex. M<sup>c</sup>Donald; request for Permit for work on Lots ref. to Com. on Lots</span></p>
<p>A communication from Alex. M<sup>c</sup>Donald, dated<span class='line-break'> </span>April 13, 1874, asking for "a permit to work in M<sup>t</sup> Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery," having been submitted, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said communication be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots on above application.'>Report of Com. on Lots on above application.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the chairman of<span class='line-break'> </span>that Committee to the Effect that the Committee were<span class='line-break'> </span>not aware of any authority contained in the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>for the issue of permits of the kind asked for in the<span class='line-break'> </span>communication of the Messrs O'Brien &amp; Alex. M<sup>c</sup>Donald.</p>
<p>After discussion, it was</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135131">
<h3><a name="page-1135131">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 302)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>302</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. April 15, 1874.'>Trustees. April 15, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Outstanding General Permits cancellation of Subject ref. to Spec. Com. to cons. &amp; report.'>Outstanding General Permits cancellation of Subject ref. to Spec. Com. to cons. &amp; report.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>be laid upon the table, and that a special committee<span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of <del>the Committee on Lots and</del> M<sup>r</sup> Choate<span class='line-break'> </span>be appointed, to consider and report what action,<span class='line-break'> </span>if any, may be necessary <del>or Expedient</del> on the part<span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation <del>with reference to</del> for the cancellation<span class='line-break'> </span>of the outstanding general permits to do work in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage into Cemetery. Report of progress by Mr Choate.'>Drainage into Cemetery. Report of progress by M<sup>r</sup> Choate.</span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> Choate reported progress with reference to<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of drainage into the Cemetery from a<span class='line-break'> </span>Street West of the Reception House, pursuant to<span class='line-break'> </span>the request made to him by the chairman of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds, to which Committee the sub<span class='line-break'></span>-ject was referred by vote of the Board adopted<span class='line-break'> </span>February 11, 1874. And stated that, in his opinion, a<span class='line-break'> </span>thorough investigation of the rights and duties of the<span class='line-break'> </span>parties would involve a considerable Expenditure of<span class='line-break'> </span>time and money. On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Choate, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Grounds authorized to incur needful Expense to ascertain rights &amp; duties of parties.'>Com. on Grounds authorized to incur needful Expense to ascertain rights &amp; duties of parties.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to incur such an Expenditure as may, in their judgment<span class='line-break'> </span>be requisite to ascertain the rights and duties of the<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation in the matter.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Choate added to Committee.'>M<sup>r</sup> Choate added to Committee.</span></p>
<p>At the request of the chairman of the Committee it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that M<sup>r</sup> Choate be added to the Committee to<span class='line-break'> </span>consider the subject of drainage.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135132">
<h3><a name="page-1135132">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 303)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>303</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 13, 1874.'>Trustees. May 13, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>May 13, 1874</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, May 13, 1874, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, Brewer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Snow and Spelman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Halcyon Lake. Sugg. drain into from Mt Aub. St via Sycamore Av. No action needed.'>Halcyon Lake. Sugg. drain into from M<sup>t</sup> Aub. S<sup>t</sup> via Sycamore Av. No action needed.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>with reference to a proposal made by the former Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>to construct a drain from Mount Auburn Street via Sycamore<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue to Halycon Lake, with a view to the better supply <span class='line-break'> </span>of water in said Lake, - stating that in the opinion of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee no action was necessary. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='General permits pronounced revocable.'>General permits pronounced revocable.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from M<sup>r</sup> Choate, appointed^a Committee^<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting with instructions to ascertain and<span class='line-break'> </span>report as to the control of the corporation over the out<span class='line-break'></span>-standing general permits to do work in the Cemetery, stating<span class='line-break'> </span>that from the Examination made by him he was satisfied<span class='line-break'> </span>that all general permits heretofore issued were revocable.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Issue of general permits not warr. by By-Laws Rep. taken from table &amp; accepted.'>Issue of general permits not warr. by By-Laws Rep. taken from table &amp; accepted.</span></p>
<p>On motion by M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee on Lots made<span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting to the Effect that the Committee were<span class='line-break'> </span>not aware of any authority contained in the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>for the issue of general permits, be taken from the table.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said report be accepted.<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that a special Committee be appointed by<span class='line-break'> </span>the chair to Enquire and report whether, and in what way</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135133">
<h3><a name="page-1135133">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 304)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>304</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 13, 1874'>Trustees. May 13, 1874</span></p>
<p>general permits can be granted under the By-Laws.<span class='line-break'> </span>And Messrs. Snow, Choate and Spelman were designated<span class='line-break'> </span>by the chair to constitute said Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Permits to perform work upon Lots: general subject;'>Permits to perform work upon Lots: general subject;</span></p>
<p>A recess of fifteen minutes having been<span class='line-break'> </span>ordered, to afford the Committee an opportunity to<span class='line-break'> </span>deliberate, - on the re-assembling of the Board the<span class='line-break'> </span>following vote was submitted, and adopted: viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Disposition of '>Disposition of </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be instructed to issue<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary permits to any person who shall show authority<span class='line-break'> </span>in writing from a proprietor or a representative, to<span class='line-break'> </span>perform work upon his lot, under the usual restrictions;<span class='line-break'> </span>such authority from a proprietor or representative being<span class='line-break'> </span>taken as the written application required by the By-Laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.'>Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President for<span class='line-break'> </span>his approval and payment by the Treasurer if foudn correct.</p>
<p>The subject of watering the streets near Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, and the arrangements for Decoration-day having<span class='line-break'> </span>been brought forward, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Decoration-day arrangements for ref. to President.'>Decoration-day arrangements for ref. to President.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that all matters connected with the arrangements<span class='line-break'> </span>for Decoration-day be referred to the President, with full<span class='line-break'> </span>powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering streets Com. on Grounds authorized to make arrangements for.'>Watering streets Com. on Grounds authorized to make arrangements for.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Grounds be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>make arrangements with the City of Cambridge for watering<span class='line-break'> </span>the streets near the Cemetery</p>
<p>A communication dated May 13, 1874, signed<span class='line-break'> </span>by A.J. Coolidge for himself and others, proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 13, 1874.'>Trustees. May 13, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Saffron Path change of grade Petn for A.J. Coolidge &amp; als. ref. to Com. on Grounds'>Saffron Path change of grade Pet<sup>n</sup> for A.J. Coolidge &amp; als. ref. to Com. on Grounds</span></p>
<p>of lots upon Saffron Path, requesting "that the grade of<span class='line-break'> </span>"said Path may be so changed as properly to drain all<span class='line-break'> </span>"the lots upon said Path with as little Expense to the<span class='line-break'> </span>"owners thereof as is possible; and "desiring to be heard<span class='line-break'> </span>"upon the whole subject"; - having been laid before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board, - it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the communication of A.J. Coolidge<span class='line-break'> </span>and other proprietors in reference to a change of grade<span class='line-break'> </span>of Saffron Path be referred tot he Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Greenhouses Com. on Lots authorized to Expend $660.- upon.'>Greenhouses Com. on Lots authorized to Expend $660.- upon.</span></p>
<p>A verbal communication from the chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Lots recommending, for reasons stated,<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee be authorized to make an Expenditure<span class='line-break'> </span>of six hundred and sixty dollars ($660.-) upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>greenhouses during the present season, having been<span class='line-break'> </span>received and considered, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Lots be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to Expend, during the present season, the sum of six<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and sixty dollars, ($660.-) upon the green<span class='line-break'></span>-houses of the corporation, in accordance with the<span class='line-break'> </span>recommendations of the chairman, if found desirable<span class='line-break'> </span>by them.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-location of lots Nos 158 &amp; 1797'>Re-location of lots N<sup>os</sup> 158 &amp; 1797</span></p>
<p>On motion of the same gentleman it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be authorized to accept<span class='line-break'> </span>from the proprietors of Lots numbered One hundred &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty-Eight, and seventeen hundred and ninety-seven,<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds of re-conveyance of said Lots to the corporation for<span class='line-break'> </span>the purpose of issuing new deeds of said premises in such</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 13, 1874'>Trustees. May 13, 1874</span></p>
<p>manner and form as the Committee on Lots may approve.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file'>Monthly statement of sales of Lots acc. &amp; placed on file</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of land Effected by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent April 8 to May 13, 1874, so far as<span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Committee on Lots, having been submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted &amp; placed<span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot #3617.'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot #3617.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 3617, Angelica Path, lately<span class='line-break'> </span>owned by Nathan R. Hill, deceased, for the sum of four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars, ($450.-), it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above contract be concurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='963'>963</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1187'>1187</span></p>

<p>Elizabeth J. Perkins^(M<sup>rs</sup> Thomas N.)^ of Boston, daughter of Ebenezer Chadwick<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirteen hundred &amp; fifty-six.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1492'>1492</span></p>
<p>Frederick H. Betts of New York, son-in-law of John F. Holbrook,</p>

<p>307</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. May 13, 1874'>Trustees. May 13, 1874</span></p>
<p>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Fourteen hundred &amp; ninety-two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3617'>3617</span></p>
<p>Emily A. Hill of Cambridge, daughter of Nathan R. Hill,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-six hundred &amp; seventeen.</p>
<p>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><u>Voted</u>, - that this meeting be adjourned.</p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder, Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. June 10, 1874.'>Trustees. June 10, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>June 10, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, June 10, 1874, at Four o'clock, P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, N.J. Bradlee, Browne,<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Pickering, Snow and Spelman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read &amp; approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Retirement from office of President by Mr J.T. Bradlee'>Retirement from office of President by M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee</span></p>
<p>The President after referring to this intention to<span class='line-break'> </span>retire from that office, as announced to the Board on<span class='line-break'> </span>two former occasions, and his having at their solicitation<span class='line-break'> </span>consented on the 11<sup>t</sup> of February last to remain in office<span class='line-break'> </span>for a few months longer in order to afford the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>time to perfect their arrangements, - then proceeded<span class='line-break'> </span><del>proceeded</del> to tender his immediate and unconditional<span class='line-break'> </span>resignation. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the resignation of the President accepted.</p>
<p>The chair having been vacated, the Board was<span class='line-break'> </span>called to order by the Secretary, and M<sup>r</sup> Snow was<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen temporary chairman.</p>
<p>The chairman having requested the members of the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>Board to prepare their ballots for President, and M<sup>r</sup> N.J. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee having been designated as a Committee to collect<span class='line-break'> </span>and count the votes, ammounced the result as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Mr I.M. Spelman President'>Election of M<sup>r</sup> I.M. Spelman President</span></p>
<p>Whole number of ballots cast 6<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for <u>M<sup>r</sup> Israel M. Spelman</u>, and<span class='line-break'> </span>he was accordingly declared^Elected^to the office aforesaid</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appointment of Mr J.T. Bradlee on the Com. on Grounds &amp; on the Com. on rel. with Mass. Hort. Soc.'>Appointment of M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee on the Com. on Grounds &amp; on the Com. on rel. with Mass. Hort. Soc.</span></p>
<p>A vacancy in the Committee on Grounds having<span class='line-break'> </span>been caused by the resignation of M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Ex offico chairman of the Committee, the said vacancy<span class='line-break'> </span>was filled by the appointment of M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee as a<span class='line-break'> </span>member of that Committee, by the President.</p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> Snow, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee be added to the Commit<span class='line-break'></span>-tee consisting of the President and Messrs. Choat and Snow<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed February 12<sup>t</sup>, 1873, on the relations between this<span class='line-break'> </span>corporation and the Massachusetts Horticultural Soceity.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watering street in front of Cem&apos;y. Contract for for 1874.'>Watering street in front of Cem'y. Contract for for 1874.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span>that arrangements had been made with the City of<span class='line-break'> </span>Cambridge for watering the street in front of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery during the present season from Coolidge Av.<span class='line-break'> </span>to the stables of the Union Railway Company for the<span class='line-break'> </span>sum of $167.50^on the part of this Corporation^ and asking that the Board would appropriate<span class='line-break'> </span>that sum for the purpose named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Water supply for Cemetery. Report &apos;inexpedient&apos; acccepted.'>Water supply for Cemetery. Report 'inexpedient' acccepted.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted and the appro<span class='line-break'></span>-priation made as desired.</p>
<p>A report was received from the same gentleman<span class='line-break'> </span>as chairman of the Committee on Grounds to whom by a<span class='line-break'> </span>vote of the Board adopted June 13, 1872, was referred</p>

<p>the general subject of water-supply for the Cemetery "to<span class='line-break'> </span>consider and report", - that having given the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>careful consideration they were of opinion that it was<span class='line-break'> </span>inexpedient to make arrangements for such supply at<span class='line-break'> </span>the present time.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Saffron Path. Petition of A.J. Coolidge &amp; als. for change of grade of Lots upon.'>Saffron Path. Petition of A.J. Coolidge &amp; als. for change of grade of Lots upon.</span></p>
<p>A report was also received from the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, to whom, at the meeting of the 13<sup>t</sup> ult<sup>o</sup>, was<span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to a change of grade on Saffron Path; stating<span class='line-break'> </span>that in the judgment of the Committee it is unadvisable<span class='line-break'> </span>to raise the grade of the lots on said Path at the present<span class='line-break'> </span>time, as the Committee wish to consider the question in<span class='line-break'> </span>connection with the general subject of the drainage of<span class='line-break'> </span>Spruce Avenue and surrounding territory, but would</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report concerning accepted.'>Report concerning accepted.</span></p>
<p>recommend that said Path be dug out from Lot #3531<span class='line-break'> </span>to Crocus Path, a distance, of say, 140 feet, and filled<span class='line-break'> </span>in with broken stone and gravel, at an Estimated<span class='line-break'> </span>Expense of two hundred dollars ($200.-)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation of $200.- made'>Appropriation of $200.- made</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report be accepted, and the sum<span class='line-break'> </span>of two hundred dollars appropriated to meet the Estimated<span class='line-break'> </span>cost of the improvement named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Watriss Lot, Chant Lot removal of fence'>Watriss Lot, Chant Lot removal of fence</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the same Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>covering a recommendation for the taking down of the<span class='line-break'> </span>remaining portion of the fence on the line of the Watriss<span class='line-break'> </span>and Chant Lots and the removal of the same to the line<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Chant Lot and Roman Catholic Cemetery, and<span class='line-break'> </span>continuing the remaining distance to the line of the</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation of $650.- made for above purpose'>Appropriation of $650.- made for above purpose</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the recommendations of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>be adopted, and the sum of six hundred and fifty<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars appropriated to meet the Estimated cost of the<span class='line-break'> </span>fence-work referred to</p>

<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the communication of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds</p>

<p>point completed one hundred and five feet to a line<span class='line-break'> </span>running from Lot #3951 to Lot #580, to be graded and<span class='line-break'> </span>sodded at an Estimated Expense of five hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>and twenty-five dollars, ($525.-) and it was</p>

<p>July 8^th, 1874. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday July 8^th, 1874, at Four o'clock P. M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs J. T. Bradlee ^Brewer^ Browne, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Spelman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Intervening space: Sec&apos;y. authorized to pass deeds of Lots contracted to be sold without. [underlined]'>Intervening space: Sec'y. authorized to pass deeds of Lots contracted to be sold without. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of the Chairman of the C ommittee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the Secretary be authorized to prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>and deliver deeds of Lots numbered 4338 and 4339<span class='line-break'> </span>on Yew Avenue, contracted to be sold without intervening <span class='line-break'> </span>space, as shown on the Report of the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>for July 11^th, 1874</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tropical Plans: appropriation of $100. - for purchase of, ordered [underlined]'>Tropical Plans: appropriation of $100. - for purchase of, ordered [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The same gentleman having submitted a <span class='line-break'> </span>communication from the Superintendent dated June 30^th, <span class='line-break'> </span>1874, requesting a small appropriation to be used in <span class='line-break'> </span>the purchase of tropical plants for the green=houses <span class='line-break'> </span>and display in the grounds in hot weather, it was, <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the recommendation of the Committee,</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the recommendation of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots be concurred in, and the sum of one hundred dollars, ($100) ^e^ appropriated for the purpose named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Moss Path Re=location of. [underlined]'>Moss Path Re=location of. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>to whom at the last meeting was referred the Superinten=<span class='line-break'> </span>=dent's communication of June 4^th respecting proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>re=location of Moss Path, and also the claim of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Messrs. Gilman, by N. B. Bryant, their attorney for</p>
