<p>Voted [underlined], - that the request of the Committee be acceded <span class='line-break'> </span>to, and that they have leave to sit again.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Engineering &amp; surveying; Com^n of Supt. resp&apos;g. favorable rep. on. [underlined] '>Engineering &amp; surveying; Com^n of Supt. resp'g. favorable rep. on. [underlined] </span></p>
<p>The same Committee reported favorably upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the communication of the Superintendent dated <span class='line-break'> </span>June 8^th, 1874, recommending certain changes in the <span class='line-break'> </span>department of engineering and surveying, and <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted to the consideration of the Board the <span class='line-break'> </span>following vote, which was adopted; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Employment of Surveyor authorized [underlined]'>Employment of Surveyor authorized [underlined]</span><span class='line-break'> </span>[in pencil at angle in left column "S. L. Brown"]</p>
<p>Voted [underlined] - that the Superintendent be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>employ a surveyor at a salary not exceeding one <span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars, ($1000. -) per annum; said surveyor <span class='line-break'> </span>to furnish a transit and level at his own expense, <span class='line-break'> </span>and to perform the duties designated in the said<span class='line-break'> </span>communication of the Superintendent dated June 8^th, '74.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Shed near Gate. Erection of authorized. &amp; appropriation of $225. - for ordered. [underlined]'>Shed near Gate. Erection of authorized. &amp; appropriation of $225. - for ordered. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The same Committee submitted a communication <span class='line-break'> </span>from the Superintendent dated June 10^th, 1874, in regard <span class='line-break'> </span>to the erection of a shed nar the Gate, to keep his <span class='line-break'> </span>horse and vehicle under cover in hot or bad weather, <span class='line-break'> </span>recommending tht his request be granted, &amp; submitting <span class='line-break'> </span>to the consideration of the Board the following vote <span class='line-break'> </span>which was adopted; -</p>
<p>Voted [underlioned], - tht the Superintendent be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>construct a shed in the rear of the Reception house,</p>

<p>wide Enough for two vehicles, at a cost not Ex<span class='line-break'></span>-ceeding two hundred and twenty-five dollars ($225.-)</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage into Cem&apos;y. from St W. of Recep. House. Report of Com.'>Drainage into Cem'y. from S<sup>t</sup> W. of Recep. House. Report of Com.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from M<sup>r</sup> Choate in<span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the special Committee appointed to consider<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject fo the drainage with the Cemetery from a<span class='line-break'> </span>Street West of the Reception house; that, pursuant to the<span class='line-break'> </span>authority conferred by the vote adopted April 15, 1874,<span class='line-break'> </span>[see p. 302] an Examination had been made at the Middle<span class='line-break'></span>-sex South District Registry of Deeds, but that no conveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>of or reference to any rights of drainage as aforesaid<span class='line-break'> </span>could be discovered, and it was believed that no record<span class='line-break'> </span>title Existed concerning said drain, which in the<span class='line-break'> </span>opinion of the Committee was a natural and not<span class='line-break'> </span>an artificial water-course. The committee recommen<span class='line-break'></span>-ded the following vote which was adopted;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Prest requested to confer with City of Cambridge &amp; A. McDonald'>Pres<sup>t</sup> requested to confer with City of Cambridge &amp; A. M<sup>c</sup>Donald</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the President be requested to confer<span class='line-break'> </span>with the authorities of the City of Cambridge, and<span class='line-break'> </span>with M<sup>r</sup> Alex. M<sup>c</sup>Donald upon the subject of the <span class='line-break'> </span>said drainage, reporting the result at the next<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gov. Winthrop, Statue of ;- request of R.S. Greenough to make changes in Eyes of. Ref. to Com.tee'>Gov. Winthrop, Statue of ;- request of R.S. Greenough to make changes in Eyes of. Ref. to Com.<sup>tee</sup></span></p>
<p>M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee submitted a communication<span class='line-break'> </span>from M<sup>r</sup> Richard S. Greenough the artist of the statue<span class='line-break'> </span>of Gov. Winthrop, in the Chapel, requesting leave of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees to make certain changes upon the Eyes of<span class='line-break'> </span>the statue, the letter being accompanied with a plaster<span class='line-break'> </span>cast showing the modifications proposed. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>and M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee with full powers.</p>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Quarterly Statements Ref. to Com. on Finance'>Treasurer's Quarterly Statements Ref. to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's report of the Receipts &amp; Expenditures<span class='line-break'> </span>for the quarter Ending June 30<sup>t</sup>, 1874, also his report of<span class='line-break'> </span>Amounts due and uncollected for the same quarter,<span class='line-break'> </span>having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the statements of the Treasurer be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred tot he Committee on Finance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule [of?] Bills referred to President.'>Monthly schedule [of?] Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval and payment by the Treasurer, if<span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot #4277'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot #4277</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4277 Willow Av<sup>e</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>owned by John J. Rayner for four hundred dollars.<span class='line-break'> </span>($400.-) it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above contract be concurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of sales of Lots'>Monthly statement of sales of Lots</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that owing to causes<span class='line-break'> </span>beyond his control he had been unable to prepare for<span class='line-break'> </span>presentation to the Board the usual monthly state<span class='line-break'></span>-ment of sales of land, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec&apos;y. granted more time for preparation of '>Sec'y. granted more time for preparation of </span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary have leave to incorporate<span class='line-break'> </span>the sales of the past with ^[thou?] for^ the coming month in one<span class='line-break'> </span>statement for presentation at the next meeting.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz;</p>

<p><u>August 12<sup>t</sup>, 1874.</u></p>
<p>At the time appointed for the regular<span class='line-break'> </span>monthly meeting of the Trustees, Wednesday, August<span class='line-break'> </span>12<sup>t</sup>, 1874, at Four o'clock P.M., Messrs. Perkins, Pickering<span class='line-break'> </span>Snow and Spelman were present, but for lack of a<span class='line-break'> </span>quorum the meeting was</p>
<p><u>Adjourned, sine die.</u></p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Sept. 9, 1874'>Trustees Sept. 9, 1874</span></p>
<p><u>September 9, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, September 9<sup>t</sup>, 1874 at Four o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Choate,<span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow &amp; Spelman.</p>
<p>The records of the last two meetings were read and approved.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 9, 1874'>Trustees. Sept. 9, 1874</span></p>
<p>for the current year on the property of the corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>having been laid before the Board by the President, and<span class='line-break'> </span>duly considered, - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> Lawrence, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cambridge taxes for 1874 referred to Special Comtee'>Cambridge taxes for 1874 referred to Special Com<sup>tee</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the assessment of taxes made by the City<span class='line-break'> </span>of Cambridge upon the property of the Corporation for<span class='line-break'> </span>the year 1874 be referred to a Committee of tow, consis<span class='line-break'></span>-ting of the President and M<sup>r</sup> Choate to consider and<span class='line-break'> </span>report: with authority to Employ counsel.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Widening of Coolidge Av. in accordance with Plan of the Com. on Grounds recommended; &amp; Com. author, to carry out the same.'>Widening of Coolidge Av. in accordance with Plan of the Com. on Grounds recommended; &amp; Com. author, to carry out the same.</span></p>
<p>The subject of the proposed widening of<span class='line-break'> </span>Coolidge Avenue having been presented by the President,<span class='line-break'> </span>and considered by the Board, it was, on motion of<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board declines to accede to the<span class='line-break'> </span>proposition of the Committee on Highways of the<span class='line-break'> </span>town of Waterown to widen Coolidge Avenue in ac<span class='line-break'></span>-cordance with plan submitted by said Committee.</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Board approves and adopts<span class='line-break'> </span>the plan for widening Coolidge Avenue recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Grounds, and authorizes said<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to take all necessary measures to carry<span class='line-break'> </span>out the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage into Cem. from St W. of Recept. House referred to Special Comtee'>Drainage into Cem. from S<sup>t</sup> W. of Recept. House referred to Special Com<sup>tee</sup></span></p>
<p>The subject of drainage into the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>from the new street West of the Reception House<span class='line-break'> </span>having been reported upon by the President, and Explained<span class='line-break'> </span>by reference to plan, - on motion of M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the statement of the President of in<span class='line-break'></span>-formation obtained by him in relation to the question<span class='line-break'> </span>of drainage be referred to a Committee, consisting</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135151">
<h3><a name="page-1135151">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 322)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>322</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 9, 1874'>Trustees. Sept. 9, 1874</span></p>
<p>of the Committee on Grounds and M<sup>r</sup> Choate, with<span class='line-break'> </span>instructions to report at the next meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board what action, if any, they would recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to take in the premises.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bill of B.B. Rand approved'>Bill of B.B. Rand approved</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the hill of M<sup>r</sup> Benj. B. Rand for<span class='line-break'> </span>Examination at the Registry of Deeds respecting<span class='line-break'> </span>the drainage rights aforesaid be approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Approval of Bills by Prest in advance of the action of the Board'>Approval of Bills by Pres<sup>t</sup> in advance of the action of the Board</span></p>
<p>It having appeared on the statement of <span class='line-break'> </span>the President that the had approved certain bills of <span class='line-break'> </span>the monthly file for August, which had not been<span class='line-break'> </span>acted upon by the Board for want of a quorum<span class='line-break'> </span>at the August meeting, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='ratified &amp; appd'>ratified &amp; app<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the action of the President in appro<span class='line-break'></span>-ving certain of the bills submitted in the August<span class='line-break'> </span>file, in advance of the action of the Board thereon,<span class='line-break'> </span>be, and the same is hereby ratified and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of Bills referred to Prest'>Monthly schedule of Bills referred to Pres<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills with accom<span class='line-break'></span>-panying schedule having been submitted to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President<span class='line-break'> </span>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if <span class='line-break'> </span>found correct</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of sales of Lots accepted, &amp;c.'>Monthly statement of sales of Lots accepted, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of land Effected by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent from June 10<sup>t</sup> to September 9<sup>t</sup>, 1874<span class='line-break'> </span>so far as approved by the Committee on Lots, having<span class='line-break'> </span>been submitted and read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said statement be accepted, and <span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135152">
<h3><a name="page-1135152">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 323)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>323</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Sept. 9, 1874.'>Trustees. Sept. 9, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comp. statement of sales of [lots?] to be prepared.'>Comp. statement of sales of [lots?] to be prepared.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Secretary be instructed to pre<span class='line-break'></span>-pare, for presentation at the next meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board a statement of the sales of land to October<span class='line-break'> </span>1<sup>st</sup>, 1874, as compared with the corresponding<span class='line-break'> </span>period of last year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[?] for perp. rep. with G. of Lots Nos. 420 2256 &amp; 2447.'>[?] for perp. rep. with G. of Lots Nos. 420 2256 &amp; 2447.</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 420, Central Av., belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to Daniel B. Widdifield for Eight hundred and fifty<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, ($850.-); of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 2256, Hawthorn Path,<span class='line-break'> </span>late of John Corey, deceased, for five hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty dollars, ($550.-); and of Lot N<sup>o</sup> 2447, Arethusa<span class='line-break'> </span>Path, late of M<sup>rs</sup> Relief Sumner, deceased for four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars, ($400.-), it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the above contracts be concurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for Lots as follows, viz; <span class='line-break'></span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='765'>765</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2637'>2637</span></p>
<p>Henry A. Morse, of Boston, son of Fritz Henry Morse<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty-six hundred &amp; thirty-seven.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4087'>4087</span></p>
<p>John D. Mason of Arlington, son in law of M<sup>rs</sup> Almira Allen<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four thousand &amp; Eighty-seven</p>
<p><u>Dissolved</u> Sam Batchelder Jr., Secretary.</p>

<div id="page-1135153">
<h3><a name="page-1135153">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 324)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>324</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874.'>Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>October 14, 1874.</u></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday, October 14<sup>t</sup>, 1874, at 4 o'clk. P.M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate, Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and <span class='line-break'> </span>Spelman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cambridge taxes for 1874, Report of Special Com. accepted &amp; approved.'>Cambridge taxes for 1874, Report of Special Com. accepted &amp; approved.</span></p>
<p>A report was received from the President, as<span class='line-break'> </span>chairman of the Special Committee appointed at<span class='line-break'> </span>the last meeting to consider the subject of the taxes<span class='line-break'> </span>assessed by the City of Cambridge for the current year;<span class='line-break'> </span>recapitulating the facts in the case, stating the course<span class='line-break'> </span>of action adopted, the opinion of counsel obtained,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the final payment of the said tax-bill by the<span class='line-break'> </span>authority of the Committee, an abatement of the sum<span class='line-break'> </span>of twenty-two thousand dollars ($22,000.-) on the<span class='line-break'> </span>assessed valuation having first been made by the<span class='line-break'> </span>assessors. And it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted^and approved^</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Coolidge Av. proposed widening of Report of Com. on Grounds respecting.'>Coolidge Av. proposed widening of Report of Com. on Grounds respecting.</span></p>
<p>A report was also made by the President as<span class='line-break'> </span>chairman of the Committee on Grounds, in reference to<span class='line-break'> </span>the widening of Coolidge Avenue authorized at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Board, pursuant to a plan recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee; stating that the Committee were in<span class='line-break'> </span>communication with the Committee on Highways of<span class='line-break'> </span>the town of Watertown on the subject, but that no<span class='line-break'> </span>decisive action had yet been taken by the authorities</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135154">
<h3><a name="page-1135154">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 325)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>325</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874.'>Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the report of the Committee be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Indian Ridge P. Extn of grading sodding of bank 550. - see p. 255, 525. - , , 311, 150. - , , 325, 176.54 , , , 401.54'>Indian Ridge P. Ext<sup>n</sup> of grading sodding of bank 550. - see p. 255, 525. - , , 311, 150. - , , 325, 176.54 , , , 401.54</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds reporting that they<span class='line-break'> </span>had deemed it Expedient to Extend the grading and<span class='line-break'> </span>sodding of the bank on Indian Ridge Path to a<span class='line-break'> </span>line Extending from Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4305 to Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4039,<span class='line-break'> </span>so as to include Lot N<sup>o</sup> 580, at an Expense of $150.-,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the action of the Committee be approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Linnaea P. sodding near; appn for.'>Linnaea P. sodding near; app<sup>n</sup> for.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - to add to appropriations already made<span class='line-break'> </span>the further sum of $176.54 to cover the Expense of<span class='line-break'> </span>sodding near Linnaea Path, which was not originally<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Indian R. Path: estimate ordd of cost of Extending grading &amp; sodding of bank on'>Indian R. Path: estimate ord<sup>d</sup> of cost of Extending grading &amp; sodding of bank on</span></p>
<p>On motion of M<sup>r</sup> J.T. Bradlee, it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee on Grounds be instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>to obtain an Estimate of the cost of Extending the<span class='line-break'> </span>grading and sodding of the bank on Indian Ridge<span class='line-break'> </span>Path to a point at or near the line of Lime Avenue.</p>
<p>The President having Exhibited a plan for<span class='line-break'> </span>a change in the laying out of Fountain Av., prepared<span class='line-break'> </span>under the advice of the Superintendent, and recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Grounds, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fountain Av. change in laying out of.'>Fountain Av. change in laying out of.</span></p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the laying out of Fountain Av. be,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the same is hereby modified in such manner<span class='line-break'> </span>as to conform to the plan Exhibited to this Board,<span class='line-break'> </span>prepared by the Superintendent, and recommended<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Grounds</p>
<p>A report was received from the special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee appointed at the last meeting on the</p>
</div>
</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874.'>Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874.</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage into Cem. from St W. of Recep. House. Com. granted further time.'>Drainage into Cem. from S<sup>t</sup> W. of Recep. House. Com. granted further time.</span></p>
<p>subject of drainage into the Cemetery from the new<span class='line-break'> </span>street West of the Reception House, to the Effect that<span class='line-break'> </span>they held the matter under advisement, but were not<span class='line-break'> </span>yet arrived at a definite conclusion, and would<span class='line-break'> </span>request that further time be granted. On motion of<span class='line-break'> </span>M<sup>r</sup> Bradlee it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the Committee have leave to report<span class='line-break'> </span>at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot sold Chas. M. Hovey (No 4205.) Non payment of Com. app. with powers.'>Lot sold Chas. M. Hovey (N<sup>o</sup> 4205.) Non payment of Com. app. with powers.</span></p>
<p>The same gentleman having called the attention<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board to the fact that Lot N<sup>o</sup> 4205, at the corner<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mound and Spruce Avenues, reported August 1<sup>st</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1872, as sold to M<sup>r</sup> Charles M. Hovey for $1648.<span class='line-break'></span>and in which a number of interments have been made,<span class='line-break'> </span>was still unpaid for, notwithstanding repreated<span class='line-break'> </span>demands made for payment; it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the subject be referred to a special<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, consisting of the President and Messrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Choate and Bradlee, with full powers.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Quarterly Statements refd to Com. on Finance'>Treasurer's Quarterly Statements ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Finance</span></p>
<p>The Treasurer's report of the receipts and<span class='line-break'> </span>expenditures for the quarter Ending September 30<sup>t</sup>, 1874;<span class='line-break'> </span>also his report of amounts due and uncollected for<span class='line-break'> </span>the same quarter; having been busmitted to the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that the statements of the Treasurer be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Finance</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.'>Monthly schedule of Bills referred to President.</span></p>
<p>The usual monthly file of bills with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>schedule having been submitted to the Board it was</p>
<p><u>Voted</u>, - that said bills be referred to the President</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>327</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874. [underlined]'>Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>for his approval, and payment by the Treasurer, if <span class='line-break'> </span>found correct.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly statement of sales of Lots accepted, &amp;c. [underlined]'>Monthly statement of sales of Lots accepted, &amp;c. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A statement of the sales of land effected <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent from September 9^th to October <span class='line-break'> </span>14^th, 1874, having been submitted and read by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that said statement be accepted and placed <span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comp. statement of sales of Lots exhibited by Sec&apos;y. [underlined]'>Comp. statement of sales of Lots exhibited by Sec'y. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary also submitted a statement <span class='line-break'> </span>showing the sales for the first nine mnths of the <span class='line-break'> </span>present year as compared with the corresponding <span class='line-break'> </span>period of 1873, in compliance with the vote adopted <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting of the Board; and it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='accepted, &amp;c. [underlined]'>accepted, &amp;c. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that said statement be accepted and <span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot #493[underlined]'>Cont. for perp. rep. with G. of Lot #493[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The Secretary having stated that the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots had recommended the Trustees to guaranty the <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of Lot N^o 493, Hemlock Path, late <span class='line-break'> </span>of John L. Russell deceased, for the sum of five <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars ($500, - ) it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the above contract be concurred in <span class='line-break'> </span>on the part of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon the petitions of the parties in interest <span class='line-break'> </span>representatives were designated for lots as follows, viz; -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='874'>874</span></p>
<p>Herbert W. Kimball of Boston, son of Daniel Kimball <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Eight hundred &amp; seventy=four</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135157">
<h3><a name="page-1135157">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 328)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>328</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874 [underlined] '>Trustees. Oct. 14, 1874 [underlined] </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='944.'>944.</span></p>
<p>Elizabeth L. Easton^of S^t Stephen's N. B.^ (M^rs J. Ed.) daughter of William Rotch, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Nine hundred &amp; forty=four.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1001.'>1001.</span></p>
<p>Newell A. Thompson, of Boston, son of Newell A. Thompson,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered One thousand and one</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2402.'>2402.</span></p>
<p>Varnum E. Coper of N. York City, son of Hiram Cooper,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Twenty=four hundred and two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3222.'>3222.</span></p>
<p>Mary N. Bowers, (M^rs Levi,)^of Boston^ Widow of Levi Bowers, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Thirty-two hundred &amp; twenty=two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='4052.'>4052.</span></p>
<p>Charles W. Winn of Belmont, son of Charles G. Winn<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased proprietor of Lot numbered Four thousand &amp; fifty=two.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='72.'>72.</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Novemb. 11, 1874 [underlined]'>Trustees. Novemb. 11, 1874 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>November 11^th, 1874 [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on Wednesday, November eleenty, at Four o'clock, P. M.</p>
<p>Present Messrs. N. J. Bradlee, Browne, Choate, <span class='line-break'> </span>Lawrence, Perkins, Pickering and Spelman.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting ws read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved,.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135158">
<h3><a name="page-1135158">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 329)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>329</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Novem. 11, 1874 [underlined] '>Trustees. Novem. 11, 1874 [underlined] </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fountain Av. Est^d cost of completing bank upon. [underlined]'>Fountain Av. Est^d cost of completing bank upon. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A communication from the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>dated October 28, 1874, and addressed to the President, <span class='line-break'> </span>giving the estimated cost of completing the bank <span class='line-break'> </span>on Fountain Avenue from the East side of Lot #580<span class='line-break'> </span>to Lot #2919, was submitted by him as chairman <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Lots as and for a report from <span class='line-break'> </span>that Committee; and it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the same be accepted and placed <span class='line-break'> </span>on file.</p>
<p>In the absence of the chairman of the Com. <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots the following communication was submitted <span class='line-break'> </span>by M^r Prekins in behalf of said Committee; viz;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Relocation of Lots numbered 4240 &amp; 111 [underlined]'>Relocation of Lots numbered 4240 &amp; 111 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>"Lot #4240 has been posted to include but 277<span class='line-break'> </span>feet, instead of 300 feet as paid for.  In correcting the <span class='line-break'> </span>lines a change from those given on the deed is asked <span class='line-break'> </span>for, to which the Superintendent sees no objection.</p>
<p>"The Committee therefore request that the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to receive a deed from the proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>thereof for the purpose of issuing to him a new deed <span class='line-break'> </span>as re=located, under direction of the Committee on Lots."</p>
<p>"Lot #111 at the junction of Central and Beech<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenues projects one corner nearer to the Avenue<span class='line-break'> </span>than the other.  The proprietor desires to re=locate <span class='line-break'> </span>it by swinging the whole Lot, privoted on the other <span class='line-break'> </span>front corner to the extent of about one foot back.<span class='line-break'> </span>The committee ask like authority for the Secretary,<span class='line-break'> </span>subject to their approval."  And it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted[underlined], - that the Secretary be authorized to accept</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135159">
<h3><a name="page-1135159">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 330)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>330</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Novem. 11, 1874 [underlined]'>Trustees. Novem. 11, 1874 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>from the proprietors of Lots N^os 111 and 4240, deeds <span class='line-break'> </span>of re=conveyance of said Lots to the corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of issuing new deeds of said premises <span class='line-break'> </span>in such manner and form as the Committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>may approve.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #3549[underlined]'>Lot #3549[underlined]</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Release of conditions as to curbing requested. [underlined]'>Release of conditions as to curbing requested. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>A further communication was also made <span class='line-break'> </span>by M^r Perkins, in behalf of said Committee, to the <span class='line-break'> </span>effect that "Lot #3549 on Garden Avenue, now <span class='line-break'> </span>owned by O'Brien has been sold by him to a M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Blodgett.  The original deed contains a condition <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Lot shall be curbed.  The purchaser desired <span class='line-break'> </span>a release from the condition, and the Committee ask <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Secretary be authorized to accept a conveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of issuing a new deed in the present <span class='line-break'> </span>form."</p>

And it ws</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the report of the Finance Committee be</p>

<p><ins>December 9, 1874</ins></p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on Wednesday, December 9th at four o'clock P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present, Msrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Little, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Spelman.<span class='line-break'> </span>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot #3549'>Lot #3549</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A verbal report was made by the chariman of the Committee on Lots, upon the subject of the request of the owner of Lot #3549 for a release by the corporation of the restrictions imposed at the time of the grant;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Re-conveyance to Corpn authorized, for purpose of issuing new deed.'>Re-conveyance to Corp<sup>n</sup> authorized, for purpose of issuing new deed.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>stating that the Committee entertained doubts as to the power of the Board of Trustees to release or impose conditions by a vote; and recommending that the Secretary be authorized to receive from the present holder of the title a deed of re-conveyance to the corporation, for the purpose of issuing to him a new deed of the same premises in its present form.</p>
<p><ins>Voted,</ins> - that the report of the committee be accepted and the recommendations thereof adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to Prest, also Bill of H.W. Paine approved.'>Monthly Schedule of Bills referred to Pres<sup>t</sup>, also Bill of H.W. Paine approved.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The usual monthly file of bills, with accompanying schedule, having been submitted to the Board, it was</p>
<p><ins>Voted,</ins> - that said bills be referred to the President for his approval and payment by the Treasurer, if found correct.</p>
<p>And it was also<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted,</ins> - that the bill of Henry W. Paine Esq. of</p>

<p><ins>Voted, - </ins> that Mr. Colburn's request be referred to the Committee on Grounds with full powers.</p>

Bradlee and Snow be a Committee to prepare the annual report of the Trustees to the proprietors, and submit said report to the Trustees for consideration at their next meeting.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr Snow, it was <span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Voted, - </ins> that the exact relations of the Trustees</p>

<p><ins> January 19, 1875</ins></p>
<p>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on Tuesday, January 19, 1875, at Three o'clock, P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present, Msrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Choate, Little, Perkins, Snow, Spelman.<span class='line-break'> </span>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees; certain relations of Report of Mr. Choate cony. see p. 335 top'>Trustees; certain relations of Report of Mr. Choate cony. see p. 335 top</span></p>
<p>Mr. Choate submitted a written report upon the subject referred to him at the last meeting of the Board, and the same having been read and considered, it was, on motion of Mr. Bradlee<span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Voted, </ins> that the report be accepted and spread upon the records. [See p. 338]<span class='line-break'> </span>Upon motion of Mr. J.T. Bradlee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr. J.T. Bradlee&apos;s resignation taken from the table and withdrawn'>Mr. J.T. Bradlee's resignation taken from the table and withdrawn</span></p>
<p><ins> Voted, - </ins> that the communication received at the last meeting from Mr. J. Bradlee tendering his resignation as a member of this Board, and laid upon the table, be taken from the table. <span class='line-break'> </span>It was then stated by the mover of the vote, that he was authorized by Mr Bradlee to withdraw his resignation. <span class='line-break'> </span>The President, in behalf of the Committee appointed at the last meeting "to prepare the annual report of the Trustees to the Proprietor, and submit said report to the Trustees for consideration at their next meeting", then submitted and read the Report prepared in compliance with the vote aforesaid;<span class='line-break'> </span></p>

<p>and the same having been fully considered, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Voted, - </ins> that the Report which has been read, be and the same is hereby approved and adopted as and for the Report of the Board of Trustees to the Proprietors;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Trustees to Proprietors adopted'>Report of Trustees to Proprietors adopted</span><span class='line-break'> </span>- the Committee drafting the same having leave to make verbal alterations, if deemed expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Treasr ref. to Com. on Finance'>Report of Treas<sup>r</sup> ref. to Com. on Finance</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Annual report of the Treasurer having been submitted to the Board, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Voted, - </ins> that the Treasurer's report be referred to the Committee on Finance, to report thereon at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Supt. accep. + ord - to be printed.'>Report of Supt. accep. + ord - to be printed.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The annual report of the Superintendent having been submitted to the Board, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Voted, - </ins> that the Superintendent's report be accepted and printed.</p>
<p><ins> Adjourned </ins> to January 25, at 3 P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sam. Batchelder Jr. Secy.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1135168">
<h3><a name="page-1135168">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 339)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>339</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Chas. F. Choate'>Report of Chas. F. Choate</span></p>
<p>meeting, submits the following report.</p>
<p>The Charter of "The Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn gives to the Trustees" the general management, superintendence and care of the property, expenditures, business and prudential concerns of the corporation, and of the sales of lots in the said Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span>By vote of the proprietors passed July, 10, 1835, the Trustees were empowered to add to the By-Laws, and leave, in accordance with this vote, from time to time made By-Laws and regulations to govern their own proceedings, and generally provide for the conduct of the affairs of the Cemetery. These regulations have been voted by the Trustees in the form of By-Laws, and are nearly all contained in the printed pamphlet entitled "Acts of Incorporation and By-Laws of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn."<span class='line-break'> </span>At the last annual meeting of the proprietors the power of the Trustees to make By-Laws was revoked, and the question submitted to the Committee is understood to refer to the present position of the Trustees in relation to the (so-called) existing code of By-Laws.<span class='line-break'> </span>The proper office of the B-Laws of a corporation is defined by the Supreme Court in the case of "Flint vs. Pierce, 99 Mass. 70" is to regulate the conduct, and define the duties of the members towards the corporation, and between themselves. <span class='line-break'> </span>It is obvious that the present code of<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135169">
<h3><a name="page-1135169">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 340)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>340</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Chas. F. Choate'>Report of Chas. F. Choate</span></p>
<p>By-Laws of Mount Auburn, as it has been adopted by the Trustees, to a very considerable extent, limits the power of the Trustees as conferred by the charter, unless the Trustees have power to amend these By-Laws.<span class='line-break'> </span>It seems quite clear that neither the proprietors nor the Trustees themselves can in any manner limit the powers granted by the charter.<span class='line-break'> </span>While the power to amend By-Laws has been revoked by the proprietors, this revocation can in no manner prevent the Trustees from making proper regulations relative to the general management, superintendence and care of the property, expenditures, business and prudential concerns of the corporation, and the sale of lots, even in cases where these matters are now regulated by the (so called) ^ existing By-Laws adopted by the Trustees under the vote of July 10, 1835.<span class='line-break'> </span>So far as this code of By-Laws is limited to its proper province of defining and regulating the conduct and duties of members, it must, of course, be considered a law binding upon the Trustees.<span class='line-break'> </span>As to any suggestions to be made to proprietors relative to the present condition of affairs, it seems to be a matter peculiarly belonging to the Trustees, and not to the Committee.<span class='line-break'> </span>While the present situation is somewhat anomalous, no injury seems to have yet resulted from it.<span class='line-break'> </span>The power of the Trustees, as granted by the charter has not been, and cannot be impaired<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135170">
<h3><a name="page-1135170">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 341)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>341</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jany, 25, 1875'>Trustees Jany, 25, 1875</span></p>
<p>by any action of the proprietors.<span class='line-break'> </span>(Signed) Charles F. Choate</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='January 25, 1875'>January 25, 1875</span><span class='line-break'> </span>An adjourned monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on Monday, January 25, 1875 at 3 o'clock P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Present, Msrs. J.T. Bradlee, Brewer, Browne, Perkins, Pickering, Snow and Spelman.<span class='line-break'> </span>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Finance on Treasurer&apos;s Com. Report:'>Report of Com. on Finance on Treasurer's Com. Report:</span><span class='line-break'> </span>A report having been received from the Committee on Finance approving as correct the Treasurer's Annual Report, which was referred to them at the last Trustees' meeting, - it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Report ord to be printed'>Treasurer's Report ord to be printed</span><span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Voted, - </ins> that the Treasurer's annual report be accepted and printed.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Dissolved. </ins></p>
<p>Sam. Batchelder Jr. Secy.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135171">
<h3><a name="page-1135171">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 342)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>342</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors Feby 1, 1875'>Proprietors Feby 1, 1875</span></p>
<p><ins> Annual Meeting of the Proprietors</ins><span class='line-break'> </span><ins> Monday, February 1st, 1875</ins></p>
<p>A duly notified meeting of the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn was held at the Horticultural Hall, Boston, on Monday, February 1st, 1875, at half past Three o'clock in the afternoon.<span class='line-break'> </span>A quorum being present the meeting was called to order by the President, and the call for the same was read by the Secretary, and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports'>Annual Reports</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Annual Report of the Trustees, accompanied by the Reports of the Superintendent and Treasurer, having been distributed in print among the Proprietors present, and the Report of the Trustees having been read by the Secretary, it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reading of Supt.&apos;s + Treasr&apos;s Reports dispensed with, Reports accepted + ordered to be recorded'>Reading of Supt.'s + Treasr's Reports dispensed with, Reports accepted + ordered to be recorded</span><span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted, - </ins> that the reading of the Superintendent's and Treasurer's Report be dispensed with.<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted, - </ins> that the Annual reports be accepted and recorded. <span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr. J. Thomas Stevenson it was</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Revision +c of By Laws Com. of Props appt to make etc.'>Revision +c of By Laws Com. of Props appt to make etc.</span><span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted, - </ins> that a Committee of three proprietors be appointed to whom shall be referred all the By-Laws so called, of this corporation, for revision, who shall report at a future meeting, two codes, one of By-Laws of the corporation, the other of rules and regulations for the conduct of the affairs of the corporation.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. Choate it was<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135172">
<h3><a name="page-1135172">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 343)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>343</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors Feby, 1, 1875'>Proprietors Feby, 1, 1875</span></p>
<p><ins>Voted, - </ins> that said Committee have authority to employ counsel at the expense of the corporation, and to submit their report in print.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stevenson, Jewell, Wadsworth appt. to compose Committee'>Stevenson, Jewell, Wadsworth appt. to compose Committee</span></p>
<p>The chair appointed Msrs. J Thomas Stevenson, Harvey Jewell and Alexander Wadsworth to compose said Committee.</p>
<p>On motion of Mr. J. Story Fay, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granite Kerbing +c Trustees to enquire + rep as to expediency of prohibiting'>Granite Kerbing +c Trustees to enquire + rep as to expediency of prohibiting</span><span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted, - </ins> that the Trustees be requested to enquire into and report to the Proprietors as to the expediency of hence forward prohibiting all fences and kerbing around lots, and in the grounds of Mount Auburn whether of granite, iron, or other material excepting Earth.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comtee app to collect count + sort votes for Trustees'>Com<sup>tee</sup> app to collect count + sort votes for Trustees</span><span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of Mr Collamore, it was <span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted, - </ins>  that a Committee of two be appointed by the chair to collect, count and sort the votes for Trustees.<span class='line-break'> </span>The chair appointed Msrs. Collamore and McLellan to compose said committee, who subsequently reported as follows, viz: -</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Keepers Brewer + Perkins'>Election of Keepers Brewer + Perkins</span><span class='line-break'> </span>Whole members of ballots, cast, 82<span class='line-break'> </span>All of which were for<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Thomas M. Brewer</ins>, to serve until 1881, by re-election<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>William Perkins</ins>, " " " " " "<span class='line-break'> </span>and they were accordingly declared elected and as foresaid.<span class='line-break'> </span>No other business being presented, it was<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>Voted, - </ins> that this meeting be dissolved.</p>
<p>Sam Batchelder Jr. Secretary.</p>

<h3><a name="page-1135173">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 344)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">

<div id="page-1135174">
<h3><a name="page-1135174">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 345)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>TRUSTEES' REPORT</p>
<p>The general depression of business which has prevailed during the past season, has not been without its effect upon the affairs of this Corporation. The receipts from sales of lots have, in consequence, fallen off considerably. Still, the usual expenses, and the yearly payment to the reserved fund have all been met from the year's receipts, and only for special expenditures for improvements has any drain been made upon the surplus assets of the last year. The affairs of the Corporation therefore remain in a satisfactory condition, though it would have been gratifying to have had a larger amount for expenditure upon the uncompleted improvements, and for the adornment of the Cemetery grounds.</p>
<p>During the past season work has been commenced on the bank of Indian Ridge on Fountain Avenue. About two hundred and eighty feet have been re-graded and sodded, and the improved appearance of the bank warrants the expenditure already made.</p>
<p>The greenhouse, commence late last year, has been finished, and rendered important aid during the past summer in supplying the constantly increasing demand for plants.</p>
<p>The fence on the line of the Roman Catholic Cemetery and Chant Lot, being beyond repair, has been replaced by a higher and more substantial wooden fence, and the stockade posts which separated the Chant Lot from the Cemetery have been removed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135175">
<h3><a name="page-1135175">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 346)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>346</p>
<p>4</p>
<p>A small shed has been erected in the rear of the Reception House, which will afford shelter for a carriage in case of storm.<span class='line-break'> </span>The lithographic map of 1867, which from lapse of time had become incorrect, and required constant alteration, has been replaced by a new and improved edition.<span class='line-break'> </span>Considerable progress has been made in the grading around Halcyon Lake, and it is hoped that by the close of the next season this work may be completed.<span class='line-break'> </span>On the Stone Farm, grading has been continued through the summer and autumn. This work has been so far advanced, that lots will be ready for sale the coming summer, on that part of this portion of the Cemetery, which has been reserved for the Landscape Lawn system.<span class='line-break'> </span>Some expenditures have been made upon the drainage of Spruce Avenue, and Saffron and Crocus Paths. The experiments made, it is hoped, will prove so successful as to warrant further similar expenditure.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Permanent Fund, increased by the payment of one-fifth of the receipts from sales of lots, $5,793.15 and of income $10,185.91, now amounts to $178,373.94.<span class='line-break'> </span>The amount received from endowments for perpetual care of lots to date is $102,905.80, with a balance of income unexpended $18,397.84, making the total amount $121,303.64.<span class='line-break'> </span>The available assets for current expenses are $24,101.21, exclusive of real estate owned by the Corporation outside of the Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span>During the preceding year Mr. John T. Bradlee notified the Trustees that on account of other pressing duties he should decline a re-election as President, but at the meeting</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135176">
<h3><a name="page-1135176">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 347)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>347</p>
<p>5</p>
<p>for organization of the present Board, yielding to the urgent request of his associates, he consented to serve until June; when, at his renewed request, the Trustees accepted his resignation, and Mr. I. M. Spelman was chosen President. The Trustees take this occasion to express their appreciation of the valuable services rendered by Mr. Bradlee during the three and a half years of his presidency, and their acknowledgment of the efficiency and courtesy with which he performed the duties of that office.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Trustees believe that the interests of the Proprietors require some further action in relation to the By-Laws, than that taken at the last Annual Meeting. Under the vote of the Proprietors passed July 10, 1835, the Trustees were authorized to make additional By-Laws. In accordance with this vote they have, from time to time, added to the By-Laws general regulations of the affairs of the Corporation and of their own proceedings. These, as finally codified, have been printed and distributed among the Proprietors. In this manner the By-Laws, which should, as defined by the Supreme Court, "regulate the conduct and define the duties of the members towards the Corporation, and between themselves," appear to regulate the proceedings of the Trustees, and to embarrass them in the discharge of their duties as prescribed by the charter, which gives to the Trustees the "general management, superintendence, and care of the property, expenditures, business, and prudential concerns of the Corporation, and the sale of lots in the Cemetery." So long as the Trustees were empowered by the Corporation to amend the By-Laws, as occasion might require, no practical difficulty resulted, but now that this has been</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135177">
<h3><a name="page-1135177">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 348)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>348</p>
<p>6</p>
<p>revoked, it seems to the Trustees desirable that the By-Laws should be revised, and the duties of the Proprietors and the Trustees more definitely stated. If the present By-Laws are to be enforced without modification in individual cases, it is certain that much inconvenience will grow out of them.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Trustees therefore recommend the appointment of a Committee of the Proprietors, to confer with them upon a revision of the By-Laws, and report at a special meeting, to be called for this purpose.<span class='line-break'> </span>For the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>I.M. SPELMAN,<span class='line-break'> </span><i>President.</i></p>
</div>
</div>

<p>THE REMOVALS WITHIN AND FROM THE CEMETERY WERE AS FOLLOWS:<span class='line-break'> </span>To Public Lots ...... 7<span class='line-break'> </span>" Private Lots ...... 51<span class='line-break'> </span>Total Removals within the Cemetery ...... 58<span class='line-break'> </span>" " from the Cemetery ...... 33<span class='line-break'> </span>Total number of Removals ...... 91</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. Feby. 10, 1875 [underlined]'>Trustees. Feby. 10, 1875 [underlined]</span></p>
<p>February 10^th, 1875. [underlined]</p>
<p>A monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on Wednesday,February 10^th, 1875 at Four o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>P.M.</p>
<p>Present, Messrs N. J. Bradlee, J. T. Bradlee, <span class='line-break'> </span>Browne, Choate, Lawrence, Perkins^Snow^ and Spelman.</p>
<p>The meeting was called to order by M^r Spelman<span class='line-break'> </span>and the record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Election of Officers:[underlined]'>Election of Officers:[underlined]</span></p>
<p>The names of the Trustees elected at the <span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Meeting of the Proprietors on the 1^st inst.,<span class='line-break'> </span>were announced by M^r Spelman, who stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the business first in order would be the election of <span class='line-break'> </span>officers for the ensuing year; - on motion of M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, it was</p>
<p>Voted[underlined], - that the Board proceed to ballot for a <span class='line-break'> </span>President.</p>
<p>M^r Perkins having been designated as a <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to collect and count the votes, announced <span class='line-break'> </span>the result as follows, viz;</p>
<p>Whole number of ballots case for President[underlined]  7<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for Israel M. Spelman, - and</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='President. J. M. Spelman. [underlined]'>President. J. M. Spelman. [underlined]</span></p>
<p>M^r Israel M. Spelman [full name underlined] was accordingly declared <span class='line-break'> </span>eleted to the office aforesaid.</p>
<p>The Board then proceeded to ballot for the <span class='line-break'> </span>offices of Secretary, Treasurer and Superintendent, <span class='line-break'> </span>with the following result, as announced by M^r<span class='line-break'> </span>Perkins, the Committee designated to collect</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>Whole number of ballots cast for Secretary[underlined],  7;<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for Samuel Batchelder Jr.,[name underlined]<span class='line-break'> </span>and he was accordingly declared elected to tht <span class='line-break'> </span>office for the ensuing year.</p>

<p>Whole number of ballots cast for Treasurer[underlined], 7;<span class='line-break'> </span>all of which were for Henry B. Mackintosh[underlined], and <span class='line-break'> </span>he was accordingly declared elected to that office <span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing gear.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries of Superintendent[underlined]'>Salaries of Superintendent[underlined]</span></p>
<p>On motion of M^r Snow, it was</p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the salary of the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>be fixed at two thousand five hundred dollars, <span class='line-break'> </span>($2500. - ) for the ensuing year, and that he shall <span class='line-break'> </span>have the use of a house with the grounds thereto <span class='line-break'> </span>belonging, the use of a horse and vehicle, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>services of one man, at the expense of the corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer[underlined]'>Treasurer[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the salary of the Treasurer be fixed at <span class='line-break'> </span>two thousand two hundred and fifty dollars, <span class='line-break'> </span>($2250. - ) for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary[underlined]'>Secretary[underlined]</span></p>
<p>Voted [underlined], - that the salary of the Secretary be fixed <span class='line-break'> </span>at one thousand five hundred dollars ($1500. -) for <span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year.</p>

<div id="page-1135192">
<h3><a name="page-1135192">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 363)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Note: Closing of Vol. 5.'>Note: Closing of Vol. 5.</span><span class='line-break'> </span>At a special Meeting of the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn held on Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>April 12, 1875, a Code of By-Laws was adopted.<span class='line-break'> </span>whereby, (in Article VI,) it was provided that<span class='line-break'> </span>"The records of the Corporation, and those<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees shall be separate and distinct."</p>
<p>The present volume of records, therefore,<span class='line-break'> </span>wherein, as in previous volumes , the minutes of<span class='line-break'> </span>proceedings both at the meetings of the Proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>and of the Trustees, have been entered consecutively,<span class='line-break'> </span>in order of time, in now closed.<span class='line-break'> </span>The minutes of the proceedings at the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors' meeting of April 12, 1875 referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>above, will be found recorded in volume marked<span class='line-break'> </span>"Proprietors' Records, 6"<span class='line-break'> </span>The minutes of the proceedings at meetings<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees, subsequent to the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of March 24, 1875, above recorded, will be found<span class='line-break'> </span>entered in volume marked<span class='line-break'> </span>"Trustees' Records 6"<span class='line-break'> </span>et infra.<span class='line-break'> </span>Saml Batchelder Jr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="page-content">
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com on Finance referred to at page 108'>Report of Com on Finance referred to at page 108</span><span class='line-break'> </span>The Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>Boston, October 11, 1871</p>
<p>The Committee on Finance take this occasion to<span class='line-break'> </span>bring to the attention of the Board the financial<span class='line-break'> </span>condition of the corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>It is well known that to complete the improve<span class='line-break'></span>ments commenced by our predecessors, and carry<span class='line-break'> </span>forward those voted by the Board, the purchase of<span class='line-break'> </span>the  "[??] Lot", and the fencing the same, have made<span class='line-break'> </span>quite an inroad into the savings of previous years<span class='line-break'> </span>which had been invested.<span class='line-break'> </span>Lasst year the expenditures exceeded the means<span class='line-break'> </span>and showed the available funds on hand $30, 943.04<span class='line-break'> </span>against $50,916.21 the previous year.<span class='line-break'> </span>The enclosed exhibit made by the Treasurer Sept.<span class='line-break'> </span>28, 1871 of the estimated expenditures and receipts<span class='line-break'> </span>for the balance of the present year shows a deficit<span class='line-break'> </span>of $16,549.88. This would reduce our available means<span class='line-break'> </span>to $14,393.16 and compel us to sell U.S. stocks to <span class='line-break'> </span>make good the deficiency.<span class='line-break'> </span>But to place the Sphynx in place we think <span class='line-break'> </span>will involve an expenditure not ennumerated in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer's estimate.<span class='line-break'> </span>The sum of #14,393.16 is too small for us to rely <span class='line-break'> </span>upon.<span class='line-break'> </span>Without quetioning our action in the improvements</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1135197">
<h3><a name="page-1135197">Trustees Records, Vol. 5, 1870 (page 368)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>now  making, and to be made under authority of this<span class='line-break'> </span>Board, which we have voted for with great unanimity, <span class='line-break'> </span>believieng that the welfar and good care of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>required such action, still this Committee are now<span class='line-break'> </span>of the unanimous opinion that no new work should<span class='line-break'> </span>be undertaken involving the expenditures of such sums<span class='line-break'> </span>of money as wil compel us to exceed our revenues<span class='line-break'> </span>the coming year.  This would not hamper the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent in the general adornment of the grounds, but<span class='line-break'> </span>place us in a postition which prudence and a wise <span class='line-break'> </span>economy requires.<span class='line-break'> </span>It is well know to the Board that the Permanent<span class='line-break'> </span>Fund for repairs is to amount to $150,000 before<span class='line-break'> </span>the interest in the same can be used for the care of the<span class='line-break'> </span>grounds (the last annual report stated it at <span class='line-break'> </span>$115,456.76) and taking in view the fact of the<span class='line-break'> </span>large quantity of land which has been sold, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>number of Avenues and Paths to be cared for, your<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee are also unanimously of the opinion that<span class='line-break'> </span>this sum should reach $200.000 before any of the interest<span class='line-break'> </span>on the same is touched; believing an annual interest<span class='line-break'> </span>of $14,000 is small enough for the purposes for which<span class='line-break'> </span>the Fund was created.</p>
</div>
